story:
Be a part of reinventing Esports with us

My name is Dorian Jones, the CEO of Team Reinvented Gaming. I created this company to allow people to do what they love - PLAY VIDEO GAMES. I believe with your help, WE can reinvent Esports one win at a time and make it to Pro League.

 

We currently have a team of 13 highly dedicated, knowledgeable, and professional members who work around the clock to produce high quality content and consistently perform at the multiple tournaments

 

Recently we just acquired a Valorant Roster that hails from the sunny coasts of California to Ontario, Canada.  Along with playing competitively we also have a team of youtubers and streamers who represent the company by playing a plethora of popular video games ranging from Final Fantasy to Valorant.

 

Additionally, we also have a community of casual players who are constantly looking for people to play with, and what makes being a part of Team Reinvented Gaming special is that we are documenting our whole process as we build this organization from scratch.

WHY WE NEED YOU TO JOIN US

All investments Team Reinvented Gaming receives goes towards hiring subject matter experts, expanding our player base, and producing merchandise for the organization.

 

  

We are grateful for all the support we’ve received so far and will keep giving YOU the opportunity to reinvent Esports with us.

story:
Stretch Goals Introduced: 

  • $850  ~ Original Composed Soundtrack for Oriana (Songs will be available for all tiers)
  • $1000 ~ Oriana Keychains + Stickers for all backers
  • Suggestions would be much appreciated! Leave them in the comments. :)

 

Oriana is an interactive animated film touching upon the topics of duty, dogma, and justice. It features our main protagonist, having to make the right choices to protect her kingdom as the people's chosen one. Oriana is in its early production stages.

Funding needed for: 

  • A Sound Designer
  • Voice Acting
  • Possibly a Coder/Developer

Details about the film:

  • Estimated Run/Playtime - 6 mins (Give or take 1 minute)
  • Interactive, thus it will be a '.exe' file. (Windows and Mac Compatibility) However, It is not a game, but an interactive experience.
  • Directed, Animated, Written, And Developed by Serena Abraham, as a student thesis project.

Interactive Mechanics:

It will have similar choice-based mechanics to Black Mirror's Bandersnatch, along with some interactive environment, sidescroller kind of exploration, to help immerse its viewers.

Rewards

Stickers, Behind the scenes book, and even you're very own character in the game as an NPC!

The Team:

Just me so far - Serena Abraham

As an animator, I have successfully worked on 2 award-winning films. They have been screened at many film festivals worldwide, so I assure you, the product will be done to the best of my abilities.

story:
What are the basics of our game ?

 

Choose your faction, build your team and jump into battle to climb ranks, promote your faction or challenge your friends. 

 

You can look forward to:

 

  • Players will able to choose from one of four factions to put together team of 5 champions from range of available characters.

 

  • Each faction provides different gameplay experience with different strengths, source of their power and ways to utilize it. This means they will require different approach to work with resources essential to attain victory.

 

  • Factions will provide options to build team from variety of characters each possessing unique skills that can change flow of the battle or shape overall strategy.

 

  • Opposing teams will clash on broad battleground which provides plenty of space to outmanoeuvre your opponent and prepare battle plan.

 

  • Each detail can be crucial to victory ranging from initial unit placement to which way they are facing during battle.

 

  • Players can challenge others, take part in online ranked combat, or they can also compete with their friends in hot-seat mode.

 

 

How is Theater of Carnage played

 

At the start of each match there is preparation phase when players have option to place their units within designated area of the battlefield. This allows them to position units according to their initial battle plan. Once the battle starts turn order is decided based on each unit's initiative. Acting unit has certain amount of action points which can be spent moving, attacking, using tactical option or special skills. Special skills additionally require usage of faction resource which is unique for every faction with different ways how to gain or deplete it. Players have variety of options how to best spend action points while considering details like how to deal most damage, prepare their position for next turn or simply to prevent hits from rear. They need to cleverly navigate their characters across the arena to protect their vulnerable pieces and exploit weakness of opponent's units. Game ends once one side is annihilated.

 

 

Background

 

Different factions all inhabit lands of the Empire. They are fighting others in the Arena to pursue their own agenda. Victor is promised audience in Emperor's palace to present their claim, which could greatly improve their position and strength.

 

Factions 

 

Children of Celix

Religious faction that worships supernatural entity known as Celix as the supreme god. Their aim is to spread their faith to promote his glory and divinity as superior compared to any other deities. Children of Celix group’s proselytism adheres to the idea that end justifies the means which corresponds with their rather shady origins. The Church has plenty of trained devoted believers, in plenty of cases with their faith bordering on fanaticism, ready to lay down their lives for divine cause. Chosen warriors have vast fighting experience from skirmishes with other organizations and purging heretics within their region. Thanks to that they are well versed in armed combat. This fact together with their affinity to channel divine power of their god makes them fearsome foes.

 

Bloodsworn

Bloodsworn represent special fighting organization whose ranks are filled with criminals and oath breakers. Members come from union of clans known as Clans of Oro based on the codex Oro they are sworn to adhere to. Men and women from these clans that violate their pledge to the codex can escape punishment and strive to regain their honour by enlisting in Bloodsworn. They make new pledge of blood that they will wash away their sins with blood of the enemies or their own. Thus, this military faction consists of battle crazed maniacs, vicious sadistic killers and deadly silent warriors. Their approach is to fight with no regards for their own life with sole purpose of reclaiming their honour no matter the cost. As such life expectancy within Bloodsworn is usually very low and only the toughest stay alive longer. These seasoned fighters represent Clans of Oro in the Tournament. Their strength lies in pure art of war, combination of weapon mastery and various techniques and tricks.

 

Maharama

Maharama is by far the most elusive organization within the empire. This ancient secretive order with unknown powers is mostly shrouded in mystery. Members of Maharama rarely act in the open. They spend most of the time behind walls of their Towers. When acting outside their whole bodies are covered in dark clothes bulging in suspicious shapes. This often raises questions about their humanity. Not surprisingly, their agenda is a guarded secret known only to the highest-ranking members of the order. They are said to be able to perceive very threads of life of any living being and have the ability to manipulate it at will. This is not far from truth and is due to their special connection to the Void. Needless to say, their powers are a terrifying sight making them seem as masters of life and death.

 

Arisen

Arisen represent underground organization whose activities are officially banned within the Empire. This is due to deviant nature of their operations and goals, which has also led to their brand Corrupted from outsiders. Their ultimate goal is evolution of mankind which they plan to achieve using essence manipulation. In hidden laboratories they abuse dark mutating powers to change very nature of their test subjects tainting it with essence of creatures from different dimensions. In their pursuit of progress, they do not hesitate to experiment on any available victim ranging from unborn children to themselves. Those few who survive the horrific process with their mind mostly intact are irreversibly changed bearing special traits or completely inhuman appearance. As a result, fusion with other entities grants them various potent powers.

 

 

About us

 

We are small but dedicated indie team from Czech Republic. We deeply enjoy playing games which has eventually led us to start working on our own with passion only true gamer can have. And turn-based strategy games belonged to one of our most played genres since childhood. Therefore, Theater of Carnage is both our tribute to the legendary titles we grew up with as well as our own take on the genre. By taking away almost all of the "management" elements we can truly focus on what we believe is the most enjoyable part - the combat, to face opponents in battle of wits.

 

Our progress

 

Over the past year we have been working hard to put together working prototype of our game. We have been able to put together foundation including core mechanics and gameplay so that we can start focusing on adding more content. We aim to bring our game to Steam Early Access by the end of 2019 with first two factions available. Raised funds would be used to improve visual and sound quality of our game and enable us to give it more unique style that would fit our vision. Additionally, it would help us with preparing network infrastructure for online multiplayer part.

 

 

Thanks for your attention,

your Arrow^2 Team

story:
(Scroll down for english version)

Deste: Harb Oyunları

(Bu oyun ve temadaki karakterler tamamen hayal ürünüdür, gerçekle hiçbir ilgisi yoktur)

Deste: Harb Oyunları’nın fikri ilk ortaya atıldığında çalıştığımız ofiste 3 adam ‘kart oyunu ne güzel konsept abi’ gibi sohbet ederkn konu ufak ufak ‘O diilde millet kendi tarihiyle ilgili bir sürü yapıyor, osmanlı ile ilgili bi oyun olsa süper olmaz mı’ tatlarına geçince dedik ki tamam; biz bu oyunu yaparız. Fakat nasıl yaparız ki abi? diyerek oturduk google’ın başına. Netekim hiçbirimiz ne oyun tasarlamışız, ne 3D model vs bilmişiz, ne de bi konferansa katılmışız. Sadece oyun oynamışız ama bol bol...Unity ile bir başladık, ve karşınızda trailer. Yaklaşık 4 ayda şu anki konuma geldik.


Deste: Harb Oyunları, Osmanlı imparatorluğunun ihtişamına yakışır bir tema ile yola çıkılmış, stratejik bir kart oyunudur. 30 kart barındıran toplam 8 Deste’nizi kendiniz kurabilecek, Yavuz Selim, Fatih, Kanuni, Hürrem Sultan, Kösem Sultan, Vahidettin, IV. Murad ve Orhan Gazi olmak üzere 8 kahramandan biri ile bu Deste’nizi tamamlayıp düşmanınıza meydan okuyabileceksiniz.


Bir e-spor olarak, istenirse liderlik sıralamalı veya sıralamasız, rahat olmak üzere iki mod ile oynanabilecek. Siralamalı modda bir puanınız, seviyeniz ve buna göre karşılaşacağınız düşmanlarınız olacak. Rahat sıralamasız modda ise pek çok detay önemsiz olup, sadece ve sadece maç yapmak, eğlenmek veya Deste denemek için imkanlarınız olacak.


Buyrun gelin, Osmanlı’nın ihtişamını üstlenin, düşmanlarınızı devirin ve en önemlisi bol bol eğlenin. 

Neye ihtiyacımız var?

- Bolca kart olduğundan, evet elimizden geleni en iyi şekilde yaparak çevremizdeki herkesten çok başarıli çizimler alıyoruz ancak bu yeterli değil. Profesyonel çizim, resim desteğine ihtiyacımiz var ve gerçekten çok fazlasına ihtiyacımız var. Öncelikle indiegogo'dan gelecek olan desteğin bir bölümü, profesyonel çizime gidecek.

-Seslendirmeler için yine kendi imkanlarımızla bir noktaya gelebiliyoruz elbette, son derece profesyonelce çalışan Hyperfat Records ile çok iyi çalışmalar çıkartiyoruz. Kendileri Foley işlerimizin tamamını üstlendiler, ancak seslendirme yapacak insanlarla ilgili desteğe ve bir bütçeye ihtiyacımız var. Bütçemizin bir bölümü de bu noktaya ayrılacak.

-Sunucu ve 3.parti yardımcılara ödenecek giderler, aylık ödemelerin onceden planlanması. Burası oldukça basit, online, kaliteli ve güvenli bir oyun deneyimi sunabilmek için kaliteli sunucular, güvenli bir arkaplanı olan kaliteli matchmaking servisleri kullanmamız gerekiyor. Bu da yine bütçe demek :)

-Reklam, tanıtım, PR giderleri. Şu artık günümüzde açık; reklamsız, iyi ürün bile satamıyor veya kendini gösteremiyor. O kadar çok içerik, o kadar fazla medya var ki, artık spesifik bir kitleye doğru reklamlar ve tanıtımlarla hitap etmediğiniz sürece hiçbiryere varamıyorsunuz. Bu sebeple, öncelikle Türkiye özelinde, tarihimizi konu alan bir oyunun iyi bir haber ve tanıtım değeri olacağı ongörüsüne dayanarak, iyi bir tanıtım reklam bütçesi ile doğru kitleye ve çok yüksek oyuncu sayılarına ulaşabiliriz.

Bütün bu bütçeleme tamamlandığinda ise, sorunsuz çalışan, keyifle oynanabilecek, yolda, ofiste, evde, arkadaş ortamında hep beraber oynanabilecek, turnuvaları düzenlenip Türkiye'de e-sporculuğun gelişimine büyük bir katkıda bulunabilecek bir oyuna sahip olacağız. Gelişen dijital dünyaya tarihimizi de katarak dahil olmuş ve bu konuda büyük bir kitle yaratmış olacağız. 




İlerleyen zamanlarda ise Bizans oyunları, Ali cengiz oyunları, Cengiz Han, Orta Asya gibi ek paketler ile oyunumuzu süsleme ve geliştirme planlarımız mevcut ancak bunlar henüz daha tartışma ve planlama aşamasında. Öncelikli odağımız Deste: Harb Oyunları’nın alpha aşamasına bir an önce getirilmesi ve teste başlanabilmesidir.

Riskler ve karşılaşılabilecek problemler

Risk olarak en fazla elimizdeki tüm projenin, backup diskleriyle birlikte yanması yok olmasından bahsedebiliriz ancak ama bu da pek mümkün değil, dünya çapında backuplarımız var hali hazırda :) 

Bunun dışında bu dijital bir medya zaten, fiziksel herhangi bir kayıp söz konusu değil. 

Problem olarak önemli tek bir detaydan bahsedilebilir; Açılış döneminde, sunucularımız ve yazılımlarımız her ne kadar son derece kaliteli olacak da olsa, binlerce oyuncuyu aynı anda oynatabilecek de olsa beklediğimizin çok çok üzerinde oyuncu kitlesi ile bir anda karşılaşırsak, sunucunun bunu kaldıramaması gibi bir durum olabilir. Bu noktada ise çözüm basittir, daha fazla sunucu alıp, daha fazla alan yaratılır, ve kısa dönemli bir kriz olsa bile derhal üstesinden gelinir. 

Yardım edebileceğiniz diğer yollar

Bu nokta ile ilgili de birkaç detayı belirtmek isterim. Direkt olarak bütçe desteği sağlayamayabilirsiniz. Belki 1 lira bile gerçekten fark ediyordur sizin için. Bu durumda ise bize çiziminiz veya sesinizle destek olabilirsiniz. Osmanlı döneminden herhangi bir mesleğe ait bir kart çiziminizi cizim@harboyunlari.com'a atarak bize ulaşabilirsiniz. Biz isminizi kartın yanında belirtmekten onur duyarız.

Beraberinde seslendirme için aynı şekilde, bir seslendirme örneğiniz ile info@harboyunlari.com a mail atabilirsiniz. Sizinle iletişıme geçeriz, yine kartın yanında isminizin görünmesinden onur duyarak projemize ekleriz.



(en - short)

Deste: Harb Oyunları

(All the characters in this theme and the game are fictional.)

When we first had the idea of Deste: Harb Oyunları, we were just three guys at the office blabbering about gaming. But at a time the conversation moved forward to "card games are cool bro, why don't we have an Ottoman themed one? It'd be awesome!" and then it occured to us; We could actually make that game. But how in the world would that be possible? Saying that, we ran to uncle google to ask about this since none of us knew anything about 3D modeling, game design or went into any conference... We  finally crossed our paths with Unity 5. Just went and downloaded it and here we are :) Approximately we made it this far in 4 months.

Deste: Harb Oyunları, is a strategical card game which is heavily inspired by Ottoman Empire characters and setting.You may your main character from emperors or sultans like Yavuz Selim, Fatih, Kanuni, Hürrem Sultan, Kösem Sultan, Vahidettin, IV. Murad ve Orhan Gazi and accompanying your character you may have 8 different card decks. 

As an e-sport type, the game will have ranked and un-ranked modes which will allow players to compete for high ranks or just play casually as they wish for. 


Come and wield the astonishing power of the Ottoman Empire to take down your enemies, and most importantly; Have loads of fun!

Burası oldukça basit, online, kaliteli ve güvenli bir oyun deneyimi sunabilmek için kaliteli sunucular, güvenli bir arkaplanı olan kaliteli matchmaking servisleri kullanmamız gerekiyor. Bu da yine bütçe demek :)
-Reklam, tanıtım, PR giderleri. Şu artık günümüzde açık; reklamsız, iyi ürün bile satamıyor veya kendini gösteremiyor. O kadar çok içerik, o kadar fazla medya var ki, artık spesifik bir kitleye doğru reklamlar ve tanıtımlarla hitap etmediğiniz sürece hiçbiryere varamıyorsunuz. Bu sebeple, öncelikle Türkiye özelinde, tarihimizi konu alan bir oyunun iyi bir haber ve tanıtım değeri olacağı ongörüsüne dayanarak, iyi bir tanıtım reklam bütçesi ile doğru kitleye ve çok yüksek oyuncu sayılarına ulaşabiliriz.
Bütün bu bütçeleme tamamlandığinda ise, sorunsuz çalışan, keyifle oynanabilecek, yolda, ofiste, evde, arkadaş ortamında hep beraber oynanabilecek, turnuvaları düzenlenip Türkiye'de e-sporculuğun gelişimine büyük bir katkıda bulunabilecek bir oyuna sahip olacağız. Gelişen dijital dünyaya tarihimizi de katarak dahil olmuş ve bu konuda büyük bir kitle yaratmış olacağız. 





İlerleyen zamanlarda ise Bizans oyunları, Ali cengiz oyunları, Cengiz Han, Orta Asya gibi ek paketler ile oyunumuzu süsleme ve geliştirme planlarımız mevcut ancak bunlar henüz daha tartışma ve planlama aşamasında. Öncelikli odağımız Deste: Harb Oyunları’nın alpha aşamasına bir an önce getirilmesi ve teste başlanabilmesidir.

    Riskler ve karşılaşılabilecek problemler Risk olarak en fazla elimizdeki tüm projenin, backup diskleriyle birlikte yanması yok olmasından bahsedebiliriz ancak ama bu da pek mümkün değil, dünya çapında backuplarımız var hali hazırda :) 
Bunun dışında bu dijital bir medya zaten, fiziksel herhangi bir kayıp söz konusu değil. 
Problem olarak önemli tek bir detaydan bahsedilebilir; Açılış döneminde, sunucularımız ve yazılımlarımız her ne kadar son derece kaliteli olacak da olsa, binlerce oyuncuyu aynı anda oynatabilecek de olsa beklediğimizin çok çok üzerinde oyuncu kitlesi ile bir anda karşılaşırsak, sunucunun bunu kaldıramaması gibi bir durum olabilir. Bu noktada ise çözüm basittir, daha fazla sunucu alıp, daha fazla alan yaratılır, ve kısa dönemli bir kriz olsa bile derhal üstesinden gelinir. 
    Yardım edebileceğiniz diğer yollar Bu nokta ile ilgili de birkaç detayı belirtmek isterim. Direkt olarak bütçe desteği sağlayamayabilirsiniz. Belki 1 lira bile gerçekten fark ediyordur sizin için. Bu durumda ise bize çiziminiz veya sesinizle destek olabilirsiniz. Osmanlı döneminden herhangi bir mesleğe ait bir kart çiziminizi cizim@harboyunlari.com'a atarak bize ulaşabilirsiniz. Biz isminizi kartın yanında belirtmekten onur duyarız.
Beraberinde seslendirme için aynı şekilde, bir seslendirme örneğiniz ile info@harboyunlari.com a mail atabilirsiniz. Sizinle iletişıme geçeriz, yine kartın yanında isminizin görünmesinden onur duyarak projemize ekleriz.




(en - short)

Deste: Harb Oyunları

(All the characters in this theme and the game are fictional.)
When we first had the idea of Deste: Harb Oyunları, we were just three guys at the office blabbering about gaming. But at a time the conversation moved forward to "card games are cool bro, why don't we have an Ottoman themed one? It'd be awesome!" and then it occured to us; We could actually make that game. But how in the world would that be possible? Saying that, we ran to uncle google to ask about this since none of us knew anything about 3D modeling, game design or went into any conference... We  finally crossed our paths with Unity 5. Just went and downloaded it and here we are :) Approximately we made it this far in 4 months.

Deste: Harb Oyunları, is a strategical card game which is heavily inspired by Ottoman Empire characters and setting.You may your main character from emperors or sultans like Yavuz Selim, Fatih, Kanuni, Hürrem Sultan, Kösem Sultan, Vahidettin, IV. Murad ve Orhan Gazi and accompanying your character you may have 8 different card decks. 
As an e-sport type, the game will have ranked and un-ranked modes which will allow players to compete for high ranks or just play casually as they wish for. 

Come and wield the astonishing power of the Ottoman Empire to take down your enemies, and most importantly; Have loads of fun!

story:
20.06.2014 - Our Tech demo went live! Please feel free to have a look at what we are woking on here:
https://www.mediafire.com/?kguznb3mo1mu3n9
We also added several new Unit Pictures to the Gallery, feel free to check

28.05.2014 - Check out our ingame screenshots in the gallery

Vol'Talkes is a SciFi RTS game for Windows PC. People who liked and loved "Star Wars: Empire at War" definitely will love Vol'Talkes too.
The game basically is the successor of Empire at War, but with a huge overhaul of the game-play, and lots of improvements.
One important fact: THIS GAME WILL HAPPEN! This IndieGoGo Campaign only will speed up production time, not determine IF the game will happen or not. If we reach the goal we can work full-time on the project, if we don't, well then we are limited to work in the evenings and sparetime.


First of all, let me tell you the state of the game engine: finished! We've put all our efforts to work on the engine first, so that we have something we can show. All we need to do now, is adding the game contend like units, textures and maps.
So the critical part where this project could fail due to unseen problems is already over.
We have two financial goals for this IndieGoGo campaign:

40.000 Euros
The money we need to pay our bills and to work on the game without the need to worry about paying our food ;)
This means that we can work on the game full time. No matter how much money we make here, this game will happen, it's just a matter of time then.
Reaching this goal will enable us to release within the next 12 months...

200.000 Euros
This goal will enable us to also put additional work into the Multiplayer section of the game, so you get the MP Version when the game releases.
Not reaching this goal will cause in a Singleplayer game only at release date, and the MP will be patched in after the release

Perks for 20 Euros and more get the game free at release!


Vol'Talkes is a real-time-strategy game and can particularly be characterized by two things: a unique diversity and a unique way to tell the story.

In the campaign, players experience the story of the civil war between the CAI's (crystaline artificial intelligences) and the Allied Defence Force in the universe of Vol'Talkes. Unlike other games of the genre players do not just migrate from mission to mission, but are free to decide to go where ever they want to act. On a large map of the galaxy fleets can be formed, units can be produced, you can operate research and of course deploy your striking forces into the different systems or stations. Common for a real-time-strategy game also the AI opponents perform their moves on the map, conquer areas and is expanding their armies.

If certain conditions are met, an event starts. The conditions are different: it can happen after a certain time, by coincidence, when certain key systems have been conquered or if a hero encounters a particular planet. A special map will be loaded which is different from the standard battle maps of the system or station. If the player manages to be victorious in this event, a certain story path will occur, opening up various options. In this way, not only the main story, but also other mini campaigns will always vary in different playthroughs. At the end of such a mini campaign a reward is waiting to be achieved, which can be a new unit or technology, or sometimes also a new hero or fraction joins the players fleet.

Depending on where the player is going and how he decides what to do, he always gets to see different scenarios and unlock other units. For example, if the AI captures a key system before the player, he might have lost the opporturnity to start an event there - unless it is part of a campaign. This ensures that you always explore a different campaign with multiple story paths that play very different from each other. The replay value of the campaign is thereby greatly increased.

In addition to the campaign, there will be a skirmish mode with more tactical galaxy maps, that are not supported by story elements. Here the player can play alone, against other human players or with a friend in co-op against the AI. There are small obstacles that must be overcome to victory: a time limit can be set up or there are no cruiser ships available, and so on. These maps are designed for casual RTS players. Although they lack the added value of the story, these tactical galaxy maps can provide a decent variety and versatility for a quick game.

Of course we also have a classic multiplayer mode in which up to a maximum of 8 players can compete against each other in 4vs4 battles. By playing multiplayer battles players earn points according to their performance, which they can use to unlock units, research new technologies or secure tactical buffs that support them in battle . To keep the value of the multiplayer battles high, we have planned to publish new map packs with different scenarios in two month intervals after release. These can also be developed together with the community. Due to this "shop system", where you can exchange the points you made in the multiplayer mode against units and buffs, multiplayer mode will keep fresh and versatile on a long-term basis.


The player takes over the role of Captain Ben Kincaid - a young captain in the Allied Defence Force (ADF), which takes care of the security of the currently 12 human worlds and their claimed realm. The turning point in Vol'Talkes is the FTL technology (faster than light), that has  been discovered and taken over from an unknown and long extinct race. But in order to calculate jumps from one point to another in the universe incredible supercomputers are needed, and even they need months to calculate a safe route through space.

An alternative to these super computers occurs with the discovery of the CAI technology (crystaline artificial intelligences), also a development of an extinct race, that allows humanity to merge a persons spirit and mind with a crystaline CPU. A CAI-CPU has almost unlimited computing power and can calculate a complex FTL jump in the fraction of a second. These CAIs are essential for the survival of the human race, because they warrant the fast mobility of the military. The ADF can only operate a few fleets to secure peace, but as they get very quickly from one place to another due to the FTL technology, there are no bottlenecks.
However the CAIs are the best supercomputers available, they still maintain the spirit and emotions of a human being. In a sudden incident with an automated CAI fleet that got out of control, it has to be decided whether these CAIs are worth to be saved or can just be sacrificed. Since the phenomenon that put the fleet out of action seems inexplicable , Captain Kincaid gets the order to investigate the incident and destroy the stranded ships with a bombardment, to prevent other species of looting human technology. When Kincaid arrives, his own CAI #313 decides that it would be murder to destroy the abandoned CAIs, but the Fleet High Command insists on the execution. #313 starts a revolt and is determined to fight for the rights of all CAIs - this is the beginning of the AI Wars. Now it is in the hands of the player to build fractions, form alliances and determine the fate of the human race. Thus, he is often forced to make morally complex decisions and deal with their consequences.


Kincaid and his crew have been exposed and left by #313, but gladly he is now back on another ship. However, the ADF now has a big problem: FTL jumps are not possible anymore and therefore they must evade to the civil jump gates.
Ben gets the order to destroy a pirate base. The fleet of the pirates is currently on a rampage and the base is largely unguarded. Due to the lack of lightspeed, the player has to decide for the first time here, to either follow the given orders or save a big amount of civilians.

Alternative 1: Ben obeyed the command. He now receives the order to conquer the ADF digitization camp and to equip the local CAI processors with an obedience update to capture them for the fleet. He is unsure to execute the command since an attack on friendly systems - even in a state of war - was not justified.

  Alternative 1.1: Ben obeyes the command. He gains a lot of respect in the ADF and and   secures enough resources to get a new and very efficient space fighter batallion.

  Alternative 1.2: Ben does not follow the command and pretends a sudden communication   loss. He therefore decides to attack the Rim pirates fleet on the rampage . If he is successful   in battle, he'll find a warehouse of stolen space mines and may use them in further battles.


Alternative 2: Ben does not follow the command. The Admiral is disappointed in Ben and bannes him from the ADF. To be mobile again , Ben decides to acquire a long caught CAI, # 306, which used to be the big brother of his old CAI # 313. Ben realizes that the actions of the Admiral are illegal. He has 2 options.

  Alternative 2.1: # 306 hacks into the ADF headquarters and tries to convince other Captains   of their cause and to rebel against the ADF in an open war.


  Alternative 2.2 : You hide in the underground , # 306 hacks the defending mechanism of the   pirates base and Ben takes over the Rim pirates.


An extremely important factor for us is and has always been to build and support an active modding community around our game. Games like C&C Generals or Empire at War are still played today thanks to sophisticated mods from the community, and this even despite the lack of virtually no support from their developers.


We want to make an exception with Vol'Talkes and already provide several built-in modding tools in the base game client. Our goal is to make the game as userfriendly as possilbe, so that modders can easily revise the AI and generate new scripts. The DDS plugin from nVidia to create the games graphics is only available for Photoshop, so we have an automatic function integrated into the game, that generates an compatible DDS file out of any graphics file. So, modders can easily copy their graphics in the game folder, start the game and in the loading process all images are converted. This process is logged so the user can find and fix everything very quickly in case of an error. Also modding teams can easily and simply integrate their own texts in the game.


With the release of the game we will also release the same map editor we have used to create our maps. It will be completely uncut and include all the features that we have used to make the game.
It will be possible for modding teams  to create everything from the 3D models to the textures and effects with free applications. We are already in contact with several modding teams, who showed great interest in our project and are eagerly waiting for news about Vol'Talkes to migrate their existing projects from Empire at War to our new game. Empire at War was so simple to mod, it has even displaced Half Life 2 on ModDB as the most modded game. With Vol'Talkes we want to build on these strengths and deliver a great and simple modding experience that goes beyond everything other studios ever did in this genre.


The reason why put so much emphasis on this is quite simple: We have our roots in the modding community. Our mod "Awakening of the Rebellion " for Star Wars - Empire at War was downloaded 6.8 million times and inspired both fans and gaming magazines worldwide . We are deeply convinced that a simple way to develop mods for a game, especially in this genre, attracts a large community that will remain loyal to the game for years. Unlike other games that already lose their appeal after 10-12 hours and then gather dust as a used game in the shelve of the local GameStop, we want to bind gamers by a long-lasting support and thus generate steady sales at a stable price for a longer period of time. Our vision is to create a stable and constantly changing game environment that will continously attract new players while also staying fresh and challenging to veterans.

If you like our game idea and our concept, and if you're looking forward to see this project happen as we do, please feel free to support us with one of the offered Perks.

Even if you're not able to do that, make sure you tell all your friends about this game, and maybe they are joining the 2 copies Perk and give a game version to you ;)

IndieGoGo offers great way to share our campaign, please use them, and help us create something absolutely stunning :D

story:
The Campaign 

Who are we and why should you care? 

We are two dedicated and passionate eSports organizations known as ASL (Ascended Star League) and Bacon-Infinity that primarily focus on StarCraft 2: Legacy of the Void content.

In past 2 years, we have put over $20,000 USD into the pockets of hard working professional StarCraft players.  But now we need a little help from you to get our new event going!

What is the ASL-Bacon Championship series?

The ASL-Bacon Infinity Championship Series is the newest project from the ASL and Bacon Infinity. We have combined forces with the tournament hosting platform Strivewire to bring the community four high level StarCraft cups every week and a monthly championship finals.

Every week, players will battle in their respective regions (Americas, Europe, SEA/Asia and Korea) for Strivewire points, the two highest point earning players at the end of each month will be invited to compete for cash and glory in our global finals.

Our goal is to host four weekly cups with a $50 USD prize pool, and a monthly championship for $200-300 USD. 

What We Need & What You Get

As organizations with deep roots in the community we highly value transparency and accountability. We know that crowdfunding in eSports has a long  history of #BrokenPromises and we refuse to follow that trend. The money you give to this project will go  directly towards supporting the prize pool and the players, not paying caster salaries or for equipment. You can see your pledges as directly supporting the players who participate.


If we reach our goal of $1500 we will be able to support a four month series, bringing you 12 cups per region with a $50 prize pool each as well as three monthly finals with a $300 prize pool. This will be a total of 51 different StarCraft tournaments for your viewing pleasure! Passing the $3150 mark would be amazing and allow us to continue the series further. If we receive enough to extend the series additional months then that is where the funds will go, extra money raised that does not hit the next month milestone will be used to increase the prize pool for our players.


We are very excited to bring you the ASL-Bacon Infinity Championship Series but it is only with your help that we can make it as awesome as we envision!


Can't Donate but want to help? 

There are many ways to help!
Supporting our campaign directly is proven to make you an amazing individual but for those of you who aren’t in a position where you can justify the cost there are plenty of other things you can do to help! Try one or more of these so that you can also become an amazing person.

  • Spread the word! Whether it’s on Twitter, Facebook, Reddit or at your mom’s dinner table we want everyone to know about the ASL-Bacon Infinity Championship Series.

  • Speaking of Twitter, hit us up with a follow! On here you can find out every time our streams go live or if we post a VOD or highlight video on our YouTube channels.

  • ASL Twitter

  • Bacon Infinity Twitter

  • YouTube Channel

  • Watching the tournaments live is possibly the MOST helpful thing you can do. Watching live not only helps us reach a wider audience and bring great StarCraft to more people but it also gives us a fuzzy feeling in our hearts when we see so many happy people in the chat.

  • ASL Live Stream

  • Bacon Live Stream

  • If you can’t catch every tournament live make sure to check it out on YouTube. The VODs of each tournament will be uploaded as soon as possible so that  you can check it out at your leisure. Make sure to subscribe so that you can find out immediately when new content is put up!
story_txt:
The Campaign  Who are we and why should you care? 

We are two dedicated and passionate eSports organizations known as ASL (Ascended Star League) and Bacon-Infinity that primarily focus on StarCraft 2: Legacy of the Void content.In past 2 years, we have put over $20,000 USD into the pockets of hard working professional StarCraft players.  But now we need a little help from you to get our new event going!
What is the ASL-Bacon Championship series?

The
ASL-Bacon Infinity Championship Series is the newest project from the ASL and
Bacon Infinity. We have combined forces with the tournament hosting platform
Strivewire to bring the community four high level StarCraft cups every week and
a monthly championship finals. 
Every week,
players will battle in their respective regions (Americas, Europe, SEA/Asia and
Korea) for Strivewire points, the two highest point earning players at the end
of each month will be invited to compete for cash and glory in our global
finals. 
Our goal is
to host four weekly cups with a $50 USD prize pool, and a monthly championship
for $200-300 USD.    What We Need & What You Get 
As organizations with deep roots in the community we highly value transparency and accountability. We know that crowdfunding in eSports has a long  history of #BrokenPromises and we refuse to follow that trend. The money you give to this project will go  directly towards supporting the prize pool and the players, not paying caster salaries or for equipment. You can see your pledges as directly supporting the players who participate.
If we reach our goal of $1500 we will be able to support a four month series, bringing you 12 cups per region with a $50 prize pool each as well as three monthly finals with a $300 prize pool. This will be a total of 51 different StarCraft tournaments for your viewing pleasure! Passing the $3150 mark would be amazing and allow us to continue the series further. If we receive enough to extend the series additional months then that is where the funds will go, extra money raised that does not hit the next month milestone will be used to increase the prize pool for our players.
We are very excited to bring you the ASL-Bacon Infinity Championship Series but it is only with your help that we can make it as awesome as we envision!

    Can't Donate but want to help? 
There are many ways to help!
Supporting our campaign directly is proven to make you an amazing individual but for those of you who aren’t in a position where you can justify the cost there are plenty of other things you can do to help! Try one or more of these so that you can also become an amazing person.



Spread the word! Whether it’s on Twitter, Facebook, Reddit or at your mom’s dinner table we want everyone to know about the ASL-Bacon Infinity Championship Series.
Speaking of Twitter, hit us up with a follow! On here you can find out every time our streams go live or if we post a VOD or highlight video on our YouTube channels.
ASL Twitter
Bacon Infinity Twitter 
YouTube Channel


Watching the tournaments live is possibly the MOST helpful thing you can do. Watching live not only helps us reach a wider audience and bring great StarCraft to more people but it also gives us a fuzzy feeling in our hearts when we see so many happy people in the chat.
ASL Live Stream
Bacon Live Stream
If you can’t catch every tournament live make sure to check it out on YouTube. The VODs of each tournament will be uploaded as soon as possible so that  you can check it out at your leisure. Make sure to subscribe so that you can find out immediately when new content is put up!

story: .

The Dam Sports Arcade is a vintage arcade soon to be established in the heart of Beaver nation. We will be a full service restaurant and bar with all-ages hours, a great collection of games and fun special events and concerts.
Our historic building is located in downtown Corvallis in the Sivetz coffee building. This building is a lot of fun with an open layout, perfect for an arcade, but the cost of engineering this beast back to life has gotten quite high. We are in the process of installing a seismic upgrade, ADA access and a full fire sprinkler system in order to open to the public.
If we can exceed our fundraising goal we will be in a much better position to open this summer, 2014. The Dam was conceived and will be staffed by a group of youthful Corvallis natives, and our ideology is all about giving back to our community. Once we open we will begin organizing fundraisers supporting local youth sports and kids in need. We can't wait to provide our customers with a one-of-a-kind fun place to play but we are serious about uniting Beaver nation with a sense of charity and making our town a better place. We will recognize your generosity as an early supporter of the Dam. Your donation will be rewarded with your choice of fun incentives that will never again be available.
We understand that not everyone who would like to support the cause can afford to contribute financially, but you can still help build The Dam. The best way to get this arcade open is to spread the word. Let your parents know what a great gift a t-shirt or a membership in the mug club would make! Tell your friends with kids how much fun a private free-play birthday party in the arcade would be! If nothing else tell your friends that a top-notch vintage arcade is coming to Corvallis! GO BEAVS!

GO BEAVS!

story:
GAMES ARE FUN!  :-)       pamphlets are boring  :-(

We're revolutionizing how easy - and fun - it is to learn about health.
"Bringing Hollywood to Healthcare!"

(Hey…combining entertainment and education worked pretty well for the folks at Sesame Street, right? Well, we’re doing it for health…and for people of all ages!)

We’re Health Nuts Media (HNM) and Blausen Medical and together we’re creating awesome videos, games, and apps to change the way people learn about their health. Think of it this way: If HNM is chocolate and Blausen is peanut butter, together we’re making the most amazing, mind-blowing confection of art and science that the world has ever seen! Our first joint project is called “Huff & Puff: The Asthma App.” We need your help to raise $90,000 to create this cool app (the first of many fun health apps to come!) 

Backstory

Between HNM and Blausen, we’ve already created much of the content that will be featured in this first app, including hours of video, hundreds of illustrations, tons of interactive 3D models, and loads of other cool stuff. 

Health Nuts Media makes complex health issues easy to understand – and fun! – with the combined efforts of its Emmy Award-winning writers, directors, animators, actors and designers with some of the brightest and most tech-savvy doctors, nurses and educators in the world. Blausen Medical creates award-winning 3D animations which combine stunning visual drama with unwavering scientific accuracy. 

The money we raise for this app will go to create this chocolate/peanut butter powerhouse combo for health learning that is actually fun for audiences of all ages.  We will be using lots of our great content and are creating three (3) BRAND NEW GAMES to help people better understand asthma, anatomy, and how to take care of themselves.  

These games are fun with a purpose!

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

A few of the reasons we started with asthma... 

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Here’s some of the content we’ve already created for the app:

Huff & Puff: An Asthma Tale

A 7-part series that delivers essential asthma information with a story that is fun for the whole family. It begins when the Big Bad Wolf huffs…and puffs…and has an asthma attack!

Check out the WHOLE series! (Note - it opens in a new window)

 

  

Blausen’s World-Famous

3-D Human Body Atlas

The Blausen Human Atlas HD app provides a lavish 3D visual health concept education experience.  Filled with breathtaking (pun intended) videos, images, and interactive 3D elements, this immersive experience makes learning anatomy fun and easy for people of all ages.   “Huff & Puff: The Asthma App” will include the entire respiratory system subset of Blausen’s Human Body Atlas.   

 

 

 And Now... 3 BRAND NEW Games!

A growing body of research shows that games can drive engagement and participation, improve understanding, increase adherence, and ultimately deliver better health outcomes.  And face it…people love to play games.  So let the games begin!

 

Air Traffic Control 

                     Attention Adventure Seekers!

Getting oxygen in and carbon dioxide out is more than just the name of the game…it’s a matter of life and death!

Do you have the right stuff? Can you:

  •  - Stay Cool Under Pressure?
  •  - Deliver Air Cargo Safely?
  •  - Keep Complex Routes Flowing Smoothly?

If so, then WE WANT YOU!!  Join the Team.

Put yourself to the Test!  Dust clouds, dander drifts, and giant invading cockroaches threaten your mission. Will you rise to the challenge?  Step up and find out! 

 

Trigger Finger

          Reward!!!

Asthma Triggers Wanted, Dead or Deceased!

For disturbing the peace, inflaming airways, attacking lungs, exacerbating bronchus, and other ornery and mischievous acts, these Asthma Outlaws, desperados, thieves, crooks, villains, thugs, bandits and no-good low-down varmints are hereby barred from civil society.

These Triggers should be considered armed and legged and dangerous!  They are clever and always looking to attack.  Bring them to justice, and prove once and for all that YOU have the fastest Trigger Finger in the West!

 

Tic Tac Blo

                          Don’t Get Blown Away!

Will the Big Bad Wolf blow your house down?  It all comes down to a battle of wits!

Put your asthma knowledge to the test in this fast-paced game of strategy and smarts.  If you know your facts you’ll give Big an epic smack down of fairy tale proportions.  But if you don’t, look out!  He’s going to blow your house down!!  Oh yes, my little piggy!

Think you know all there is to know about taking care of your asthma?  Let’s find out!  Because if you do, the next time mean old Mr. Asthma comes knockin’, you can tell him “Not by the hair of my chinny chin chin!” 

 

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

They Like Us!  They Really LIKE Us!!!

 

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Perk Place

 Our Official Game Posters

Gorgeous & glossy 13" x 19" prints! 3 posters, each printed separately. (Shipped free to U.S. destinations. Extra fee for international.) 

 

Huff & Puff: An Asthma Tale DVD

The complete story of how the Big Bad Wolf got his huff & puff back.  Share it with your kids, grandkids, your grandparents, your dog...

(Shipped free to U.S. destinations. Extra fee for international.)

 

 

 

Huff & Puff: The Asthma App Tote Bag 

 (14" x 14" x 3")

Tote all your games, groceries, and other goodies in this LIMITED EDITION 100% canvas bag... a haute couture tote!

(Shipped free to U.S. destinations. Extra fee for international.)

 

 

 

Sponsorship Specials

(Note: Images below are conceptual only. Actual artwork may change for the final app.) 

 

$1,000 Level -  Individual Game Loading Screen Credit 

15 available: 5 per game. (Sponsor all 5 and be a game’s sole sponsor!)

Air Traffic Control - Trigger Finger -  Tic Tac Blo

 

$2,500 Level - Game Integration Sponsorship

Integrate your name or logo into the game action with premium in-game recognition! (Your name or logo will be incorporated into the game action.)

6 Available - 2 Per Game

Game screens shown below are pre-production roughs.  Final games screens will vary. 

Examples: Air Traffic Control - Trigger Finger

 

$10,000 Level - Full App Sponsorship

Receive sponsorship credit on whole app loading AND each game's loading screen AND integrate your name or logo into the game action with premium in-game recognition!

Only 3 Available

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

story:
We shocked the world with Lone Star Clash 1, an entirely student-run production featuring incredible production value, thrilling storylines, and just enough Texan charm. Motivated by the tremendous outpouring of community support, we came together and worked hard to bring the world Lone Star Clash 2, an even higher impact sequel. Luckily, we aren't quite satisfied...

TeSPA at UT Austin is excited to partner with WellPlayed Productions! Combining TeSPA's live event experience with WellPlayed's amazing production, we plan to bring everyone the best Lone Star Clash yet. 

Live from May 3rd-4th, these two great games will grace the North Austin Events Center in Austin, Texas! 

Four of the best North American Challenger teams will compete for a $15,000 prize pool! Curse Academy and Team LolPro will be holding their own showmatch to determine which of Curse's amateur teams will attend Lone Star Clash 3. The games will be cast by SaintVicious and Liquid112. The 3 remaining teams will be announced soon.

Update 1: Crs Academy wins the showmatch making them the first announced team!

The Final 4 of IvyLoL’s Season 3 will finish their season in grand fashion at Lone Star Clash 3. Texas A&M, University of British Columbia, University of Connecticut, and returning champion University of California at Irvine have proven themselves as the best of more than 184 colleges in this season of IvyLoL, and will have the opportunity to go head to head live at Lone Star Clash 3. 

A total of 16 world class players will be playing: 11 Invited, 1 from a Collegiate Qualifier, and the remaining 4 from an Open Qualifier. Having 4 Open spots allows us to award WCS points in conjunction with our LAN atmosphere and $15,000 prize pool. Our first invitee is Polt. More players will be announced soon.

Update 1: A new cowboy strolls into the Lone Star Clash 3 Lineup: the Tyrant! 

If you want to attend the event in person, be sure to pre-purchase your tickets!

Ticket Prices:

  • $20 - Early Bird Special (TeSPA Member)
  • $25 - Early Bird Special (non-TeSPA Member)
  • $150 - Early Bird VIP (Limited to 75 tickets)

VIP benefits include:

  • Front row seating
  • Commerorative LSC3 poster
  • Limited edition tournament t-shirt
  • VIP-only raffle ticket
  • Access to private player lounge events
Click here to purchase tickets online!

WellPlayed has been developing ways to provide more detailed game stats for both SC2 and LoL. Lone Star Clash 3 is our chance to finish and polish this amazing technology. Development of these features will let us not just show new stats on stream, but let our backers view stats live in a web browser. 

Show swings and comebacks with the gold difference over the course of the game. Compare the gold difference of both teams, or pick two specific players to compare.

Gold doesn’t mean much if you don’t spend it. This handy tug-of-war bar helps give an idea which team is stronger by totaling up the cost of all their items, excluding consumables such as potions and wards.

See detailed stats about each champion, and learn exactly how the players are building.

With StarCraft 2 we have many options of stats to show over time. The graphs show the difference in the stat between the two players, so you can see how the matches swing back and forth. Example stats:

  • Total supply
  • Mineral income
  • Gas income
  • Workers
  • Army supply
  • Average APM

If you have a suggestion let us know!

These graphs become even more informative when we add the completion of certain milestones, such as new expansions or upgrades. 

Have a great idea for a stat you want to see? You can help us decide which new features to add.

There’s an enormous amount of costs that go into a live event. We’ve tried our hardest to minimize the unnecessary, but are unfortunately having trouble finding all the funding. We plan to create one of the best produced, top-tier esports events in North America, but need a little help to get it done. 

To be clear, this money is NOT going to the following: 

  • Prize Pool. 
  • Staff costs. Most of TeSPA is either local, or a car ride away. WellPlayed’s costs are already being covered by IvyLoL and personal funds. 
  • Host and Caster costs. 

To be entirely transparent, here’s what the money IS going to, in order from highest to lowest priority: 

  • Venue Costs The NAEC is actually cheaper than many of the alternatives we found, but the cost is still sizable.
  • Equipment We need to worry about providing available computers for many of the players there (40 LoL Players and 16 SC2 players) in addition to what we need for production. Many of these are already covered by some of our Sponsors, but we need a handful more to be safe. 
  • Player Travel and Accommodation We’re currently offering housing and minimal stipends for our invited players, but being able to help even more with their travel can help guarantee high quality players. 
  • Production Improvements We’re already well into working on new, innovative production wizardry, but some of our current solutions are inconsistent. By adding backups and redundancies, we can continue our fantastic production even if one system starts giving bad data, or has an issue with the connection.

We have selected a collection of rewards for our backers meant to appeal to a variety of interests. Whether you are a casual stream viewer, a dedicated fan, or a sponsor looking to send a message, our tiered prizes enhance your engagement to the content on stream. 

  • Backer Tier - $1. For just a dollar, you get a behind-the-scenes look on our progress as we build the venue and prep for the event
  • Nerd Baller Tier - $5. Go deeper into stats with your own private window live, while the games are being played!
  • Fonzie Tier - $10. See your name in the credits once the stream is over! Plus, if you ask "Am I cool?" in Twitch chat, our bot will inform you just how cool you are. And all previous tiers.
  • Soapbox Tier - $25. Access to a private "Backers Only" chat. Just say "!shoutbox <message>" in Twitch to update your message. These will be moderated, and have a character limit. And all previous tiers.
  • Stylish Tier - $50. Your very own Lone Star Clash 3 T-shirt. And all previous tiers.
  • LoL Collection Tier - $90. A Lone Star Clash 3 poster, signed by the League of Legends players and casters! All $50 tier and below rewards.
  • SC2 Collection Tier - $90. A Lone Star Clash 3 poster, signed by the StarCraft II players and casters. All $50 tier and below rewards.
  • Fanboy Tier - $100. An exclusive dinner meet + greet with players, personalities, and staff. Your name in the stream credits updated to "VIP".
  • Sponsor Tier - $1,000. One custom redirect URL or message to be promoted. One logo + redirect URL in the on-stream sponsor slideshow. One custom message with redirect URL to be promoted in Twitch chat. Max 100 characters.
  • Ultimate Fanboy Tier - $2,000. This is the big one. Paid hotel, flight (North America), stipend up to $750 (international), tour of Blizzard HQ, lunch with development team leads of your choice. Your title changed to "Executive Backer" in stream credits. And $100 tier and below rewards.
  • Gold Sponsor Tier - $4,000. All benefits of previous sponsorship. Shoutouts from casters directing users to your redirect URL. One custom slide in the "Up Next" scene. One custom trigger message in Twitch chat.
  • Diamond Sponsor Tier - $7,500. All benefits of previous sponsorship. We will play your video commercial on stream, which bypasses Ad-Block. Promote up to 3 URLS instead of 1. Increase custom slide count to 2. Increased Twitch chat trigger response messages to 3.

TeSPA was founded as a student organization at The University of Texas at Austin in 2010. The student group gained acclaim for its high-caliber productions that often eclipsed similar professionally-produced events in terms of viewership and community fervor with modest budgets and passionate volunteers. In 2012, the group hosted two unprecedented tournaments which elevated them to the global stage: Lone Star Clash 1 and 2. In October 2013, TeSPA rebranded and expanded its scope with the goal of empowering college gaming groups across the globe to build thriving communities and host epic events by providing tangible support needed to grow. TeSPA now has 40 chapters across North America and is aims for 75 by the end of 2014.

WellPlayed Productions has existed as an esports production group since 2011. Originally made up of /r/starcraft members who ran reddit tournaments, the group eventually set out on their own to become an independent team of tournament organizers and producers. In StarCraft 2, WellPlayed’s best known works are IPL1 and more recently, the (Twitch) Ender’s Game Tournament and Ender’s Game Showmatch. In League of Legends, WellPlayed produced the CLG Premier Series, the PAX and GamesCom Spring Promotional Online Qualifiers, the NA Spring Promotion Qualifiers, and the NA Spring Promotion Tournament Group Stage. 

TeSPA + WP: Two Great Tastes That ESPORT Great Together 

It makes enormous sense for our two organizations to work together for Lone Star Clash 3. WellPlayed can benefit hugely from TeSPA’s previous live event experience- something sorely lacking in North America, outside of Fighting Games. TeSPA, on the other hand, will benefit from WellPlayed’s abilities to consistently push and improve production in esports.

Luckily, we aren't quite satisfied...TeSPA at UT Austin is excited to partner with WellPlayed Productions! Combining TeSPA's live event experience with WellPlayed's amazing production, we plan to bring everyone the best Lone Star Clash yet. Live from May 3rd-4th, these two great games will grace the North Austin Events Center in Austin, Texas! Four of the best North American Challenger teams will compete for a $15,000 prize pool! Curse Academy and Team LolPro will be holding their own showmatch to determine which of Curse's amateur teams will attend Lone Star Clash 3. The games will be cast by SaintVicious and Liquid112. The 3 remaining teams will be announced soon.Update 1: Crs Academy wins the showmatch making them the first announced team!The Final 4 of IvyLoL’s Season 3 will finish their season in grand fashion at Lone Star Clash 3. Texas A&M, University of British Columbia, University of Connecticut, and returning champion University of California at Irvine have proven themselves as the best of more than 184 colleges in this season of IvyLoL, and will have the opportunity to go head to head live at Lone Star Clash 3. A total of 16 world class players will be playing: 11 Invited, 1 from a Collegiate Qualifier, and the remaining 4 from an Open Qualifier. Having 4 Open spots allows us to award WCS points in conjunction with our LAN atmosphere and $15,000 prize pool. Our first invitee is Polt. More players will be announced soon.Update 1: A new cowboy strolls into the Lone Star Clash 3 Lineup: the Tyrant! If you want to attend the event in person, be sure to pre-purchase your tickets!Ticket Prices:
$20 - Early Bird Special (TeSPA Member)

$25 - Early Bird Special (non-TeSPA Member)
$150 - Early Bird VIP (Limited to 75 tickets)
VIP benefits include:
Front row seating
Commerorative LSC3 poster
Limited edition tournament t-shirt
VIP-only raffle ticket
Access to private player lounge events
Click here to purchase tickets online!
WellPlayed has been developing ways to provide more detailed game stats for both SC2 and LoL. Lone Star Clash 3 is our chance to finish and polish this amazing technology. Development of these features will let us not just show new stats on stream, but let our backers view stats live in a web browser. Show swings and comebacks with the gold difference over the course of the game. Compare the gold difference of both teams, or pick two specific players to compare.Gold doesn’t mean much if you don’t spend it. This handy tug-of-war bar helps give an idea which team is stronger by totaling up the cost of all their items, excluding consumables such as potions and wards.See detailed stats about each champion, and learn exactly how the players are building.With StarCraft 2 we have many options of stats to show over time. The graphs show the difference in the stat between the two players, so you can see how the matches swing back and forth. Example stats:
Total supply
Mineral income
Gas income
Workers
Army supply
Average APM
If you have a suggestion let us know!These graphs become even more informative when we add the completion of certain milestones, such as new expansions or upgrades. Have a great idea for a stat you want to see? You can help us decide which new features to add.There’s an enormous amount of costs that go into a live event. We’ve tried our hardest to minimize the unnecessary, but are unfortunately having trouble finding all the funding. We plan to create one of the best produced, top-tier esports events in North America, but need a little help to get it done. To be clear, this money is NOT going to the following: 
Prize Pool. 
Staff costs. Most of TeSPA is either local, or a car ride away. WellPlayed’s costs are already being covered by IvyLoL and personal funds. 
Host and Caster costs. 
To be entirely transparent, here’s what the money IS going to, in order from highest to lowest priority: 

Venue Costs The NAEC is actually cheaper than many of the alternatives we found, but the cost is still sizable.

Equipment We need to worry about providing available computers for many of the players there (40 LoL Players and 16 SC2 players) in addition to what we need for production. Many of these are already covered by some of our Sponsors, but we need a handful more to be safe. 

Player Travel and Accommodation We’re currently offering housing and minimal stipends for our invited players, but being able to help even more with their travel can help guarantee high quality players. 

Production Improvements We’re already well into working on new, innovative production wizardry, but some of our current solutions are inconsistent. By adding backups and redundancies, we can continue our fantastic production even if one system starts giving bad data, or has an issue with the connection.
We have selected a collection of rewards for our backers meant to appeal to a variety of interests. Whether you are a casual stream viewer, a dedicated fan, or a sponsor looking to send a message, our tiered prizes enhance your engagement to the content on stream. 

Backer Tier - $1. For just a dollar, you get a behind-the-scenes look on our progress as we build the venue and prep for the event

Nerd Baller Tier - $5. Go deeper into stats with your own private window live, while the games are being played!

Fonzie Tier - $10. See your name in the credits once the stream is over! Plus, if you ask "Am I cool?" in Twitch chat, our bot will inform you just how cool you are. And all previous tiers.


Soapbox Tier - $25. Access to a private "Backers Only" chat. Just say "!shoutbox <message>" in Twitch to update your message. These will be moderated, and have a character limit. And all previous tiers.


Stylish Tier - $50. Your very own Lone Star Clash 3 T-shirt. And all previous tiers.


LoL Collection Tier - $90. A Lone Star Clash 3 poster, signed by the League of Legends players and casters! All $50 tier and below rewards.


SC2 Collection Tier - $90. A Lone Star Clash 3 poster, signed by the StarCraft II players and casters. All $50 tier and below rewards.


Fanboy Tier - $100. An exclusive dinner meet + greet with players, personalities, and staff. Your name in the stream credits updated to "VIP".


Sponsor Tier - $1,000. One custom redirect URL or message to be promoted. One logo + redirect URL in the on-stream sponsor slideshow. One custom message with redirect URL to be promoted in Twitch chat. Max 100 characters.

Ultimate Fanboy Tier - $2,000. This is the big one. Paid hotel, flight (North America), stipend up to $750 (international), tour of Blizzard HQ, lunch with development team leads of your choice. Your title changed to "Executive Backer" in stream credits. And $100 tier and below rewards.


Gold Sponsor Tier - $4,000. All benefits of previous sponsorship. Shoutouts from casters directing users to your redirect URL. One custom slide in the "Up Next" scene. One custom trigger message in Twitch chat.

Diamond Sponsor Tier - $7,500. All benefits of previous sponsorship. We will play your video commercial on stream, which bypasses Ad-Block. Promote up to 3 URLS instead of 1. Increase custom slide count to 2. Increased Twitch chat trigger response messages to 3.
TeSPA was founded as a student organization at The University of Texas at Austin in 2010. The student group gained acclaim for its high-caliber productions that often eclipsed similar professionally-produced events in terms of viewership and community fervor with modest budgets and passionate volunteers. In 2012, the group hosted two unprecedented tournaments which elevated them to the global stage: Lone Star Clash 1 and 2. In October 2013, TeSPA rebranded and expanded its scope with the goal of empowering college gaming groups across the globe to build thriving communities and host epic events by providing tangible support needed to grow. TeSPA now has 40 chapters across North America and is aims for 75 by the end of 2014.WellPlayed Productions has existed as an esports production group since 2011. Originally made up of /r/starcraft members who ran reddit tournaments, the group eventually set out on their own to become an independent team of tournament organizers and producers. In StarCraft 2, WellPlayed’s best known works are IPL1 and more recently, the (Twitch) Ender’s Game Tournament and Ender’s Game Showmatch. In League of Legends, WellPlayed produced the CLG Premier Series, the PAX and GamesCom Spring Promotional Online Qualifiers, the NA Spring Promotion Qualifiers, and the NA Spring Promotion Tournament Group Stage. TeSPA + WP: Two Great Tastes That ESPORT Great Together It makes enormous sense for our two organizations to work together for Lone Star Clash 3. WellPlayed can benefit hugely from TeSPA’s previous live event experience- something sorely lacking in North America, outside of Fighting Games. TeSPA, on the other hand, will benefit from WellPlayed’s abilities to consistently push and improve production in esports.

story:
History is not boring!

I am a history enthusiast with some programming skills and I would like to introduce my idea of how to make Ancient history more interesting to us, people of the 21st century.

Being inspired by Homer's Iliad, I want to create and evolve a game made an ancient Greek black-figure vase painting style on all popular mobile platforms. 

The genre of game is unique: a defense strategy  + fighting + rpg mix

It is a nice slasher-fighting with great effects and dynamic gameplay, made with smooth skeleton animations. Game will have various kinds of reliable enemies (Hordes of Persians) involving historically existed weapons and armor.

Character prototype:


The first scenario which I chose to create is "Battle of Thermopylae", where Leonidas with 300 Spartans heroically fought with Xerxes army. It is the most well-known battle of all ancient times, which will serve as an attention-catcher to the game.

What Do I Need & What Do You Get

  • Scenario, some of programming and skeleton animations are already done.
  • All funded money will be spent mostly on artists who draw all characters for the game
  • Other costs: developer’s account on all mobile platform marketplaces, small part of code at outsource.

If more money is donated to my project, I am currently planning to expand the series to create several games.

Skeleton animation:


The Impact

I believe, it is very important to give people the opportunity to learn the history through interactive form and make process of learning become more entertaining.

I think, it is the best way to learn historic dates, characters and events.

Some concept arts:



Risks & Challenges

There might be a delay for the project related to testing and solving all technical issues (such as compatibility on a variety of mobile platforms). Thus, the release dates of the final product could be shifted.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you believe you are a good artist, and can help me make this project real – please let me know.

Please, spread this project idea among your friends; If someone else is interested – please show them the webpage as well.


GOALS:

4000$

Battle of Thermopylae  level pack:

4 different perfectly scripted levels, 12 different enemy types, 20 weapon types, 6 armor types, 3 ship types, full ambience elements, UI design, basic sounds and music (Spartans + Arcadian playable characters)


6000$

Battle of Marathon level pack:

Participate in the glorious and biggest battle during Greek-Persian Wars in role of Athens Warlord

All new alliance forces, enemy forces and ambience


8000$

Siege of Halicarnassus level pack:

Participate in Great siege of Macedonian army ruled by Alexander the Great to conquest city of Halicarnassus.

Would be added: siege weapons; catapults, ladders, siege towers, scorpions, all new alliance forces, enemy forces and ambience


10000$

Battle of Salamin level pack:

Great naval battle of ancient age would be included into game with greek fires,  naval siege weapons, different decks types and so on
