story:
STRETCH GOALS AND REWARDS ANNOUNCED!

$650 - UNLOCKED - Free PDF of The Shrine of St. Aleena by Pete Spahn, Published by Small Niche Games

$750 - UNLOCKED - Free PDF of The Chronicles of Amherth by Pete Spahn, Published by Small Niche Games

$850 - UNLOCKED - Free PDF of Ghoul Keep & The Ghoul Lands by Pete Spahn, Published by Small Niche Games

$950 - UNLOCKED - Spell Appendix - The Class Compendium will feature an extra Appendix which will include all of the Advanced Edition Companion spells used by classes featured in the Compendium, for ease of reference.

$1000 - UNLOCKED - Extra Classes - At $1000, we'll add an additional class to the Class Compendium, and for each additional $250 dollars over that, we'll add another!

$1250 - ISBN - At $1250 we'll purchase an ISBN, so the Class Compendium can be available in hardcover in major retails across the country! Even if they don't have it in stock, with an ISBN, you'll be able to order it from major retailers and hobby shops everywhere!

$1500 - NPC Generator - At $1500 we'll include an extra appendix which will include a collection of charts to quickly and easily generate NPCs using the classes featured in the Class Compendium. A few rolls of the dice and you've got an instant NPC that goes beyond the core classes of Labyrinth Lord.

 

 

 

 

UPDATE: $750 Stretch Reward Revealed: Chronicles of Amherth PDF!

All backers of the Torch Bearer ($5) or more will now have a PDF copy of The Chronicles of Amherth added to their rewards. This original setting for Labyrinth Lord is the perfect companion to The Shrine of St. Aleena and the Class Compendium. You've got all classes, a campaign world and an adventure ready to go! Thanks again to Pete Spahn and Small Niche Games for their wonderful support.



UPDATE: $650 Stretch Reward Revealed: The Shrine of St. Aleena PDF!
All backers of the Torch Bearer ($5) or more will now have a PDF copy of The Shrine of St. Aleena added to their rewards. This Labyrinth Lord adventure for characters of 1st to 3rd level is the perfect opportunity to start a new campaign with all the new class options you'll have from your Class Compendium! Special thanks to Pete Spahn and Small Niche Games for their wonderful support.

UPDATE: Stretch Rewards!

Well just because we've made our goal, doesn't mean the fun has to end! Thanks to Small Niche Games, we're going to be offering extra rewards to any of our backers who have supported at the Torch Bearer level or higher, with more rewards to be unlocked as the funding goes higher! Rewards ill be announced at $650, $750, and $1000!

UPDATE: EXCLUSIVE CLASS THE THOPIAN GNOME!

And we're funded!!!!!!! So with that, let's reveal the final Class Compendium exclusive class: The Thopian Gnome. He's a devilishly charming little guy, inspired by and released with permission from Lesser Gnome, the Thopian Gnome is based on their iconic mascot! Part magic-user, part charming schemer, all gnome!

 Gnomes are diminutive creatures, typically standing around three feet tall with sharp features and long noses. They regularly sport long white beards and merry smiles. The Thopian gnome is a rare subrace of these creatures which is said to come from a distant realm in a hidden vale. It is believed that they are all descended from a single progenitor – a nefarious, yet highly virile gnome whose is said to be have a skilled silver tongue and a gift for all manner of vile magic.


WE'RE FUNDED!!!!!!!!!!


UPDATE: EXCLUSIVE CLASS THE LUCKY FOOL REVEALED!


Wow! We shot right past $500 and are just $25 dollars from our goal! That means the reveal of another original class for Labyrinth Lord and other old-school fantasy role-playing games for The Class Compendium: The Lucky Fool!

 It is said that halflings are born lucky and none exemplify this more than the Lucky Fool. Choosing to go off on an adventure on a whim, they have no real gifts or talents beyond their uncanny luck. Things always seem to turn out for the best for the Lucky Fool, no matter how bleak they seem. This uncanny trait makes them valuable, if often reckless additions to any adventuring party who some how accomplish the impossible through sheer chance!

This full 8-level class is for Labyrinth Lord and other old-school fantasy role-playing games. Art by Jeff Freels.





UPDATE: EXCLUSIVE CLASS THE RAGING SLAYER REVEALED!

We've soared past the $450 mark and are well on our way to $500! As promised here's a tease from the Class Compendium! A new, never before seen class exclusive to this product: The Raging Slayer!

 While all dwarves have a natural knack for combat, there are some of the bearded folk who are born with a special lust for battle. Whether they are blessed (or cursed) by the dwarvish gods of war, none can say. They sing and slay in equal measure, wandering the land in search of terrifying beasts that might fall beneath their axe, pausing only long enough to drink themselves into a stupor at a roadside tavern. They are called raging slayers and their craving for war cannot be slaked.

This is a full 12-level class is for Labyrinth Lord and other old-school fantasy role-playing games. Art by Maciej Zagorski of The Forge Studios.


UPDATE: CLASS COMPENDIUM INTRO BY DANIEL PROCTOR!

One of the fathers of OSR gaming will be contributing to the Class Compendium by penning the introduction! Daniel Proctor, founder of Goblinoid Games and author of Labyrinth Lord, will offer a few words in the opening pages of the Class Compendium!

In addition to writing Labyrinth Lord and the Advanced Edition Companion, Mr. Proctor has also written Cryptworld, Starships & Spacemen (2nd Edition), Rotworld, Realms of Crawling Chaos, GORE, as well as co-authoring Mutant Future!

More information on all the products available from Goblinoid Games can be found at GoblinoidGames.com!


UPDATE: CLASS COMPENDIUM COVER REVEALED!

We've reached $400.00 in just three days! To celebrate, I'm revealing the full-color wrap around cover for Class Compendium, with art by intrudstry veteran Eric Lofgren! Mr. Lofgren has contributed artwork to countless major publishers in the role-playing game industry including Alderac Entertainment Group, Fantasy Flight Games, Goodman Games, Green Ronin Publishing, Necromancer Games, Paizo Publishing, Steve Jackson Games, West End Games and White Wolf Publishing just to name a few!

So without further delay...

Front Cover:


Back Cover:


Short Summary

Greetings,

My name is James M. Spahn and I am the one-man show that is Barrel Rider Games. In addition to publishing over seventy PDF products for Labyrinth Lord, OSRIC and Swords & Wizardry I have also done freelance writing for Cubicle 7 Entertainment and regular contributions to Small Niche Games' Brave the Labyrinth magazine.

I've been playing table-top RPGs for over 25 years and Barrel Rider Games has been in business three years. In that time BRG has produced over 75 products, several of which have reached the top five on RPGNow's Hottest Sellers list. These include Sleepy Hollow, Buccaneers & Bilge Rats, Frozen Fortress of the Winter Warlord and Player's Companion.

This campaign is being launched to raise money to purchase the necessary equipment to publish the first major print product from Barrel Rider Games - the Class Compendium. The Class Compendium will be a compilation of fifty classes for use with Labyrinth Lord and other OSR games that were previously only available as PDFs. It will have a full color hardcover and feature black and white art through out its interior.

The Class Compendium was already well into production when the computer used to develop products for Barrel Rider Games began a rapid decline. It's only a matter of time before the poor, over-worked machine finally gives up the ghost and brings the future of Barrel Rider Games to a halt. To that end, I'm turning to the OSR community and internet at large to not only help me bring the Class Compendium  to life, but also ensure the future of BRG for years to come through this Indiegogo campaign.

Where Your Money Goes

Because Class Compendium will be printed through One Bookshelf's Print-on-Demand service, the cost of production is kept to a minimum. Listed below is a break down of where the funds go.

  • Hardware and Software to Produce the Book: $300
  • Art, Editing & Layout: $200
  • Incidentals & Buffer Money: $50

Risks & Challenges

Because of the nature of how the Class Compendium will be produced and the nature of Print-on-Demand products, there is very little risk involved. I'm giving myself an ample amount of time to prepare and develop the Class Compendium. Still, no project is fool proof. Delays can happen.

In the unlikely event that delays occur, supporters will be kept up to date on a weekly basis. Communication is key. All supporters who receive PDF perks and at-cost rewards will be contacted via e-mail when the campaign has ended. PDFs will be made available within two weeks of the campaign ending and at cost print-on-demand products will be available as soon as the product proofs are approved.

Other Ways You Can Help

Share the love! Tell everyone how awesome Barrel Rider Games and OSR gaming really is! Social media is the driving force of crowd funded projects so don't be afraid to spread the word!

The Class Compendium was already well into production when the computer used to develop products for Barrel Rider Games began a rapid decline. It's only a matter of time before the poor, over-worked machine finally gives up the ghost and brings the future of Barrel Rider Games to a halt. To that end, I'm turning to the OSR community and internet at large to not only help me bring the Class Compendium  to life, but also ensure the future of BRG for years to come through this Indiegogo campaign.

    Where Your Money Goes Because Class Compendium will be printed through One Bookshelf's Print-on-Demand service, the cost of production is kept to a minimum. Listed below is a break down of where the funds go.  Hardware and Software to Produce the Book: $300 Art, Editing & Layout: $200 Incidentals & Buffer Money: $50    Risks & Challenges Because of the nature of how the Class Compendium will be produced and the nature of Print-on-Demand products, there is very little risk involved. I'm giving myself an ample amount of time to prepare and develop the Class Compendium. Still, no project is fool proof. Delays can happen.
In the unlikely event that delays occur, supporters will be kept up to date on a weekly basis. Communication is key. All supporters who receive PDF perks and at-cost rewards will be contacted via e-mail when the campaign has ended. PDFs will be made available within two weeks of the campaign ending and at cost print-on-demand products will be available as soon as the product proofs are approved.
Other Ways You Can Help
 Share the love! Tell everyone how awesome Barrel Rider Games and OSR gaming really is! Social media is the driving force of crowd funded projects so don't be afraid to spread the word!

story:
Our names are Jackson Tegu and Joe Mcdaldno. We want to come to Big Bad Con, but there is a spot of trouble. We live hundreds of miles and kilometers away. It's too far to walk - we're going to need to teach ourselves to fly, before we can actually make it down to California.

The good news is that we're both game designers in the vaguely autobiographical vein. Once we master the art of flight, we'll create games about the experience and share them with you.

This is a fundraiser to send two silly, loveable friends down to Big Bad Con. It's mostly a request for charity, as well as a chance for our friends to see us again if they can help subsidize the trip. In exchange for such hospitality, we're putting on offer two short, ephemeral games about birds and flight.

Funds will go toward airfare first, and other trip costs (like food) second. Anything raised in excess of $1k will be donated to Big Bad Con.

 

The first game is Brave Sparrow, by Joe Mcdaldno. It's a game to be played in the margins of your own life (like Jackson Tegu's Temper, or The Stork by Andre Monserrat),  a meditation on what it means to be a sparrow trapped inside a human body, and a journey to return to your true form.

The second game is The Cacophony, by Jackson Tegu. It's a game about a flock – a murder, really – of magically realistic crows, descending upon a situation in order to pluck snippets out of human minds and chew them over with their colleagues. The Cacophony's playtime is short: it plays mid-session during another game's pause, drawing upon that story's fiction and adding to it in ways that enlighten, but don't burden.

Only backers of this IndieGoGo campaign will receive copies of these games at this time - no other copies will be made available before Fabricated Realities 2013.

Both of these games are short and strange.

 


While we're offering games and other tokens of appreciation to those who support this campaign, it's mostly a request for charity. Only give money to this campaign if you're excited about the two of us arriving at Big Bad Con this fall.

The games on offer are short, and will likely be presented in a zine or pocketbook format. Think of them as a thank-you gift for a generous donation, as opposed to a game you've paid twenty-five dollars for.

Hopefully this campaign funds! I want to give you all hugs, and play games with as many of you as possible.

"Joe and Jackson are beautiful creatures. I made them put on this fundraiser so I could see them at Big Bad Con. I'm selfish but I'll share. Chip in and you can see them too." -Sean Nittner

 

(Images courtesy of www.public-domain-image.com)

story:
What is this?

Ever wondered what it is like to jump out of an aircraft 50,000 feet above a stricken oil tanker? Or how you’d handle defusing an IED? Or what it is like standing between a visiting VIP and that sniper’s bullet? Well now you can because The Company will put you right at the centre of the action.

In The Company you play an employee of The Company – an elite independent Private Military Service Provider, a global security concern capable of dealing with any situation from a high octane firefight to the tracking down of serial killers.  If you can think of it, The Company can handle it.


This 214 page Roleplaying which puts you in the boots of a member of The Company. Play a solider, a pilot, a surveillance officer or any other concept you can dream up that fits the setting.


The game uses a modified version OpenQuest, a straight forward d100 system, with extra rules to handle Guns, non-lethal weapons, mental trauma and Vehicles.


It also contains pages of World information about Trouble hot spots, terrorist organisations, and Competitors to the company. A skill-full blend of real world information, written by someone who has worked in the UK Defence industry, and game-able fiction.


Two full scenarios : 

  • Operation Bluebeard  - A seemingly straightforward mission to parachute out of a Osprey onto an oil captured by Somali pirates and rescue the crew.
  • Operation F.I.S.H and C.H.I.P.S - As part of a Assault Group Maximum unit protect A.I.D.S charity workers in war torn Africa.

Want to check it out?

Here's games web-page, which has a preview pdf: http://d101games.co.uk/the-company

Also check out the author's blog, for more insights: http://thecompany.d101games.co.uk/

Who will like it?

  • If you are looking for a good Modern Military RPG, and/or a modern action thriller game.
  • If you are an existing D100 fan looking to branch out from Fantasy and/or have a good reference book for modern arms and equipment.

What will I get?

Depending on the Rank of your pre-order at you get a

  • All pre-orders get the Pdf of the game upon placing pre-order*, which will be updated if any errors are found during proof. Just the Pdf on its own costs $10.
  • A soft-cover + FREE Pdf (Team Leader) -$30
  • A hard-cover + FREE Pdf (Section Head) - $40


Please note price includes shipping anywhere in the world.

*Pdfs are sent out via a manual email, so you might have to wait a couple of hours after placing your order or in rare circumstances up to a day. 

What happens if we reach the Goal?

Everyone who has pre-ordered will get a copy of Operation Camphor an exclusive scenario, that you will get months in advance of general release, in the format equivalent to your main order (i.e. Field Operatives get a pdf version, and Team Leaders and Section Heads get a print version).

story:
>> OFFICIAL WEBSITE <<<

Yesterday our campaign ended for Target Earth and as you may have noticed we did not reach our funding goal. But we are not down and out, we learnt a lot from this campaign and received some very helpful feedback from the community about our game.

We would like to thank all of you for showing your support for our campaign, may it have been by backing our campaign or sharing it on your social networks. Although the amount we need to complete Target Earth was not achieved, your contributions helped us to stay afloat a bit longer.

We live to fight another day and Target Earth will be released, it will just take a bit longer than we hoped. To underline our commitment to our game, we are about to launch our Alpha version and we are looking for testers. For those who are interested in participating in our Alpha version for Android, you can sign up Here

For those who have selected a perk that is not in-game credit related, fear not. Your item or items will be delivered to you in the coming weeks.

Thank you for believing in us!

 

>>> Download the Demo <<<

Runs on Windows, Linux, Mac OS -> Finished Version will only run on IPhone and Android, so test it while its hot!

Target Earth is a location-aware sci-fi strategy game with turn-based tactical battles. To add to the already long category title, it is also a massive-multiplayer mobile game and it will be released for the Android and iOS platforms.

The key features of Target Earth are:

  • Level-up your character to unlock more powerful cyborgs and arm them with stronger weapons.
  • Play against other players in turn-based battles with over 20 different cyborgs and weapons to choose from.
  • Play in multiple sectors against different enemies at the same time.
  • Battle against different enemies with different sets of tactical rules.
  • Collect resources to craft your army of cyborgs.
  • Research new blueprints to build stronger cyborgs and improve your researched weapons to get the most out of them.
  • Upgrade your ship to increase your cyborg production and weapon research.
  • Collect numerous award badges to impress other players and document your in-game progress.
  • Compete on regional leaderboards within your neighborhood or hometown and climb in the rankings on the global leaderboard.

We plan to add more multiplayer features, like team play and PvP (Player vs player) real time battles, if we exceed our funding goal or if the game is successful enough to fund the development by itself. You can read more on this in the section "Stretched Goals" below.

What do we dislike in location-based games?

Most location-based games restrict the player to the area that they are currently in. That means that you often have to cross the street or walk a few blocks to reach an in-game objective or the player is forced to play by themselves due to the fact that no one else is playing in their area.

What do we like about location-based games?

We really love the idea of being able to use the entire world as a game map. Not only does it allow the game to have a really huge map, but anyone can travel in-game to their destination of choice, maybe they wish to travel to their hometown, a special holiday destination or even the stadium of their favorite sports club. Target Earth allows you to battle where ever and whenever you want.

How is Target Earth different?

Target Earth is not location-based, but rather location-aware: There are benefits to playing at your current location, but you are not tied down to it. You can virtually travel the world and conquer sectors where ever you please. Do you live in a boring village in Siberia and want to conquer Manhattan? Or are you stressed by the urban jungle and prefer conquering some quaint villages? In Target Earth you can.

But if we love the huge in-game world, how can we guarantee that there are enough players?

We are totally aware of this problem and therefore we incorporated a unique dynamic map into our game. Our game world dynamically adapts to the number of players in each region to prevent overcrowding or isolation. In the beginning, earth will be divided into four sectors, this is enough for the first few players to not have to play against AI. As more players join the game, sectors with higher activity will split up faster to make room for new players. In the beginning you fight for continents and oceans, but in the end you will be fighting vicious street battles for every inch of planet earth.

Do you have to walk around to play our game?

Definitely not, you get certain benefits if you play in your current location, but as we said before, you can play anywhere you like. The world is yours for the taking. Thanks to OpenStreetMap, we were able to integrate geographic areas spanning the entire world and have been able to make sure that every zoom level is as close to real life as possible.

My solar system is overcrowded and corrupt and the three big corporations are calling all the shots, or are they? Their infighting makes it easy for a mob-boss like myself to make a pretty penny while they turn a blind eye. Now they have found a new planet to conquer and I am going to make sure that I get my tentacles on a piece of the action.

The new blue planet is called earth and I can already taste all the money that I will be making selling off its precious territories. Now I don't have enough thugs to go and do my dirty work in the pre-invasion, so I need free agents like yourself to get me those territories. I will give you what you need to get to earth and then it will be up to you to fight your way to the top and become my number one agent. But nothing in life is free, so don't for one second think that this is a free meal ticket, I always triple my money on my investments, always!

                                                    The Boss

 

Crafting

For every fight that you win, you will be rewarded with energy sources and resources that you will need to build your army of cyborgs. Defeated cyborgs will drop the resources that you need to build a new one, so if you want to build stronger cyborgs, you will first have to defeat them in battle. Currently we have over 20 different in-game resources, but if our funding is successful, we will add even more.

Research

In the research bay of your ship you can develop new weapons or upgrade those you already have. To use those mighty weapons you will first have to research new blueprints to produce cyborgs that can handle them. Every weapon belongs to one of the three categories "Energy", "Hacking" or "Physical". You need cyborgs that are specialized in those skills to use your weapons with maximal effectiveness.

 

Tactics

A wise general once said, battles are won and lost before they have even been fought. By selecting the right weapons before a battle, you can increase the chances of successful attacks and ultimate victory. Cyborgs have different attack and defence skills in "Energy", "Hacking" and "Physical" attacks, so you have to analyze your opponents and choose the right cyborgs and weapons configuration to defeat them. Stronger cyborgs can bring more weapons into battle, so as the game evolves, tactics become more complex and battles become more challenging.

 

Sector games

The world is divided into different sectors. Each sector consists of a grid of 6x6 fields that you can attack with your cyborgs. To conquer a sector and split it up into new sectors the players have to achieve the victory conditions. When the sector has been conquered, each player who took part in the mission gets a reward for their efforts. The rules for those sector games are not always the same. Currently we have two different rule sets, but if our funding is successful, then we will be able to develop and implement more game types to add more variety to the battles.

Leaderboards

By conquering sectors, you collect pieces of geographic areas like continents, countries, urban districts or streets, depending on how far the territories have been divided up. If you collect enough pieces, you will be rewarded with a badge from "The Boss" and it will count towards your overall ranking and also to your local ranking. You can compete with other players in your area to add to your regional ranking and become the don of your area. Completing other tasks will also count towards your overall ranking, along with your various victories in battle.

Credits, but for what?

An important part of the Target Earth eco-system are credits. They are necessary for two aspects of the game; functional and visual elements. Functional elements are "speed-ups" (if you are impatient), production upgrades (if you are even more impatient) and travel, if you don't like where you are located. Visual elements come in the form of pimping out the way that your cyborg look, nicer attack animations (your opponent will be impressed) and a different skin for your ship.

One option to receive credits is by playing the game with a certain degree of success. Battle for territory, fight against your opponents and you will be rewarded with credits. But your income of credits is rather low and requires a lot of screen time. The second option is to buy them. This way you can fast track your game by increasing your cyborg production rate and completion times, and also allowing you to travel to other areas more frequently.

But to be clear, our philosophy about how we develop games is: play to win and not pay to win. Therefore you are never forced to buy credits at all. You can still build your army and research your weapons without them. We think having fun in the game shouldn't depend on your wallet. This image illustrates the way that credits play a part in Target Earth. It does not show the entire economy, but the tiny part credits play in the game.





Early Beta Tester

Get early access to our Beta version of Target Earth and get a head start on your plans for world domination. Get in contact with our developers and help finish the game.




Credits

Use your in-game credits to enhance your game play. Change the look of your cyborgs, their weapons and your ship, or use the credits to speed up your game play.




Digital Media Pack

Receive a collection of wallpapers for your pc and your Smartphone in brilliant HD, the sound track to our trailer and a collection of process art works from the game. The art works will also show the production process of some of our designs and contains beautiful concept art from early versions of Target Earth.


In-Game Badge

Receive a custom in-game badge that will distinguish you as one of our Indiegogo backers. This badge will be on your badge screen in the game for everyone to see.





Feature In Our In Game Credits

Reserve your spot to be mentioned in Target Earth's in game credits and let it be known that you supported our campaign.





Embroidered Patch

Receive a really cool looking military style embroidered patch of one of Target Earth's in game awards that you can sew onto an item of clothing or bag.





Postcard

Receive an awesome Target Earth postcard that you can send to someone to inform them about your invasion of earth so far.





Poster

Receive a 85cm x 60cm poster of either Target Earth art work or of The Boss. Printed on high quality paper you can proudly display this poster for all to see.








Exclusive Weapon

Receive an exclusive in game weapon that will set you apart from the rest. The weapon will not just be styled differently but will also work differently to the other in-game weapons. This weapon will be exclusively for our Indiegogo backers and no one else.




T-shirt

Receive a Target Earth t-shirt with concept art of our beloved Boss. The tee will be 100% high quality cotton and will make you very cool in the eye of The Boss.





Playing Cards

Receive a custom styled deck of playing cards (Bicycle cards) featuring elements of the Target Earth game. Play poker with cyborgs and raise the stakes.








Vinyl Figure

Receive and awesome vinyl figure of one of the Target Earth cyborgs and keep him on your desk at work or at home.






Signed T-shirt

Receive one of our awesome T-shirts that has been signed by the entire team who worked on Target Earth. Get one of these unique tees, that will remind you of your pledge to our campaign. Together with this tee we will give you a second t-shirt that you can actually wear.



Hoodie

Receive an awesome Target Earth hoodie to go with your awesome t-shirt. Now you can also look good when it gets cold. The Boss loves it too, but it saddens him that he can't wear it properly because of the spike on his head.



Name A Cyborg

For those who like to spend big, we are allowing a limited number of people to name one of our new cyborgs. This name will appear every time someone uses the cyborg. (must be kept clean)






Design A Cyborg

For our heaviest backers we are allowing a limited number of people to design a cyborg in collaboration with the halfreal team. You will work closely with our designer, who will take your suggestions and convert them into a cyborg deserving of being an underling of The Boss.





 

[05/02/2013] Our first cyborgs have been rendered and are ready for our Alpha testing. 

The Heavy Backer Perk

Are you considering to become a heavy backer, have a look at that goodies, prepared 3D Models for the plastic figures of the Octups Cyborg, and the Warrior Cyborg.

    

[05/06/2013] A perk update

[05/15/2013] One of the first fully developed cyborgs, the Warrior will also be available in the Target Earth demo.

Defcon 5

The cyborg army is caught in its home solar system and does not have enough credits to launch an invasion. Current state, peace time, no threat of invasion.

Defcon 4 € 30 000

The cyborg army enters the wormhole heading to Target Earth. Completion and release of Target Earth to the public. This is our basic funding goal.

First and foremost by pledging, every donation counts and your contributions will help in finishing this project and bringing the game to the public.

Just as important as pledging your hard earned Dollars and Euros, is spreading the word about our campaign. So if you use the usual social media networks, maybe you have a blog, or you make Youtube videos, if you could share our campaign that would be amazing. Every bit of publicity helps.

 

halfreal games was born in the heart of Berlin, Germany, founded by three recent university graduates in 2012. With a dream of creating our own game developing company and a passion for games of all sorts, we took our dream to the next level and founded a start-up company and halfreal games was born. The team itself has grown over the months, with some new faces who have joined the halfreal family. But one thing has not changed: our dream of creating geo-social games that challenge the player and achieve long-term motivation and excitement.

The company was awarded a "Gründerstipendium", a sort of start-up grant by the Gründerwerkstatt, a business incubator, operated by the Beuth University of Applied Sciences Berlin.                                                                    

The funding was set to last for 18 months and the company also received co-working office space and other support and has come a long way in that time. But the challenge of creating a great game was far more than we expected and time started to fly by as we worked to finish Target Earth. Now we are so close to our goal of releasing the game and only need that last financial push to get us over that hill and release Target Earth.

 

 

 

 

Please note, that if we do not reach our goal, it could be that certain perks will take longer to be issued due to Target Earth not being released yet. This mainly refers to the in game currency and the special weapon that have been listed in the perks section.

But we assure you that we will definitly try, no matter if the goal is reached or not, to finish Target Earth. Too much work and time has already been invested for it not to be completed.

Visit our official Target Earth website

Their infighting makes it easy for a mob-boss like myself to make a pretty penny while they turn a blind eye. Now they have found a new planet to conquer and I am going to make sure that I get my tentacles on a piece of the action.  The new blue planet is called earth and I can already taste all the money that I will be making selling off its precious territories. Now I don't have enough thugs to go and do my dirty work in the pre-invasion, so I need free agents like yourself to get me those territories. I will give you what you need to get to earth and then it will be up to you to fight your way to the top and become my number one agent. But nothing in life is free, so don't for one second think that this is a free meal ticket, I always triple my money on my investments, always! 
                                                    The Boss 

 
Crafting
For every fight that you win, you will be rewarded with energy sources and resources that you will need to build your army of cyborgs. Defeated cyborgs will drop the resources that you need to build a new one, so if you want to build stronger cyborgs, you will first have to defeat them in battle. Currently we have over 20 different in-game resources, but if our funding is successful, we will add even more.

Research
In the research bay of your ship you can develop new weapons or upgrade those you already have. To use those mighty weapons you will first have to research new blueprints to produce cyborgs that can handle them. Every weapon belongs to one of the three categories "Energy", "Hacking" or "Physical". You need cyborgs that are specialized in those skills to use your weapons with maximal effectiveness.
 
Tactics
A wise general once said, battles are won and lost before they have even been fought. By selecting the right weapons before a battle, you can increase the chances of successful attacks and ultimate victory. Cyborgs have different attack and defence skills in "Energy", "Hacking" and "Physical" attacks, so you have to analyze your opponents and choose the right cyborgs and weapons configuration to defeat them. Stronger cyborgs can bring more weapons into battle, so as the game evolves, tactics become more complex and battles become more challenging.
 
Sector games
The world is divided into different sectors. Each sector consists of a grid of 6x6 fields that you can attack with your cyborgs. To conquer a sector and split it up into new sectors the players have to achieve the victory conditions. When the sector has been conquered, each player who took part in the mission gets a reward for their efforts. The rules for those sector games are not always the same. Currently we have two different rule sets, but if our funding is successful, then we will be able to develop and implement more game types to add more variety to the battles.
Leaderboards
By conquering sectors, you collect pieces of geographic areas like continents, countries, urban districts or streets, depending on how far the territories have been divided up. If you collect enough pieces, you will be rewarded with a badge from "The Boss" and it will count towards your overall ranking and also to your local ranking. You can compete with other players in your area to add to your regional ranking and become the don of your area. Completing other tasks will also count towards your overall ranking, along with your various victories in battle.
Credits, but for what?
An important part of the Target Earth eco-system are credits. They are necessary for two aspects of the game; functional and visual elements. Functional elements are "speed-ups" (if you are impatient), production upgrades (if you are even more impatient) and travel, if you don't like where you are located. Visual elements come in the form of pimping out the way that your cyborg look, nicer attack animations (your opponent will be impressed) and a different skin for your ship.
One option to receive credits is by playing the game with a certain degree of success. Battle for territory, fight against your opponents and you will be rewarded with credits. But your income of credits is rather low and requires a lot of screen time. The second option is to buy them. This way you can fast track your game by increasing your cyborg production rate and completion times, and also allowing you to travel to other areas more frequently.
But to be clear, our philosophy about how we develop games is: play to win and not pay to win. Therefore you are never forced to buy credits at all. You can still build your army and research your weapons without them. We think having fun in the game shouldn't depend on your wallet. This image illustrates the way that credits play a part in Target Earth. It does not show the entire economy, but the tiny part credits play in the game.

Early Beta Tester
Get early access to our Beta version of Target Earth and get a head start on your plans for world domination. Get in contact with our developers and help finish the game.
Credits
Use your in-game credits to enhance your game play. Change the look of your cyborgs, their weapons and your ship, or use the credits to speed up your game play.

Digital Media Pack
Receive a collection of wallpapers for your pc and your Smartphone in brilliant HD, the sound track to our trailer and a collection of process art works from the game. The art works will also show the production process of some of our designs and contains beautiful concept art from early versions of Target Earth.

In-Game Badge
Receive a custom in-game badge that will distinguish you as one of our Indiegogo backers. This badge will be on your badge screen in the game for everyone to see.

Feature In Our In Game Credits
Reserve your spot to be mentioned in Target Earth's in game credits and let it be known that you supported our campaign.

Embroidered Patch
Receive a really cool looking military style embroidered patch of one of Target Earth's in game awards that you can sew onto an item of clothing or bag.

Postcard
Receive an awesome Target Earth postcard that you can send to someone to inform them about your invasion of earth so far.

Poster
Receive a 85cm x 60cm poster of either Target Earth art work or of The Boss. Printed on high quality paper you can proudly display this poster for all to see.

Exclusive Weapon
Receive an exclusive in game weapon that will set you apart from the rest. The weapon will not just be styled differently but will also work differently to the other in-game weapons. This weapon will be exclusively for our Indiegogo backers and no one else.

T-shirt
Receive a Target Earth t-shirt with concept art of our beloved Boss. The tee will be 100% high quality cotton and will make you very cool in the eye of The Boss.

Playing Cards
Receive a custom styled deck of playing cards (Bicycle cards) featuring elements of the Target Earth game. Play poker with cyborgs and raise the stakes.

Vinyl Figure
Receive and awesome vinyl figure of one of the Target Earth cyborgs and keep him on your desk at work or at home.

Signed T-shirt
Receive one of our awesome T-shirts that has been signed by the entire team who worked on Target Earth. Get one of these unique tees, that will remind you of your pledge to our campaign. Together with this tee we will give you a second t-shirt that you can actually wear.

Hoodie
Receive an awesome Target Earth hoodie to go with your awesome t-shirt. Now you can also look good when it gets cold. The Boss loves it too, but it saddens him that he can't wear it properly because of the spike on his head.

Name A Cyborg
For those who like to spend big, we are allowing a limited number of people to name one of our new cyborgs. This name will appear every time someone uses the cyborg. (must be kept clean)

Design A Cyborg
For our heaviest backers we are allowing a limited number of people to design a cyborg in collaboration with the halfreal team. You will work closely with our designer, who will take your suggestions and convert them into a cyborg deserving of being an underling of The Boss.


 

[05/02/2013] Our first cyborgs have been rendered and are ready for our Alpha testing. 
The Heavy Backer Perk
Are you considering to become a heavy backer, have a look at that goodies, prepared 3D Models for the plastic figures of the Octups Cyborg, and the Warrior Cyborg.
      
[05/06/2013] A perk update
[05/15/2013] One of the first fully developed cyborgs, the Warrior will also be available in the Target Earth demo.


Defcon 5
The cyborg army is caught in its home solar system and does not have enough credits to launch an invasion. Current state, peace time, no threat of invasion.
Defcon 4 € 30 000
The cyborg army enters the wormhole heading to Target Earth. Completion and release of Target Earth to the public. This is our basic funding goal.



First and foremost by pledging, every donation counts and your contributions will help in finishing this project and bringing the game to the public.
Just as important as pledging your hard earned Dollars and Euros, is spreading the word about our campaign. So if you use the usual social media networks, maybe you have a blog, or you make Youtube videos, if you could share our campaign that would be amazing. Every bit of publicity helps.
 

halfreal games was born in the heart of Berlin, Germany, founded by three recent university graduates in 2012. With a dream of creating our own game developing company and a passion for games of all sorts, we took our dream to the next level and founded a start-up company and halfreal games was born. The team itself has grown over the months, with some new faces who have joined the halfreal family. But one thing has not changed: our dream of creating geo-social games that challenge the player and achieve long-term motivation and excitement.
The company was awarded a "Gründerstipendium", a sort of start-up grant by the Gründerwerkstatt, a business incubator, operated by the Beuth University of Applied Sciences Berlin.                                                                    
The funding was set to last for 18 months and the company also received co-working office space and other support and has come a long way in that time. But the challenge of creating a great game was far more than we expected and time started to fly by as we worked to finish Target Earth. Now we are so close to our goal of releasing the game and only need that last financial push to get us over that hill and release Target Earth.
 

 
 
 

Please note, that if we do not reach our goal, it could be that certain perks will take longer to be issued due to Target Earth not being released yet. This mainly refers to the in game currency and the special weapon that have been listed in the perks section.
But we assure you that we will definitly try, no matter if the goal is reached or not, to finish Target Earth. Too much work and time has already been invested for it not to be completed.
Visit our official Target Earth website

story:
Short Summary

Our good friend, Leslie M. Collins has many dreams in life.  Most of them are beyond our control; however, one of his most infamous dreams is to own a Cobra Command arcade machine of his very own.  We can help Leslie fulfill this dream.

Leslie is well-known online in the various arcade-related forums for his excessive (and often misinterpreted) enthusiasm for classic arcade games.  Having known Leslie for over 12 years, myself and others have come to care for him very much.  Leslie wants the same things out of life that most of us do...  good health, a house of his own, a wife, kids, a good job, and people who care about him.  Leslie has yet to attain many of these things... and by no fault of his own.

Leslie is a good person who deserves our compassion and friendship.  We can help him to fulfill at least one of his life-long dreams.  So let's do it. 

What We Need & What You Get

I have the speicifcs for the Cobra Command cabinet in Leslie's dreams.  It needs to be a Cliffhanger-style cabinet with red ball joystick and Cobra Command artwork.  A picture of the exact cabinet Leslie wants is posted in the gallery.  I am tacking on some additional requirements in that this Cobra Command machine needs to be made out of all-new components to prevent reoccurring breakdowns.  Inside will be a solid-state computer running the Daphne Laserdisc emulator software.  http://www.daphne-emu.com.  A brand new monitor will be installed.

The funds for this project will pay for:

  • Cabinet and freight
  • Reproduced artwork/paint
  • Any missing cabinet parts (ie: Coin door)
  • All new electronics
  • Freight to Southern California
  • Freight to Las Vegas, NV
  • Perks

We are donating our time to this project.  ANY MONEY LEFT OVER OR ABOVE AND BEYOND THE $2,500 GOAL WILL GO TO LESLIE'S CASE-WORKER FOR SAFE-KEEPING FOR HIS WELFARE.

The cabinet will first go to Steve Bower who will handle the painting and artwork.  It will then be shipped to me, Brad Oldham, where the electronics will be taken care of.  I will rent a truck and drive the game to Leslie's apartment in Las Vegas NV in August, September, or October of 2013.

We have set up some perks for various donation amounts. 

The Impact

This is a great opportunity to do something nice for someone else in need.  This isn't so much about getting a Cobra Command for Leslie... it is more about showing Leslie that there are a whole lot of people who care about him. 

We will take video of the Cobra Command delivery and post it for all to see.  It will be awesome to see Leslie fulfilling one of his life-long dreams.  All contributors are invited to come to Las Vegas, NV for the grand finale where we will deliver the Cobra Command machine to Leslie.  We will all go out to eat at Buffet@Asia.

Alternate Donation Option

We have been notified by a few people that they are unable to donate via PayPal for one reason or another.  We prefer that you donate through this official project if at all possible as we need to meet the goal.  If this is not possible, you can feel free to send a check or money order to this P.O. Box and we will ensure that it goes straight to this project.  You can make a check or money order payable to LV426 Software and mail it to:

LV426 Software

attn:  Cobra Command for Collins
P.O. Box 53311
Irvine, CA 92619-3311

USA

story:
DARK FABLE MINIATURES:

You can now purchase the entire Egyptian Harem Miniatures range at Dark Fable Miniatures.  Check out the link below:

http://www.darkfableminiatures.com/index.html



FINAL 24 HOURS BIG PUSH!

There is less than 24 hours remaining to the present campaign and in an effort to entice you further we have the following offers for those who have purchased a perk!

1. Purchase additional sets of your choice for $12 each to add to your perk!  Choose from the Egyptian Ladies, The Eunuch Harem Guards, Personalities I, The Entertainers or Personalities II!

2. Purchase a set of Egyptian concubines from the First Indiegogo Campaign for only $12!

3. Purchase a set of all four stretch goal reward figures for only $12!

Just send payment for the sets that you want to the present Indiegogo Campaign.  Then send a message to me stating which set or sets it is that you want added to your perk!  Thank you for your support!!

28mm Egyptian Harem Miniatures

 

Hi, I'm Mike Burns, a long-time gamer and miniatures collector who has had a passion for adventures in historical settings.  I was inspired by archaeology, history and Hollywood films to create a range of pseudo-historical Egyptian figures for use in role-playing games, wargames and collecting.  The focus of the range is the court and harem of the Egyptian pharaoh which many lavish Hollywood epics are set.  The costumes of some characters in this range are purely historical, while others have a healthy dose of Hollywood about them.  This is my second Indiegogo campaign producing Egyptian Harem miniatures and it is somewhat more ambitious than the first campaign which offered only a single set of miniatures.

A total of five different sets of Egyptian harem miniatures are being offered as perks which have been sculpted by the legendary Kev Adams and the talented Brother Vinni and Snuurg.  These high-quality 28mm miniatures are made from a lead-free pewter alloy and have an incredible amount of detail and personality. Whether you are a collector or gamer you are certain to enjoy these figures!  Check out the gallery for more images!

How May I Assist Pharaoh?

  • Almost all of the miniatures on offer in this campaign have already been sculpted so I am able to show you the greens and the concept drawings on which they are based.  Your contributions will help to cover production costs and give you the opportunity to acquire these excellent miniatures at an early stage in the development of the range.  The figures offered in this Indiegogo campaign will eventually be sold under the label of Dark Fable Miniatures.

  • A number of perks ranging from $10 to $190 have been offered so that anyone with an interest in these miniatures can make a contribution.  Everyone will receive their sets of miniatures in small zip-lock bags with plastic slotta bases.  (Sorry - no blister packs yet!).

 Five Sets of Miniatures on offer:

1. Egyptian Ladies by Brother Vinni

2. Eunuch Harem Guards by Kev Adams

3. Harem Personalities I (Concubine, Vizier, Pygmy priest of Bes) by Kev Adams

4. Harem Entertainers (Two dancers and harpist) by Brother Vinni

5. Harem Personalities II (Egyptian noblewoman, Libyan princess, Concubine) by Snuurg

There are also a number of reward figures available which will be added when stretch goals are achieved.

 

THE PERKS:

Level 0, Sandal-bearer: $1

Contribute your sofa change and have one of the sacred crocodiles or baboons named after you . . . only Pharaoh could be so generous ;)

Level 1, Servant of Pharaoh: $10

You get one randomly selected miniature from the Egyptian ladies set - sent to you anywhere in the world post free.

Level 2, Royal Concubine: $20

Select one set of miniatures (3 figures) from the five sets on offer - sent to you anywhere in the world post free

Level 3, Eunuch Guard: $35

Select two sets of miniatures (6 figures) from the five sets on offer - sent to you anywhere in the world post free

Level 4, Royal Courtesan: $50

Select three sets of miniatures (9 figures) from the five sets on offer - sent to you anywhere in the world post free

Level 5, Favoured of Isis: $65

Select four sets of miniatures (12 figures) from the five sets on offer - sent to you anywhere in the world post free

Level 6, Grand Vizier: $75

Get all five sets of miniatures (15 figures) - sent to you anywhere in the world post free

Level 7, Lion of Egypt: $135

Get two of each set of miniatures PLUS an extra set of miniatures of your choice (33 figures) - sent to you anywhere in the world post free

Level 8, Mighty Pharaoh: $190

Get three of each set of miniatures PLUS two extra sets of miniatures of your choice (51 figures) - sent to you anywhere in the world post free

EUNUCH SETS: If you have ordered multiple sets of eunuchs you may replace the extra chief eunuch figures with a eunuch spearman if you wish.  Please message me that you want to do this.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Stretch Goal Rewards

$2000 - Egyptian Noblewoman by Kev Adams (from levels 2 and up)  ACHIEVED!

$3000 - Egyptian Assassin by Dave Foster (levels 3 and up)  ACHIEVED!

$4000 - Egyptian Food-taster by Kev Adams (levels 4 and up)  ACHIEVED!

$5000 - Egyptian Concubine by Kev Adams (levels 5 and up)  ACHIEVED!

$6000 - An extra pair of Egyptian Ladies from Set I by Brother Vinni (levels 6 and up)

$8000 - An extra pair of Eunuch Harem Guards from Set II by Kev Adams (levels 7 and up)

$10,000 - an extra pair of Harem dancers from the Entertainers Set by Brother Vinni (level 8)

The Impact Of Your Contribution

The successful funding of this project will really help to move things forward with expanding the range by commissioning more miniatures to be sculpted.  Future sets include alot of interesting and useful characters that are not often found in miniature including; the queens of Egypt and their attendants, servants, more eunuch guards, foreign concubines, pharaoh's favourites, exotic pets and even Egyptian vampires and demons.  I will post some of my concept drawings on which these future sets of miniatures will be based in the gallery.

Other Ways You Can Help This Project

Pharaoh has sent chariots and messengers far and wide to spread the word, but you too can help!

  • Ask friends, gaming associates, minions and anyone you think might be interested in these excellent miniatures from ancient Egypt to get the word out.
  • You can put a link to this campaign on your blog, forum or website.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
Who Am I?

I am Mona and I am a Highlands Athlete. Sounds like I am introducing myself at an AA meeting doesn't it?  At this point in my life, it does almost feel like I am addicted to this sport. I had, for most of my adult life been a couch potato.  I was never an athlete, not in high school, nor in college.  I certainly never threw on a track team. I am what some affectionately refer to as an MCA~Midlife Crisis Athlete.


In the summer of 2010, I had to face the reality that I was getting sick and that I was the one making myself sick.  I had given up on my body in the prime of life and I was now paying the price: pre-diabetic, advancing arthritis, severe stenosis in my neck, bad liver and kidney functions, and joints that barely carried me up a flight of stairs.  At the encouragement of a dear friend, I started CrossFit.  It was horrible, but I stuck with it. 

Fast forward about 10 months: I had lost 45 pounds and I had begun to understand that yes, there really can be an athlete inside of everyone. While I enjoyed the gym, I felt that there needed to be more. Then I remembered an old friend of my husband's, Chuck Thomas, who was involved in the Highland Games. I contacted him to find out if women did this crazy "thing" too, and he assured me that, yes, women do throw. 

I was initially hesitant, but my husband encouraged me to give it a go, “Well, I could go down, just try it. What can it hurt?"  One of the defining moments of becoming an athlete came on a cool spring morning when I picked up that hammer for the first time and fell in love, with possibilities. That moment would change, utterly and completely, how I see myself, how much I would discover about myself, about training, about determination, about failure, about success. I am also much healthier than when I started, not just from time spent in the gym, but time on the field.  I don't worry about blood work anymore and although I still have issues with my neck; moving and competition keep me flexible and healthy.

To my surprise and delight, the folks who run the games here in New Mexico pushed me.  They saw potential in me I did not know was there.  I am actually pretty good. Through the support of other athletes, there are pieces of myself, my power that I found, that I never knew I had lost. I am so glad I said yes to this physical "experiment" in part because I have met the most amazing people from literally, all over the world. 

What am I doing?

I am going to the Masters World Championship Game which next year will be held in Inverness, Scotland, September 12th through the 14th. It is not my first time at these traveling games, but it is my first opportunity to attend games in Scotland! The thought of being able to compete in Scotland, with some of the best throwers in the world is nearly more than my mind can process at times. It is not hyperbole to say this sport saved my life. To be able to throw where the games started connects me to hundreds of years and tens of thousands of athletes who believe the same. I have had major changes in my life this past year and I am reaching out for help. I cannot do this without the support of my friends and family.

This is not about winning the games, or some trophy: I win as a thrower each time I show up on the field. Each time I compete I strike a blow against every doctor that told me I would just feel more and more pain as I aged.  Hopefully, other middle aged women can look at me and see it is never too late to say yes to their physical potential, their strength. I know that my children see what I do and they are proud of me, even if they tease me a little! I have no doubt that I am a better parent for having found this sport.  Both kids now find time in the gym to be a source of stress relief and a way to connect to their bodies.

I know that some of you have heard me speak of my "Highlands Family," I don't take that lightly, it isn't just a catch phrase for me.  Finding this group of athletes has changed me in ways I am only beginning to understand.  I am making choices from a place of strength and empowerment. So, I am asking you to help me go to these games, to be a part of something larger than I can ever be on my own.


What I Need & What You Get

  • I am looking to raise 3,500 for the trip.  I know this seems a little early to raise funds for a trip in September, but it is international travel.  I am making plans and need to pay for hotels and cars ASAP to get the best prices. This amount will help me cover airfare (1500), Hotel (500), Rental Car (400), Extra bag Fees (200), A new Kilt (mine is trashed! 200) Registration Fee (80), the fees and perks on Indiegogo as well as gas, food, and hopefully a celebration for a great competition as well! 
  • My dear friends Heather Ahtone and Marwin Begaye are being exceedingly generous with their skills.  Marwin has designed a wood block just for this campaign which reflects my ethnic heritage (I'm Polish), the Scots, and a little bit of New Mexico flair.

  • Every dollar raised will be used for expenses for the trip. Whether or not I meet my goal, every dollar helps.  If I end up raising more than my goal? The money would be used to help me get to other games in the US as preparation for The World Master's Championship Game.

Other Ways You Can Help

I know not everyone can throw cash my way, but you can help me by posting this on Facebook or sending the link around via email or on a bathroom wall.

story:
About Me

I am a video-game designer with 10+ years of experience in the industry, and this project is hopefully the first step to me fulfilling my indie dream. With your help, I hope to be able to bring unique and innovative games to market at pocket-money prices. I’m not looking to become rich and famous, but would love it if each game managed to pay for the next one.

Networm – Hack like they do in the movies!

Networm is based on an idea I have been thinking about for most of my career. During my youth, I was an avid sci-fi fan, and always fascinated to see how “hacking” was represented in film and TV shows during the 80s and 90s. Invariably breaking into the baddies “mainframe” involved a snarky, cock-sure “boy genius” hammering away at the keyboard while the monitors showed a game-like sequence, flying through wire-frame representations of code or networks. As a gaming-obsessed 14 year old, I always thought that looked fun, so Networm is my attempt to recreate the “authentic” 80’s film hacking experience for gamers around the world, and to finally make a game that my 14 year old self would think was “pretty cool”.

Next Stages

Working alone in Unity for the last 5 months, I have been able to put together a feature-complete, 40 level game based around this concept. The end is in sight, but I need your help to make the final push and ensure that Networm is everything I believe it can be.

Whilst I can (mostly) handle the code and graphics side myself, the game is sorely in need of a musician to provide a suitable soundtrack to accompany the cyber-crimes of the console cowboys.

In addition, whilst I have been able to put together all of the game mechanics and visual systems, I would like to employ a freelance programmer for a few days to put together a save-game system for me, as this has proven to be a rather specialised task that is somewhat beyond my understanding.

Whatever funds I am able to obtain towards this project will go towards these two goals, with any surplus being used for a marketing/awareness raising when I submit the game to Steam Greenlight, which will hopefully be at the end of July. Naturally, the sooner we can get the game approved through that process, the sooner it can be on general release.

story:
Our Pinbox 3000 campaign was fully funded on Kickstarter within a few days and we're now opening up for pre-orders with Indiegogo InDemand to give those that missed out a chance to get their own Pinbox 3000 at a  discount.

 

We're working with a large scale cardboard box and display manufacturing company in Philadelphia. With this facility we are able to execute faster turnarounds and larger orders.

When Cardboard Teck Instantute formed in 2006, we wanted to be a resource for folks to get interested in cardboard construction, as well as an outlet for outside-the-box, interactive devices. We are so pleased to have the PinBox 3000 as our platform for expressing the potential of cardboard, inspiring makers and game designers.

We have been working on this project since January of 2015, with the help and collaboration of our Vermont community. We've been given so much support from the maker community, particularly Make Magazine and Maker Faire.  We've won ribbons of merit from National Maker Faire, Bay Area Maker Faire, and World Maker Faire, for the addictive learning potential of the PinBox 3000. We've hosted numerous school workshops and play tests in our summer camps and after school programs.   

We have been working incredibly hard over the last year to ensure that we will have smooth production, bringing the artwork in on time, ensuring a cohesive instruction manual, testing material quality, and meeting with consultants, designers, customers, and educators. We know you and your family will love this product.

Your contribution will help to bring more PinBox 3000 games to life, and help us transition into making our web store a great resource for long-term engagement and inspiration for our customers.

OUR TIMELINE: (all dates subject to change)

  1. Submit die lines for approval- APPROVED
  2. Submit art work for approval- APPROVED
  3. Begin production- November 9
  4. Webstore launch- November 11
  5. Shipping- November 21

story:
Pour ceux et celles qui préfereraient voir la vidéo en Français, voici le lien de la vidéo :

Blaster - Bande-Annonce (Français) - http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=-kfmVNFpxm8


What is Blaster ?

Blaster is a browser-based game with a unique mix between brickbreaker and pong gameplay elements, taking place on a futuristic background.

It features :

- 6 different game modes ranging from classic Time Attack mode to intense head-to-head duels with different teams on unique ships, in arenas full of soon-to-be destroyed boxes and power-ups.

- 6 teams with their specific ships. Every ship has unique stats of Power, Health, Recovery and Speed.

- 5 unique power-ups with unique multiplier bonuses, the higher your game multiplier, the better your power-up effects will be, even granting stats bonuses on higher multiplier levels. GigaBall, SonicBall, GigaPaddle, Minimize and Distort, the choice is yours to bring nightmare into the game field. You're even able to store and switch between your 3 first acquired power-ups at anytime !

- Enthralling sounds and music. Every bit of sound and graphics has been studied so as to put more focus on immediate action without getting in the way, you could almost play without actually watching the game.

- Pure and clean graphics and overall design was made so as to be immediately readable by anyone. Power-ups got color codes, boxes are also color coded. Gameplay decisions like "when to play a power-up while another is  being used and how much time left have I got before this power-up gets dumped " must be made in less than a second, so everything in the game is made to achieve a speed-thinking action game !

- Competition-based gameplay with achievements, ladders, levels and experience values. Being highly connected to Social Platforms, show your ever-growing skills and even participate to real-world online tournaments.

- A Serial Pixel experience like none other...

What do we need ?

We have actually achieved an alpha version with most of the gameplay features included. We have been using a free version of the Unity3D game engine and for a better game experience we recently switched to the 30-days limited pro edition of Unity3D. Having the alpha version of the game ready is great and we would like to start our "SERIAL PIXEL" methodology (please read it on "Our Story" below) and have everyone test and submit ideas to form and expand on our base and create the most exciting experience both for us and for our followers. Unfortunately we can't publish even our alpha without now buying the full version of Unity3D which costs 1500$. If we achieve this goal everyone will immediately receive a link with a special code granting you access to Blaster and a personal profile to start earning experience points, ranks etc...

So to summarize :

- 1500$ to pay for a pro license of Unity3D game engine.
- Everything exceeding this we'll get invested on our Serial Pixel platform, website costs and development.

Actually we aren't making any money out of it yet but of course our wish would be to be able to do full-time work on our projects.

Of course if you can't  support us this way, you can still help us a lot by spreading our campaign everywhere you want, Facebook, blogs, mails, etc... You can also write to us directly and ask us questions about this project or just get in touch with us because you know...we're nice guys ^^ !

What you get for supporting us ?

Our love and admiration... but you also get some interesting perks ! You'll be getting the game as soon as the goal is reached, and also be the first to give us input and ideas to develop Blaster further. For those who want to support us a little bit more, you'll be treated as funders all over our website and on our credits (in-game and website). You can get unique vouchers and merchandising coupons for Blaster goodies and future Serial Pixel titles. And you'll be also invited to live online meetings with us to work on immediate releases and gameplay additions. Finally for EPIC supporters, you can get your name in-game as an actual Star Blaster Pilot (Every team we'll be having up to three pilots) and for the UBER EPIC supporters, you can have one of the four Final Boss have the name you'll choose (you'll get a description of the boss so to have more inspired name ideas) !

Finally you get our eternal gratitude, this project having been a lot of work and personal sacrifice, we really hope it will work, thanks to you!


What is Serial Pixel project ?


Serial Pixel would be an indie videogame studio, where the major concerns would be make fun/accessible games, highly connected to social networks and competition-geared games.

Also we want Serial Pixel to have some "ethical rules" in which we strongly believe. The first rule is that we would want to achieve a high degree of involvement from the community in the development of our games. From bug reports to forum topics or even polls, we want to make games for the gamers themselves. This involvement could have impact on what is the next feature to add or even on storyline and background events, thus creating an Open-Social game where everyone can have his ideas put on the game (Of course every idea would be weighted by the developers and the community itself.

The second rule concerns our business model. We think that the "Pay What You Want" approach is best-suited for us and our gaming community. But we want to stress that we don't want any Item-store or In-game benefit from paying more. No matter how much you pay, from 1 dollar to 50, you'll get the exact same game, the only difference being the more you pay, the more goodies you can get. Our goal is to earn your support (and love !) and thus fans would be able to support us a little more, but still regular gamers would be able to get our games for as low as 1 Euro.


About Us

We are two French guys who met three years ago, at school. Freshly graduated from our 3D/CG school, we  felt like doing something from our passion : videogames. While at school we had a lot of conversations with a lot of people from the industry and outside of it, we talked about how we perceived this industry, gameplay-centric designs, etc... So after having graduated, we thought we would try and make games, and we focused our attention on a piece of software called unity3D. Nearly a year later, here we are with our "Serial Pixel" project !


(Edit 01 : We added a video below showing the digitalization process of our Blaster ships thanks to our custom-made shader. A lot of effort has been put in R&D for this project to be unique and good-looking ! We will soon add a gameplay video of Blaster with all the gameplay explained in depth. Thank you for you time !)

Agon Team - "Digitalization" Turntable - http://vimeo.com/21481020
