story:
(Deutsche Kurzbeschreibung weiter unten, Video mit Untertiteln auf YouTube)

THE COLUMBUS LITTLE APP

We want children to explore our beautiful and diverse world and to get curious about different cultures, awesome scenery, vibrant cities, yummie food, strange animals, high mountains, blue oceans, ...? That's why we create the Columbus Little App!

Columbus Little takes your kids on a journey to various lovely designed locations and let's them learn about them in a playful way. In some locations children may play small games or solve puzzles, others tell stories or show pictures. The app is targeted for kids between 1 and 7 years and is unique because:

  • The majority of the content is still created the old-fashioned style on paper and later digitized.
  • We specifically want to create a family-friendly, playful learning experience and urge our customers to play jointly with their kids.
  • We will include the ideas of our customers in enhancing and extending our app. 
  • Zestlab will make regular donations to child support projects all over the world.
  • And the best: New content will be added to the Columbus Little world regularly, so that the learning journey can continue.

 

WE NEED YOUR SUPPORT

We (Tobi, Steffi, and Philip from Zestlab) have been developing Columbus Little for the past 6 months as a side project next to our regular jobs. 

Most of the art has actually been created on paper as real drawings and later digitized. The coding has been done with Corona SDK, which is a software development kit that lets developers code once and then publish the apps on both iOS and Android. It has been fairly easy to use and speeded up our coding process a lot or made it even doable at all for non-computer scientists in the first place.

 

But now we need your support to make it ready for the little fingers of your children. Specifically, we need to:

  • Finish the details in the two locations that we already created.
  • Do beta testing and fine tuning (beta testers welcome, just contact us!).
  • Add professionally edited sounds and some speech elements.
  • Create more content so that the app can start with four interesting locations to discover.
  • Add multi-language support: The app already includes English, German and Spanish but we also plan at least Russian, French, Chinese and Japanese translations.
  • Develop an Android version of the app (code-wise it's easy because we used Corona SDK, but we need to convert all graphics to different aspect ratios and do beta testing).

 

APP RELEASE

We work very hard to get the iOS version of Columbus Little to the app store this fall. An Android version will follow within this year.

Initially, there will be four locations to discover. Two more will be added as in-app purchases within this year. Moreover, we plan free updates and extensions of already existing adventures. So you can expect a lot of stuff from us this year.

We also hope to release a free iPhone app alongside with Columbus Little that contains all the mini games from the iPad app so that your kids can play on the go.

 

THE PERKS

If you like Columbus, please support us and order one, several or even all of the cool perks we designed specifically for this campaign.

It is also possible to just donate money (1+ EUR) to us or pay more for the perks than their price tag, if you want to. We will mention all major supporters in the credits of our app. We are very gateful for your support!

Please add shipping costs to your donation as noted in the perk description.

Free shipping to Germany.

THE APP (+ BADGE)

Your support will of course get you the Columbus Little App upon release this fall. The voucher will be transferable, so that you can support us even if you don't have kids or a tablet. 

For a few bucks more we'll send you a cool badge for the jeans or backpacks of your little world discoverers. 

App & badge will be included in all perks.

 

1492 COLUMBUS LITTLE SPECIAL EDITION CHOCOLATE

Something for the adults: 1492 Columbus Little Special Edition Chocolate by WOHLFARTH SCHOKOLADE from Berlin.

FLIP-BOOK

All animations within the app are actually created with a set of similar images (called sprite sheet) that - when combined - seem like motion (just like flip-books). So Steffi will create a cool old-school flip-book with a funny animation.

 

"I LOVE THE WORLD" T-SHIRT

For kids and adults, a cool cotton t-shirt to show others that you love our world, too. You will of course get it in various different sizes and adult male and female versions.

COLUMBUS' SHIRT

Want your kids to look like Columbus Little? We'll produce a hand-sewn version of Columbus' shirt for your kids. 

COLUMBUS' WORLD MAP

Do you like maps? We will produce a high-quality, handmade, silk-screen printed copy of Columbus' map for your kids' room wall, similar to the one that hangs in Columbus' room (it comes in size A0/ 33.1 x 46.8 inch)

MOLESKINE BOOK

If you like to write travel diaries or notebooks, we have the perfect thing for you: A Moleskine book with a unique laser-printed logo and your name/text on it.

UNIQUE FAVORITE ANIMAL PAINTING

Steffi will portray a unique watercolor painting of your kid's favorite animal.

ANIMATION CLASS

Steffi will hold a one-day class in Berlin to teach your children in animation and illustration (in German and for Children between ages 6 and 66 only, dates will be determined after the end of this campaign)

YOUR CHARACTER IN OUR APP

If you're really crazy about Columbus Little, we'll grant your support with the possibility to design your own character, which we will integrate permanently into the app. A drawing of your own kids? Hugo the superdog? Bernard the frog? This is a unique chance to let your creativity free.

 

THANK YOU FOR YOUR SUPPORT

We hope that you like Columbus Little! If so, please help us to bring the app to your kids really soon:

  • Preorder the app and buy one or several of our cool perks.
  • Tell your family and friends about Columbus Little.
  • Share our campaign via email or a social network of your choice (e.g. Facebook and Twitter right below).

If you have any feedback or want to support us in any other way, please feel free to contact us.

Thanks!

 

 

DEUTSCHE KURZFASSUNG - GERMAN SHORT VERSION

Wir erkunden gerne unsere Welt und wollen, dass Kinder dies auch tun. Deshalb entwickeln wir Columbus Little, eine App für das iPad und Android Tablets, mit der Kinder auf spielerische Art die Welt entdecken können. Die App enthält zahlreiche Orte, die es zu entdecken gilt. In den unterschiedlichen Abenteuern warten viele Überraschungen und Mini-Spiele auf die kleinen Entdecker. Die App ist für Kinder zwischen 1 und 7 Jahren konzipiert, kann aber natürlich auch älteren Kindern gefallen. Columbus Little ist besonders, denn:

  • der Großteil der Inhalte entsteht noch mit Pinsel und Papier.
  • wir wollen familiengerechte Unterhaltung für unsere Kleinen und versuchen, Kinder zu spielerischem Lernen zu animieren.
  • wir werden die Ideen unserer Kunden aufnehmen und Ihnen die Möglichkeit geben, die App aktiv mitzugestalten.
  • wir unterstützen Kinderhilfsprojekte in aller Welt.
  • es kommen regelmäßig neue Abenteuer als Update hinzu, so dass die Lernreise mit Columbus immer weiter gehen kann.

In den vergangenen Monaten hatten wir viel Spaß und haben einen tollen Prototyp entwickelt. Nun brauchen wir Eure Hilfe, um die App fertigzustellen. Wir wollen ausführlich testen, Details in den bestehenden Orten ergänzen, professionelle Sounds hinzufügen und vor allem weitere Inhalte erstellen.

Es ist noch viel zu tun, aber wir werden Columbus Little diesen Herbst veröffentlichen. Die Android-Version kommt kurze Zeit später. Dieses Jahr planen wir noch 2-3 neue Orte als Update, so dass wir euch 6-7 Abenteuer zur Verfügung stellen können.

EURE UNTERSTÜTZUNG

Für eure Unterstützung möchten wir euch mit kreativen "Perks" (Dankeschöns) danken. Zudem ist es möglich, uns Geld zu spenden oder mehr für die Perks zu bezahlen als sie kosten, wenn ihr mögt. Wir für jede Hilfe sehr dankbar!

Nach Deutschland liefern wir diese kostenlos, woanders hin wie in der Perk-Beschreibung angegeben.

Die App ("The App")

Ihr erhaltet in allen Perks einen Gutschein für die App und die erste Erweiterung. Zudem gibt's ab 10 EUR einen tollen Aufnäher.

1492 Schokolade ("Special Edition Chocolate")

Leckere Schokolade aus einem Berliner Schokoladenladen, in der Columbus Little Sonderedition

Daumenkino ("Flip Book")

Die Animationen in Columbus Little entstehen durch Zusammensetzung mehrere Bilder - wie ein Daumenkino. Steffi wird ein echtes Daumenkino für Euch designen.

T-Shirt "I LOVE THE WORLD"

Für Kinder und Erwachsene in verschiedenen Größen.

Columbus Shirt

Das rot-blau-gestreifte Shirt von Columbus, handgenäht für eure Kinder.

Columbus Weltkarte ("Columbus' World Map")

Wir produzieren selbst im Siebdruckverfahren eine schöne A0 Wandkarte ähnlich der in Columbus' Zimmer.

Moleskine Buch

Bestellt euch ein schönes Moleskine Buch mit einer Lasergravur eines der Logos und beliebigem Kurztext

Unikat ("Unique Painting")

Steffi wird mit Aquarellfarben ein Bild des Lieblingstiers eurer Kinder malen.

Animations-Kurs

Steffi wird in Berlin einen deutschsprachigen, eintägigen Animationskurs für Kinder und Erwachsene geben. Die Teilnehmer lernen u.a. wie mit der Stop-Motion-Technik aus Standbildern Bewegung entsteht.

Euer Charakter in unserer App

Wir werden einen von Euch skizzierten Charakter dauerhaf in eines der Abenteuer integrieren. Einzigartig!

 

VIELEN DANK FÜR DIE UNTERSTÜTZUNG

Wenn euch Columbus Little gefällt, dann

  • kauft bitte einen oder mehrere unserer Perks
  • teilt unsere Idee und diese Kampagne mit eurer Familie und Freunden
  • verbreitet die Idee via E-Mail oder einem sozialen Netzwerk eurer Wahl (z.B. Facebook und Twitter direkt weiter unten).

 

Lieben Dank!

 

PS: Eine Anleitung, wie das Spenden bei indiegogo funktioniert, findet Ihr oben unter "Galerie". Bei Fragen sprecht uns gern an.

(Deutsche Kurzbeschreibung weiter unten, Video mit Untertiteln auf YouTube)

THE COLUMBUS LITTLE APP
We want children to explore our beautiful and diverse world and to get curious about different cultures, awesome scenery, vibrant cities, yummie food, strange animals, high mountains, blue oceans, ...? That's why we create the Columbus Little App!

Columbus Little takes your kids on a journey to various lovely designed locations and let's them learn about them in a playful way. In some locations children may play small games or solve puzzles, others tell stories or show pictures. The app is targeted for kids between 1 and 7 years and is unique because:

The majority of the content is still created the old-fashioned style on paper and later digitized.
We specifically want to create a family-friendly, playful learning experience and urge our customers to play jointly with their kids.
We will include the ideas of our customers in enhancing and extending our app. 
Zestlab will make regular donations to child support projects all over the world.
And the best: New content will be added to the Columbus Little world regularly, so that the learning journey can continue.


 
WE NEED YOUR SUPPORT

We (Tobi, Steffi, and Philip from Zestlab) have been developing Columbus Little for the past 6 months as a side project next to our regular jobs. 
Most of the art has actually been created on paper as real drawings and later digitized. The coding has been done with Corona SDK, which is a software development kit that lets developers code once and then publish the apps on both iOS and Android. It has been fairly easy to use and speeded up our coding process a lot or made it even doable at all for non-computer scientists in the first place.
 
But now we need your support to make it ready for the little fingers of your children. Specifically, we need to:

Finish the details in the two locations that we already created.
Do beta testing and fine tuning (beta testers welcome, just contact us!).
Add professionally edited sounds and some speech elements.
Create more content so that the app can start with four interesting locations to discover.
Add multi-language support: The app already includes English, German and Spanish but we also plan at least Russian, French, Chinese and Japanese translations.
Develop an Android version of the app (code-wise it's easy because we used Corona SDK, but we need to convert all graphics to different aspect ratios and do beta testing).


 
APP RELEASE
We work very hard to get the iOS version of Columbus Little to the app store this fall. An Android version will follow within this year.
Initially, there will be four locations to discover. Two more will be added as in-app purchases within this year. Moreover, we plan free updates and extensions of already existing adventures. So you can expect a lot of stuff from us this year.
We also hope to release a free iPhone app alongside with Columbus Little that contains all the mini games from the iPad app so that your kids can play on the go.
 
THE PERKS
If you like Columbus, please support us and order one, several or even all of the cool perks we designed specifically for this campaign.
It is also possible to just donate money (1+ EUR) to us or pay more for the perks than their price tag, if you want to. We will mention all major supporters in the credits of our app. We are very gateful for your support!
Please add shipping costs to your donation as noted in the perk description. 
Free shipping to Germany.



THE APP (+ BADGE)
Your support will of course get you the Columbus Little App upon release this fall. The voucher will be transferable, so that you can support us even if you don't have kids or a tablet. 
For a few bucks more we'll send you a cool badge for the jeans or backpacks of your little world discoverers. 
App & badge will be included in all perks.


 





1492 COLUMBUS LITTLE SPECIAL EDITION CHOCOLATE
Something for the adults: 1492 Columbus Little Special Edition Chocolate by WOHLFARTH SCHOKOLADE from Berlin.





FLIP-BOOK
All animations within the app are actually created with a set of similar images (called sprite sheet) that - when combined - seem like motion (just like flip-books). So Steffi will create a cool old-school flip-book with a funny animation.
 





"I LOVE THE WORLD" T-SHIRT
For kids and adults, a cool cotton t-shirt to show others that you love our world, too. You will of course get it in various different sizes and adult male and female versions.





COLUMBUS' SHIRT
Want your kids to look like Columbus Little? We'll produce a hand-sewn version of Columbus' shirt for your kids. 





COLUMBUS' WORLD MAP
Do you like maps? We will produce a high-quality, handmade, silk-screen printed copy of Columbus' map for your kids' room wall, similar to the one that hangs in Columbus' room (it comes in size A0/ 33.1 x 46.8 inch)





MOLESKINE BOOK
If you like to write travel diaries or notebooks, we have the perfect thing for you: A Moleskine book with a unique laser-printed logo and your name/text on it.





UNIQUE FAVORITE ANIMAL PAINTING
Steffi will portray a unique watercolor painting of your kid's favorite animal.





ANIMATION CLASS
Steffi will hold a one-day class in Berlin to teach your children in animation and illustration (in German and for Children between ages 6 and 66 only, dates will be determined after the end of this campaign)





YOUR CHARACTER IN OUR APP
If you're really crazy about Columbus Little, we'll grant your support with the possibility to design your own character, which we will integrate permanently into the app. A drawing of your own kids? Hugo the superdog? Bernard the frog? This is a unique chance to let your creativity free.



 
THANK YOU FOR YOUR SUPPORT
We hope that you like Columbus Little! If so, please help us to bring the app to your kids really soon:

Preorder the app and buy one or several of our cool perks.
Tell your family and friends about Columbus Little.
Share our campaign via email or a social network of your choice (e.g. Facebook and Twitter right below).

If you have any feedback or want to support us in any other way, please feel free to contact us.
Thanks!

story:
Our story begins in the distant future (2009) with Troy Sanders working at a small town pizza shop. His co-workers nicknamed him “T-rock” because his name starts with “T” and he Rocks. Somehow this turned into some story about him having his own planet called T-rocktopia.

His friend [Ben Mock] heard about his planet and said, “dude! Please let me write the story line for T-rocktopia!” (because you know, he likes writing stories and drawing.)

So T-Rocktopia became a story about Four Heroes, who can use Music and Acoustical Energy to protect the Planet of Music against evil Cyborgs and Robots.

Then with the combined powers of Ben Mock’s Graphic Design skills and Troy Sanders Programming skills, they started making games. And then Karah Sanders (Troy’s sister) was like, “I’ll promote stuff and do merchandise things” [so she did]

At some point they needed some business cards and Troy said, “Let’s make our business cards look like Trading Cards.” But when they started handing them out people where like, “Is this a game? We want this game.”

So we made a game.

Battle of the Cards is ready to go! All we need is your help. Our graphic artist Ben Mock has worked hard designing each card while programmer, Troy Sanders, and Director of Marketing and Merchandise, Karah Sanders, collaborated on rules and gameplay to ensure the most fun you'll ever have in your life.

Our team is set to make Battle of the Cards happen! All we need is your support to get these awesome Cards into your hands!
story_txt:
Our story begins in the distant future (2009) with Troy Sanders working at a small town pizza shop. His co-workers nicknamed him “T-rock” because his name starts with “T” and he Rocks. Somehow this turned into some story about him having his own planet called T-rocktopia.
His friend [Ben Mock] heard about his planet and said, “dude! Please let me write the story line for T-rocktopia!” (because you know, he likes writing stories and drawing.)
So T-Rocktopia became a story about Four Heroes, who can use Music and Acoustical Energy to protect the Planet of Music against evil Cyborgs and Robots.
Then with the combined powers of Ben Mock’s Graphic Design skills and Troy Sanders Programming skills, they started making games. And then Karah Sanders (Troy’s sister) was like, “I’ll promote stuff and do merchandise things” [so she did]
At some point they needed some business cards and Troy said, “Let’s make our business cards look like Trading Cards.” But when they started handing them out people where like, “Is this a game? We want this game.”
So we made a game.
Battle of the Cards is ready to go! All we need is your help. Our graphic artist Ben Mock has worked hard designing each card while programmer, Troy Sanders, and Director of Marketing and Merchandise, Karah Sanders, collaborated on rules and gameplay to ensure the most fun you'll ever have in your life.
Our team is set to make Battle of the Cards happen! All we need is your support to get these awesome Cards into your hands!

story:
Colossal Blob is a 2 to 4 player card game for everyone! Kids, big kids (like all us adults), families, friends and anyone who just likes to have fun!


Well, it's actually the Colossal Blob, because there can be only one! The Colossal Blob is the biggest, baddest, most colossal blob in the universe! And it could be you!

 

You are a blob, setting down number cards to build your growth stack. You can also use special attack cards to keep other blobs from getting bigger than you, or to help you grow bigger yourself. Stay on your blobby toes, this game can change quickly. You may be behind the others blobs in one round, but with strategy and luck you can be ahead in the next.

Scroll down to see how to play!

 

You may wonder why you, as a blob, want to grow and grow and grow. Well, you're hungry, that's why! You better eat everything in sight and race the other blobs to become the Colossal Blob! And it's fun to do so because this game was...

 

One of the coolest things about Colossal Blob is that it was chosen as one of the 5 finalists in Hasbro's Great Game Contest for 2016!  Hasbro had around 650 games to look at and decided that Colossal Blob was one of the most fun out of all of them!

The grand prize winner of the challenge will receive $25,000 and they will get to visit Hasbro and take Colossal Blob to make it even more awesome! It goes without saying that I would love Colossal Blob to be the grand prize winner, but we can't accomplish this goal without your help. So, tell you friends, tell your family and tell your pets to support Colossal Blob. Let's help it to become the biggest, baddest most colossal backed Indie Go Go campaign ever!

Of course, winning the challenge isn't everything because at the end of the campaign, as long as we get funded, you will still get a super fun copy of Colossal Blob to enjoy with your friends and family!

 

How to Play Colossal Blob

Watch the "How to Play" video below for more information.

 

​PERKS

I'm sure everyone is looking at the perks and is interested in getting something super fun with their copy of the game. So, let's go over them here. Please read through these to make sure you get the perk you'd like, and feel free to ask me questions here about any of them.

There are a limited number of early bird copies of Colossal Blob, so get this perk while you can!

 

Enough said, this is your basic perk. You want a copy of Colossal Blob at the normal price? You got it!

 

At this perk you will receive 2 copies of Colossal Blob at a special price!

 

Would you like you very own hand drawn blob art from the artist of Colossal Blob? Back at this perk and you'll get a copy of the game plus your very own custom hand drawn blob scene. This isn't just a piece of art from the game, you can send me a description of what sort of scene you'd like and I'll draw it up for you. Look below for an example!

A custom blob, from sketch to inked! 

 

This will be your only chance to hug one of these adorable blobs without being sucked into them! If you back at this perk, you will get a copy of the game plus your own plush blob to sit on your shelf or keep you company at night. You can even pick between 6 colors! Red, green, blue, purple, pink or yellow. You may also choose between the 6 different expressions found on the blobs on the number cards and weather your blob has 1 or 2 eyes! Look below for what one plush looks like!

The plush was made by the incredibly talented artist Jeanette Humphries of PonkiAndJeani on Etsy. Jeanette's work has been featured in the magazine Stuffed and I think that her talent really speaks for itself. So you know that you're not just getting an adorable plush blob but one that is high quality at that! Thanks Jeanette!

 

My cat Sushi hanging out with the blob. Now he knows who ate his cat food!

 

How cool would it be to have your pet in Colossal Blob? Or maybe your child? Maybe your favorite kitchen utensil? Whatever it is (within reason), I will create a new series of cards for you with that item featured on them! For example below, I created a custom card that has Danielle's cat Ehzzie on the #1 growth cards. In this instance, Danielle would receive her normal copy of the game, along with a set of cards that can replace all the #1 growth stack cards in her deck. You will also get an 8x10 print of the custom card artwork.

If you have any questions on what items I will draw or include, please contact me on the facebook page.

 

Own or work at a game shop? Maybe you just have a lot of family or friends that love card games? Then this is the perk for you. You'll get 10 copies of Colossal Blob at a special price! And I can't promise anything, but if you contact me on the facebook page, I might be able to give you an even better price on this perk. ;)

 

With this perk, you'll be getting everything you can with your copy of Colossal Blob. This is the Colossal Box of Blob Stuff and I am forever in your debt for backing this. The contents are described below:

  • 2 copies of Colossal Blob
  • 1 set of custom cards to use in your game
  • 1 8x10 pint of the custom card art
  • 1 plush blob, choose your color from red, green, blue, purple, pink or yellow
  • 1 hand drawn piece of blob art
  • Plus any stretch goals that we reach!

 

This is The Secret Colossal Yeti Box. Within it, you will receive all of the items that are in The Colossal Box of Blob perk above. In addition, you will also receive:

  • 10 copies of the game (instead of 2)
  • 1 hand painted blob ornament
  • 1 photo shopped image of you with the blob (digital copy and 8x10 print). We will work with you on what image you'd like to use.
  • The exclusive and rare Colossal Yeti Blob Plush! (with back story) 

The Colossal Yeti Blob has been talked about for centuries but never actually seen in the wild. This is the amazingly rare Yeti Blob Plush and this perk is the only way to bag your own! The Yeti Blob will also come with a back story printed just for you, so only you will know the secret origin of the Colossal Yeti Blob. Get these quick, there are only 3 available!

 

STRETCH GOALS

Of course, not only will you be able to get cool items for backing certain perks, but we have a lot of fun stretch goals too! If we reaching these funding goals, you'll find these additional, fun extras. Let's take a look!

 

The Cost of Blobs

While it would probably take cities millions of dollars to rebuild civilization from a blob attack, to fund Colossal Blob, we're looking to raise $4,000. While we aren't rebuilding any cities, we are putting together a quality game and taking care of other fees that come with running a funding campaign. We really want to bring this game to life for friends and families to enjoy together, but we need your help to do that. As this is a fixed campaign, the game will only get made if we reach our goal. If the goal isn't met and the game isn't funded, Colossal Blob will not be made and we don't keep your money. Let's help the blobs succeed and make this campaign Colossal!

We are working with the wonderful people at Ad Magic to print the game and bring it to life! They have been great to work with, going out of their way to help us get the information we need to put Colossal Blob in your hands.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We completely understand that not everyone is in a position to help fund the campaign. However, there are still ways you can help Colossal Blob! You can show your support by sharing this Indiegogo page, the Facebook page, or the video from the campaign with your friends on Facebook, Twitter or in person! Scroll to the top and use the social networking buttons to make this even easier to do!

 

About Us

When Richard was young, he lived in Detroit. The area he lived in was unsafe, so he and his sister had to stay inside a lot of the time. He spent most days watching monster movies and playing games. He also formed his silly sense of humor from clowning around at school during that time, trying to make people laugh. As he got older he wanted to take his love of silly humor, monsters and games and put them together somehow. Colossal Blob became that “somehow,” as it combines all of these things into one!


Danielle doesn’t consider herself a bookworm, but rather a book dragon! Danielle's love of reading lead to her super active imagination. As a kid she imagined that she owned all sorts of fantastic pets and creatures. She would have loved to own a little blob! Danielle really enjoys smaller, silly games and she used her experience from playing those games (and her imagination) to help shape Colossal Blob into what it is today.
story_txt:
Colossal Blob is a 2 to 4 player card game for everyone! Kids, big kids (like all us adults), families, friends and anyone who just likes to have fun!



Well, it's actually the Colossal Blob, because there can be only one! The Colossal Blob is the biggest, baddest, most colossal blob in the universe! And it could be you!
 

You are a blob, setting down number cards to build your growth stack. You can also use special attack cards to keep other blobs from getting bigger than you, or to help you grow bigger yourself. Stay on your blobby toes, this game can change quickly. You may be behind the others blobs in one round, but with strategy and luck you can be ahead in the next.
Scroll down to see how to play!
 

You may wonder why you, as a blob, want to grow and grow and grow. Well, you're hungry, that's why! You better eat everything in sight and race the other blobs to become the Colossal Blob! And it's fun to do so because this game was...
 

One of the coolest things about Colossal Blob is that it was chosen as one of the 5 finalists in Hasbro's Great Game Contest for 2016!  Hasbro had around 650 games to look at and decided that Colossal Blob was one of the most fun out of all of them!
The grand prize winner of the challenge will receive $25,000 and they will get to visit Hasbro and take Colossal Blob to make it even more awesome! It goes without saying that I would love Colossal Blob to be the grand prize winner, but we can't accomplish this goal without your help. So, tell you friends, tell your family and tell your pets to support Colossal Blob. Let's help it to become the biggest, baddest most colossal backed Indie Go Go campaign ever!
Of course, winning the challenge isn't everything because at the end of the campaign, as long as we get funded, you will still get a super fun copy of Colossal Blob to enjoy with your friends and family!

 
How to Play Colossal Blob

Watch the "How to Play" video below for more information.


 
​PERKS
I'm sure everyone is looking at the perks and is interested in getting something super fun with their copy of the game. So, let's go over them here. Please read through these to make sure you get the perk you'd like, and feel free to ask me questions here about any of them.

There are a limited number of early bird copies of Colossal Blob, so get this perk while you can!
 

Enough said, this is your basic perk. You want a copy of Colossal Blob at the normal price? You got it!
 

At this perk you will receive 2 copies of Colossal Blob at a special price!
 

Would you like you very own hand drawn blob art from the artist of Colossal Blob? Back at this perk and you'll get a copy of the game plus your very own custom hand drawn blob scene. This isn't just a piece of art from the game, you can send me a description of what sort of scene you'd like and I'll draw it up for you. Look below for an example!

A custom blob, from sketch to inked! 
 

This will be your only chance to hug one of these adorable blobs without being sucked into them! If you back at this perk, you will get a copy of the game plus your own plush blob to sit on your shelf or keep you company at night. You can even pick between 6 colors! Red, green, blue, purple, pink or yellow. You may also choose between the 6 different expressions found on the blobs on the number cards and weather your blob has 1 or 2 eyes! Look below for what one plush looks like!

The plush was made by the incredibly talented artist Jeanette Humphries of PonkiAndJeani on Etsy. Jeanette's work has been featured in the magazine Stuffed and I think that her talent really speaks for itself. So you know that you're not just getting an adorable plush blob but one that is high quality at that! Thanks Jeanette!
 

My cat Sushi hanging out with the blob. Now he knows who ate his cat food!
 

How cool would it be to have your pet in Colossal Blob? Or maybe your child? Maybe your favorite kitchen utensil? Whatever it is (within reason), I will create a new series of cards for you with that item featured on them! For example below, I created a custom card that has Danielle's cat Ehzzie on the #1 growth cards. In this instance, Danielle would receive her normal copy of the game, along with a set of cards that can replace all the #1 growth stack cards in her deck. You will also get an 8x10 print of the custom card artwork.

If you have any questions on what items I will draw or include, please contact me on the facebook page.
 

Own or work at a game shop? Maybe you just have a lot of family or friends that love card games? Then this is the perk for you. You'll get 10 copies of Colossal Blob at a special price! And I can't promise anything, but if you contact me on the facebook page, I might be able to give you an even better price on this perk. ;)
 

With this perk, you'll be getting everything you can with your copy of Colossal Blob. This is the Colossal Box of Blob Stuff and I am forever in your debt for backing this. The contents are described below:

2 copies of Colossal Blob
1 set of custom cards to use in your game
1 8x10 pint of the custom card art
1 plush blob, choose your color from red, green, blue, purple, pink or yellow
1 hand drawn piece of blob art
Plus any stretch goals that we reach!

 

This is The Secret Colossal Yeti Box. Within it, you will receive all of the items that are in The Colossal Box of Blob perk above. In addition, you will also receive:

10 copies of the game (instead of 2)
1 hand painted blob ornament
1 photo shopped image of you with the blob (digital copy and 8x10 print). We will work with you on what image you'd like to use.
The exclusive and rare Colossal Yeti Blob Plush! (with back story) 

The Colossal Yeti Blob has been talked about for centuries but never actually seen in the wild. This is the amazingly rare Yeti Blob Plush and this perk is the only way to bag your own! The Yeti Blob will also come with a back story printed just for you, so only you will know the secret origin of the Colossal Yeti Blob. Get these quick, there are only 3 available!

 
STRETCH GOALS
Of course, not only will you be able to get cool items for backing certain perks, but we have a lot of fun stretch goals too! If we reaching these funding goals, you'll find these additional, fun extras. Let's take a look!
 
The Cost of Blobs
While it would probably take cities millions of dollars to rebuild civilization from a blob attack, to fund Colossal Blob, we're looking to raise $4,000. While we aren't rebuilding any cities, we are putting together a quality game and taking care of other fees that come with running a funding campaign. We really want to bring this game to life for friends and families to enjoy together, but we need your help to do that. As this is a fixed campaign, the game will only get made if we reach our goal. If the goal isn't met and the game isn't funded, Colossal Blob will not be made and we don't keep your money. Let's help the blobs succeed and make this campaign Colossal!
We are working with the wonderful people at Ad Magic to print the game and bring it to life! They have been great to work with, going out of their way to help us get the information we need to put Colossal Blob in your hands.
 
Other Ways You Can Help
We completely understand that not everyone is in a position to help fund the campaign. However, there are still ways you can help Colossal Blob! You can show your support by sharing this Indiegogo page, the Facebook page, or the video from the campaign with your friends on Facebook, Twitter or in person! Scroll to the top and use the social networking buttons to make this even easier to do!
 
About Us

When Richard was young, he lived in Detroit. The area he lived in was unsafe, so he and his sister had to stay inside a lot of the time. He spent most days watching monster movies and playing games. He also formed his silly sense of humor from clowning around at school during that time, trying to make people laugh. As he got older he wanted to take his love of silly humor, monsters and games and put them together somehow. Colossal Blob became that “somehow,” as it combines all of these things into one!
Danielle doesn’t consider herself a bookworm, but rather a book dragon! Danielle's love of reading lead to her super active imagination. As a kid she imagined that she owned all sorts of fantastic pets and creatures. She would have loved to own a little blob! Danielle really enjoys smaller, silly games and she used her experience from playing those games (and her imagination) to help shape Colossal Blob into what it is today.

story:
Short Summary

 

Hello everyone! My name is Summer Bishop and I am the creator of Spazztastiq Games LLC. I develop games and apps for the phone and computer. I am a stay at home mother to a wonder one year old daughter. I am a full time student getting my degree in Network Management. I was a network engineer in the army also. I like to make things in my free time and that is how Spazztastiq Games LLC came to be.

What is “Spazztastiq”? You may ask… well it has been my gamertag for a very long time. So I thought it was appropriate to name my game and app development company after it.

My current game which I am asking assistance with is, Zombie Road Match 3. It is a mobile match 3 game based on the amazing book series, Zombie Road, by the awesome David A. Simpson.

When you donate to my game, Zombie Road Match 3, you are helping me support the development of this game! Either to pay freelancers for help like making the music, to an amazing and very helpful programmer who helps me with coding that is over even my head. These donations will also help with marketing to make sure this game is as successful as it can possibly be!

 

What We Need & What You Get

 

So after trying to fund this myself, I’ve looked around and figured that $4000 should help tremendously with the production of Zombie Road M3 and help me get it to you, the players, much quicker. Of course if we can raise even more that would be even more fantastic!

Like I said before all proceeds go to development and marketing the game. I want to be able to afford to pay artists and designers to help make this game look amazing. I also want to be able to make some amazing marketing and ads that are fun to look at, that won’t make you say, “eh, oh no, another ad, bleh”.

In return of your generosity we will offer grand gifts for you! Much Swag! Like patches, stickers, trucker hats, shirts, and more! Even early access to when the game hits beta! I’ve talked with my pixel artist and we will offer to make rescuable game pieces in your image so you can be in the game! Or you can choose to have a 16 bit portrait of yourself!

 

Risks & Challenges

 

As a small business owner my biggest challenge is getting funded. I’ve got a lot of the hard parts done. I just want to be able to afford to make this game look as best as it possibly can. A risk I might run into, not getting enough funding. This will make the developing process run much slower and release of the game will be much later than we would like and might not look that appealing. My plan if this happens is slowly fund the game myself.  

Other Ways You Can Help

Can’t donate? That’s ok ^_^ Please share this campaign with your friends and family! Indiegogo has several share options.

 

This is a very new business so I will post new stuff when it comes up!

story:
The Jumpgate is a sleek and portable dock has an ingenious design. It can easily switch between dock and hub mode to work with your Nintendo SWITCH, laptop and smart phone.  

We have spent the past 8 months ensuring that the Jumpgate Dock and AC adaptor are safe to use. Here are the tests we ran:

  • 100 hours of non-stop charging test: We tested the PD (power delivery) chips in the Jumpgate Dock and AC adaptor to see if they delivered the proper volt and ampere to the SWITCH according to its battery level. 
  • Firmware update test: We updated the firmware when the console was connected with the Jumpgate Dock. Check out the videos:

  • Plugging test: We checked to see whether the Jumpgate Dock could automatically switch between TV and tabletop mode when the USB-C and HDMI was connected or disconnected. 



The Pop-up design creates a gap, which allows the air circulation to enter the vents on the back of SWITCH.

The detachable Core Drive can be used on your SWITCH without the dock.

The Jumpgate Dock can also work with the Nintendo dock.


The Core drive can disengage from the dock.

The 5 degrees of adjustable range allows you to dock your Switch with or without a protective case.

The guide pillar can be detached to fit most third-party cases.

It allows you to dock your SWITCH with most third-party cases on the market.

The Jumpgate will automatically switch to Tabletop Mode if there is no signal (coming) from the HDMI port.

Enjoy gaming without worrying about running out of juice.

 
A kickstand provides two viewing angles for Tabletop Mode.

The Core Drive provides all the necessary ports you need in daily life.

It’s easy to switch.

The built-in DeX function can turn your smart phone into a computer if it has the DEX function like SAMSUNG Galaxy S9 and S8.


Expand the storage capacity of your phone and transfer photos and data easily and quickly.

Literally, it can be used on all your electronic devices, such as smart phones (fast charging) and laptops (full power for both 13” and 15” laptops, but the charging speed will be slower on 15” laptops to compare with the 87w AC adaptors). The detachable 5'/1.5 meter USB-C (C to C) cable is included, which provides up to 100W charging power and high speed data transmission. 

 

Projects such as this one are required a number of molds to be made upfront, as well as a minimum order quantity needed to get this off the ground. After more the 8 months polishing and testing, we are ready to make the Jumpgate a reality!  

We need your help to spread the word about The Jumpgate. Every post, share, and pledge counts! Thanks for your support!

We delivered GripCase last year, which was our first project on Kickstarter and we’ve made a wide range of gaming accessories in the past. Our previous Kickstarter experience, combined with our strong product development background has given us great confidence in (making the Dock into existence)(accomplishing Jumpgate)(producing Jumpgate). Still, we can’t foresee every problem so we’re committed to fix any challenges that may arise during the fulfillment process.

Product Manufacturing 
We are mostly focused on the tooling of creating this product. Any mistake or change can lead to a delay in shipping of the products.

Quality Management 
We’ve carefully selected our manufacturing partners to make sure our final products are of the highest quality. The products will be tested 100% before being packaged.

Shipping and logistics 
Our first Kickstarter campaign taught us a lot about how to deal with a logistics provider. Besides, we will avoid Christmas rush and bad weather this time.

WE ARE SHIPPING !

Grab your NS Glasses today at this reduced price while the Early Bird lasts!
30% OFF for limited time.





















 

Press Kit"

Kickbooster

Affiliate Program
 

On the attempt of replacing ACTIVE 3D with Passive 3D our (patent pending) “Color Switching Technology” was born and were able to finalize our first Consumer grade lens. This hasn’t stop us to continue R&D in order to improve Color Switching Technology algorithm to a point where one day we can fully substitute ACTIVE 3D.
This is not just new, but an opportunity for Low-End Hardware like the Nintendo Switch to flawlessly fit into the world of 3D.

Need more information? Chat with us!

story:
About the Game

Collie of Duty was originally created in May of 2011. Its humble beginnings were some card sleeves and pieces of paper with really bad art. After nearly two years of testing and tweaking (and contracting an awesome artist), it's ready to be published!

Technical Stuff: 3 - 6 players, 20 - 30 minutes

This game is all about the sheep. Herd sheep from the pasture and add them to your pen, but watch out for wolves! The other collies will also try to stop you in any way they can, even if it means spraying you with water to distract you! Play cards to power up your pen with special sheep and bonuses. Every draw is a risk, though, because some cards shake up the whole game! (Literally; one of the cards is an earthquake.)

 

Why You Should Buy It

In its two years of playtesting, only one person has not liked Collie of Duty. When asked why, he said that it was too cute and too happy! So he liked it but wanted to be manly and standoffish. Collie of Duty has been to conventions across the southeastern United States and has always been met with great enthusiasm! 

Collie of Duty is unlike any other game. It has some leader-bashing aspects found in Munchkin and scoring that's a little bit like Nuts, but there is no game on the market with this much special flair. Where else can you send a pack of feral Corgis after your opponents or tempt them with persuasive puppy eyes?

Autographed Art

Certain contribution levels offer signed 4''x6'' prints of actual art featured in the game.  Pictures of these drawings will be featured in the gallery (the artist is finishing up the last of them).

 

Please Spread the Word!

Whether or not you choose to put money towards this game, please share this campaign with anyone that may be interested! The more Collie of Duty players there are worldwide, the merrier!

story:
War of Reckoning, an online real-time browser-based multiplayer strategy game

Recently graduated student of computer-science, I started creating and working at this game 8 months ago after quitting my job.

It all started years ago after having played endless hours of various games. I have never found that special x-factor that makes the game perfect, so I've decided to start my own little universe and try to design bits of every awesome gameplay I've encountered and bring them together in one game.

War of Reckoning is an online real-time strategy game that is based in a world not so far in the future. The game will offer two perspectives:
  • Single-Player campaigns - you will be able to experience the story of the game by gaining control over a handful of units and completing various missions by eliminating threats and achieving objectives, using diferite unit abilities. Each campaign has its own set of rewards;

  • Multi-Player instances - players will be gathering resources, expanding the military base, conducting battles and researching new technologies.

Some of the properties buildings and units can have in the game are: Health, Power, Armor, Shield, Energy, Range, Attack speed, Movement speed, Health regeneration, Energy regeneration, Armor regeneration, Shield regeneration, Development slots and Construction slots.
 
Mercenaries will probably have properties like Accuracy or Plasma to benefit various special abilities. The possibilities are endless.
 
The goal of the game is to earn emblems, spend them on various in-game items and have fun while doing it. Players will also have the possibility to create alliances and schedule battles between them.
 
 
The game engine has its own campaign editors such as conversations, objectives, triggers, rewards, abilities, units, models and many more. At the moment, all of these editors are available for an administrator account and can be made either public or private by him.
 
 
If the campaign reaches its milestones, players will be able to create their own vision of the universe with just a few clicks.
 
 
 
The game:
  • will have its own campaign publishing system, as well as campaign editor, where any player can create its own small universe and share it with his/her friends;
  • will also have unique multi-player instances on a colossal map (up to 100 players) where players will be able to simulate MMO-RTS gender;
  • players will be able to contract various mercenaries (powerful units that possess various special abilities) and summon them in-game in order to aid them in battle;
  • will have its own economy, where players will be able to buy and sell various items found and earned in campaigns.

For the future, I have planned multiple versions of stories, races and campaigns that will enhance the gaming experience.

 

A public demo of the game is available in its beta phase. You can register and play for free the beta version of the game at http://www.warofreckoning.com/. The current version contains a preview of 3 campaigns in single-player mode and a rough functionality in the multi-player game, it being in heavy development and testing. Playing the game requires only a browser.

 

The resources gained for the previous job were all invested in this project until now. My funds are beginning to decrease and I need financial support in order to carry on and finish it.

Up until now, I’ve managed to release a beta-version of the game. However, to finish and improve the current quality of the game engine I need extra funds, for the following areas:

  • Hardware - the game engine runs on different servers. As the price for the servers increase, the quality of the in-game experience rises and the latency lowers;
  • Additional in-game content - characters and units, as well as environmental objects are basically 3D models that cost money. Up until now, these models were purchased as you can see them, without further modification and personalization. Part of the campaign money will be invested in a full-time designer for creating and expanding the game’s content;
  • Sounds and music - currently, there are no sound effects in-game, but I am planning on introducing various themed-sounds to increase the game experience;
  • Expanding development - at the moment, I am working on every aspect of the game (development, design, gameplay, etc).  In order to increase the pace of the project’s growth, I am in need of developers as well as designers to split the massive amount of time and work;
  • Basic survival - given the fact that i currently invest 8 to 10 hours a day into this project, I have no income and live on personal savings from the past years, which are depleting fast.

Weather the campaign succeeds or fails, the money will still be invested as much as possible into the project to try and keep it alive. In case the campaign fails, the development will probably be reduced to 1 or 2 hours a day, me being forced to move on.

 

Thank you so much for checking out the War of Reckoning campaign. If you have any questions of any kind in any field, suggestions or just want to chat, don’t hesitate to send me an email at

Recently graduated student of computer-science, I started creating and working at this game 8 months ago after quitting my job.
It all started years ago after having played endless hours of various games. I have never found that special x-factor that makes the game perfect, so I've decided to start my own little universe and try to design bits of every awesome gameplay I've encountered and bring them together in one game.

War of Reckoning is an online real-time strategy game that is based in a world not so far in the future. The game will offer two perspectives:


Single-Player campaigns - you will be able to experience the story of the game by gaining control over a handful of units and completing various missions by eliminating threats and achieving objectives, using diferite unit abilities. Each campaign has its own set of rewards;




Multi-Player instances - players will be gathering resources, expanding the military base, conducting battles and researching new technologies.



Some of the properties buildings and units can have in the game are: Health, Power, Armor, Shield, Energy, Range, Attack speed, Movement speed, Health regeneration, Energy regeneration, Armor regeneration, Shield regeneration, Development slots and Construction slots.
 
Mercenaries will probably have properties like Accuracy or Plasma to benefit various special abilities. The possibilities are endless.
 
The goal of the game is to earn emblems, spend them on various in-game items and have fun while doing it. Players will also have the possibility to create alliances and schedule battles between them.
 

 
The game engine has its own campaign editors such as conversations, objectives, triggers, rewards, abilities, units, models and many more. At the moment, all of these editors are available for an administrator account and can be made either public or private by him.
 

 
If the campaign reaches its milestones, players will be able to create their own vision of the universe with just a few clicks.
 

 

 
The game:

will have its own campaign publishing system, as well as campaign editor, where any player can create its own small universe and share it with his/her friends;
will also have unique multi-player instances on a colossal map (up to 100 players) where players will be able to simulate MMO-RTS gender;
players will be able to contract various mercenaries (powerful units that possess various special abilities) and summon them in-game in order to aid them in battle;
will have its own economy, where players will be able to buy and sell various items found and earned in campaigns.

For the future, I have planned multiple versions of stories, races and campaigns that will enhance the gaming experience.
 

A public demo of the game is available in its beta phase. You can register and play for free the beta version of the game at http://www.warofreckoning.com/. The current version contains a preview of 3 campaigns in single-player mode and a rough functionality in the multi-player game, it being in heavy development and testing. Playing the game requires only a browser.
 

The resources gained for the previous job were all invested in this project until now. My funds are beginning to decrease and I need financial support in order to carry on and finish it.
Up until now, I’ve managed to release a beta-version of the game. However, to finish and improve the current quality of the game engine I need extra funds, for the following areas:

Hardware - the game engine runs on different servers. As the price for the servers increase, the quality of the in-game experience rises and the latency lowers;
Additional in-game content - characters and units, as well as environmental objects are basically 3D models that cost money. Up until now, these models were purchased as you can see them, without further modification and personalization. Part of the campaign money will be invested in a full-time designer for creating and expanding the game’s content;
Sounds and music - currently, there are no sound effects in-game, but I am planning on introducing various themed-sounds to increase the game experience;
Expanding development - at the moment, I am working on every aspect of the game (development, design, gameplay, etc).  In order to increase the pace of the project’s growth, I am in need of developers as well as designers to split the massive amount of time and work;
Basic survival - given the fact that i currently invest 8 to 10 hours a day into this project, I have no income and live on personal savings from the past years, which are depleting fast.

Weather the campaign succeeds or fails, the money will still be invested as much as possible into the project to try and keep it alive. In case the campaign fails, the development will probably be reduced to 1 or 2 hours a day, me being forced to move on.
 

Thank you so much for checking out the War of Reckoning campaign. If you have any questions of any kind in any field, suggestions or just want to chat, don’t hesitate to send me an email at

story:
Update:Monday February 11th, 2013

We've in the final 40 hours of our campaign! If you have been holding out, now is the time to share and/or donate and help us out. We'd love to break $1000, even if we don't make our goal. This has been an exciting experience so far, and hope you decide to be a part of it!

Update: Saturday January 26th, 2013

OK, so we're down to the last 17 days of the campaign and we've added a Perk that I think you'll find hard to resist. If this looks like an app you'd enjoy using-one that you might download for $.99 in the app store, then simply donate at the $1 level and you'll get it for free when it's released. This way you help us make sure the app gets made, but you don't extend yourself. Think of it as a pre-sale! We hope you will take advantage of this if you've been thinking the project sounds cool but just didn't want to donate more. Thanks!

Update: Tuesday January 22nd, 2013

Hey guys, we just put up the new video detailing the features and interface on onSchedule Alarm, along with some of the science behind the project. If you're having trouble viewing the video above, go here to see it over at vimeo: http://vimeo.com/57913062

 It's crunch time and we really need your help. With three weeks left in the campaign we've got a long way to go before making our goal! Anything you can spare to donate is fantastic. Otherwise if you could share this page or just the video with your friends, that's extremely helpful. Thanks!

        -A

Update: Friday January 18th, 2013

Welcome @TheNerdyGymRat podcast listeners! On Monday we plan to release a video showing the app's UI and features in detail, but before then I wanted to give a brief rundown of the concept behind the app and how it'll make your life better.

onSchedule Alarm is an app that is designed around the waking up process. Most alarms treat waking up as an instantaneous event that occurs due to a shock to your system, in the form of the alarm sound. Science shows us a better way. At Spark Development we see waking up, like going to sleep, to be a process with multiple stages. Jumping straight to wakefulness from sleep is jarring and painful, both physically and psychologically. Let us look briefly at what happens when you sleep.

There are 5 brain stages of sleep. 1-4 get progressively deeper, as your brain frequencies drop as low as half a hertz. The last stage is REM sleep, when your brain and body are actually quite active, with elevated blood pressure, heart rate, and muscle contractions. When the melatonin in your body begins to decline in early morning, the REM cycles become longer, eventually lasting up to an hour. When you wake up naturally and pleasantly, your brain has a chance to cycle up from whatever level it's in, until it is in an acceptable place to become conscious. 

Since REM tends to include largely beta waves, which is what we predominantly have when alert and awake, we often wake up from a dream and remember parts of it. Unless, that is, we have to wake up at an arbitrary time, which could yank us straight from Theta or Delta, causing distress and sometimes disorientation. So onSchedule offers a variety of different features, all of which you can enable or disable, to assist in the gradual and natural waking process, irrespective of when you have to get up. An example could be the following:

  • You set your alarm for 6AM.
  • At 5:45 a low modulated tone begins softly, gradually increasing in frequency and volume over 15 minutes. Brain entrainment will cause your mind to 'follow' this frequency up, bringing you out of your deepest level, up toward a waking brain pattern. Increased dreams in this time are expected.
  • At the same time, either a pulsing light in sequence with the tone, or a steadily increasing warm glow will show on your phone's screen, to simulate sun rise.
  • A relaxing tone will sound. Something pleasant and relaxing, but new. With your brain at an elevated state, it will naturally listen to this new sound and begin to process what the sound represents (water, frogs, birds, etc)
  • Your selected alarm sound will tone at 6AM. Although you can select a harsh tone if needed, over time your brain can adjust to answer to a much softer and less jarring tone. Your brain was prepped in previous steps, and now is ready to get up.
  • Once the alarm tones, a pleasant voice reads you the weather report, the time, and the headlines from your favorite news source or tech blog.
  • If you hit snooze, it will be silent for 30 seconds, and then play an alpha wave pattern, increasing in volume over the snooze interval time that you set. This is to prevent you dropping back down to theta or delta, where you'll miss your second alarm. After the interval your alarm and voice alerts play again.

Now, this sounds very complicated, and from a development and research perspective it is somewhat complex. However, the beauty of having a project lead by someone committed to design and UX is that we make it simple for you to use. There are many alarms with many great features, but the ones with the best features are often the hardest to use. In the upcoming video we'll show you how easy it is to set up onSchedule Alarm.

Where does the funding go?

Most of the funding is devoted to the actual development of the app. I am committing my time as a designer to handle all the visual and UI elements, but the programmer must be paid! The rest will go toward further testing of the app in sleep studies where we will be monitoring brain patterns in response to various combinations of tone, frequency, and stimulus. It's important to us that this works, because so many people have a hard time feeling good in the morning. We believe we can help change that, but we need your help to get there! Please give whatever you can, and we'll be eternally grateful. Thanks! Old info is below :)

My name is Anthony Fransella, and I want to make the world better through new ideas and technologies. I have projects on the drawing boards for automotive, troop, and motorcycle safety, for the hearing and visually impaired, and for spatial data organization and productivity UI design. Everything must, however, have a beginning, and this is mine.

onSchedule Alarm is founded, it must first be said, on the psychology of the individual. It focuses on giving you a positive reason to WANT to get going, rather than just a desire to escape the normal alarm clock's hideous noise. More than a reminder app, more than just an alarm clock, onSchedule Alarm adapts to what works for you! It's perfect for the business professional who lives by his Outlook calendar, the tech junkie who checks Engadget every day, or the tired commutist who wants to know the traffic and weather before setting out.
 
It must also be said that this is not simply a sleep pattern alarm clock, such as are so prevalent these days. It's a new concept that goes much farther toward increasing your productivity, energy, and satisfaction in life. We can't reveal with exactly specificity the particulars of our feature set quite yet, since it's unique, but as development proceeds we'll be posting more information here.
 
I believe in starting small and growing based on the merits of how meaningful and impactful the projects and ideas are. For this reason I have founded Spark Development, Inc., with an experienced engineer friend of mine, Adriel Gonzalez. I need your help to get this whole crazy ride moving, so let me explain why I think you will not regret any contribution you make, should you choose to do so.

Why we need you!

We have some big ideas, and we've decided that its our mission to change the world in whatever positive way we can. You can help us by generously donating to this project. We've talked to traditional funding sources, like banks and venture capitalists, but in order to really follow a more altruistic path of creative invention we feel it's important not to be ordered about by someone who's really only looking for a fast return on investment. My partner and I have each committed money to get the development started, and if you look at the rewards we've come up with you'll see that I am willing to put my time and experience where my mouth is by offering creative services to upper tier donors.
 
We are asking for $3300 from you to cover development costs (the extra $300 is to cover Indiegogo fee). The actual programming will be contracted out for this round, but we hope to grow and hire on someone fulltime when possible. Thank you very much, and please promote our project to your friends! The more the merrier, and they'll all at least get a free app license if they donate even the minimum $5. If we get just 33 people to donate $100 we'll already hit our goal. Or 330 at $10. It's really very doable, but we need help getting the word out! We can't do it without you!

What you get out of it

I know that the purpose of this site is to fund ideas and causes that people are passionate about. One of the things that we stressed when creating Spark was that we will be donating 10% of corporate net profits to various charities, permanently, no matter how big it gets. On a more immediate note, anyone donating at or above the $5 minimum will be getting a free voucher for the app when its released on Android or iOS. Other rewards include:
  • $20+: Thanks in the app's credits
  • $50+: Spark Development T-Shirt - logo of your choice
  • $100+: Spark Development Mug
  • $200+: Business or Personal custom logo or brochure design
  • $500+: Basic website design OR Architectural renderings/drawing
  • $2000+: 2 day wedding photography or videography (you pay airfare for outside FL/GA)

Note that these are stackable, so donations of $200 or more will also receive the T-shirt or mug, thank you letter, and name in the credits. Any $500+ donations will receive special thanks!. Basically I'm offering this: if you happen to need professional visual design services, why not donate and both help our project thrive and get the service as a bonus? :) On the possibility that we don't reach our goal we're not giving up. We've been searching for the best way to fund some of these ideas for almost 2 years, but need to do it the right way. I will find a way to make up the difference if we're reasonably short. If it's still to great a difference the funds will go toward the project and await a way to find the rest. If we raise more than the required amount, we'll port it to other platforms.

The Impact

 Although this is our first app, I have 15 years professional experience both running my own business and acting as a professional designer and art director. My partner has as many years in top level (undisclosed) engineering applications.

I believe this application could affect a great many people who have trouble waking up. It can also just make for a more fun and energizing start to the day! I'm personally excited to use it, and I hope you will be to. As we get a little farther into production I'll start to let out specific features, since it'll be too late then for copycats to catch up.

Other Ways You Can Help

Alright guys, I've rambled enough! If you can't tell I have a lot of passion and energy for this, so if you could, let that encourage you to share the project and get the word out! If you think it worthy of course; I'd never ask anyone to endorse something they weren't interested in themselves! Indiegogo has useful sharing tools built in too. If you'd rather just donate your talents to convert the app to another platform once its built, that'd be great too! Thanks so much, and rock on! -Anthony

Twitter: @sparkdevinc www.twitter.com/sparkdevinc

Facebook: www.facebook.com/onschedulealarm

story:
Get the FULL Soundtrack here

Vote for/Follow "The Lady" on Steam Greenlight
Web Volg on YouTube

Our campaign is over, thanks to anyone who viewed the videos and played the demo, and especially thanks to those who contributed. The game will be releasing this May/June on DESURA, Greenman Gaming, and several other online distros. The only way to get the demo now is through my website: 
http://www.mprart.net/mprarthallucinations/ 

What is "The Lady"?

The Lady is a very dark and unique 2D Surreal/Puzzle /Adventure game, with Horror elements (For Windows PC exclusively). The game features hand drawn character art , photographic backgrounds, stop-motion themed animation, and a hauntingly abrasive analog soundtrack by the creator of the game, Michael Patrick Rogers . The game is being programmed/developed by the talented Roger Levy.

The game is a short and surrealist journey that takes The Lady through a series of fever dream like hallucinations, while being at odds with her own inner struggles with anxiety and depression. She encounters multiple versions of herself throughout the game, unsure of who to trust. The gameplay is Inspired by classic SNES and Turbo Grafx16 type games. The difficulty in gameplay will be brutal, reminiscent of old school games, such as Ghost N Goblins. The game features side-scrolling exploration and arcade-style battles, playing in letterbox full screen HD. 


Press & Development Documentation

 I've done several interviews about the game recently. To learn more about the story, gameplay, and other aspects about the game, take a look at some of the interviews I've done to date.

http://plus10damage.com/blog/2013/12/3/theladymichaelpatrickrogersinterview

http://1001-up.com/2013/12/06/1001-previews-the-lady/

http://thegamingground.com/2013/december/michael-patrick-rogers-the-lady-interview.html

http://www.followingyourfears.com/2014/01/05/electric-funeral-the-lady-is-coming

 http://mwap.me.uk/game-industry-news/the-lady-horror-game.html

http://www.thesoundarchitect.co.uk/theladygame/


Some "Let's Play" Videos of the Demo

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=K740v870Eoc&...

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=J1qESJThS5E&...

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=aSydfATIBkg&...

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=CwVe1V9g43A&amp...

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=gxmUAQuDWj8&... 

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Ii1gPp9Kr1s&...

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=sWsBIfi3g9I

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=RzmCVPfU4mI&...

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=hMA3e9ufQsA&amp... 

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=afzDcEUQUq8&...

To learn more about the story, gameplay, and other aspects about the game, take a look at some of the interviews I've done to date.http://plus10damage.com/blog/2013/12/3/theladymichaelpatrickrogersinterviewhttp://1001-up.com/2013/12/06/1001-previews-the-lady/http://thegamingground.com/2013/december/michael-patrick-rogers-the-lady-interview.htmlhttp://www.followingyourfears.com/2014/01/05/electric-funeral-the-lady-is-coming http://mwap.me.uk/game-industry-news/the-lady-horror-game.htmlhttp://www.thesoundarchitect.co.uk/theladygame/Some "Let's Play" Videos of the Demohttp://www.youtube.com/watch?v=K740v870Eoc&...http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=J1qESJThS5E&...http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=aSydfATIBkg&...https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=CwVe1V9g43A&amp...http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=gxmUAQuDWj8&... http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Ii1gPp9Kr1s&...http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=sWsBIfi3g9Ihttp://www.youtube.com/watch?v=RzmCVPfU4mI&...https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=hMA3e9ufQsA&amp... http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=afzDcEUQUq8&...

story:
I need your help!

My name is Andrew Stock and I've been playing poker for almost 2 years. I started playing before I was 21 and have been playing in Vegas before and after that age. Out of all the times I went to Vegas I can say I broke even. But out of all the times I have played locally, I have made enough money to cover my travel expenses across the nation and the transportation of a car from South Texas to Utah. 

I play or study poker 5 or 6 days a week. I have read 5 poker books (over 2,000 pages!), and am currently reading 3 more, with two more on the shelf waiting to be read after my current ones. My poker study involves mostly reading poker books and watching professionals play online.

I strongly believe that I am at least good enough to place high enough to get 'in the money'. My goal is to make it to the final table, the final 9 players, and play for the top prize of at least $10,000,000.

I need your help raising enough money to play in this grand poker tournament. I am getting married in a few months, and there is no way I can put up $10,000 of my own money, even if I had it. I need it for my new married life. But if everyone pitched in at least $10, I could play in the Main Event.

 Placing in this tournament would be a great start for my marriage. My future wife and I would be able to buy a car, put a down payment for a house, finish paying for school, and even pay for any wedding expenses!



What I need from you, and what you can get

     The entry cost to the Main Event at the 2014 World Series of Poker is $10,000. That is only the entry, so it does not include travel and stay; therefore, I will need to raise at least that amount.

Because of rules on this site, I am not allowed to talk about investing. I had to edit this campaign and take out anything that mentioned the word 'invest'. I will explain to you what 'Turn $10 into $5005' means. For the complete details of my project text or call me at 801-404-7188. Or email me at andrewstock@sbcglobal.net.


Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, you can still help by sharing this page on Facebook or any other type of social media.
