story:
#5 Update: [12 days left] Game demo is ONLINE! Find it here: http://www.dakija.com

 

 

 

 

Story:

     Embark on a journey to a brand new world and change the fate of a people needing redemption.
Set in a land far away, Dakija follows your story as a hero in a quest to restore order among the land and the people: a land of advanced technology and civilization; a people evolved into higher conscious beings.
     Chaos ensued after the forces of evil, hidden for a long time, rose through a volcanic explosion marking their ascension deep from the undergrounds.
     Kingdoms will be shattered.
     Terror will reign.
     But out of the ashes, a hero will rise and restore a world thrown into chaos.
     Unleash your power within. Discover the ancient powers you alone possess. Stop the evil forces to finally restore the order the ancients once knew.

 

Gameplay:

     Dakija is an online browser-based fantasy RPG game. Following a turn-based combat format, players choose their type of hero and develop their abilities, skills, spells and other attributes as he progresses in the game. Train a Fighter or Magician (Archer and Monk - coming soon). Cast over 100 spells of different types. Develop more than 200 sets of skills. Equip more than 400 weapons and 200 armors as you fight the evil forces, discover ancient knowledge and save the land of Dakija!  

 

 
 

 

     The game starts off with simple turn-based battles, but as your journey goes deeper into the heart of the story, you will encounter lots of exciting quests, build a unique team of mercenaries and NPCs and enjoy hours of pure RPG experience.

     From the halls of the castles to the heart of the woods, there is no single way to finish the quests that await you.

     Build a character of your own in hundreds of different ways and expect more options from the developers.

     Most of the online RPG games you see so far requires a lot of money for you to progress and gain advantage over other players. Dakija believes in fair play and will provide equal opportunities to every gamer wanting a level playing field.

     No ridiculous amount of money involved.No unfair advantage. This is pure gaming experience at its best.

 

     At its very core, Dakija is an interplay of fantasy, RPG and the love for developing. The creator of Dakija conceived this game out of pure passion and the need to share this to the gaming community.

      In a desire to bring this to the world, this game was built from scratch, timeless devotion and the vision of giving every player an online RPG they can call their very own.

     The creator promises unceasing development to bring endless hours of the finest gaming experience to every player out there.

 

     Currently, the game is being rolled out at its very alpha stage. That means a lot has been made to come up to this point, but that also entails a lot of work still needs to be done.

     Among my top priorities right now is to find a co-founder designer, who will be involved in the game design. The second on the list would be a dedicated server so that the valuable feedback would be captured and that progress would not be halted. Another important thing is to code, code and code more! I made this game out of my years of experience and passion for online games and I would continue to do so! The last on my list of future plans is to hire a writer who can help me create the world of Dakija and unfold hours of epic story-telling.

 

 

 

  • Bare minimum - 500$ - is required for finishing coding pvp system and entering final alpha #3 stage.

 

  • At 1000$ - Game will reach Open Beta on mid of March! Thank you!

 

  • At 1500$ I’m planning on getting pro graphics on archer class and enchantments in dungeon and upgrading page.

 

  • At 2400$ all year long fast server preordered. Faster gameplay = more satisfaction!

 

  • At 2800$ writer enchants my texts in a professional manner.

 

  • At 3500$ many more enchants in graphics such as different outlook when using different equipments, profesionally-painted merchants and NPCs (that are currently black now).

 

  • At 4500$ REAL GOAL. Starting developing version for tablet computers and mobile devices. because current game's design is well fit for mobile devices I would like you to play this game anywhere!

 

  • At 6000$ will search for programer for half-time job to help me with game’s code.

 

  • At 8000$ an outstanding 5x5 guild battles on end of May!

     

  • At 10000$ additional two classes decided by community (besides archer and priest).

 

  • At 12000$ creating a full-paid team for faster game development (check FAQ section for more information).

 

  • At 25000$ We got the stable background for half of the year as a team, our main goal – perfecting an epic game.

 


      Have you been playing new browser games lately? It feels like I'm watching a movie, not playing a RPG.. I feel sorry that they are called RPGs. You have no choices, beside equipping items, and they are giving you one-way to improve your hero and even fights became automatic!

     What's the fun in it?

     This game is different, more old school, becouse Dakija RPG grants you choices you deserve to have in the RPG game.  Dakija gives you full control of your moves in combat, many ways to improve you hero the way you want and even upgrade weapons the way you want! Enough of these cheap one-way-one-story lines of codes called games, it's time for a deep and full of choices RPG!

 

 

 

 

       In the spring of 2012 the game had open testing in Alpha #1, where community tested combat and leveling system, skills, spells,  shopkeepers in town and hero page. Players sent some really nice ideas on how to improve this game. Thank you.

 

       Now, after a half year, I’m having Closed Alpha #2 testing.  Player-versus-monster also known as PvM has been improved a lot. You can test exploring system, dungeons, quests, more monsters, more items, better balanced skill trees and spells, item upgrading system, in game teacher - called scholar.

  Few things that are on my to do list or currently are being coded:

  • PvP fights (both online and offline, working now),
  • Party Travelling (up to 5 people exploring),
  • Challenging game even after you reach max level,
  • Guild competition (5x5 battles until death),
  • Guild’s leveling system (skill trees for guilds, some skills may be used in guild battles),
  • Monster invasions,
  • Fully interactive NPCs
  • Epic main quest and many subquests,
  • Mercenaries and NPCs joining you in battles.
  • Translated into many languages
       Also, I’d like to tell you, why I started creating this game.

        I was playing RPGs for  many years and was one of those guys, who never stopped experimenting with builds. My brother had 1 fighter and felt happy with that. I didn’t. I searched, had 10 champions and wanted to know everything about the RPG I was playing, so I could outsmart others. But these games were limited, not only to the builds and the depth of the game, but they mostly had 1 or 2 ways for building a good champion. After failing at finding the perfect game for me, I decided to create one myself.

   

       Focus One - Freedom and tactics       

       Game focuses on creating you hero in variety of ways. How I do that? Well, check the game, you can wield any weapon or any armor as long as you can carry it. Weight limits that, but you can always rise your strength. “But” again, if you rise it too much, you my fall behing to those who balanced other statistics better. And so on… I got current combat system for a half year and I’m still now sure what is the best way to build heroes.

        When battle starts you may be weaker, but end with victory, because you  know the game mechanics, use skills or spells in the right time, fallback when needed and so on. That’s how I’m killing hard monsters now that at the beginning seemed to be unkillable for my level.

        Furthermore, there is a thing, called balancer (my definition, simply because it keeps the balance of the game). Currently there are six balancers, meaning, you have access to 6 different skill trees. Every time you level up, you gain some balancer points and it’s up to you to decide what skills you want to get by rising appropriate balancer. Currently there is more than 200 skills in all 6 skill trees. Have fun searching for the best combinations!

 Currently done: ~60%. Still 2 or more classes to add, skill and spells to balance.

 
       Focus Two - Interesting quests

 

       Growing your hero is one of the main focuses, but not the only. Second thing that is important for me, is freedom of will when doing quests. I think that player should have some choices on how to do specific quest. Let’s say NPC-A asked you to kill a NPC-B, but didn’t explain you why, but reward is tempting. You can go and kill NPC-B, but! you can talk with him first, try to understand what’s going on and try to convince to live in peace or just kill NPC-A if NPC-B gives you a better reward… These things takes time to code, but this quest is 10x more valuable than quests where you have to kill X monsters and click – do quest, click – do quest. If you like brainless games, you probably won’t like this game.

        Currently done: ~33%. Created quests system. Quest will be added in time.

 

        Focus Three - Best PvP System

        This will be the hardest to achieve. Currently you can test 2 classes and 6 subclasses, though archer is coming soon and monk class after. They will be different, but somehow, I will manage to balance them with community’s help.

        Also there is a point, where I think other MMO lacks balance is guild battles. They are mostly about the quantity, not the quality. That’s why my guild battles will only allow 5x5 and may the best win (not the most) !

        I think guild battles should be epic with all those possible hero/guild skill combinations and many tactics you can use to reach the victory.

        Currently done: Working on basic pvp system, still much to do.

 

 

 

 

 

       Currently I’m thinking of early to mid spring on 2013. At this time game should have it’s open beta: full first town,  balanced skill trees, PvM and PvP combat, a bunch of lands to explore and quests, upgrading system, guilds. If my team will do well, you will also see guild fights, mercenary system and many other features.

 

 

 

     
After donation, I will have your email and this email will be in database with assigned bonuses you will get after registration in open beta.

The Pride Points you will receive -  ingame currency that helps you in leveling and traveling, though, to keep balance, they don't influence fighting system directly.


 

 

 

       You can also help me by spreading the word for your friends, family and RPG fans. Also be so kind and press Like for Dakija RPG on Facebook .

       Also you can use indiegogo sharing tools.

 

 

What type of game is it?

Browser based RPG fantasy game with turn based combat.

 

What type of computer I need to play the game?

All you need is supported browser – Mozilla, Chrome, Safari or Opera.

 

Can I play the game?

From 12-18 of 2012 you can. Check here: http://www.dakija.com

 

Why flexible campaign?

Becouse this is my first crowdfunding campaign ever, I was kind of afraid of going all or nothing (you see people donate something, but you get nothing if it fails). Now I would definitely go for fixed funding. (2012-12-19)

 

The game is just like many others browser games?

Don’t think so. Game has unique mechanics and play style. Got a traveling system I’ve never seen on any browser game. Same goes to upgrading system. Furthermore, differently from other browser RPGs, Dakija has many skills and spells to choose from, a lot of items to find and unique dungeon’s system.

 

If you have to choose combination of games, that Dakija is alike?

I would say heroes-ragnarok-baldur’s gate-my fantasy hybrid.

 

How are you going to make it?

Well I’m already more than a half way. I could use money-kick from crowdfunding for faster development, though, if it fails, I’m still developing the game, because at this points I just don’t have B plan, I’m going directly to my dream!

p.s. found on the net that a lot of life-changers didn’t have plan B.. :)

 

Do you think $12,000 USD is enough to finance a "full-paid team" and go open beta in spring?

Here is my plan: I need about 6 months to release open beta. Average salary in my country is ~800$. My team needs full-time designer and half-time writer. Currently I'm using dedicated server which costs ~30$ a month. But my dream server would cost around 75$ a month (it is possible to get 50% discount for the first year). I can live with low expenses, such as 200 or 300$ (as I do now). So lets sum everything up:  6x800 (designer) + 6x400 (writer) + 12x75$ (server) + 6 x 300 (me) = 9900$.  20% of 12000$ (total of 2100) is force majeur - unexpected costs.

 

Your english in game s***, when you going to improve that?

As soon as I can afford employing a native english writer. If I succeed in this campaign, texts will be enchanted before next alpha release.

 

 

      Thank you very much for your support.

 

 

      I wish you all the best and don’t be afraid of your dreams. Make them come true!

     From the halls of the castles to the heart of the woods, there is no single way to finish the quests that await you.
     Build a character of your own in hundreds of different ways and expect more options from the developers.
     Most of the online RPG games you see so far requires a lot of money for you to progress and gain advantage over other players. Dakija believes in fair play and will provide equal opportunities to every gamer wanting a level playing field.
     No ridiculous amount of money involved.No unfair advantage. This is pure gaming experience at its best.
 



     At its very core, Dakija is an interplay of fantasy, RPG and the love for developing. The creator of Dakija conceived this game out of pure passion and the need to share this to the gaming community.      In a desire to bring this to the world, this game was built from scratch, timeless devotion and the vision of giving every player an online RPG they can call their very own.
     The creator promises unceasing development to bring endless hours of the finest gaming experience to every player out there.
 



     Currently, the game is being rolled out at its very alpha stage. That means a lot has been made to come up to this point, but that also entails a lot of work still needs to be done.


     Among my top priorities right now is to find a co-founder designer, who will be involved in the game design. The second on the list would be a dedicated server so that the valuable feedback would be captured and that progress would not be halted. Another important thing is to code, code and code more! I made this game out of my years of experience and passion for online games and I would continue to do so! The last on my list of future plans is to hire a writer who can help me create the world of Dakija and unfold hours of epic story-telling. 

 

 
 


Bare minimum - 500$ - is required for finishing coding pvp system and entering final alpha #3 stage.

 


At 1000$ - Game will reach Open Beta on mid of March! Thank you!

 


At 1500$ I’m planning on getting pro graphics on archer class and enchantments in dungeon and upgrading page.

 


At 2400$ all year long fast server preordered. Faster gameplay = more satisfaction!

 


At 2800$ writer enchants my texts in a professional manner.

 


At 3500$ many more enchants in graphics such as different outlook when using different equipments, profesionally-painted merchants and NPCs (that are currently black now).

 


At 4500$ REAL GOAL. Starting developing version for tablet computers and mobile devices. because current game's design is well fit for mobile devices I would like you to play this game anywhere!

 


At 6000$ will search for programer for half-time job to help me with game’s code.

 


At 8000$ an outstanding 5x5 guild battles on end of May!  


At 10000$ additional two classes decided by community (besides archer and priest).

 


At 12000$ creating a full-paid team for faster game development (check FAQ section for more information).

 


At 25000$ We got the stable background for half of the year as a team, our main goal – perfecting an epic game.

 


      Have you been playing new browser games lately? It feels like I'm watching a movie, not playing a RPG.. I feel sorry that they are called RPGs. You have no choices, beside equipping items, and they are giving you one-way to improve your hero and even fights became automatic!
     What's the fun in it?
     This game is different, more old school, becouse Dakija RPG grants you choices you deserve to have in the RPG game.  Dakija gives you full control of your moves in combat, many ways to improve you hero the way you want and even upgrade weapons the way you want! Enough of these cheap one-way-one-story lines of codes called games, it's time for a deep and full of choices RPG!
 
 
 
 
       In the spring of 2012 the game had open testing in Alpha #1, where community tested combat and leveling system, skills, spells,  shopkeepers in town and hero page. Players sent some really nice ideas on how to improve this game. Thank you.
 
       Now, after a half year, I’m having Closed Alpha #2 testing.  Player-versus-monster also known as PvM has been improved a lot. You can test exploring system, dungeons, quests, more monsters, more items, better balanced skill trees and spells, item upgrading system, in game teacher - called scholar.
  Few things that are on my to do list or currently are being coded:

PvP fights (both online and offline, working now),
Party Travelling (up to 5 people exploring),
Challenging game even after you reach max level,
Guild competition (5x5 battles until death),
Guild’s leveling system (skill trees for guilds, some skills may be used in guild battles),
Monster invasions,
Fully interactive NPCs
Epic main quest and many subquests,
Mercenaries and NPCs joining you in battles.
Translated into many languages

       Also, I’d like to tell you, why I started creating this game.
        I was playing RPGs for  many years and was one of those guys, who never stopped experimenting with builds. My brother had 1 fighter and felt happy with that. I didn’t. I searched, had 10 champions and wanted to know everything about the RPG I was playing, so I could outsmart others. But these games were limited, not only to the builds and the depth of the game, but they mostly had 1 or 2 ways for building a good champion. After failing at finding the perfect game for me, I decided to create one myself.
   
       Focus One - Freedom and tactics       
       Game focuses on creating you hero in variety of ways. How I do that? Well, check the game, you can wield any weapon or any armor as long as you can carry it. Weight limits that, but you can always rise your strength. “But” again, if you rise it too much, you my fall behing to those who balanced other statistics better. And so on… I got current combat system for a half year and I’m still now sure what is the best way to build heroes.
        When battle starts you may be weaker, but end with victory, because you  know the game mechanics, use skills or spells in the right time, fallback when needed and so on. That’s how I’m killing hard monsters now that at the beginning seemed to be unkillable for my level.
        Furthermore, there is a thing, called balancer (my definition, simply because it keeps the balance of the game). Currently there are six balancers, meaning, you have access to 6 different skill trees. Every time you level up, you gain some balancer points and it’s up to you to decide what skills you want to get by rising appropriate balancer. Currently there is more than 200 skills in all 6 skill trees. Have fun searching for the best combinations!
 Currently done: ~60%. Still 2 or more classes to add, skill and spells to balance.

 
       Focus Two - Interesting quests
 
       Growing your hero is one of the main focuses, but not the only. Second thing that is important for me, is freedom of will when doing quests. I think that player should have some choices on how to do specific quest. Let’s say NPC-A asked you to kill a NPC-B, but didn’t explain you why, but reward is tempting. You can go and kill NPC-B, but! you can talk with him first, try to understand what’s going on and try to convince to live in peace or just kill NPC-A if NPC-B gives you a better reward… These things takes time to code, but this quest is 10x more valuable than quests where you have to kill X monsters and click – do quest, click – do quest. If you like brainless games, you probably won’t like this game.
        Currently done: ~33%. Created quests system. Quest will be added in time.
 
        Focus Three - Best PvP System
        This will be the hardest to achieve. Currently you can test 2 classes and 6 subclasses, though archer is coming soon and monk class after. They will be different, but somehow, I will manage to balance them with community’s help.
        Also there is a point, where I think other MMO lacks balance is guild battles. They are mostly about the quantity, not the quality. That’s why my guild battles will only allow 5x5 and may the best win (not the most) !
        I think guild battles should be epic with all those possible hero/guild skill combinations and many tactics you can use to reach the victory.
        Currently done: Working on basic pvp system, still much to do.
 
 
 
  
 
       Currently I’m thinking of early to mid spring on 2013. At this time game should have it’s open beta: full first town,  balanced skill trees, PvM and PvP combat, a bunch of lands to explore and quests, upgrading system, guilds. If my team will do well, you will also see guild fights, mercenary system and many other features.
 
 

 
      After donation, I will have your email and this email will be in database with assigned bonuses you will get after registration in open beta.
The Pride Points you will receive -  ingame currency that helps you in leveling and traveling, though, to keep balance, they don't influence fighting system directly.
 
 
 
       You can also help me by spreading the word for your friends, family and RPG fans. Also be so kind and press Like for Dakija RPG on Facebook .
       Also you can use indiegogo sharing tools.
 



 
What type of game is it?
Browser based RPG fantasy game with turn based combat.
 
What type of computer I need to play the game?
All you need is supported browser – Mozilla, Chrome, Safari or Opera.
 
Can I play the game?
From 12-18 of 2012 you can. Check here: http://www.dakija.com
 
Why flexible campaign?
Becouse this is my first crowdfunding campaign ever, I was kind of afraid of going all or nothing (you see people donate something, but you get nothing if it fails). Now I would definitely go for fixed funding. (2012-12-19)
 
The game is just like many others browser games?
Don’t think so. Game has unique mechanics and play style. Got a traveling system I’ve never seen on any browser game. Same goes to upgrading system. Furthermore, differently from other browser RPGs, Dakija has many skills and spells to choose from, a lot of items to find and unique dungeon’s system.
 
If you have to choose combination of games, that Dakija is alike?
I would say heroes-ragnarok-baldur’s gate-my fantasy hybrid.
 
How are you going to make it?
Well I’m already more than a half way. I could use money-kick from crowdfunding for faster development, though, if it fails, I’m still developing the game, because at this points I just don’t have B plan, I’m going directly to my dream!
p.s. found on the net that a lot of life-changers didn’t have plan B.. :)
 
Do you think $12,000 USD is enough to finance a "full-paid team" and go open beta in spring?
Here is my plan: I need about 6 months to release open beta. Average salary in my country is ~800$. My team needs full-time designer and half-time writer. Currently I'm using dedicated server which costs ~30$ a month. But my dream server would cost around 75$ a month (it is possible to get 50% discount for the first year). I can live with low expenses, such as 200 or 300$ (as I do now). So lets sum everything up:  6x800 (designer) + 6x400 (writer) + 12x75$ (server) + 6 x 300 (me) = 9900$.  20% of 12000$ (total of 2100) is force majeur - unexpected costs.
 
Your english in game s***, when you going to improve that?
As soon as I can afford employing a native english writer. If I succeed in this campaign, texts will be enchanted before next alpha release.
 
 
      Thank you very much for your support.
 
 
      I wish you all the best and don’t be afraid of your dreams. Make them come true!

story:
Project By CodeHatch

Liquids & Lava + Dynamic Ecosystem Stretch Goals Reached.

"It’s remarkably ambitious, but the terrain manipulation already looks fantastic and outer space is gorgeous. This thing has “potential” scrawled all over it." - PC Gamer

"I just had a major nerdgasm" - Markus Persson, Notch, Creator of Minecraft

"The idea being, you create your own insane Starship Troopers moments." - Kotaku

"It lets you build blocky structures, just like Minecraft does, but instead of coating them in low-resolution textures, it makes them look incredible." - Wired UK

" This morning I received an email telling me that the first playable build of StarForge was available. [...] Six and a half minutes later I was wondering how to put my excitement into words. Thirty seconds after that I decided to forget words and just share the bloody video. Watch." - Rock Paper Shotgun

"The most ambitious Indie game in history" - Gamer MC

"Is so remarkably ambitious that I can't begin to describe what I (and so far many others) like about its concepts" - Inside Gaming Daily

"I've played the game for a bit, and I must say: I am very excited for the future of StarForge." - Destructoid

"StarForge remixes Minecraft with sci-fi shooting reminiscent of Halo." - IGN

"StarForge is an ambitious 3d action game..." - Derek Yu, TIG Source, Creator of Spelunky

"...it’s another reminder that indie games are the best." - games.on.net

"Shut up and take my money" - Ncrpts, Poster from Reddit

StarForge is a game about gathering resources, building bases, crafting, and surviving on an alien planet. Earth's star is dying and humanity transferred as much technology and resources as possible and left on a one way mission to populate another planet.

StarForge was inspired by Halo, Warcraft 3, Borderlands, Terraria, and Minecraft. It borrows elements from the RTS, FPS, RPG, Voxel Builder, Tower Defense, and Physics Sandbox genres. We are building a dark and serious universe and want the player to live out their own unique story on the procedural planet.

Procedural Weapons - StarForge features procedural weapons. This adds a large variety to the weapons you find in the game.

Procedural Infinite Voxel Terrain - Dig an endless tunnel, fly out to the far reaches of space, and come back again. Hide out in endless forests or harvest them. Mine to your heart's content and discover the different biomes.

Procedural 3D Tilesets - Build anything you want with our unique 3D Tilesets. You can create cities, towns, villages, bridges, forts, underground bases, trenches and much more. 

Underground/Surface/Space Gameplay - Build a tower that ascends into the clouds, through the atmosphere, then into space, and do this in realtime. 

Physics Sandbox - We are designing every object in the world to be fully dynamic. Fell trees in by launching your vehicle on them. Construction, vehicles, players, objects, everything is physically simulated. Do whatever you want and enjoy what happens.

Physics Movement - Our movement model is designed closely around the real biomechanics of biped locomotion; it can simulate jumping, running, climbing, wall jumping, wall running, crawling and pretty much any other behavior all without the use of any state driven code. The result is a more human look and feel, and a character that is equipped to intelligently react to dangers far beyond what conventional movement code was designed to handle. It also features a full body IK system.

Loot and Survive - Before the humans landed countless weapons and armor were sent to Atlas. You will find loot chests littered throughout the land, you will need their contents to survive. We will be implementing a perm death system, so you will have to be careful. Every decision matters. 

Customizable Characters - We plan on allowing you to cloth and armor your character and change his or her appearance. You are unique and your character should be too.

Dynamic World - Enjoy dynamic weather patterns, a 24 day and night cycle and a real time atmosphere.  Creatures will also behave in a realistic matter, scavenge for food and return to their hives at different times of day. 

Resources and Economy - There will be many different resources in StarForge. However, the player can only hold so much at a time. 

Vehicles, Turrets, Furniture, Fences, ect. - We plan to support a lot of different content. So you can decorate your house or make your fort tough.

Multiplayer & SinglePlayer - We will have both modes playable in the game.  Enjoy emergant gameplay where you land on the planet, meet other players, build villages, and go to war. Play whatever role you want. It's your world and you can do whatever you want in it.


We've been developing StarForge in our free time for nearly 2 years. Nearly 5 months ago we put a video of it up on Youtube and we got a ton of great comments and support from everyone online.  Since then we decided to quit our jobs and work full time on StarForge.

In the meantime we have been working really hard on the design and backend of the game. We now have a prototype of the game and we hope to turn it into a complete game.

Here is what our game looked like only 5 months ago -

http://youtu.be/YxBSYit49c8

We chose IndieGoGo because it's a very open funding platform, and we hope to raise enough money to make a fully fledged Single Player & Multiplayer for our game. Here is what we will use the money for:

Survival: Rent, food, and internet to keep 3 developers working full-time for a year.

Hosting: Server hosting costs money, especially ones with alot of speed and bandwidth. Your money will help keep our main servers going, plus, allow us to provide some dedicated servers for the multiplayer.

Software: Help us afford the essential software needed for pushing this game forward.

Multiplayer: We plan to make a robust multiplayer experience. 

Single Player: In order to do a proper single player game you need good A.I and lore. We have extremely innovative ideas on improving A.I beyond what you have seen in traditional games, and good things take time to develop.

Music & Audio: We will hire LoudCore to compose a full fledged soundtrack to the game. 

Art: Were looking to purchase some high quality creatures, characters, and weapons from some great 3D art talents we've got lined up. We want you to be able to feel the StarForge universe.

Polish: We generally don't like releasing anything unless it has undergone a lot of polish. So your money will also go to making everything the best it can be.

We've decided to use IndieGoGo because we feel we can only innovate without barriers by remaining independent. We enjoy communicating directly with you and we love all your ideas for the game. This is what makes developing games so special to us, it's fun, it's innovative, we get to share with you, and we feel the need to create.

Our vision for StarForge is innovation and fun, and by contributing to our campaign you will empower that idea and make this happen.

The Full Game:

Everyone who contributes to our IndieGoGo (enough to qualify for the first reward) will receive the full game of StarForge and all of its updates free, forever until the final release! The game is currently in its alpha stage. We plan on developing it over the next couple years yet, so there is much more to come. It will be digital download only.

*Updates do not necessarily include possible future user generated mods, and any exclusive cosmetic content provided for higher tiers then the one you purchased.


Special Unique Content:

Certain tiers reward you with special unique content. This content is cosmetic only, but it will be desirable and look good when it is released. We plan to make and release this content when the game is done.

Naming In-Game Content:

Supporters of higher tiers will be have the ability to put their names in the worlds everyone will be playing in.

*We will use our best discretion when accepting user suggested names

The Original StarForge Soundtrack:

LoudCore will be making a full soundtrack for the game. Expect there to be around 15 original songs. It will be digital download only.

T-Shirts:

There are 3 T-Shirt designs to pick from. As the game nears completion, we will reach out to you, and you can pick what T-Shirt you want and your size. The T-Shirts are limited edition and for backers only.

Autographed Poster:

Art posters will be delivered as the game nears completion, we will reach out to you then. The dev team(Will, Steve) will also sign your poster. The posters will be limited edition and for backers only.

story:
A teacher at the notoriously underfunded Miskatonic University Daycare Centre sends her charges off to sleep with a story from the Necronomicon (it was the only book she could find in the library that had pictures...)
Through her not-quite-carefully-edited-enough account, we follow the dread Tiny Cthulhu on his travels through mind-blasting vortexes of madness and adorableness on his way to rain inevitable and cuddly doom on a blissfully unsuspecting humanity.
...Sleep well, kids...

 

Are you puzzled by the lack of 3D platform games for PC, Mac, and/or Linux...?
Are you further bemused by the lack of games that blend 3D platforming and 3rd-person-shooting together with Jazz-Age-pulp-inspired Eldritch Abomination from beyond this cosmos and angled space itself...?
Of course you are. We ALL are.

 


'Tiny Cthulhu' is an upcoming game for PC/Mac/Linux from developer THEORY32.

After two years of development, the game is now at the 'playable demo' stage, but cries out to be extended into a full universe of sanity-shattering abnormalities.

 

Personally, I like to think of it as the tentacled lovechild of Commander Keen and Quake...

Stages are set in such unmentionable locales as: The Dark Planet Vhoorl, Primal Chaos, The Ghooric Zone, Yuggoth, Pnakotus, R'Lyeh, Modern Earth, and many more.

Monsters include such impious horrors as: Yog-Sothoth, the Mi-Go, The Elder Things, Byakhee, The Deep Ones, Shoggoths, The Great Race of Yith, Nyarlathotep, Shub-Niggurath, and many, many, many more.

Gameplay is a Rachet&Clank-esque blend of 3D Platforming and 3rd-Person shooting. (Check out the area-in-progress footage at: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=FtuR-PEMYN8 for a better idea)

 

With your support, we can shake the sanity of the overly-cute-yet-somehow-disturbing-platform-game-playing world!

(...And if that isn't a worthy goal, I'd like to know what is...)


More footage, information, screenshots, animation tests, news, and incoherent blatherings (blatherii?) can be had at the official development blog at:
http://tinycthulhu.blogspot.com.au/

Questions? Post them in the comments section either here or at the blog, or email them to: tinycthulhugame@gmail.com

Stay tuned for more updates/screenshots/videos in the weeks ahead!

*PAYPAL IS NOW WORKING! YAAAAAAAY!*

Stages are set in such unmentionable locales as: The Dark Planet Vhoorl, Primal Chaos, The Ghooric Zone, Yuggoth, Pnakotus, R'Lyeh, Modern Earth, and many more.
Monsters include such impious horrors as: Yog-Sothoth, the Mi-Go, The Elder Things, Byakhee, The Deep Ones, Shoggoths, The Great Race of Yith, Nyarlathotep, Shub-Niggurath, and many, many, many more.
Gameplay is a Rachet&Clank-esque blend of 3D Platforming and 3rd-Person shooting. (Check out the area-in-progress footage at: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=FtuR-PEMYN8 for a better idea)
 

With your support, we can shake the sanity of the overly-cute-yet-somehow-disturbing-platform-game-playing world!
(...And if that isn't a worthy goal, I'd like to know what is...)
More footage, information, screenshots, animation tests, news, and incoherent blatherings (blatherii?) can be had at the official development blog at:http://tinycthulhu.blogspot.com.au/
Questions? Post them in the comments section either here or at the blog, or email them to: tinycthulhugame@gmail.com
Stay tuned for more updates/screenshots/videos in the weeks ahead!
*PAYPAL IS NOW WORKING! YAAAAAAAY!*

story:
## DeadRogue Alpha version will be released very soon.

DeadRouge is a survival-sandbox game with rogue-like elements. You are only a few survivors in post-apocalyptic world, The dangerous world full of zombies, bandits and mutant creatures. You must find a way to survive in extreme situation, explore the abandoned world, scavenging for food or crafting useful items to fight for your survive. 

Face super zombies, the dangerous kind of mutated creatures with deadliest kill-power that is impossible for a lone survivor to win. Group with other survivors and fight together as a team to overcome extreme challenges, or play a lone wolf style for easier threat-avoiding. Build your own shelters for cooking food, storing supplies or taking refuge at night.

Be the hero or bandit, it's up to you to play in DeadRogue.


  • SURVIVAL GAMEPLAY

In DeadRogue, survivors need a food and water for survive, You must search for food and water, loot for useful items and find medicalsupplies for curing sickness.

  • CHARACTER CUSTOMIZATION

Customize your survivor, choose thier background, leveling and building up your skill that help you to survive, crafting your armors, tools and powerful weapons.

  • CLASS & SKILL

DeadRogue has a plenty of skills, You can choose to play many ways to survive.

Melee weapon skill, attack enemies with high damage blade weapon.

Medic skill, gain more extra health from medical items.

Miner skill, collect more material resouces from mining.

Farmer skill, build your own organic farm to grow some giant vegetables.

And lot of skills you can choose in DeadRogue.

  • CRAFTING ITEMS

Crafting cool stuffs to help you survive, combine your basic resources to create a new items, food, tools, armors, weapons or even buildings shelters.

  • RANDOMLY GENERATED ELEMENT

Explore different environments as you play, adventuring through randomly generated world; such as randomly spawned items, buildings, abandoned village and dangerous enemies.


  • BOSS FIGHT

Face the deadliest super zombies, a special type of enemies that are extremely strong, dangerous and have some abilities that encourage players to fight as a team.



If we can reach our base goal, We'll work with stretch goals we can aim for


Currently DEAD ROGUE game is still in prototype version, We planned to release Alpha version soon with multiplayer gameplay, survival mechanic, crafting items and skill features. We planned to give all reward as digital content to help us stay focus on developing game.

When we can reach our initial funding goal, The money will be spent as follow:

Working part-time in this project result in less time we spend on DeadRouge. Your funding will help us to be able to work fulltime in this project and release the game sooner, and more features added. Please support us.


“11 OCT Game” is a small game developer. We are based in Bangkok, Thailand. Creating awesome games is our passion. We have experience in game development and we are committed to deliver the best experience in gaming.DeadRogue has been under development only few months ago. But an alpha version will be released very soon.

It’s so exciting to share our awesome game that we have put so much love into it. And you’re going to love it too.


Every project has it own risk, We are a small developers. The biggest risk is some technical difficulties during the development process. DeadRogue could be delayed by technical issues, testing, balancing the game and bug fixing. Getting funded means we can get more people to cope with those issues and release the game sooner. You can help us by supporting us, spreading the news about DeadRogue and share this funding campaign through your social network. Any forms of help are appreciated.


With our passion and dedication to make a great game, we will keep on working on DeadRogue to the release version.

Thank you so much for your interest and support.

What platforms will Deadrogue be?

DeadRogue will be available for PC in the initial release. We don’t have a plan for other platforms yet.

Will there be an online multiplayer mode?

Yes, We are making DeadRogue for online multiplayer mode. Get ready to have fun with your friends.

When will the game be available?

This project will spend 5 months for developing, We planned to release the game on summer 2015.

When do we get the rewards?

You will get your reward when the game is released.

Why Indie Go Go?

Because Indie Go Go is easy, fast and allow developers from many countries to present their project. Our studio in Thailand could start crowd-funding campaign easily.

story:
Paraversume

Paraversume is a location-based massively multiplayer online game for portable devices, combining strategy and role-playing mechanics to form a unique player experience. The game features an interactive storyline that is molded by the players’ actions. We also intend to give players power over the evolution of the experience: We in the Paravesume team believe that the only way to make an enjoyable social game is to openly interact with the community.

The project began in November 2011, and thus far much of the ground work is done. The basic architecture is there, but the graphics and game logic are still in a work-in-progress stage.

Paraversume will be released first for iOS devices (iPod 3/4 gen, iPhone 3GS+, later on iPads) and probably later for Windows Phone. Android version is in consideration also.

Us

We are a small group of game enthusiasts, developers and artists from Finland. In the past we’ve seen games with somewhat similair concepts, but were left cold by either technical excecution or poor service of the players in general. So we decided to make a game of our own, the kind of game we would like to play – the kind of game we believe you will enjoy playing.

Paraversume is the first title we’re working on as a team, but our programmers boast well over a decade’s worth of experience in other software development.

We Need

Managing a massively multiplayer game is no small task. We need servers, people tending the game, addressing problems and bug reports, taking in ideas and plotting the course of the game. We need sound design and music. And we're sure other things will appear along the way.

We want to be able to run the game as our main job and not as a side hobby. We don't want to release the game without knowing that we can keep it running for some time. Naturally the game being a freemium title (free to play for all, some premium things available on purchase) we expect most revenue to come when the game is running.

We set the target very low. This does not reflect the actual amount of money we need to run the game. So please don't think we have got enough if we hit the target. You can support us even after that. Also it's to ensure that we don't have to pay extra to Indiegogo if we don't meet some bigger target.

To give you some understanding of the costs: we estimate $4000 will allow a developer and an artist to work on the game for a month without much distraction (Indiegogo etc take their share, currency rates, taxes...)

You Get

Depending on the amount of money you contribute we offer you several things. You get your name to our contributors list.You get in-game resources. We will not offer anything that would make you more powerful than people starting later on or otherwise distort the balance of the game, other than earlier access to the game.

We thought about giving some exclusive art work, posters etc, but printing and posting takes a lot of money and we think everyone would rather support the game and not put their money into some random stuff.

We also welcome companies to sponsor the game. We offer possibilities to advertise either in the game story via product placement or other types of advertising. You can contact us privately too, if you like. First come first serve! We will naturally reserve the possibility to not accept some sponsors, including gambling, competing games etc. But we're open to everything nice!

You can also purchase the packs containing the possibility to choose others to start in the beta too and give them out however you want to, except that you can't sell them or require any purchase to get them. They can be given out e.g. in free raffles or to your employees or friends. As long as it's free.

Remember: you can also buy several different perks if you like!

Sharing Is Caring!

Please share the project with the Indiegogo's share buttons! Spread the word! Even if you can’t contribute money, every bit of publicity helps. Thank you so much for your interest, and let’s make a kick-ass game!

story:
ciao a tutti, vi presento questo nuovo gioco di avventura e sopravivenza.

a causa di un incidente della nave la nave affonda e voi vi risvegliate in questo paradiso di isola, che sarà un inferno sopravvivere.

No non ci saranno i militari ad uccidervi ma la natura stessa, sul isola sarà possibile fare qualsiasi cosa ed una cosa che serve per sopravvivere è un rifuggo!

"Vi chiedereste", ma perche?

Pensate solo gli animali affamati come voi...

fame, sete ...ecc.

USCITA DEL GIOCO?

Non si sa ancora di preciso,

si prevede una la prima versione di prova per estate 2014 (ma non sarà ancora disponibile per il download)


Hello everyone, I present this new game of adventure and survival. 

due to an accident of the ship the ship sinks and you are awakened in this island paradise, it will be a hell to survive. 

No there will be no military to kill you but nature itself, the island will be able to do any thing and one thing you need to survive is a shun! 

"There you ask," but why? 

Just think of the hungry animals like you ... 

hunger, thirst ... etc.. 

OUT OF THE GAME? 

No word yet on exactly, 

is expected to be the first test version for summer 2014 (but not yet available for download)

story:
About ConTessa's Founder

Stacy Dellorfano has been kicking around the tabletop world since her days as a delinquent band geek in High School, skipping class to hide in the band room and play AD&D with her friends.

In the late 90s and early naughties, she worked in the video games industry, spending her late nights patching up games like EverQuest and writing translation tools to make awesome games in other languages. While her day job is now outside the gaming industry, she is also pursuing her newest secondary job as a publisher of tabletop RPGs and related merchandise and events, including her own RPG, Precious Dark.

Getting more women into tabletop RPGs is near and dear to Stacy's heart. Her passion is bringing the ideas, talent, and enthusiasm of all of those women out of the shadows and into the light, where they belong. She's dedicated to not only bringing the RPG industry into the modern world of web and software development, but also providing platforms for new and up-and-coming designers and developers to showcase and expand their amazing work.

About ConTessa

ConTessa is an apolitical space for women to lead their own tabletop gaming convention, deciding which games they want to run and which panels they want to moderate. ConTessa is a celebration showcasing women who play, create, and love tabletop games.

In addition, it provides women with an outlet to experience gaming as gamers, setting aside for a few fun-filled days the women's issues discussions that often dominate our time and energy in the hobby. While women run all aspects of ConTessa, anyone can join in the fun - playing in games, joining a panel, or watching events. The convention is held online, spanning the globe, open to all. Google Hangouts keeps things accessible - no need for a high-end computer or expensive specialized equipment, just click and play.

ConTessa Registration Central

This year, we're adding a new tool that allows you to view events, sign up to play or attend, and manage your schedule - all from a central location. Modern and user-friendly design is important to us, but it takes time and skill. Your support will help us build the best version possible, using modern web development practices and technologies. You can check it out, here, now, and register new events early!

ConTessa Blog & Archives

The ConTessa Blog is home to all of our news and announcements, as well as a central clearinghouse for news and updates about women in gaming. The blog also stores the archives of our previous games, panels, and events, allowing people to watch at their leisure. You can help with maintenance costs by supporting this ConTessa campaign.

We strive to make ConTessa professional and polished, and that includes paying for high-quality artwork and marketing to deliver a one-of-a-kind online gaming experience. It isn't the cheapest way to go, but we think it is worth it to broaden the appeal and attract new players to online gaming.

ConTessa merchandise makes great door prizes. Our swag was extremely popular during ConTessa 2013, and we're expanding the program this year.

When you purchase one of the perks from this IGG campaign, you will also be donating a matching Goodie Bag to be given out in your name during ConTessa.

 

The 'What Happened at the Con' Card Game

What Happened at the Con is a card-matching game created by two of ConTessa's staff members - Ethel Buster and Sarah Richardson. Role-play is essential to the fun of WHatC!  There is no right or wrong way to do it, but the idea is to tell a fantastic story as you and your friends come up with ways to ensnare each other and devise clever twists to escape the trickiest of situations.

The game comes in its own tuck box with a complete set of rules and a deck of full-color cards. ConTessa art cards match each other. Goblin cards skip people or reverse directions. Dice cards – some with suggestions and some blank –  let you create role-play scenarios and trap your opponents. But be careful! They can stack up and you might be the victim of your own plot. Just use your imagination to create your own story of What Happened at the Con.

Grab WHATC as an add-on by adding $16 to any perk, or pick up ☢ ORANGE - WHATC Card Game ☢ with the game as a perk all its own!

The ConTessa 2013 & 2014 Annuals - PDF copies containing winning contest entries (microgames, random tables, poetry) and more from the convention.

The ConTessa 2014 Coloring & Activity Book - a PDF featuring the ConTessa mascots and friends for the colored pencil and puzzle crowd.

Randomocity #2 – a PDF copy of the second edition of the acclaimed zine.

Exclusive ConTessa Icons and Tokens

Get and give the gift of GM Prep! Engine Publishing has offered up a discount for ConTessa supporters on their popular GM resource books! By selecting the '☢ GREEN - DIGITAL GM EDITION ☢' to the right, you'll get PDFs of Eureka, Masks, Never Unprepared, and Odyssey, PLUS we'll throw in PDFs of both ConTessa Annuals (when available), the ConTessa Coloring Book PDF, and PDFs of Randomocity #1 and #2 (when available).

What's more, when you purchase ☢ GREEN - DIGITAL GM EDITION ☢, you'll also donate a complete set of all of these PDFs as a door prize to be won at the con!

See below for how you can also purchase the Digital GM Pack as an add-on!

The Bully Pulpit Pack: Fiasco & The Fiasco Companion in Softcover, Plus Carolina Death Crawl

Get your hands on the softcover print copies of the popular GMless, prepless game Fiasco, plus The Fiasco Companion and Bully Pulpit's card game, 'Carolina Death Crawl'! 

To order as a get one / give one, choose ☢ BLUE - FIASCO EDITION ☢, to the right. This will get you print copies of each, plus we'll add the set to our door prizes for some lucky con goer to win! 

Want just the books? Choose any of our perks, then add on the Fiasco Pack for just $72 (that's $60 plus $12 S&H). 

Bookmarks, Postcards, and Greeting Cards - some that are specifically ConTessa themed, others that are more 'geeky' themed! With perk packs that contain the 2 postcards, the cards will feature a light grid on the front to draw a dungeon on and a small legend on the back to complete the adventure. One postcard will be addressed and stamped to return your creation to ConTessa headquarters for redistribution in next year's ConTessa!

Pinback Buttons, Magnets, and Keychains - all sporting the existing ConTessa characters as well as the new monster illustrations we got for this year, AND more generic RPG-themed accessories

The ConTessa 2013 & 2014 Annuals - zines containing winning contest entries (microgames, random tables, poetry) and more from the convention.

The ConTessa 2014 Coloring & Activity Book - featuring the ConTessa mascots and friends for the colored pencil and puzzle crowd.

A three-month subscription to the coolest new site for managing campaigns, Tavern Keeper, along with an awesome title showing the world that you're a ConTessa sponsor!

Pick up your Tavern Keeper subscription by choosing any of the clearance levels ☢ ORANGE ☢ and above!

An annual subscription to this gorgeous quarterly zine filled with unique gaming materials and artwork. Randomocity fuels your imagination with lots of fun and interesting roleplaying game adventures, NPCs, and ideas.

Pick up your Randomocity subscription (and give one to a lucky gamer) by choosing any of the perk levels at ☢ YELLOW ☢ clearance and above!

We've secured a limited quantity of Large Chainmail dice bags to add to our perks, courtesy of Bryan Rumph at Dark Angel Metal Works! These awesome chainmail bags are handmade and can hold up to 100 dice ... that's about half your dice collection, right?

Pick one up by choosing ☢ BLUE - DICE BAG EDITION ☢ in the perks to the right!

Check out the side panel for sponsorship levels and rewards. If you want to find out about all the benefits of sponsorship and donation options for sponsors, visit our Become a Sponsor page.

Add $16.00 to your perk level to get this card game! - A fast-paced card/dice-rolling/role-playing game where everyone gets to be the GM. Exclusively offered to ConTessa supporters.

Get your hands on GM prep! Engine Publishing has offered up a discount for ConTessa supporters on their popular GM resource books! By adding $39 to any perk, you'll get PDFs of Eureka, Masks, Never Unprepared, and Odyssey, PLUS we'll throw in PDFs of both ConTessa Annuals (when available), the ConTessa Coloring Book PDF, and PDFs of Randomocity #1 and #2 (when available). A bounty of inspirational material for any GM!

Add $39 to your contribution to receive this pack! You'll get the Engine Publishing books, ConTessa Annual #1, and Randomocity #1 as soon as the campaign ends, and we'll send you Randomocity #2, the ConTessa Annual #2, and the ConTessa Coloring Book once they're complete!

The Bully Pulpit Pack: Fiasco & The Fiasco Companion in Softcover, Plus Carolina Death Crawl

Get your hands on the softcover print copies of the popular GMless, prepless game Fiasco, plus The Fiasco Companion and Bully Pulpit's card game, 'Carolina Death Crawl'! 

Add this by choosing any of our perks, then add on the Fiasco Pack for just $72 (that's $60 plus $12 S&H). 

  1. Decide on a perk level
  2. When prompted, add the purchase price of your add-on(s) to the total amount of your contribution
  3. If you want to add additional items during the campaign, you can make changes on your contribution page on IndieGoGo at any time
  4. At the end of the campaign, be on the look-out for an email from ConTessa with instructions for completing your order

ConTessa 2013 was a big success - over 40 games and events, tons of goodies, fun contests and a very popular random dungeon crawl competition. Women (some of whom had never GM’d a game before) were so inspired, they are already asking when they can register for 2014.

ConTessa has a track record of doing what we say we will do and delivering on time. We are driven to repeat last year’s success and go beyond what we've already achieved, so you can count on the ConTessa team to efficiently manage your contributions and use them to expand and improve ConTessa for all our contributors and participants - from the first registration through the posting of the final videos.

The proceeds of this campaign will go directly into defraying costs and bringing even more goodies and more fun to the ConTessa experience.

If you just can’t swing the funds to get in on one of our perks, you can still help. Tell your friends about ConTessa, encourage the gamer women you know to GM or moderate a panel, and post links to this page on your websites and social networks.

Spread the word!

We can’t wait to see every one of you in all your glorious geeky gamerishness at...

About ConTessa's Founder
Stacy Dellorfano has been kicking around the tabletop world since her days as a delinquent band geek in High School, skipping class to hide in the band room and play AD&D with her friends.
In the late 90s and early naughties, she worked in the video games industry, spending her late nights patching up games like EverQuest and writing translation tools to make awesome games in other languages. While her day job is now outside the gaming industry, she is also pursuing her newest secondary job as a publisher of tabletop RPGs and related merchandise and events, including her own RPG, Precious Dark. 
Getting more women into tabletop RPGs is near and dear to Stacy's heart. Her passion is bringing the ideas, talent, and enthusiasm of all of those women out of the shadows and into the light, where they belong. She's dedicated to not only bringing the RPG industry into the modern world of web and software development, but also providing platforms for new and up-and-coming designers and developers to showcase and expand their amazing work.
About ConTessa 
ConTessa is an apolitical space for women to lead their own tabletop gaming convention, deciding which games they want to run and which panels they want to moderate. ConTessa is a celebration showcasing women who play, create, and love tabletop games. 
In addition, it provides women with an outlet to experience gaming as gamers, setting aside for a few fun-filled days the women's issues discussions that often dominate our time and energy in the hobby. While women run all aspects of ConTessa, anyone can join in the fun - playing in games, joining a panel, or watching events. The convention is held online, spanning the globe, open to all. Google Hangouts keeps things accessible - no need for a high-end computer or expensive specialized equipment, just click and play.
ConTessa Registration Central
This year, we're adding a new tool that allows you to view events, sign up to play or attend, and manage your schedule - all from a central location. Modern and user-friendly design is important to us, but it takes time and skill. Your support will help us build the best version possible, using modern web development practices and technologies. You can check it out, here, now, and register new events early!
ConTessa Blog & Archives
The ConTessa Blog is home to all of our news and announcements, as well as a central clearinghouse for news and updates about women in gaming. The blog also stores the archives of our previous games, panels, and events, allowing people to watch at their leisure. You can help with maintenance costs by supporting this ConTessa campaign.
We strive to make ConTessa professional and polished, and that includes paying for high-quality artwork and marketing to deliver a one-of-a-kind online gaming experience. It isn't the cheapest way to go, but we think it is worth it to broaden the appeal and attract new players to online gaming. 
ConTessa merchandise makes great door prizes. Our swag was extremely popular during ConTessa 2013, and we're expanding the program this year.
When you purchase one of the perks from this IGG campaign, you will also be donating a matching Goodie Bag to be given out in your name during ConTessa.



 

The 'What Happened at the Con' Card Game

What Happened at the Con is a card-matching game created by two of ConTessa's staff members - Ethel Buster and Sarah Richardson. Role-play is essential to the fun of WHatC!  There is no right or wrong way to do it, but the idea is to tell a fantastic story as you and your friends come up with ways to ensnare each other and devise clever twists to escape the trickiest of situations.The game comes in its own tuck box with a complete set of rules and a deck of full-color cards. ConTessa art cards match each other. Goblin cards skip people or reverse directions. Dice cards – some with suggestions and some blank –  let you create role-play scenarios and trap your opponents. But be careful! They can stack up and you might be the victim of your own plot. Just use your imagination to create your own story of What Happened at the Con.
Grab WHATC as an add-on by adding $16 to any perk, or pick up ☢ ORANGE - WHATC Card Game ☢ with the game as a perk all its own!

The ConTessa 2013 & 2014 Annuals - PDF copies containing winning contest entries (microgames, random tables, poetry) and more from the convention.
The ConTessa 2014 Coloring & Activity Book - a PDF featuring the ConTessa mascots and friends for the colored pencil and puzzle crowd.
Randomocity #2 – a PDF copy of the second edition of the acclaimed zine.
Exclusive ConTessa Icons and Tokens



Get and give the gift of GM Prep! Engine Publishing has offered up a discount for ConTessa supporters on their popular GM resource books! By selecting the '☢ GREEN - DIGITAL GM EDITION ☢' to the right, you'll get PDFs of Eureka, Masks, Never Unprepared, and Odyssey, PLUS we'll throw in PDFs of both ConTessa Annuals (when available), the ConTessa Coloring Book PDF, and PDFs of Randomocity #1 and #2 (when available).
What's more, when you purchase ☢ GREEN - DIGITAL GM EDITION ☢, you'll also donate a complete set of all of these PDFs as a door prize to be won at the con!
See below for how you can also purchase the Digital GM Pack as an add-on!
The Bully Pulpit Pack: Fiasco & The Fiasco Companion in Softcover, Plus Carolina Death Crawl
Get your hands on the softcover print copies of the popular GMless, prepless game Fiasco, plus The Fiasco Companion and Bully Pulpit's card game, 'Carolina Death Crawl'! 
To order as a get one / give one, choose ☢ BLUE - FIASCO EDITION ☢, to the right. This will get you print copies of each, plus we'll add the set to our door prizes for some lucky con goer to win! 
Want just the books? Choose any of our perks, then add on the Fiasco Pack for just $72 (that's $60 plus $12 S&H). 








Bookmarks, Postcards, and Greeting Cards - some that are specifically ConTessa themed, others that are more 'geeky' themed! With perk packs that contain the 2 postcards, the cards will feature a light grid on the front to draw a dungeon on and a small legend on the back to complete the adventure. One postcard will be addressed and stamped to return your creation to ConTessa headquarters for redistribution in next year's ConTessa!






Pinback Buttons, Magnets, and Keychains - all sporting the existing ConTessa characters as well as the new monster illustrations we got for this year, AND more generic RPG-themed accessories



The ConTessa 2013 & 2014 Annuals - zines containing winning contest entries (microgames, random tables, poetry) and more from the convention.



The ConTessa 2014 Coloring & Activity Book - featuring the ConTessa mascots and friends for the colored pencil and puzzle crowd.



A three-month subscription to the coolest new site for managing campaigns, Tavern Keeper, along with an awesome title showing the world that you're a ConTessa sponsor!
Pick up your Tavern Keeper subscription by choosing any of the clearance levels ☢ ORANGE ☢ and above!
An annual subscription to this gorgeous quarterly zine filled with unique gaming materials and artwork. Randomocity fuels your imagination with lots of fun and interesting roleplaying game adventures, NPCs, and ideas. 




Pick up your Randomocity subscription (and give one to a lucky gamer) by choosing any of the perk levels at ☢ YELLOW ☢ clearance and above!
We've secured a limited quantity of Large Chainmail dice bags to add to our perks, courtesy of Bryan Rumph at Dark Angel Metal Works! These awesome chainmail bags are handmade and can hold up to 100 dice ... that's about half your dice collection, right? 

 
Pick one up by choosing ☢ BLUE - DICE BAG EDITION ☢ in the perks to the right!
Check out the side panel for sponsorship levels and rewards. If you want to find out about all the benefits of sponsorship and donation options for sponsors, visit our Become a Sponsor page.



Add $16.00 to your perk level to get this card game! - A fast-paced card/dice-rolling/role-playing game where everyone gets to be the GM. Exclusively offered to ConTessa supporters.


Get your hands on GM prep! Engine Publishing has offered up a discount for ConTessa supporters on their popular GM resource books! By adding $39 to any perk, you'll get PDFs of Eureka, Masks, Never Unprepared, and Odyssey, PLUS we'll throw in PDFs of both ConTessa Annuals (when available), the ConTessa Coloring Book PDF, and PDFs of Randomocity #1 and #2 (when available). A bounty of inspirational material for any GM!
Add $39 to your contribution to receive this pack! You'll get the Engine Publishing books, ConTessa Annual #1, and Randomocity #1 as soon as the campaign ends, and we'll send you Randomocity #2, the ConTessa Annual #2, and the ConTessa Coloring Book once they're complete!
The Bully Pulpit Pack: Fiasco & The Fiasco Companion in Softcover, Plus Carolina Death Crawl
Get your hands on the softcover print copies of the popular GMless, prepless game Fiasco, plus The Fiasco Companion and Bully Pulpit's card game, 'Carolina Death Crawl'! 
Add this by choosing any of our perks, then add on the Fiasco Pack for just $72 (that's $60 plus $12 S&H). 

Decide on a perk level
When prompted, add the purchase price of your add-on(s) to the total amount of your contribution
If you want to add additional items during the campaign, you can make changes on your contribution page on IndieGoGo at any time
At the end of the campaign, be on the look-out for an email from ConTessa with instructions for completing your order

ConTessa 2013 was a big success - over 40 games and events, tons of goodies, fun contests and a very popular random dungeon crawl competition. Women (some of whom had never GM’d a game before) were so inspired, they are already asking when they can register for 2014.
ConTessa has a track record of doing what we say we will do and delivering on time. We are driven to repeat last year’s success and go beyond what we've already achieved, so you can count on the ConTessa team to efficiently manage your contributions and use them to expand and improve ConTessa for all our contributors and participants - from the first registration through the posting of the final videos.
The proceeds of this campaign will go directly into defraying costs and bringing even more goodies and more fun to the ConTessa experience.
If you just can’t swing the funds to get in on one of our perks, you can still help. Tell your friends about ConTessa, encourage the gamer women you know to GM or moderate a panel, and post links to this page on your websites and social networks. 
Spread the word!
We can’t wait to see every one of you in all your glorious geeky gamerishness at...

story:
You choose - Black or White Dygma Raise

Featured on

 

 

"This is a split keyboard that has been designed so that you can position your hands more ergonomically, and it has also been designed for competitive gaming/eSports in mind." - Ubergizmo

"It’s certainly one of the more feature-packed split keyboards I’ve seen. It’s even got one of my favorite mechanical keyboard features, the ability to swap out switches on the fly." - Kotaku

"This ergonomic keyboard is ideal for esports and offers you total comfort and control." - Gadget Flow

"Dygma Raise is a revolutionary split keyboard that offers the possibility of working from the first moment with comfort, and at the same time gives you the option of looking for a deeper learning to try to optimize each pulsation." - AS esports

 

In gaming, 0.1s can be the difference between victory or defeat. To play at our best we need to be physically and mentally in top shape. That’s why we’ve created Raise, an ergonomic gaming keyboard designed to increase performance, health and comfort.

 

A normal keyboard forces the wrists to bend towards the pinky side of our hand. Rotating Raise’s halves lets you keep your wrists at a neutral angle, decreasing pressure and strain over time. You can also adjust the width between the two halves, placing them in front of your shoulders to reduce internal shoulder rotation.

 

Its configuration software allows you to create different layouts and toggle instantly between them. Every key in every layout is remappable and can be configured as a macro. Any key can have special behaviors if you tap once, several times or hold it.

Our software and firmware is open source. This means that anyone can make an improvement or program their own plugins and the whole community can benefit from it.

 

We’ve divided the spacebar into 4 and added 4 extra keys under it. They are comfortable to use because they are in the area where our thumbs naturally rest.

 

Raise is a gaming keyboard and a gaming keypad in the same device. You can detach either side and play with the other. This way you’ll have more space for your mouse and be able to play more comfortably.

 

The combination of nearly symmetrical and rebindable keys makes Raise perfect for left handed gamers.

 

The palmrest elevates the wrist, increasing comfort and reducing the harmful angle created by the difference between the desk and keyboard height.

The palm pads are interchangeable. You can remove them and clean them.

 

 

All Raise mechanical switches are hot-swappable, so you can easily pull them out and replace them with others whenever you want.

Raise comes with Cherry MX or Kailh switches. You’ll be able to choose between the following 7 kinds.

 

Raise RGB backlight and underglow reduced the user’s learning curve when getting used to multiple layouts.

You can also assign a different backlight color to any individual key.

 

 

Many USB keyboards limit you to pressing 6 keys (plus modifiers) at once. The NKRO-over-USB technique we're using works great on Windows, MacOS X and Linux without any special drivers.

 

We want all our users to feel a “wow experience” using Raise. That’s why we’ve focused on making it look and feel awesome and be more comfortable to use:

  • Extra USB slot - It’s always handy to have a USB port next to you.
  • Magnetic connectors - Instantly detach and attach any side. Change your setup instantly.
  • Full aluminium body - More durable and beautiful.
  • Magnetic inner joint - It feels solid when both sides are together and can’t accidentally split.

 

 

 

Thanks to everyone that helped and supported us during this journey. Family and friends, kind internet users, our beta testers and all the collaborators we've had during the last months.

We believe that Raise is the seed that will make the peripheral industry focus more on gamers' health and performance, and less on doing the same products with tiny modifications.

Lastly, we would like to thank you for taking the time to view the Dygma Raise project. We hope that you will back and share this project!

story:
HEY ZOMBIE LOVERS!!!!

IT'S BEEN AN AMAZING JOURNEY WITH ZOMBIE WITH A SHOTGUN.  IT ALL STARTED WITH A SIMPLE DREAM BY CREATING A ZOMBIE FILM. I NEVER HAD THE SLIGHTEST IDEA OF HOW FAR THIS PROJECT WOULD'VE TAKEN ME.  I HAD MANY WONDERFUL PEOPLE THAT HELPED ME DURING THIS PROCESS. I TRULY THANK THEM AND EVERYONE THAT SUPPORTED ME AND ZOMBIE WITH A SHOTGUN. ONE MORE THING, I ALWAYS EXPLAIN TO MY FANS THAT IF I CAN DO IT, ANYONE CAN AND THAT'S THE TRUTH. FOLLOW YOUR HEART AND YOUR DREAMS...

ZOMBIE WITH A SHOTGUN THE VIDEO GAME!!!

IT ALL STARTED IN THE YEAR 2012 AS A WEB-SERIES AND A COUPLE OF YEARS LATER WE'VE CREATED A COMIC-BOOK SERIES.

WE DIDN'T STOP THERE....IN 2016 WE DECIDED TO GO ON A CAMPAIGN TO RAISE MONEY FOR THE FEATURE FILM ZOMBIE WITH A SHOTGUN!

NOVEMBER 27 2019  ZOMBIE WITH A SHOTGUN DEBUTED ON AMAZON PRIME VIDEO.

TO WATCH FILM ON TUBI ~ ZOMBIE WITH A SHOTGUN

TO WATCH FILM ON AMAZON ~ ZOMBIE WITH A SHOTGUN

IF YOU HAVEN'T SEEN IT HERE'S THE TRAILER....

 
THIS WOULD HAVE NEVER HAPPENED IF IT WASN'T FOR ALL YOUR AMAZING SUPPORT!!!
 

AND NOW.....

WITH YOUR AWESOME HELP WE WOULD LIKE TO RAISE MONEY TO RELEASE....

ZOMBIE WITH A SHOTGUN

THE VIDEO GAME!!!!!!

Zombie with a Shotgun is going to be that zombie GAME where all the rules we know about zombie GAMES go right out the window.​

It begins:

You’re getting chased! Quickly you hurry through the front door of an old apartment complex.
For a second you think you’re safe, but better think again! Accomplices to the ones that are after you are already inside, hiding in the dank hallway for you to show up.
You have a room here, where you have your belongings. You left the apartment-key on the dresser so get to your place , pick up that key and lock the door behind you!
You pull a tucked away handgun and prepare to face your enemies.

GAME ON!!!

Shoot down the bad guys, pick up some weapons, pet and rescue some rabbits and be careful around all those zombies roaming 'round the dark. They're hungry!...

Feel like wasting ammo? Blast away your enemies, cupboards, chairs, vases, and whatever else gets in the way! Though some things may be better left alone as they'll keep you covered from enemy fire - at least a little while.

 

Depending on how many stretch goals we reach the more levels, story and characters we'll add to the game. These are the 10 levels we've planned for and with your help, we'll reach to make every single one a memorable experience!

READ BELOW AS WE ASK FOR YOUR HELP TO GRAB ONE OF OUR WONDERFUL PERKS!

THANK YOU ALL!!!

Perks:

Support us with $15 and get your own copy of the Zombie with a Shotgun Video Game to play at your leisure.

Support us with $25 we'll throw in a digital "behind the scenes" Art Book where you'll get to see the process of making the game and all the drawings and final renders, layouts and 3D models.

Support us with $35 we'll thank you by name in the game's credits.

Support us with $50 we'll go out of our way to thank you by name in a little more exclusive way in the game's credits.

Support us with $500 or more we will grant you the title of Co-Producer of the game.

 

Stretch Goals:

When we reach $9300 the game will get an amazing soundtrack composed by music master Jönköping Sound Machine (his awesome music is already in the trailer!). We will also bring in the phenomenal artist Ian J. Miller from the ZWAS comics to draw portraits for characters in the game.

Reaching $10380 we will port the game to Android and iOS and make it cell-phone friendly.

At $12 540 another level will be built and the plot will thicken. With every new level, more story will be revealed and more characters will pop in, both friendly and those ready to put a gun in your face.

At $13 080 there will be new weapons and we'll add another character.

When going for $15 240 there will be yet another level added for Aaron to run around in.

$15 780 and we'll drop in a bunch of new characters.

For $17 940 you'll get one more level to practice your shotgun at.

When we get to $18 590 Ian will come back and artistically illustrate an intro sequence and some other scenes.

At $20 750 there will be another level filled of goons with guns and hungry zombies.

$22 910‬ Mini Game! Drive between levels, and be careful of whom or what you might bump into.

We will add another level to play at $25 070.

At $25 610 there will be new weapons and another character.

If we reach $27 770 there will be more gameplay on another level.

Going for $28 280 there will be a new weapon and new characters.

$30 440 will grant us to make yet another level to explore. This far into the game there will be lots of dangerous enemies and a variety of weapons to use.

With $30 980 Aaron will get 2 extra attacks another character will be added to the mix.

Reaching $33 140 there will be one more level. The enemies on this one are out of this world!!!

With $35 300 we will add a FINAL LEVEL to the game. Now we have 10 places for Aaron to swing his shotgun at.

Drop us another buck and we reach $35 840 we will with this final goal squeeze in another weapon and adding a whole two more characters.

 

TEAM

Hilton Ariel Ruiz

Creator and Producer

Fredrik "fedde" Mattsson

Game Designer and Art Director

Jimmy Brunnberg

Game Designer and Programmer

 

Who will get to eat pie after the campaign?

We will add another level to play at $25 070.

At $25 610 there will be new weapons and another character.

If we reach $27 770 there will be more gameplay on another level.

Going for $28 280 there will be a new weapon and new characters.

$30 440 will grant us to make yet another level to explore. This far into the game there will be lots of dangerous enemies and a variety of weapons to use.

Game Designer and Programmer

story:
Float: The Falling Kingdom!


Float is a game which uses a low-poly graphics style, but uses the latest game Unity Game engine!  The Idea for this game came about one day as a joke at college with my friends who said I should turn one of my low-poly pictures into a full game and well I am in the process of creating it but well I need your help to get it onto steam, get some advertising out for it!

What We Need & What You Get

Firstly the money you will donate ,will go directly to Float or equipment to help finish Float.

Things you will get;

-Even if you donate as little as £1 I will take the time to email you all back ASAP cause you're all amazing for helping me make my dream come true!

-A copy of the game

-Name in about section of the game 

- Other things to be announced 

What the money will be used for.

-A new Computer to speed up production.£600

- Steamgreen light cost £70

-Website - £40

-Other costs will go to computer

    The Impact

    Float will also provide a platform in the future after the game is release for you to add a educational twist allowing for you to teach you children, Maths, a another language .

    Risks & Challenges

    Risks of the this project as I am just one person creating this game, so progress will be slow. But I have the determination to over come all challenges which may arise!

      Other Ways You Can Help

      If you would like to help this project, but you just not able to then don't worry. All you could do is just share the game!
