Float is a game which uses a low-poly graphics style, but uses the latest game Unity Game engine!  The Idea for this game came about one day as a joke at college with my friends who said I should turn one of my low-poly pictures into a full game and well I am in the process of creating it but well I need your help to get it onto steam, get some advertising out for it!



What We Need & What You Get
 Firstly the money you will donate ,will go directly to Float or equipment to help finish Float.
Things you will get;
-Even if you donate as little as £1 I will take the time to email you all back ASAP cause you're all amazing for helping me make my dream come true!
-A copy of the game
-Name in about section of the game 
- Other things to be announced 
What the money will be used for.
-A new Computer to speed up production.£600
- Steamgreen light cost £70
-Website - £40
-Other costs will go to computer

  The Impact Float will also provide a platform in the future after the game is release for you to add a educational twist allowing for you to teach you children, Maths, a another language .
Risks & Challenges
 Risks of the this project as I am just one person creating this game, so progress will be slow. But I have the determination to over come all challenges which may arise!

  Other Ways You Can Help If you would like to help this project, but you just not able to then don't worry. All you could do is just share the game!

story:
FUNDED!

Thanks to everyone's support, and especially the support of Sundance Giovanni (who donated the entire goal at once!), my campaign was successfully funded and I'll be able to play the Master Chief Collection!  What a crazy day.

Sundance has kindly opted out of the prize pool, which means you can still win my signed Final Boss Team Arenas jacket if you contribute the highest donation by the 18th of November. The raffle to win my signed Final Boss jersey is still open too, and you can still grab as many tickets as you like ($10 per ticket). The other perk rewards are available as marked on the right.

Thanks again, everyone! You've proved the Halo community is, even after all this time, still one of the kindest and most supportive gaming communities that has ever existed.

See you all on MCC!

--------------------------------------------

One of the most dominant Halo players of all time, OGRE 1, needs your help getting back into Halo.

Hi, I'm OGRE 1. I'm pumped that Halo (particularly Halo 2!) is coming back. With an Xbox One,  Xbox Live Subscription and Master Chief Collection being priced at over $600 in Australia, and having recently become a father, it's hard to come up with that kind of money for gaming. Any help via donations would be extremely appreciated and I would be forever grateful!

I would love the opportunity to game some of the new Halo, stream regularly, and attend a couple events this coming year, so I've set up this raffle to help me get started!

Where your donations are going:

Here’s a breakdown of what the costs are for me to get back into Halo:


  • Xbox One - $499

  • MCC - $80

  • 12 Month Xbox Live Subscription -$60

  • I also have no working console headsets so I'll have to grab one of those too  ^_^

  • Paying to ship the jersey and jacket overseas

  I appreciate any donation and I love you all!


What you can get in exchange for helping me out:

 

(link to close up image: close up)

Other ways you can help:

If you can't afford to donate, I still love you! You can still help me out by sharing this with friends, Halo/e-Sports fans or linking to this on social media!

Thank you all and good luck in the raffle!  :)

- Dan "Ogre1" Ryan

story:
Heya Cubians,

So this is our Livestream charity donations page! If you  came here by accident, here is some basic info for you:

Our names are Sean (Prawnilious) and Tads (taddio) and we are staff members on the Minecraft server Multicube! Multicube has recently hit the 1 million unique players mark, and to celebrate we're hosting a 24 hour livestream for charity to celebrate the occasion. (Stream is at http://www.twitch.tv/multicubelive). We will be collaborating with some great youtubers during the stream; including ThezRhino, Champwan and 16BitDec.
As Multicube has a large community of players, we asked them what charities they wanted to see us donate money to. The charities selected were Special Effect, Extra Life and PennysForGSD. We're hoping to raise £1000 for these charities.

Special Effect is an amazing UK based charity who provide gaming equipment for people with severe disabilities. http://www.specialeffect.org.uk/
You only need to watch a few of their youtube videos from their channel to really grasp how big a difference they make to the lives of these people.
Here, Ben and Harry are just two examples of the many people that they've helped:




Extra Life is a charity that started out as a 24 hour gaming marathon like this one to raise money for the Texas Children's Hospital. Since then, the charity has grown with more and more gamers supporting the charity to raise money for their local Children's Miracle Network Hospitals. http://www.extra-life.org/



PennysForGSD is a charity suggested from one of our own staff members who has GSD Type VII. PennysForGSD is a charity that raises money for Glycogen Storage Disease research and awareness in order to try and find a cure for this rare, and sometimes fatal disease. http://pennysforgsd.org/
Here's a link to their Story http://pennysforgsd.org/our-story/

Your contributions to this fundraising page will help so many lives out there. You will be helping a disabled child in the UK to be able to play video games, with technology that your donations help to fund. Your donations will be helping a child in a US hospital get the treatment they need, as well as helping to find a cure to a very rare disease. 

When you donate to this IndieGoGo campaign, your money will go towards these charities and these charities only. Once all the contributions are collected and our stream ends, we'll split up the money and send each charity a third of the total funds gathered. Even if we don't reach our goal, we'll send any money that is raised towards these charities. A small difference made is better than no difference made. 

We hope that you will help out these charities in any way possible, whether it be:
1. Contributing to this IndieGoGo page
2. Sharing the IndieGoGo Page/ Livestream with friends
or 3. Simply take your time to look at their sites and get to know what work they do

Make sure that you're watching the stream when we hit milestones on our way to our goal! We'll be giving away:
1000 cubics at 100 pounds raised!
10 Cosmetic Tokens at 250 pounds raised!
50 Cosmetic Tokens at 500 pounds raised!
Pro lifetime rank at 750 pounds raised!
Pro+ lifetime rank at 1000 pounds raised!

Special shoutout to 'BlackKeys' for making the beautiful pitch image

Few extra details for you guys:
The money will be going to a designated bank account (clear of any personal funds) and will this bank account is designated for this purpose only. Once the contributions have been put in this account, we will donate the funds divided equally to each charity. The new PayPal option is linked to the same designated account.
Once this is done we will try and confirm that the money has reached the charities through receipts/ email contact or other methods.

story:
Currently you can support the game on http://www.ancient-cities.com



















As you can check in the pledge chart, only Chief, Lord, Shaman & Deity will get "unlocked expansions". Any other unlocked stretch goal is for every game owner.

* Exclusive Backer DLC: Unique building for backers that will not  affect gameplay .
Everyone will know that you are a backer looking at your screenshots or game videos.

* "Deity", "Shaman" and "KS Beloved Chief" will have beta access preference.

* Uncasual Pass Includes all games, expansions and DLCs that Uncasual Games may release in the future.

We love tech, strategy games, history, archaeology and cities. We dream, as you do, with a gorgeous strategy city simulator, focused in history and realism, that lets the player develop its city through the ages in a credible and immersive way.

This sounds too ambitious? Definitely.
But we think everything can be done, if you move steady, step by step.
 


Our solution is to not even try to do it all at once, but to build each time-frame and location as a full expansion over one common platform, with all the content, from assets to game-play features, needed for that historical simulation.
As a whole, Ancient Cities is a long-term project.

If successful, we expect Ancient Cities to become a powerful game platform for next developments, moving us more and more into the realms of history, exploring different places and ages around the world with you: Bronze Age, Mighty Ur, Classic Greece, Egypt, Rome or Middle Ages.

Let's dream. Join us if you want ;)
 


We have chosen to start at the origin of cities, in the Neolithic era because It is logic and highly suitable for the project:
New eras will introduce new gameplay and game features, just as in real life.
Neolithic allows us to face all the game features ( religion, society, architecture, politics or warfare ) in their most simple form compared to other ages, and that makes it a perfect suit for a development team with the limited resources we have.
A natural step that fits historically and technically.

We are developing our own custom engine and gaming technology for Ancient Cities because it allows us to render what we envision: thousands of items on the screen at the same time with nice fps, offering the players breathtaking images of their cities.
Both, game-play and detail, are important to us.

If you share our vision, this is a great opportunity to make it happen.
We are already working on it!
 



This project started as a project of two friends, one coder and one artist, both with passion for technology, video-games and history. Both with a long career, years of expertise in custom 3D engines and full of new ideas. 

We consider to use Unity or UDK for AC in the beginning, but we realized that AC requirements needed a custom technology focused on managing thousands of entities in the screen. For us this was a new challenge in our careers, and we love that.

We have been developing the technology behind Ancient Cities and AC Neolithic working full time in our own homes for more than a year, running on our own funds.

Two more people, a programmer, and a sound designer, have joined us recently as they love the project as much as we do.

We believe in what we are doing, and truly love it.
 


In the last months, we decided to start showing our work while growing a community around the game.

We started our "almost" daily development updates on twitter https://twitter.com/_AncientCities . You should take a look there if you really want to know us, the project, and a small but wonderful community ;)

With this community supporting us and the game progressing well, but still in early alpha, we decided to try Steam Greenlight before it shut down.

What happened there was completely unexpected, it was the best reward for all our efforts to date:
 


In the last 4 days of Greenlight the game skyrocketed #2 position, with a 95% of positive votes and hundreds of nice comments.

You can check our Greenlight page here: 
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=854046403
 


Currently, the game is in the early alpha stage.
This means that only some of the final features are implemented and almost none of them are finished or polished.

Yet we have done lot of work building the basis of the tech and gameplay, both still unfinished but beyond the prototype stage.

There is a ton of work ahead in order to add all the content we have planned so we still need your help to grow the team and to ensure an on-time and polished release, while keeping our creative freedom.




Ancient Cities first crowdfunding succeeded after surpassing the 100.000€ goal and reaching 125.000€ in a previous Kickstarter  campaign. But this campaign was very short not allowing a lot of people to discover it in time. 

This IndieGogo campaign is planned to work as a tool to extent funding time, to allow backers to reach more stretch goals, as well as allow people that missed the original campaign to help fund the game and getting them the possibility of joining the closed Beta.

*Please, if you are a Kickstarer backer check the KS FAQ at the bottom of this page.
 



We are a small team and we want to spend our time improving the game for you, designing, coding, modelling, animating and texturing... not selling you cups or T-shirts.
Managing physical gifts is very time consuming.

Why not an early alpha pledge?

Lots of people asked for an early alpha access. We know you want to play the game right now, but this would imply tons of community management and technical support. This effort, dedicated to keep people playing instead of evolving the game features towards release specifications, could seriously compromise the project.

Of course there will be an alpha when the time comes, we need it to improve the game, but we need it to be very controlled. An alpha is a development stage, not a product to sell.

In addition, we consider that the game should be played as intended, and current status does not represent what we have in our minds and in our design sheets.

We really hope you all to understand our decision about this pledges. We have decided to reward your help with what we set out to make; a better game.

What kind of pledge are we offering?

What we are offering to you is the game itself, finished, completed and polished with a discount on final price ( 40€ ), and a mention in the game credits as a backer in AC game platform. A backer's especial section in the game website is planned too.

Of course, we will continue with our daily development updates, with frequent gameplay videos about new features to keep you up-to-date at every moment until the game is done.

10 top backers will hold a distinguished place in the backer’s section in the game credits and on the website.

No mention that we will be always open to discuss gameplay ideas and features with you.


 


 Current Features

The game is a city/world simulation where you can change time progression from normal speed to several time-lapse velocities.

  • This is what we already have, but still to be polished:
  • In house 3D render technology and UI.
  • Procedural world generation.
  • Simulated day and night cycles.
  • Simulated seasonal cycles.
  • Weather simulation based on real data.
  • Wild animal life and plants cycle of life.
  • Farming system.
  • Step-by-step structure building and effects.
  • Resource collection and storage.
  • Family tree for citizens.
  • Character attributes.
  • AI to some extent, including path finding, job selection...
  • Citizen basic needs like eat, drink, sleep or rest.
  • Tech system.
  • Some items of each type to test the tech ( plants, animals, buildings... )
  • Decay of resources and buildings.

 Final Release Features

Configure your gameplay enabling combat and natural disasters or simply relax building your beautiful city.

The world

  • Discover the lands around you sending out exploring parties.
  • Factions:  other tribes competing for resources, power and alliances.
  • Cities: Populated places where you can trade or raid, with their own religion, culture and economy.
  • Migrations due to famine or sickness will spread religion, tech and culture.
  • Hunter parties will explore the map searching for hunting.
  • World events can change the course of history.

The city

  • Survive the unforgiving nature building structures to live and to defend against raiders and predators.
  • Receive migration parties while taking care of your citizens.
  • Mine, Chop, Crop, Gather, Hunt and Fish for resources, but be aware they are finite.
  • Craft tools, weapons, food and other manufactured resources if you know how to do it.
  • Plant, seed, crop and storage for the winter. But remember that nothing lasts forever.
  • Take care of your animals and protect them from predators.
  • Fight back your enemies, trade, hunt and explore beyond your city walls. Or wait for others AI factions to come to you.
  • Praise your gods for faith and political power, fight against other religions. spread your faith...
  • Politics
  • More building types, clothes, animals, etc...

The citizens

  • Citizen traits, religion and culture.
  • Sickness can decimate your people.

Platforms

PC Windows at first release.
Others to be determined.  

Languages

English at first release.  
German, French, Chinese, Japanese, Russian, Spanish & Portuguese to be added after final release.
Others to be determined.



  • Closed Alpha Version in Jun 2018.
  • Closed Beta Version in Sep 2018.
  • Release in Dec 2018.



We have planned the features, we have estimated the time cost, and we have realized that we need to grow. 

This is the percentage of funds allocated to each major area of ​​development. It includes all the fixed expenses for each activity including taxes.
 

* The crowdfunding platform fees range from 8% to 10%
* Taxes cuts 21% from what we receive from the crowdfunding platform.

As an example; At the end of KS campaign 125.000€ were funded, we will get around 90.000€ after fees and taxes.





 

  • Interview with twocredits.co:
    http://twocredits.co/columns/interview-uncasual...
     
  • Announcement by gameit.es( Spanish )
    https://www.gameit.es/uncasual-games-busca-financiacion-kickstarter-ancient-cities/
     
  • YouTube preview by Keralis:
    https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=DgAeG9e6X2Y
     
  • YouTube preview by Resonant:
    http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=_of9II_Ol1k&t=56s
     
  • YouTube preview by Vaypah Gaming 
    https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=VTfutsbrO24
     
  • YouTube interview by Alkhalim
    https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=He1F0b9OEt4&t=1s
     
  • YouTube preview by DrProof ( German )
    https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1GiMJShwLMU
     
  • YouTube preview by HForHavoc
    https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=DvWJP6g5QXM&feature=youtu.be&a
     
  • YouTube Q&A by HForHavoc
    https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=m-pYaSLNpxg&feature=youtu.be
     
  • YouTube preview by WarriorofSparta
    https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=FnWx9wA8kAA&feature=youtu.be&a
     
  • YouTube preview by lionheartx10
    https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=MNS3HfIrhUM&feature=youtu.be
     
  • Interview with Arsgaming.com ( Spanish )
    http://arsgaming.com/ancient-cities-entrevista-desarrolladores
     
  • Announcement by onlysp.com
    http://onlysp.com/ancient-cities-seeks-crowdfunding/
     
  • Announcement by niveloculto.com ( Spanish )
    https://niveloculto.com/ancient-cities-citybuilder-neolitico/
     


 

LLuis, Ancient Cities sound designer and musician, takes his job very seriously.
We love that and you will love it too when you have the game in your hands!



This is our first PC game but... 
We have years of experience with similar technologies. Also, many features has been already completed during the last year, so we have no doubt we can finish the work.

We are developing our own tech, but... 
We have created many 3D engines in our careers, working for private companies and VR research labs, and even as a hobby!

We are a team of four running on our own budget... 
So we need to grow, and we need funding, this is the main reason to be here.

What is our greatest shortcoming? 
We are perfectionists, even worse, we like that!



  • There will be multiplayer?
    Ancient Cities uses a player controlled time velocity that does not fit well with multiplayer. This game is closer to a city builder with strategy elements than it is to a base camp game like AoE.

    If the game works very well and we have funding in the future we could consider a spin off, or a multiplayer mode with fixed time, but we will not compromise single player experience in any case. Multiplayer is not a priority for us at this moment.
     
  • There will be combat?
    Yes, in the first release there will be combat in the form of raids, but it will be optional.
     
  • Can I evolve my city from Neolithic, to Rome, Middle Ages or beyond or can I play with Tenochtitlan?
    Not in the first release.First release will start with a nomadic tribe and cover Neolithic to the Bronze Age start in Atlantic Europe. If the first release works well and we can continue development we will expand the game to other ages/cultures, step by step.
     
  • Will there be modding support for the game?
    Not for the first release.
    But we know how important modding is for this kind of games, so it will be added later.
     
  • What will be the system requirements for this game?
    At this stage of development is too early to say, still lots of optimizations are needed, and lots of features are going to be added.
    The game already provides a full range of typical quality configurations though.
    Currently i5 CPU and not too old discrete 2GB GPU is the actual minimum for low settings, but this may ( and will ) change a lot.

    We will know actual minimum requirements near the final release
    Integrated GPU are not going to be officially supported.
     
  • Will there be Linux or Mac version?
    Only Windows version is planned at this moment.
    Other platforms are to be determined in the future if they have commercial sense for us.
     
  • When this game will be released?
    Release date is planned for late 2018
     
  • There will be Early Access or open Alpha?
    Early Access is not planed and alpha will be closed.
    We think alpha is a development stage, not a product to sell.
    There will be a closed Beta for people who backed in any crowdfunding platform with the beta access reward.
     

Kickstarter FAQ


This section is dedicated to all the people who already backed us on the Kickstarter (KS) campaign.

  • Are the goals and rewards the same as the Kickstarter campaign?
    This Indiegogo campaign is designed to work as a time extension of KS, so goals and rewards are the same, but those we considere obsolete.
     
  • What if I already backed the game in the previous Kickstarter campaign?
    Then you already backed the game and we thank you again ;)
    You DO NOT need to back again.

    If you backed as Citizen on KS, any extra funding achieved here will improve the game, and your gameplay experience as well.

    If you backed as Chief, Lord, Shaman or Deity on KS, you will be granted with all expansions unlocked in this campaign as well.

    If you have any question, please don't hesitate to contact us.
     
  • Can I upgrade my KS pledge?
    Yes, you can:

    If you are a Kickstarter "Citizen" and want to upgrade to "Chief" follow this link and pledge for the secret perk in the perk list ( yes, just like that ).

    If you are a Kickstarter "Citizen" and want to upgrade to "Lord" follow this link and pledge for the secret perk in the perk list ( yes, just like that ).

    If you are a Kickstarter "Chief" and want to upgrade to "Lord" follow this link and pledge for the secret perk in the perk list ( yes, just like that ).
     
  • What about Paypal?
    We will try to support Paypal as well, for all of you who don’t use credit card.
    This will be supported on Ancient Cities website in the near future.
     
  • Are you not going to return to the work until the end of this campaign?
    Greenlight and Kickstarter campaigns took us all of our time.Now, with the basic funding achieved on KS, we are working again full time in the game.
    This means that we will be answering questions less frequently and campaign updates will be related to our daily development progress.
     

  • Is not the funding obtained in KS enough?
    ​After taxes and fees we are getting around 90.000€ in order to continue developing the game. This is enough to keep working the original team and make the base game, but not for hiring more people or improving our working conditions. More funding means better development and finally a better game.

We dream, as you do, with a gorgeous strategy city simulator, focused in history and realism, that lets the player develop its city through the ages in a credible and immersive way.This sounds too ambitious? Definitely.But we think everything can be done, if you move steady, step by step. Our solution is to not even try to do it all at once, but to build each time-frame and location as a full expansion over one common platform, with all the content, from assets to game-play features, needed for that historical simulation.As a whole, Ancient Cities is a long-term project.If successful, we expect Ancient Cities to become a powerful game platform for next developments, moving us more and more into the realms of history, exploring different places and ages around the world with you: Bronze Age, Mighty Ur, Classic Greece, Egypt, Rome or Middle Ages.Let's dream. Join us if you want ;) We have chosen to start at the origin of cities, in the Neolithic era because It is logic and highly suitable for the project:New eras will introduce new gameplay and game features, just as in real life.Neolithic allows us to face all the game features ( religion, society, architecture, politics or warfare ) in their most simple form compared to other ages, and that makes it a perfect suit for a development team with the limited resources we have.A natural step that fits historically and technically.We are developing our own custom engine and gaming technology for Ancient Cities because it allows us to render what we envision: thousands of items on the screen at the same time with nice fps, offering the players breathtaking images of their cities.Both, game-play and detail, are important to us.If you share our vision, this is a great opportunity to make it happen.We are already working on it! This project started as a project of two friends, one coder and one artist, both with passion for technology, video-games and history. Both with a long career, years of expertise in custom 3D engines and full of new ideas. We consider to use Unity or UDK for AC in the beginning, but we realized that AC requirements needed a custom technology focused on managing thousands of entities in the screen. For us this was a new challenge in our careers, and we love that.We have been developing the technology behind Ancient Cities and AC Neolithic working full time in our own homes for more than a year, running on our own funds.Two more people, a programmer, and a sound designer, have joined us recently as they love the project as much as we do.We believe in what we are doing, and truly love it. In the last months, we decided to start showing our work while growing a community around the game.We started our "almost" daily development updates on twitter https://twitter.com/_AncientCities . You should take a look there if you really want to know us, the project, and a small but wonderful community ;)With this community supporting us and the game progressing well, but still in early alpha, we decided to try Steam Greenlight before it shut down.What happened there was completely unexpected, it was the best reward for all our efforts to date: In the last 4 days of Greenlight the game skyrocketed #2 position, with a 95% of positive votes and hundreds of nice comments.You can check our Greenlight page here: http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=854046403 Currently, the game is in the early alpha stage.This means that only some of the final features are implemented and almost none of them are finished or polished.Yet we have done lot of work building the basis of the tech and gameplay, both still unfinished but beyond the prototype stage.There is a ton of work ahead in order to add all the content we have planned so we still need your help to grow the team and to ensure an on-time and polished release, while keeping our creative freedom.Ancient Cities first crowdfunding succeeded after surpassing the 100.000€ goal and reaching 125.000€ in a previous Kickstarter  campaign. But this campaign was very short not allowing a lot of people to discover it in time. This IndieGogo campaign is planned to work as a tool to extent funding time, to allow backers to reach more stretch goals, as well as allow people that missed the original campaign to help fund the game and getting them the possibility of joining the closed Beta.*Please, if you are a Kickstarer backer check the KS FAQ at the bottom of this page. We are a small team and we want to spend our time improving the game for you, designing, coding, modelling, animating and texturing... not selling you cups or T-shirts.Managing physical gifts is very time consuming.Why not an early alpha pledge?Lots of people asked for an early alpha access. We know you want to play the game right now, but this would imply tons of community management and technical support. This effort, dedicated to keep people playing instead of evolving the game features towards release specifications, could seriously compromise the project.Of course there will be an alpha when the time comes, we need it to improve the game, but we need it to be very controlled. An alpha is a development stage, not a product to sell.In addition, we consider that the game should be played as intended, and current status does not represent what we have in our minds and in our design sheets.We really hope you all to understand our decision about this pledges. We have decided to reward your help with what we set out to make; a better game.What kind of pledge are we offering?What we are offering to you is the game itself, finished, completed and polished with a discount on final price ( 40€ ), and a mention in the game credits as a backer in AC game platform. A backer's especial section in the game website is planned too.Of course, we will continue with our daily development updates, with frequent gameplay videos about new features to keep you up-to-date at every moment until the game is done.10 top backers will hold a distinguished place in the backer’s section in the game credits and on the website.No mention that we will be always open to discuss gameplay ideas and features with you.  Current FeaturesThe game is a city/world simulation where you can change time progression from normal speed to several time-lapse velocities.
This is what we already have, but still to be polished:
In house 3D render technology and UI.
Procedural world generation.
Simulated day and night cycles.
Simulated seasonal cycles.
Weather simulation based on real data.
Wild animal life and plants cycle of life.
Farming system.
Step-by-step structure building and effects.
Resource collection and storage.
Family tree for citizens.
Character attributes.
AI to some extent, including path finding, job selection...
Citizen basic needs like eat, drink, sleep or rest.
Tech system.
Some items of each type to test the tech ( plants, animals, buildings... )
Decay of resources and buildings.
 Final Release FeaturesConfigure your gameplay enabling combat and natural disasters or simply relax building your beautiful city.The world
Discover the lands around you sending out exploring parties.
Factions:  other tribes competing for resources, power and alliances.
Cities: Populated places where you can trade or raid, with their own religion, culture and economy.
Migrations due to famine or sickness will spread religion, tech and culture.
Hunter parties will explore the map searching for hunting.
World events can change the course of history.
The city
Survive the unforgiving nature building structures to live and to defend against raiders and predators.
Receive migration parties while taking care of your citizens.
Mine, Chop, Crop, Gather, Hunt and Fish for resources, but be aware they are finite.
Craft tools, weapons, food and other manufactured resources if you know how to do it.
Plant, seed, crop and storage for the winter. But remember that nothing lasts forever.
Take care of your animals and protect them from predators.
Fight back your enemies, trade, hunt and explore beyond your city walls. Or wait for others AI factions to come to you.
Praise your gods for faith and political power, fight against other religions. spread your faith...
Politics
More building types, clothes, animals, etc...
The citizens
Citizen traits, religion and culture.
Sickness can decimate your people.
PlatformsPC Windows at first release.Others to be determined.  LanguagesEnglish at first release.  German, French, Chinese, Japanese, Russian, Spanish & Portuguese to be added after final release.Others to be determined.
Closed Alpha Version in Jun 2018.
Closed Beta Version in Sep 2018.
Release in Dec 2018.
We have planned the features, we have estimated the time cost, and we have realized that we need to grow. This is the percentage of funds allocated to each major area of ​​development. It includes all the fixed expenses for each activity including taxes. * The crowdfunding platform fees range from 8% to 10%* Taxes cuts 21% from what we receive from the crowdfunding platform.As an example; At the end of KS campaign 125.000€ were funded, we will get around 90.000€ after fees and taxes. 
Interview with twocredits.co:http://twocredits.co/columns/interview-uncasual... 
Announcement by gameit.es( Spanish )https://www.gameit.es/uncasual-games-busca-financiacion-kickstarter-ancient-cities/ 
YouTube preview by Keralis:https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=DgAeG9e6X2Y 
YouTube preview by Resonant:http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=_of9II_Ol1k&t=56s 
YouTube preview by Vaypah Gaming https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=VTfutsbrO24 
YouTube interview by Alkhalimhttps://www.youtube.com/watch?v=He1F0b9OEt4&t=1s 
YouTube preview by DrProof ( German )https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1GiMJShwLMU 
YouTube preview by HForHavochttps://www.youtube.com/watch?v=DvWJP6g5QXM&feature=youtu.be&a 
YouTube Q&A by HForHavochttps://www.youtube.com/watch?v=m-pYaSLNpxg&feature=youtu.be 
YouTube preview by WarriorofSpartahttps://www.youtube.com/watch?v=FnWx9wA8kAA&feature=youtu.be&a 
YouTube preview by lionheartx10https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=MNS3HfIrhUM&feature=youtu.be 
Interview with Arsgaming.com ( Spanish )http://arsgaming.com/ancient-cities-entrevista-desarrolladores 
Announcement by onlysp.comhttp://onlysp.com/ancient-cities-seeks-crowdfunding/ 
Announcement by niveloculto.com ( Spanish )https://niveloculto.com/ancient-cities-citybuilder-neolitico/ 
 LLuis, Ancient Cities sound designer and musician, takes his job very seriously.We love that and you will love it too when you have the game in your hands!This is our first PC game but... We have years of experience with similar technologies. Also, many features has been already completed during the last year, so we have no doubt we can finish the work.We are developing our own tech, but... We have created many 3D engines in our careers, working for private companies and VR research labs, and even as a hobby!We are a team of four running on our own budget... So we need to grow, and we need funding, this is the main reason to be here.What is our greatest shortcoming? We are perfectionists, even worse, we like that!

There will be multiplayer?Ancient Cities uses a player controlled time velocity that does not fit well with multiplayer. This game is closer to a city builder with strategy elements than it is to a base camp game like AoE.If the game works very well and we have funding in the future we could consider a spin off, or a multiplayer mode with fixed time, but we will not compromise single player experience in any case. Multiplayer is not a priority for us at this moment. 

There will be combat?Yes, in the first release there will be combat in the form of raids, but it will be optional. 

Can I evolve my city from Neolithic, to Rome, Middle Ages or beyond or can I play with Tenochtitlan?Not in the first release.First release will start with a nomadic tribe and cover Neolithic to the Bronze Age start in Atlantic Europe. If the first release works well and we can continue development we will expand the game to other ages/cultures, step by step. 

Will there be modding support for the game?Not for the first release.But we know how important modding is for this kind of games, so it will be added later. 

What will be the system requirements for this game?At this stage of development is too early to say, still lots of optimizations are needed, and lots of features are going to be added.The game already provides a full range of typical quality configurations though.Currently i5 CPU and not too old discrete 2GB GPU is the actual minimum for low settings, but this may ( and will ) change a lot.We will know actual minimum requirements near the final releaseIntegrated GPU are not going to be officially supported. 

Will there be Linux or Mac version?Only Windows version is planned at this moment.Other platforms are to be determined in the future if they have commercial sense for us. 

When this game will be released?Release date is planned for late 2018 

There will be Early Access or open Alpha?Early Access is not planed and alpha will be closed.We think alpha is a development stage, not a product to sell.There will be a closed Beta for people who backed in any crowdfunding platform with the beta access reward. 
Kickstarter FAQThis section is dedicated to all the people who already backed us on the Kickstarter (KS) campaign.

Are the goals and rewards the same as the Kickstarter campaign?This Indiegogo campaign is designed to work as a time extension of KS, so goals and rewards are the same, but those we considere obsolete. 

What if I already backed the game in the previous Kickstarter campaign?Then you already backed the game and we thank you again ;)You DO NOT need to back again.If you backed as Citizen on KS, any extra funding achieved here will improve the game, and your gameplay experience as well.If you backed as Chief, Lord, Shaman or Deity on KS, you will be granted with all expansions unlocked in this campaign as well.If you have any question, please don't hesitate to contact us. 

Can I upgrade my KS pledge?Yes, you can:If you are a Kickstarter "Citizen" and want to upgrade to "Chief" follow this link and pledge for the secret perk in the perk list ( yes, just like that ).If you are a Kickstarter "Citizen" and want to upgrade to "Lord" follow this link and pledge for the secret perk in the perk list ( yes, just like that ).If you are a Kickstarter "Chief" and want to upgrade to "Lord" follow this link and pledge for the secret perk in the perk list ( yes, just like that ). 

What about Paypal?We will try to support Paypal as well, for all of you who don’t use credit card.This will be supported on Ancient Cities website in the near future. 

Are you not going to return to the work until the end of this campaign?Greenlight and Kickstarter campaigns took us all of our time.Now, with the basic funding achieved on KS, we are working again full time in the game.This means that we will be answering questions less frequently and campaign updates will be related to our daily development progress. 
Is not the funding obtained in KS enough?​After taxes and fees we are getting around 90.000€ in order to continue developing the game. This is enough to keep working the original team and make the base game, but not for hiring more people or improving our working conditions. More funding means better development and finally a better game.

story:
Follow us on https://twitter.com/CorporateShark

===============================================

What is this Linderdaum Jigsaw Puzzle?

It is a unique 3D jigsaw puzzle game. Simple, right? Have you ever played a jigsaw game on your tablet? Usually it looks completely, utterly 2D and you have to move awkward tiles around. We are going to make the gameplay feel natural, as if you were touching the real tiles and putting the elements of the jigsaw puzzle together. We did that once for a picture puzzle game in Linderdaum Puzzle HD. Now we are going to do it for a jigsaw and in 3D.

3D gallery to select images from online photo hostings:

You can always switch between 3D and a top-down view, whenever you want.



What We Need

Long story short, we're looking to raise $5000 to release our 3D jigsaw picture puzzle game on Android this year, and we need your help. This money will cover the costs of hiring a designer, who will contribute the final touches to the look-n-feel of our game.

Why flexible campaign and not fixed funding?
The game is almost ready and will be released whether we do or do not hit the funding goal. Raising the funds will help us to improve the visual part of the UI and release the product 2-3 months earlier. This means each person, who has contributed to the project, will receive their perks regardless of the overall campaign success.

How money will be spent?
7% of the funding will be Indiegogo and processing fees. 13% of what is left will cover tax payments. About 10% of the rest will be spent on the perks delivery. This gives us approximately 3600 USD to hire a freelancing designer for 100 hours. The complete UI design for our previous Linderdaum Puzzle took slightly less than 60 hours, so we are pretty confident this amount will be sufficient.


Game Content

This is a lean indie project, so we plan to use the collected funding as wisely as possible.

We will use our own open-source 3D engine, which has proved to perform very good for puzzle games, to power Linderdaum Jigsaw Puzzle. By the way, we have the plans to make the crowdfunded game open-source.

The 3D models of jigsaw tiles are generated on the fly using sophisticated math. Here is an overview for those interested. The tile edge consists of an ellipse and two slopes (left and right), represented by a cubic Hermite curve:

Four edges make up a single tile boundary. The bounded region is then triangulated and extruded to form a 3D mesh for the tile.

The game contains offline and online photo galleries. The offline gallery is filled with photos under Creative Commons ShareAlike license. Online galleries stream photos from Flickr, Picasa and similar photo hostings.



What Are the Perks?

Besides the game itself, we have a couple of perks available:

1) A hand signed gloss varnished postcard (10x15 cm) with the logo of our game. We will send it to your address.

2) Additionally to the jigsaw puzzle, you will receive the full version of our previous game Linderdaum Puzzle HD.



Stretch Goals

Our Ingiegogo crowdfunding goal is to cover the costs of the game art. If we make it above our main goal, we will be able to go for other cool milestones:

  • 6000 USD iOS version of the game
    To build an iOS version, we need an iPad. Once we cover its cost, the iOS version will take approximately one additional month to be polished.
  • 8000 USD Desktop version of the game (Windows + MacOS)
    The money will be spent on the redesign of the touchscreen-based gameplay for a desktop PC. Desktop version will be available via Steam a couple of month after the iOS version is out.

Everything extra will help us to produce updates for an extended period of time, add new features and, of course, develop other cool games!


What Can You Do to Help Out?

Besides your contribution, you can always:

  • Share our project with your friends.
  • Use Indiegogo share tools!
  • If you are a talented photographer, designer or illustrator, you can contribute to our project!


About Us


Sergey Kosarevsky is a software engineer with over 10 years of experience in 3D graphics and mobile applications. He is one of the developers of SPB Shell 3D and Yandex.Shell.

Viktor Latypov is a software engineer and a mathematician with experience in compiler development, device drivers, robotics, high-performance computing, and a personal interest in 3D graphics and mobile technology. Surrounded by computers for almost 20 years, he enjoys every bit of developing and designing software for anything with a CPU inside.

Both guys develop an open-source 3D gaming engine in their spare time, which will be the engine behind Linderdaum Jigsaw Puzzle, they are coauthors of Android NDK Game Development Cookbook.

Disclaimer: we do not have any relationship to Unity. It is just a coincidence and a nice photo.


Summary


  • Platforms: Android, (iOS, Windows, Mac as stretch goals).
  • Release date: Q4 2014 on Android. iOS, Windows and Mac to be determined.
  • Minimal Requirements: Android 4.1 smartphone or tablet, HD screen.
  • Recommended Requirements: Android 4.3+ smartphone or tablet with OpenGL ES 3 and a large full HD screen.


That's all. Thank you for reading, We hope you are looking forward to playing our game!


Best regards,

Sergey Kosarevsky & Viktor Latypov

story:
FOR Q&A visit resistance.ancientscroll.pl


Join the Resistance

Resistance: Cross of Lorraine is first full pen & paper RPG by Library of Ancien Scroll (http://ancientscroll.pl)


This is a game about trust & betrayal, courage & sacrifice.


Take a role of French resistance fighter during II World War. Organize Your team, go underground, fight for Your family and country.


"Whatever happens, the flame of the French resistance must not be extinguished and will not be extinguished.ï¿½

- General de Gaulle, Appeal of 18 June 1940

Players

French resistance gathered people of different classes, religions and political views.


In R:CoL You may play as a teacher, cabaret singer, veteran, spy, shopkeeper etc. But those are PC's ï¿½real lifeï¿½ backgrounds. In fact they form an underground resistance movement cell. Their goal: fight Nazis


Work together, fight together

Every PC has different level of Resources. It can be Arms, Medicine, Contacts etc. 


Those Resources are extremely important, because Nazis plunder everything. Without proper level of Resources, missions PCs get from HQ are impossible. 


So gather Your Resorces every possible way: buy on black market, steal from an enemy, or simply improvise. Than share You Resources with other freedom fighters in Your team. Together You are more powerful


You will need also a safe haven, underground hide out to plan Your actions, store weapon and rest. Invest Your Resources to make Your hide out stronger!


Trust, risk, betrayal


You are hunter, but also a prey for Nazi secret police. Every resistance action expose You to the risk of denunciation. But it is not only Your risk - whole team or even whole net of resistance can be endangered. Trust is the most valuable currency in the resistance. 

Do You  trust 100% your team mates? Will You die for them? Will they die for You? Are you sure that the is no Nazi spy in Your team?


Maybe Your fellow fighter's loyalty decreased after he had to choose: another mission or getting food for his family?


Schedule & other stuff


R:CoL will be available early next year. By supporting this project, You will get Your PDF copy before official release. 

R:CoL will be on sale in PDF and Print on Demand. 

Game will be available in Englishand Polish first.

We plan to release several addons later next year, like special Equipment Cards to power up Your gaming experience. 


What You Get


Our graitude!


Great indie RPG :)


Satisfaction of being part of amazing RPG fans community.

story:
Infinity Heroes is a simultaneous turn-based strategy card game for mobile and PC which promises an evolved playing experience with the introduction of pre-defined decks that you can hot swap between every turn. Gameplay has been designed to let you jump into the action, whether you’re a casual player or competitive streamer. Games can also be played at a competitive level without spending a cent.
 

 

Strategic Simultaneous Turns

Simultaneous turns are a special game mechanic for Infinity Heroes. Players initiate their planning phases simultaneously with everything resolving at once. In this system, based on our previous game Infinity Wars, a whole new level of strategy has been added to the card strategy genre that forces players to predict and outmanoeuvre their opponents. Support? Attack? Defend? The choice is yours!

Taking turns in order is simple, there’s usually one or two good moves and the rest are subpar. However, with simultaneous turns, a psychological element is added (like Poker) where your opponent’s turn directly affects how you play.

WINNING YOUR BATTLES

The battlefield has limited spaces available giving a greater importance on unit placement. If too many small unit cards are placed down rapidly, players may miss out of the opportunity to play more impactful units. Thus, moving units between lanes can (and will) become more difficult.

This is balanced out by a hand refill mechanic where 4 cards are refilled at the end of each turn. This provides players with adequate time and information to react to an opponent’s action.

Through the implementation of lanes, we’ve constructed a MOBA-like experience to allow for strategic decisions to respond to specific threats on the battlefield.

CRAFT PERSONALIZED HEROES, SPELLS AND CARDS

This feature has been made with creatives in mind. We’re providing players with the chance to bring their creations to life in Infinity Heroes. Our in-game hero deck designer allows for artwork to be uploaded and applied to a player’s cards. From there, players will be able to name heroes, set their power levels and costs, give them effects, and upload their decks online to show off their creations.

Like dinosaurs? Make 'em! Vampires? Sure, why not? Garlic spells? (is that a thing?). The point here is, the option is there to create ANYTHING...within reason. We've provided players with the freedom to become the heroes they want to be!

ASSEMBLE YOUR HERO LINE-UP

Players can pick three Heroes for their line-up. As each turn begins, players can pick a hero from their line-up to take into that turn. The hero selected will determine which cards are drawn for that turn, what ultimates are accessed, and the hero power. This allows multiple strategies and strengths in a line-up for players to adapt their gameplay strategy as the game progresses.

These three Heroes each have a unique pool of cards under their command. At the start of each turn, you will select which hero will lead your assault. This will determine which deck your next card will come from. This system turns deck building into a dynamic part of your gameplay experience because you tweak your deck to your preferences at each and every turn.

GET SPOILT

 We’ve developed Infinity Heroes with variety in mind. With a rotating roster of heroes, players are spoilt for choice! Our most recent Hero Spotlight on Aberion, will give you some insight on how we design and plan out decks:

REWARDS

Backing our project unlocks a bunch of long lasting in game rewards. All tiers will include hero unlocks, an invite to the pre-release party, and backer names listed in our backers Hall of Fame.

In The Loop | $5

  • Get an invite to the pre-launch party  
  • Download the game two weeks before public release  
  • 1 hero unlock 

Beta Player | $30

  • Get invited to the closed beta 
  • 2x hero unlocks 
  • Additional cosmetic rewards (incl. in-game title "The Gamebreaker") 
  • Beta launch location 

Luminous Ages Dream Hero Pack | $55   

  • Get a digital graphic novel 
  • A new hero 
  • Get invited to the closed beta 
  • 2x hero unlocks 
  • Additional cosmetic rewards (incl. in-game title "The Gamebreaker") 
  • Beta launch location 

Alpha Player | $90  

  • Get access to the closed Alpha 
  • 4x hero unlocks 
  • In-game title "The Generous" 
  • Alpha location 
  • Friend invite code 
  • Advanced access to developers for feedback 

Featured Tier | $490 ( Limited )

  • "Immediate" access to the game 
  • In-game title "The Almighty" 
  • 8x hero unlocks 
  • 2x friend invite codes 
  • Alpha location 
  • A fully animated custom card to implement into a deck

Become A Hero | $790   ( Limited )

  • "Immediate" access to the game 
  • Unlock ALL Alpha heroes 
  • Join the Developers as a "Producer"
  • 4x friend invite codes 
  • CUSTOM in-game title of your choosing
  •  A fully animated card 
  • Work with our developers on designing a deck around your card to act as a hero card 

Stretch Goals

We'll be giving more to our backers from all campaigns, as well as adding to the core of the game with rewards. 

$5,000 - Alternate Hero Artwork

All backers will vote on a hero / faction combination to receive an alternate artwork to be unlocked. These alternate arts will be timed exclusives for backers. Maybe you want to see Rita with Genesis technology, or a demonic Aberion, or maybe even Patient Zero before he was fully claimed by the infection. Let us know, and it'll get done!

Voting will commence shortly after the goal is reached, and only backers may vote. However, this tier will repeat EVERY $5,000. So, those that have backed early on will get to vote more times than those who show up late to the party.

$10,000 - Additional Hero Unlocks

All backers of any level from all campaigns will receive an additional hero unlock, stacking with however many hero unlocks they currently have.

This stretch goal will repeat every time it's doubled. So a second hero unlock will be given at 20,000 and a third at 40,000 ect. 

$20,000 - Hero Lore Expansion

Learn more about the Lore of the Heroes you play as with a Hero Lore section. Each hero will have information on who they are, their past, their home, and and what's next potentially.

$50,000 - T.B.A.

Further stretch goals will be announced at a later date.

PARTNERS

Our first partnered I.P. is Luminous Ages, who are bringing their amazing fantasy world and artwork to Infinity Heroes. The creator, Antonios Christou, is a creator from our home soil of Australia, and we're excited to have him on board as the first official partner.

THE STUDIO  

Lightmare Studios is a Game Development and Training facility comprised of some of the best talent the industry has to offer. In over a decade of operation, Lightmare has trained over 2,000 junior game developers in Australia. Their most successful launch titles to date have been Infinity Wars, a free-to-play trading card game launched on Steam in 2014, and Omni, a third person MOBA title launched in the Philippines a few years earlier.  

BECOME AN INFINITY HERO AND UNLOCK EXCLUSIVE LIMITED TIME OFFER REWARDS
story_txt:
Infinity Heroes is a simultaneous turn-based strategy card game for mobile and PC which promises an evolved playing experience with the introduction of pre-defined decks that you can hot swap between every turn. Gameplay has been designed to let you jump into the action, whether you’re a casual player or competitive streamer. Games can also be played at a competitive level without spending a cent. 

 
Strategic Simultaneous TurnsSimultaneous turns are a special game mechanic for Infinity Heroes. Players initiate their planning phases simultaneously with everything resolving at once. In this system, based on our previous game Infinity Wars, a whole new level of strategy has been added to the card strategy genre that forces players to predict and outmanoeuvre their opponents. Support? Attack? Defend? The choice is yours!Taking turns in order is simple, there’s usually one or two good moves and the rest are subpar. However, with simultaneous turns, a psychological element is added (like Poker) where your opponent’s turn directly affects how you play.WINNING YOUR BATTLESThe battlefield has limited spaces available giving a greater importance on unit placement. If too many small unit cards are placed down rapidly, players may miss out of the opportunity to play more impactful units. Thus, moving units between lanes can (and will) become more difficult.This is balanced out by a hand refill mechanic where 4 cards are refilled at the end of each turn. This provides players with adequate time and information to react to an opponent’s action.Through the implementation of lanes, we’ve constructed a MOBA-like experience to allow for strategic decisions to respond to specific threats on the battlefield.CRAFT PERSONALIZED HEROES, SPELLS AND CARDSThis feature has been made with creatives in mind. We’re providing players with the chance to bring their creations to life in Infinity Heroes. Our in-game hero deck designer allows for artwork to be uploaded and applied to a player’s cards. From there, players will be able to name heroes, set their power levels and costs, give them effects, and upload their decks online to show off their creations.Like dinosaurs? Make 'em! Vampires? Sure, why not? Garlic spells? (is that a thing?). The point here is, the option is there to create ANYTHING...within reason. We've provided players with the freedom to become the heroes they want to be!ASSEMBLE YOUR HERO LINE-UPPlayers can pick three Heroes for their line-up. As each turn begins, players can pick a hero from their line-up to take into that turn. The hero selected will determine which cards are drawn for that turn, what ultimates are accessed, and the hero power. This allows multiple strategies and strengths in a line-up for players to adapt their gameplay strategy as the game progresses.These three Heroes each have a unique pool of cards under their command. At the start of each turn, you will select which hero will lead your assault. This will determine which deck your next card will come from. This system turns deck building into a dynamic part of your gameplay experience because you tweak your deck to your preferences at each and every turn.GET SPOILT We’ve developed Infinity Heroes with variety in mind. With a rotating roster of heroes, players are spoilt for choice! Our most recent Hero Spotlight on Aberion, will give you some insight on how we design and plan out decks:REWARDSBacking our project unlocks a bunch of long lasting in game rewards. story:
Short Summary

RoughEdge Software is your basic "born in the garage" game studio.  A few guys got together and decided that they wanted to build games that they were interested in playing; RoughEdge was born.  With the advent of mobile gaming we decided to try our hand at it.  Realizing that most people are interested in either free or cheap games we decided to try both.  Thus we released Aleeoop and Attack of the Zombie Chipmunks.  We've learned a lot from our experience and feel that building this sequel will give us a chance to demonstrate what we've learned as well as put out a fun and addictive game.

What is this game?

Expanding on the story of the first game, the second continues
the prairie dog militia fight against the invading zombie chipmunks.  In story mode, you defend the prairie dog burrows by deploying your forces in the various holes.  Survive the onslaught to save the prairie dog nation!

In survival mode, you must hold out as long as possible against the ever advancing zombie chipmunks.  This mode is similar to the original game with the addition of the weapons and items.


Why are we making this game?

We want to make this game in order to continue the storyline.  The first game met with favorable reviews so we feel that expanding on the IP would continue that success.  Also, the first game was self-funded which forced us to scale back the scope of the project.  With this version, we'd like to be able to include some of the features that were left out of the first one, such as the more tactical story mode.

Features:
 - Story Mode
   - Deploy forces to defend the prairie dog nation on a tactical map
   - Take control of one specific location for real time battle
   - Use earned gold to purchase equipment upgrades
   - Survive the set onslaught
   - Story told through in game comic panels
 - Survival Mode
   - How long can you hold out?
   - Use items unlocked from story mode to upgrade your defensive hole
   - Survive the unlimited onslaught

What your contribution will mean to us?

Your contributions will help us hire the necessary artist(s) to complete this game.  Our first game was self-funded, meaning we weren't able to incorporate many of the ideas that will now be included in its sequel, given full funding.

What We Need & What You Get

We are looking for $10,000 dollars to complete the sequel to our first successful Attack of the Zombie Chipmunk mobile game for the WinPhone.  By raising the necessary funds we can hire the staff we need to complete as well as keep the final cost of the game to $.99.  If we end up raising more than our goal we will look to release the game on iOS ($13,000) and Android ($18,000) as well.  At $25,000 we will release an XBLA version.  We're offering some awesome perks for your support!

The Impact

Your contributions will allow the development team to focus on continuing the story that so many of our fans wish we would continue!  In addition, we will be able to bring on additional staff to make our game as fun and enjoyable as possible.  We have released a couple other games; Aleeoop, Kubus and  several educational apps all for the WinPhone.  A successful campaign and release will allow us to begin branching out into other platforms such as iOS and Android!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute financially that is ok!  Please share our campaign with your friends and family.  Our link is:
 
www.indiegogo.com/AotZC2
 
Don't forget you can use the SHARE tools located on your screen to share with facebook and twitter communities!

story:
Update: We Made It!

With a flurry of last minute activity, together we managed to bring back Photon from the 80s for a 30th Birthday Party. Thank you for everyone's help.

We'll be hosting the birthday party July 25-27th in Laurel, Maryland for XP LaserSport. You can still attend. Watch xplasersport.com for more information and to get your tickets if you didn't make it in time for the campaign.


Phocon: A Laser Tag 30th Birthday Party

Photon was the original commercial laser tag experience. The first Photon location opened its doors in 1984 near Dallas, Texas. Laser tag is 30 years old this year!

To commemorate the fun, excitement and competition laser tag has brought to all of us over the past 30 years, Jason Bock the Laser Tag Guy and Marc Mueller of XP LaserSport are going to bring back Photon for a last "hurrah" this summer.

This may be your last chance to try the granddaddy of all laser tag equipment or to relive one of your 80's fantasies.

Raising Funds to Rework the Equipment

Marc has over 40 functional Photon pods at XP LaserSport, but due to time, the batteries were shot the last time we tried to play Photon.

There is also need for cleaning some of the equipment after water damage suffered this winter and testing the base equipment like the radio and game computer.

We want to make Photon pristine for your enjoyment.

In addition, we're planning a little birthday bash with a banquet and special guests like George Carter, Photon's inventor and founder.

  • Your contribution will be used to repair and replace Photon equipment for the Armageddon Laser Tag tournament and the July 25-27th Birthday Celebration.
  • Your contribution will also be used to pay for a birthday celebration banquet on the 26th near Laurel.

Contribute and You Can Play Photon

If you contribute at least $120 towards this cause, you'll be entitled to join everybody at this 30th birthday party and play Photon. While you may have the opportunity to join the festivities later, we won't be able to have the party at all if you don't help us reach our goal.

Be One of the First 15 to Contribute

The first 15 to contribute at the $120 or higher level will receive a special remastered version of LightSport on DVD from Yo Vinny! productions. This new edition will feature footage not used in the original video.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help:

  • Spread the world about Phocon and the 30th Birthday Party to your friends and former teammates.
  • You can use the Indiegogo share tools to get the word out.

Will you help us let the light shine one more time?


Frequently Asked Questions


Photon warriors everywhere are talking about our campaign.We've posted some of your best questions and the answers here...

Can't I just wait and pay later to go to Phocon?

Well, maybe. But we will be unable to update the equipment, buy new batteries and confirm the event unless this IndieGoGo campaign is successful. In other words, if we don't reach the goal here there will be no Phocon. Please contribute now to make sure the event is a reality and a success.

Also, we will be limiting the number of Gamma Warrior (unlimited play) tickets to make sure that all Gamma Warriors get all the Photon they want during the weekend. Contributing now guarantees your spot.

Does my credit card (or paypal) get charged immediately or only if the campaign makes it?

According to Indiegogo, you will be charged immediately and your money will be refunded if we don't make our goal. We aren't about to let that happen, of course.

If I contribute less than $120 to keep the light shining and find out later I can actually attend the event, will I be able to?

Yes, we'll be selling tickets to the event afterwards (probably at $5-10 more than the perks here). If you donate to this campaign at any level, you will be able to upgrade (pay the difference) to get a ticket. If there are a lot of Photon Warriors, we may place a limit on the number of unlimited play perks to make sure you get your money's worth.

If I contribute with the $120 perk, will I be able to buy additional games on the party weekend?

Probably. It will depend on the number of unlimited players. If you can buy an extra individual game, it will probably be $5-6 per game. You will only be allowed to play if you purchase a perk here or later purchase or upgrade to an event ticket. In other words, you can't skip this campaign and show up to play one game...sorry.

Do I have to be on a team to play?

Absolutely not. This is not a tournament. While there may be some team "grudge" games, you'll be able to play games at all levels of skill and experience.

Will I be able to run when I play?

You'll get to play Photon like you always did, which means you must move in a safe and controlled manner. This means you can move quickly if you move in a safe and controlled manner.

Can I bring my son/daughter with me to play? What is the age requirement?

Yes, your whole family is invited to participate. Each perk is good for one person or you can wait to buy a "ticket" once the campaign succeeds. There is no age requirement, but we will have a height requirement of 48" or taller for players due to the size and weight of the equipment.

story:
This 2014 CrossFit Games will be Pip's second appearance. Before CrossFit, Pip competed at International Elite level in Trampolining, Power Tumbling, Acrobatic Gymnastics and Canoe Slalom. Proving herself as an accomplished athlete.

The funding Pip receives will go towards her accommodation and travel expenses. Representing your country/region at the CrossFit Games is a great achievement and an amazing experience, but it's also a costly one.

Due to the distance travelled and timing of the event Pip will be based overseas, unable to continue her part time work for over a month.

Any support you can offer through this campaign allows Pip to focus on her training and preparation for the Games this year.
