On the other hand, you can also help by telling others about this campaign. Please share the link to this page with as many people as you can, post it on Facebook, Twitter, Google+, blogs, and anything else! 
 
To know more about Enola, follow this link. You can also follow me on Twitter @TheDomaginarium and @magnolia_fan for updates on Enola and other things..

story:
Dear funders, we would like to bring to your attention an unbelievably epic GPS outdoor game based on mobile application. Similar to “Capture the Flag” game TownEscape offers fun and unique gaming experience where "TownEscapers" (You!) tend to compete outdoors with each other to win real tangible products. A local town serves as a virtual playground, where all users' location and movements are identified via GPS signal emitted from their mobile devices. The game will be available on iOS, Android, Windows and Blackberry operating systems. On all of these marketplaces this mobile application will be free of charge. After downloading TownEscape on your mobile device, you will be able to use full version of our game!

Step By Step Guide - How It Works?

The purpose of this game is to create fun and unique experience for users, while spending time outdoors with your friends and other people. The most important part is that by competing with others, users are able to win real prizes and products. Your dream is much closer than you think! For example, you can win a car (or any other product) of your dreams just by having fun and competing with others players. Everything now is in your hands!

Step 1 - Download TownEscape on your mobile device

TownEscape will organize most competitions itself. TownEscapers first download the mobile application and when they access it they will see a list of location-based competitions available. Based on TownEscaper’s location, user will be presented with a list of existing or up-coming competitions held in his/her city or the closest city where competitions are being held, for example New York. The list will include different competitions and each of them will have a category, name, short description, number of entrants, final prize and the entrance fee.

By pressing on one of the competitions, TownEscaper will be directed to a full description about this particular competition. In order to take part in one of the competitions user will have to pay an entrance fee (usually small one) or there would be also free competitions. Moreover, the user will be allowed to take part only in one active competition at a time.

Step 2 - Entering Competition

This is where all the fun part starts! After TownEscaper paid the entrance fee he/she will directly receive a map, where his/her current location will be shown (red), the location of the virtual prize (blue) and location of other users (green) participating in this particular game (competition). 

The time in a header shows duration of the competition and when it will finish. Apart from the main menu, when user entered a particular competition, he/she will be presented with a new button called Tools. When TownEscapers will press on Tools tab, they will see a list of available in-game tools they can utilize in this particular competition or if they don’t have any tools purchased before - they will be offered to buy them. At the launch of the game, we will introduce the following in-app purchases (in-game tools):

• Deactivation – Deactivates your opponent for 5 minutes and deactivates him/her from re-catching a product from you.

• Mass Deactivation - Deactivates all your opponents within 100m (328 feet) radius for 5 minutes and deactivates them from re-catching a product from you.

• Invisibility – Makes you invisible for other TownEscapers for 5 minutes. Can’t use this tool when time left (duration) is less than 1 hour for a particular competition.

• Mines – Drops the prize from your opponent’s mobile device and he/she will be unable to pick it up for 2 minutes. You can put mines wherever you want to within a certain area specified for a certain competition.

• Clones – Creates two clones of you that will confuse your opponents.

• Blind – Makes your opponent “blind” by switching off his map for 5 minutes.

• Shield – You ignore all the tools used against you by your opponents for 5 minutes.

As we believe these in-game tools will help you to compete with each other and make your game even more fun to play. We will be adding more in-game tools in the future!

Step 3 – Catch a Virtual Prize on your Mobile Device!

After locating the virtual prize, TownEscaper will have to come closer than 50m (164 feet) in radius to virtual prize in order to catch it on his/her mobile device.

Step 4 - Escape from your Opponents!

Now eScape from the other users, as other TownEscapers will start chasing you as soon as you will catch a virtual prize on your mobile device. Moreover, your opponents will be able to steal the prize from your mobile device if they come closer to you than 50 meters (164 feet) in radius. Don’t forget to utilize your TownEscape in-game tools and your cunning to get away from your opponents!

Step 5 – Keeping your Virtual Prize on your Mobile Device!

When time for competition will elapse, a lucky TownEscaper who will have a virtual prize on his/her mobile device at that moment will win the real physical prize! And this will be one of you!

TownEscape Leveling System

Based on TownEscaper’s experience or achievements, he/she will be able to acquire TownEscape levels. There will be 10 different levels. Each level will enable users to select their own Game Logo or icons, which will allow other users to see it on their maps and smartphones. When reaching a new level TownEscaper will be presented with items which he can buy from our shop, available only for users who reached a certain TownEscape level. Moreover, each level will have a certain privileges. In order to acquire a certain level a user has to earn points or experience by participating in different contests.

TownEscape Shop

At our shop you will be able to get some products for free and others for an additional fee. At each level which you will reach you will be presented with new and cool products that will be available for those users who reached a certain TownEscape level. Moreover, you will be able to exchange your virtual points on products at our store!

Team Play

The ability to create a team in TownEscape will be available as soon as the person will reach 10th level in TownEscape. The team owner (team leader) will be able to sign in those escapers who have reached 5th level. Being part of the team allows you to enter different team competitions and to aid your teammates in various competitions. Moreover, there will be a team rank and those teams who will reach top 3 in the end of the year will be awarded with unique prizes. Apart from this, our shop will offer rare products for TownEscape teams available only to them.

Game Restrictions

In order to make this game fair for everyone, we had to come up with the following boundaries for TownEscape:

• If TownEscaper turned off the device, lost 3G connection or lost a GPS signal he will be allowed to recover within 2 minutes. Otherwise he will loose the prize at his last location and won’t be allowed to pick it up for 10 minutes.

• TownEscapers have to be located within a pre-defined area for a certain competition, while they are competing. If the user went outside these boundaries, he/she will need to return back into this area within 5 minutes or his/her prize will be lost (at his last location when he was inside this area) and he won’t be allowed to pick it up for 1 hour.

• If there will be a suspicion about particular user’s actions, we will track the user and disqualify him if he broke the rules without any notice.

If that user broke the rule and had a virtual prize on his/her mobile device, then the virtual prize will be dropped at his last location and will be discarded from this particular competition.

While we will be developing TownEscape there might more game restrictions to come in order to make the game fair for every user. We will keep you updated!

About Founders

You can find biography of Jaroslavs Conda and Ervin Jarvlepp below: 

Born in August 1989, Jaroslavs is very ambitious, self-motivated and hardworking individual with an entrepreneurial spirit, who was always passionate about business, sports, innovative technology and mobile games. His passion helped him to develop keen interest and expertise in IT-enabled businesses through studies in Business Management, Information Technologies and wide-reaching dealings with industry professionals. Master’s Degree at Lancaster University gave him an opportunity to get a deep insight in mobile gaming and e-commerce, which enabled him to see new opportunities in these areas and right now he is eager to make them a reality.

In his private life Jaroslavs used to be a professional tennis player with various achievements in his sports career. Apart from this he enjoys listening to house music (favorite music label: Defected Records), mountain & water skiing, travelling, racing (cars and bikes) and just having lots of fun. However, his biggest goal and passion is to deliver TownEscape to you!

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Ervin was born in Estonia, a country that is best known for its IT solutions. He was brought up in a very entrepreneurial environment and started working in the family business from an early age. Ervin always had a keen interest in technology, innovation, entrepeneurship and of course sports as well. He got the opportunity to combine all these when he became friends with Jaroslavs during the Master’s studies at Lancaster University and the two of them came up with TownEscape. In his professional career Ervin opened a translation agency Lionspell and co-founded a technology firm Real Time Cloud, after having turned down a job offer from one of the Big Four audit firms.Ervin’s biggest hobby is martial arts and he has practiced them for more than 8 years. In addition, he loves mountain skiing, travelling, cooking and one of his greatest passions is trying out cool new tech gadgets.

That is why Ervin can proudly say that TownEscape is a game that he really wants to play himself and is sure that others would enjoy it too.

Perks

We hope you will like our perks and we highly appreciate your support!

Stretch Goals

With your kind support we hope to reach our following goals! Thank you!

 

Your money will be spent wisely!

Through your support we are raising the full budget in order to develop and deliver TownEscape to you! If we will be successfully funded, and this will definitely happen, then with your support we will be able to deliver TownEscape on 4 different operating systems, deliver to you our amazing perks and launch the game successfully while being confident that it will run smoothly. Dear our funders we need you to help us to make our dream come true! Also do not hesitate to leave any feedback for us and please spread the word about our project! Thank you very much!  

We are planning to launch TownEscape in August 2013!

Please follow us on our Website, Facebook and Twitter pages!

TownEscape’s status will turn into developing stage just after this amazing offer to help us will finish and, yes, once again thank you for your support our dear potential TownEscape users!

Moreover, you will be able to exchange your virtual points on products at our store!
Team Play
The ability to create a team in TownEscape will be available as soon as the person will reach 10th level in TownEscape. The team owner (team leader) will be able to sign in those escapers who have reached 5th level. Being part of the team allows you to enter different team competitions and to aid your teammates in various competitions. Moreover, there will be a team rank and those teams who will reach top 3 in the end of the year will be awarded with unique prizes. Apart from this, our shop will offer rare products for TownEscape teams available only to them.
Game Restrictions
In order to make this game fair for everyone, we had to come up with the following boundaries for TownEscape:
• If TownEscaper turned off the device, lost 3G connection or lost a GPS signal he will be allowed to recover within 2 minutes. Otherwise he will loose the prize at his last location and won’t be allowed to pick it up for 10 minutes.
• TownEscapers have to be located within a pre-defined area for a certain competition, while they are competing. If the user went outside these boundaries, he/she will need to return back into this area within 5 minutes or his/her prize will be lost (at his last location when he was inside this area) and he won’t be allowed to pick it up for 1 hour.
• If there will be a suspicion about particular user’s actions, we will track the user and disqualify him if he broke the rules without any notice.
If that user broke the rule and had a virtual prize on his/her mobile device, then the virtual prize will be dropped at his last location and will be discarded from this particular competition.
While we will be developing TownEscape there might more game restrictions to come in order to make the game fair for every user. We will keep you updated!
About Founders
You can find biography of Jaroslavs Conda and Ervin Jarvlepp below: 
Born in August 1989, Jaroslavs is very ambitious, self-motivated and hardworking individual with an entrepreneurial spirit, who was always passionate about business, sports, innovative technology and mobile games. His passion helped him to develop keen interest and expertise in IT-enabled businesses through studies in Business Management, Information Technologies and wide-reaching dealings with industry professionals. Master’s Degree at Lancaster University gave him an opportunity to get a deep insight in mobile gaming and e-commerce, which enabled him to see new opportunities in these areas and right now he is eager to make them a reality.
In his private life Jaroslavs used to be a professional tennis player with various achievements in his sports career. Apart from this he enjoys listening to house music (favorite music label: Defected Records), mountain & water skiing, travelling, racing (cars and bikes) and just having lots of fun. However, his biggest goal and passion is to deliver TownEscape to you!
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Ervin was born in Estonia, a country that is best known for its IT solutions. He was brought up in a very entrepreneurial environment and started working in the family business from an early age. Ervin always had a keen interest in technology, innovation, entrepeneurship and of course sports as well. He got the opportunity to combine all these when he became friends with Jaroslavs during the Master’s studies at Lancaster University and the two of them came up with TownEscape. In his professional career Ervin opened a translation agency Lionspell and co-founded a technology firm Real Time Cloud, after having turned down a job offer from one of the Big Four audit firms.Ervin’s biggest hobby is martial arts and he has practiced them for more than 8 years. In addition, he loves mountain skiing, travelling, cooking and one of his greatest passions is trying out cool new tech gadgets.
That is why Ervin can proudly say that TownEscape is a game that he really wants to play himself and is sure that others would enjoy it too.
Perks
We hope you will like our perks and we highly appreciate your support!

Stretch Goals
With your kind support we hope to reach our following goals! Thank you!

 
Your money will be spent wisely!
Through your support we are raising the full budget in order to develop and deliver TownEscape to you! If we will be successfully funded, and this will definitely happen, then with your support we will be able to deliver TownEscape on 4 different operating systems, deliver to you our amazing perks and launch the game successfully while being confident that it will run smoothly. Dear our funders we need you to help us to make our dream come true! Also do not hesitate to leave any feedback for us and please spread the word about our project! Thank you very much!  
We are planning to launch TownEscape in August 2013!
Please follow us on our Website, Facebook and Twitter pages!
TownEscape’s status will turn into developing stage just after this amazing offer to help us will finish and, yes, once again thank you for your support our dear potential TownEscape users!

story:
Greetings everyone, I am extremely fortunate and proud to stand in front of you once again with a new project that will unveil a recently discovered race to the loyal and most devoted fans of fantasy football.

     During this festive occasion, it is with sincere joy and honor to present a football team that is extremely aggressive, with the capacity to intimidate any race that would dare show itself on the football pitch.

      This project is a continuation of the Necronomicon Cthulhu Mythos, it is one of my first projects that combines the horrific personages of HP Lovecraft and fantasy football. This sculpting project encompasses three years of dedicated passion for not only myself but all the fans of this game.

     A percentage of the benefits obtained in this campaign will be donatet to FUMBBL to give suport to their web, your help is welcomed.

https://fumbbl.com

Necronomicon II it is a continuation of the same collection Necronomicon I , this time let's dive straight in the city of R'Lyeh and start discovering Fantasy Football players we can find .
 


SHARKS DEEP ONES

     Another critical component of any Cthulhu Mythos football team, are the Deep Ones, most infamously from the Shark blood line. This ancient bloodline inhabited the depths of the forgotten city of R’lyeh. They are currently threatened with extinction because of the encroachment of fathomless numbers of humans into their ocean environment.

     The Shark Deep Ones are strong, agile, and extremely adaptable to any style of gameplay or strategy. They are capable of being included on any football team roster. i.e. (Humans, Norses ,Orcs, Elves, Dark Elves, Ratmens, Lizards ,Vampires and even Chaos or Plague)



And further on....



                        

PERKS:

   8 euros  - Choose a Shark (free shipping)

   69 euros  - Standard team: Estandar/Human roster:
Cthulhu BG x2 throwers x4 blitzers x4 runners x5 linemans +free shipping
   69 euros - Heavy team: heavy/orco roster :
Cthulhu BG x2 throwers x4 blitzers x4 blockers x5 linemans +free shipping
   69 euros - Speed team: Specialists/ratmen roster
Cthulhu BG x2 throwers x4 runners x2 blitzers x7 linemans +free shipping
 
    69 euros - R'lyeh Team/Nordik roster
Cthulhu BG x2 throwers x2 blitzers x2 blockers x2 runners x7 linemans +free shipping.
   150 euros - all sharks  (36 differents models) +free shipping
   300 euros - all miniatures of this campaign (around 70 minis)
    1000 euros (perk exclusive) - All miniatures painted of this campaign ,the same as the images of the panel  ( around 40 miniatures).


    *10 euros - Starbowl funders: this perk is only for funders Starbowl (previous campaign), 40% discount for the level you want (except field).


STREACH GOALS

   When we reach 500 euros ,unlocks the field make by FFfields

   When we reach 2000 euros ,unlocks all Sharks mutants ,sculpt by Rykar
 
   When we reach 3000 euros ,unlocks all Sharks starplayers ,sculpt by Rykar

   When we reach 4000 euros ,unlocks all Sharks players locked , sculpt by Rykar

   When we reach 5000 euros ,unlocks miniature H P Lovecraft Free for all funders,sculpt by Rykar

   When we reach 6000 euros ,unlocks Yog-Shothoth trophy ,sculpt by Rykar

   When we reach 7000 euros ,unlocks Shub-Niggurath trophy ,sculpt by Rykar

   When we reach 9000 euros ,unlocks all Deep ones sculpt by Pedro Ramos
 
   When we reach 10.000 euros ,unlocks miniature Miskatonik Jones sculpt by Pedro Ramos ,Free for all funders.

   When we reach 11.000 euros ,unlocks Azathoth trophy ,sculpt by Rykar

   When we reach 12.000 euros , unlocks Cthulhu trophy ,sculpt by Rykar





The miniatures of Necronomicon I are available on the Impact Miniatures web.


CREDITOS

story:
What is Casino Night?

We are excited to be gearing up for our fourth annual Casino Night philanthropy event, hosted by the brothers of Phi Delta Theta and the sisters of Alpha Phi on the 6th of March, as well as our second annual Parents and Alumni Casino Night on the evening of March 7th. The first night of the event will consist of Maryland Greek organizations competing against each other to win one of two $500 donations in their honor for a philanthropic cause of their choice. 

The second night, Saturday, March 7th from 6-10pm, is open exclusively to parents and alumni and will include a night of games, music, silent auction, and cocktail style hors d'oeuvres. Incorporating feedback from last year, we have moved the parent and alumni night to the Terrapin Turf, a local restaurant. A wide variety of nonalcoholic beverages, beer, wine, and spirits will be available. 

What we need and what you get:

We're hoping to exceed the $21,000 raised by last year's event. We have developed three donor tiers for the event, but contributions of any size are greatly appreciated. 

Below is a breakdown of donation levels and the benefits of each.

  • Donors with a contribution of any size will be recognized in our event booklet.
  • Our Bronze level donors with contributions of $100 will be recognized in our event booklet as well as on the event t-shirt that will be sold the night of the event**
  • Our Silver level donors with contributions of $250 will be receive the bronze level benefits plus recognition on a banner to be draped from the front of the chapter house leading up to, and during the event
  • Our Gold level donors with contributions of $500 or more will receive the silver level benefits with the addition of being an honorary table sponsor

**Each individual/party that donates will receive a complimentary t-shirt. 

Although the this campaign is not noted as a benefitting a specific 501(c)3, each organizations being supported is, and as such all donations are tax-deductible. We will be making donations to each charity in your name, and will return receipts to you for tax purposes. 

Where does the money go?

The proceeds from this year's event will go towards the following charities:

ALS Association

Established in 1985, The ALS Association is the only national non-profit organization fighting Lou Gehrig’s Disease on every front. By leading the way in global research, providing assistance for people with ALS through a nationwide network of chapters, coordination multidisciplinary care through certified clinical care centers, and fostering government partnerships, The Association builds hope and enhance quality of life while aggressively searching for new treatments and a cure.

Alpha Phi Foundation

The Alpha Phi Foundation raises money for women's cardiac care through research grants and hospital treatments to help those in need. In addition, the foundation raises money for their forget-me-not fund, which gives money to Alpha Phi sisters in need and their families. For example, when some of the Delta Zeta Chapter’s sisters' homes were affected by hurricane sandy, the forget-me-not fund gave her family a grant to rebuild their home. Lastly, the foundation provides scholarships to sisters who are excelling while in school.

PG County Shock Trauma 

When students get injured and need medical attention, PG County Hospital is one of the main primary-care providers that they are taken to. Our members have determined that contributing to this organization, and specifically the Shock Trauma Center, is an investment into our own health and futures. The funds donated to the Shock Trauma Center will be used to improve quality of care. 

Medfund 

Medfund is a cost-effective medical aid program that was established in La Paz, Bolivia in 2014 operating under the NGO: “Cup of Cold Water Ministries.” This organization provides financial aid and medical relief of abandoned patients with extreme needs in the “Hospital General” in the City of La Paz. Volunteers find people with urgent medical needs, and then evaluate the degree of urgency and the individual’s financial condition to determine if aid is justified. Medfund then pays for the person’s most urgent medical bills and treatment, with volunteers assisting the patient throughout their hospital experience and visiting them regularly until they are stable.

This organization is gaining momentum and recognition in La Paz, and has the potential to have even more significant impact through your support. The American dollar has a much higher purchasing power in Bolivia, with some patients needing only $20 to survive. Medfund works at 0% overhead, meaning that 100% of your donations go to medicine, patient operation, or treatments.

Terps Against Hunger 

Terps Against Hunger is a student-run organization at the University of Maryland that aims to fight hunger and food insecurity in the DC Metro area through packaging nutritious, nonperishable meals and educating students about the impact of hunger domestically and how they can make a difference locally. The organization operates through Kids Against Hunger – DC Metro, a volunteer-run nonprofit. In 2014, Terps Against Hunger packed over 210,000 meals, all of which were donated to shelters and food banks in local communities. If we match the $21,000 raised from last year’s Casino Night, the donation to this organization would be used to fund a joint community service event with the members of Phi Delta Theta and Alpha Phi, packaging at least 50,000 meals.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share our campaign with friends and family. Although it may not be possible to contribute financially, we'd love to spread the word about these great charitable organizations.

story:
EMOJIS have accidentally entered the earth realm and it is your duty to catch all of them before they cause some trouble. But remember... It's safer not to play alone!  So bring your friends with you, make a group and hunt together, trade the emojis you catch, see other adventurers around you and make new friends.

  

  

 

 

Why play alone when you can play with friends. That is the mindset EMOJI The Game is built on.  The real-life interaction of the players is the most crucial mechanic in the game.

The game is designed in such a matter that the more people you interact with in the real world, the better you progress in the game.

Of course, you can be a lonely wolf, play the game alone an still have blast! But you get extra benefits if you play with other players, for example, more XP, harder to get EMOJIS etc.

 

  

Now that Emojis have entered our realm, two different teams that compete with each other have emerged to catch all of those Emojis. You must join one of those teams and work together with your teammates to return all the Emojis to their realm. 

 

 

 

Currently, we have made 100+ EMOJIS all with unique characteristics and personalities. Most of them are friendly but some of them might try to trick you so take care!

  

 

If you've found an EMOJI on the map click on in to enter their world or if you'd like you can enter their world. In order to catch any EMOJI, you will need to shoot him with energy and be careful not to miss!

  

  

 

If you have a rare EMOJI that a friend needs, you can share it! Ask him to trade an EMOJI for one of yours. Or trade both any EMOJI in order to get a BABY EMOJI.

  

 

No RPG would be complete without the ability to form a group and play with your friends. In EMOJI The Game you can do just that. Any game is more fun with friends!

  

 

Want to know who else is playing the game near you?  That is why we made it possible to see other players on the map for your area.

  

 

Caught en EMOJI that you love? Take a selfie with it and share it with all your friends !

story:
Live Hard is an uninhabited island survival simulation game. The character finds himself in an uninhabited area without any connection to the outer space. You struggle for existence using all the means and resources you are able to make use of. Pelting tropical rains, droughts, endless winters, wild animals, exotic diseases and hunger.


Storyline

Our hero's name is Ivan. He's a factory worker from Syberia where he worked all his life. One day, while he was watching a TV program about tempting and mysterious far away islands, something ticked in his head. The idea of living on an inhabited island seemed wonderful! Shining sun, deep blue ocean, fresh exotic fruits.. and all of that for free! It sounded like heaven on Earth! And so he realised that his life dream would be to live that way. No job, no responsibilities... only a neverending vacation!

So, Ivan made a decision immidiately. He sold his flat and got just enough money to buy a business class one-way ticket to the Island. With no regrets Ivan said “Bye” to Russia and started his way to the new life!

But something went wrong during the flight. The plane crushed! The only person survived was our hero with his balalaika.

On the first page of the story the future seemed not bad at all. Ivan was alive, at the Paradise Island, like the dream came true! But the first appearance can be deceptive. It turned out that the Island was not as perfect as Ivan thought.

A wide range of struggles is waiting for our hero in near future. Predators, freezing winters (as cold as Syberian) and many others. Now Ivan has to learn how to survive: where to get food, how to set fire and even how to construct buildings.


Key features

  • Island exploration: the game world is generated for each player individually. 
  • A huge variation of sandbox: many ways to solve one and the same problems. 
  • 5 parameters: health, temperature, hunger, thirst, tiredness. 
  • Crafting of all the items needed: tools, weapon, clothes, tableware. 
  • Food: at first you are like "Eww! Eating THIS?!", but later you crave for more. 
  • Building: you need a place to sleep, to store your supplies and to hide from animals. 
  • Farming: you're becoming a happy farmer. A lonely happy farmer. 
  • Hunting, fishing and domestication of animals: find yourself a furry friend. Or just eat it!


About gameplay

At the first sight the game may look more like some "Happy Farm" stuff and most people wonder how can it be of any interest for hardcore gamers? But we don't consider indie and hardcore to be always associated with clumsy dark or even inefficient graphics. Our graphics is colourful, vivid and lively.

Visualisation is in contrast with the very idea of the game — the re-born of a human sunk in urbanism, his re-connection with nature. There is no particular aim except for survival at any cost. The game is based on the variation of combinations, so that you can solve one and the same problem in different ways.

Except for crafting part there are a lot of random situations: heavy rain (the unprotected fire will die out), rotten food, unknown illness, tsunami, forest fire, wild animals and many many more. These events will considerably diversify the gameplay and won't let you get bored.

The exploration of the island is the most important part of the gameplay. The map is generated for every player individually so you won't be able to act according some unified scheme. We try to vary the gaming surroundings as it is very important for us to make this little island trip a new and exciting adventure for you.

In the game special attention is also paid to the change from one season to another. The character finds himself on the island in spring and he has to make himself familiar to it before the first winter comes. On the one hand it's easier to get fresh water in winter, but on the other hand you have to improve your avatar's dwelling. You need to know how to build a house and how to maintain fire. And don't forget that animals get the way more agitated in winter since it's getting harder to find food for them too, so try not to become an easy prey for them.

The death of the character means the end of the game. No re-spawns, no saves.


Screenshots and concepts


About us

We're a small group of developers from Perm (Russia). There were six of us who worked on the game. All of us worked with online-games and applications for social networks before, but once we understood that we wanted to create something more complicated and versatile.

Any game development project is a risk and Live Hard is no exception. We could finish this project even without IndieGoGo, but you help can significantly speedup the process.

For the last several month we were able to implement game engine and basic gameplay elements, but we still need 2-3 month to finish all intended features and at least a month for gameplay testing.

Primary challenge is to add as much variety and replayability as possible. We want to make it so anytime you start a new island your playstyle can be completely different. We had paid much attention to map generation algorithm, changing environment and random events which won’t leave Ivan bored.

Secondary challenge is creating noticeable different game modes. Game world must be equally interesting to both casual and seasoned hardcore gamers. We a planning 3 main game modes: Casual, Hardcore and Nightmare. The last one will be available after release as a DLC. It will transform paradise island into real Hell on Earth.


Goals

  • $10 000 — We will be able to finish the game and publish it on Steam.
  • $15 000 — Nightmare Mode DLC. In this mode the island will transform into Hell on Earth. Ivan would have one hell of a day. 
  • $25 000 — Tablet version for iOS and Android.
story_txt:
Live Hard is an uninhabited island survival simulation game. The character finds himself in an uninhabited area without any connection to the outer space. You struggle for existence using all the means and resources you are able to make use of. Pelting tropical rains, droughts, endless winters, wild animals, exotic diseases and hunger.Storyline Our hero's name is Ivan. He's a factory 
worker from Syberia where he worked all his life. One day, while he was 
watching a TV program about tempting and mysterious far away islands, 
something ticked in his head. The idea of living on an inhabited island 
seemed wonderful! Shining sun, deep blue ocean, fresh exotic fruits.. 
and all of that for free! It sounded like heaven on Earth! And so he 
realised that his life dream would be to live that way. No job, no 
responsibilities... only a neverending vacation!

So, Ivan made a decision immidiately. He sold his flat and got just 
enough money to buy a business class one-way ticket to the Island. With 
no regrets Ivan said “Bye” to Russia and started his way to the new 
life!

But something went wrong during the flight. The plane crushed! The only person survived was our hero with his balalaika.

On the first page of the story the future seemed not bad at all. Ivan 
was alive, at the Paradise Island, like the dream came true! But the 
first appearance can be deceptive. It turned out that the Island was not
 as perfect as Ivan thought.

A wide range of struggles is waiting for our hero in near future. 
Predators, freezing winters (as cold as Syberian) and many others. Now 
Ivan has to learn how to survive: where to get food, how to set fire and
 even how to construct buildings. Key features

Island exploration: the game world is generated for each player individually. 

A huge variation of sandbox: many ways to solve one and the same problems. 

5 parameters: health, temperature, hunger, thirst, tiredness. 

Crafting of all the items needed: tools, weapon, clothes, tableware. 

Food: at first you are like "Eww! Eating THIS?!", but later you crave for more. 

Building: you need a place to sleep, to store your supplies and to hide from animals. 

Farming: you're becoming a happy farmer. A lonely happy farmer. 

Hunting, fishing and domestication of animals: find yourself a furry friend. Or just eat it!
About gameplayAt the first sight the game may look 
more like some "Happy Farm" stuff and most people wonder how can it be 
of any interest for hardcore gamers? But we don't consider indie and 
hardcore to be always associated with clumsy dark or even inefficient 
graphics. Our graphics is colourful, vivid and lively.

Visualisation is in contrast with the very idea of the game — the 
re-born of a human sunk in urbanism, his re-connection with nature. 
There is no particular aim except for survival at any cost. The game is 
based on the variation of combinations, so that you can solve one and 
the same problem in different ways.

Except for crafting part there are a lot of random situations: heavy 
rain (the unprotected fire will die out), rotten food, unknown illness, 
tsunami, forest fire, wild animals and many many more. These events will
 considerably diversify the gameplay and won't let you get bored.

The exploration of the island is the most important part of the 
gameplay. The map is generated for every player individually so you 
won't be able to act according some unified scheme. We try to vary the 
gaming surroundings as it is very important for us to make this little 
island trip a new and exciting adventure for you.

In the game special attention is also paid to the change from one season
 to another. The character finds himself on the island in spring and he 
has to make himself familiar to it before the first winter comes. On the
 one hand it's easier to get fresh water in winter, but on the other 
hand you have to improve your avatar's dwelling. You need to know how to
 build a house and how to maintain fire. And don't forget that animals 
get the way more agitated in winter since it's getting harder to find 
food for them too, so try not to become an easy prey for them.

The death of the character means the end of the game. No re-spawns, no saves. Screenshots and conceptsAbout usWe're a small group of developers from Perm 
(Russia). There were six of us who worked on the game. All of us worked 
with online-games and applications for social networks before, but once 
we understood that we wanted to create something more complicated and 
versatile.Any game development project is a risk and Live Hard is no exception.
 We could finish this project even without IndieGoGo, but you help can
 significantly speedup the process.
For the last several month we were able to implement game engine and 
basic gameplay elements, but we still need 2-3 month to finish all 
intended features and at least a month for gameplay testing.
Primary challenge is to add as much variety and replayability as 
possible. We want to make it so anytime you start a new island your 
playstyle can be completely different. We had paid much attention to map
 generation algorithm, changing environment and random events which 
won’t leave Ivan bored.
Secondary challenge is creating noticeable different game modes. Game
 world must be equally interesting to both casual and seasoned hardcore 
gamers. We a planning 3 main game modes: Casual, Hardcore and Nightmare.
 The last one will be available after release as a DLC. It will 
transform paradise island into real Hell on Earth.
Goals

$10 000 — We will be able to finish the game and publish it on Steam.

$15 000 — Nightmare Mode DLC. In this mode the island will transform into Hell on Earth. Ivan would have one hell of a day. 

$25 000 — Tablet version for iOS and Android.

story:
NEW REWARDS SYSTEM: You will be able to choose any model available on ROLLJORDAN.COM webstore. The offer is valid till the end of the campaign, if we reach the 10K mark after the campaign is over the reward will stay a 9.95€ single miniature.

Latest model to be added... more to come for a total of 17 different models.


Rolljordan miniatures has been active for over 10 years mainly as a painting service. Now we are making our own line of Fantasy Football miniatures to be used in games like Elf Bowl ™, Blood Bowl ™ and other Fantasy Football games.
In the past years we have run several successful campaigns bit under the Rolljordan line and the MK1881 Line. The company is composed of several entities such as Massimiliano Gallo our designer, Cosimo Auricchio production and sculpting, Christian Kirylo logistics, sculpting, and other freelancer artist such as Raffaele Stumpo the sculptor of this team and Chiafele Giuseppe our box art artist.

We are looking to crowdfunding to cover both the molding cost and the cost to have the additional models sculpted.


Level 2 - You get to choose any one models from the lineman, runner and thrower models.

Level 3 - You get to choose any one model from the Ulf or Berzerkers

Level 4 - You get the Snow Troll

Level 5 - You get one of each Ulf and Berzerkers

Level 6 - You get 10x of your choice from lineman, thrower and runner

Level 7 - You get a basic team of 12 models. 1 each Ulf and Berz + 6 between lineman, runner and throwers. 

Level 8 - You get the full team - 1 Snow Troll, 2 Berz, 2 Ulf, 2 runners, 2 trhower and 7 lineman All figures will be metal including the Troll. All figures will be different.

Level 9 - You get level 8 x 5

NEW STRETCH GOALS WILL BE STAR PLAYERS AND WILL START AT 7500€

BUT LEVEL 8 AND ABOVE ONLY CAN ADD THE ROLLJORDAN WEREWOLF WILHELM FOR 6.00€


Not many, all the process is almost completely under control.  The main risk can be a small delay in delivery as many factors such as suppliers are not under our control. The sculptor, the caster and have been booked and 10 of the models are already been sculpted and will go into molding as the campaign is running. The majority of the costs have been paid for.

story:
Hi my name is James Arndt and I'm a game developer. You can see some of my work and some of the game titles I've worked on at: www.jamesarndt3d.com

This project is all about bringing game development assets to fellow game developers at a very low cost. This works due to the nature of crowdfunding. With this pack I'm looking to bring developers mobile development ready assets. No ultra dense, detailed geometry with insane poly counts here. Most of the detail is put into the texturing. These aircraft will run efficiently on mobile phones and tablets and will allow the developer to put more into their terrains and world building. Keeping draw calls low is the key!

Let's start with what I need: In a nutshell, I need the time to create these assets. I can't dedicate time for a month building all of them and ignore the electricity bill, internet bill, rent, etc. I set my funding goal to cover myself financially, so that I can simply focus on art creation. This is my day job and my current focus.

Now on to what you get! There are (3) perk options on the right side of the page. The first $10 perk snags you any choice of (2) of the aircraft featured in the mockup. The $20 perk gains you any (4) you would like and lastly the full $30 gets you the entire (8) pack.

Models will be delivered in .FBX format, Maya .MB format and .OBJ formats. I will bundle all associated PSD and TGA textures with the models. I will also provide a Unity Package file for single import of all assets into your Unity project. The model assets will be usable in just about any game engine currently on the market.

Here is a list of the aircraft in the set:

  1. Cessna 172 Skyhawk - Civil Aircraft
  2. Piper Warrior PA-28 Cherokee - Civil Utility Aircraft
  3. Douglas DC3 - Airliner/Transport Aircraft
  4. Bombardier Lear Jet 60 - Business Jet
  5. Boeing 737 or 747 - Jet Airliner
  6. Airbus A380 or A340 - Jet Airliner
  7. Gulfstream IV G400 - Business Jet 
  8. Beechcraft Super King - Civil Utility Aircraft

Here is a graphic showing the aircraft that will be part of this set:

Now on to some technical details:

Exterior Models

  • 1,800 - 2,800 polygons for LOD0 (Your highest detail LOD)
  • 900 - 1,400 polygons for LOD1 (Second highest detail LOD)
  • 450 - 700 polygons for LOD2 (Lowest detail LOD)
  • 1024  x 1024 single PSD diffuse exterior texture
  • 256 x 256 Reflection Map texture

Interior Models (cabin)

  • 1,700 - 2,100 polygons for the interior (No LOD for interior)
  • 1024 x 1024 PSD diffuse interior, 1024 x 1024 PSD diffuse for gauges

Interior models will feature fully functional gauges for:  Airspeed, Altitude, Vertical Speed indicator, Engine RPMs and Compass. These gauges will feature needles that are on an atlased Needle Gauge PSD texture (using Alpha transparency), each mapped to a single polygon plane. This will create a transform that will have a proper pivot, and allow you to easily script it's rotation based on any value.

These aircraft will be set up to have a completely separate 3d model for exterior 3rd person views and a separate model for the internal cabin for 1st person viewing. The internal cabin model will of course have all viewable sections of the outside of the aircraft visible through the windows, i.e. struts, wheels, wing undersides, etc.

Take a close look at the completed exterior model for the Cessna 172 Skyhawk:

(Requires Unity Webplayer plugin)

Cessna 172 Skyhawk Web Demo

Here are some (proof of concept) images of the first Cessna Skyhawk exterior model completed. This will give folks an idea of the quality standard to expect from the pack.



This campaign should put into the hands of fellow developers, assets that will allow them to make the games they want to make. This will also allow "indie" developers to not break the bank while working on their projects. Due to the nature of crowdfunding I can afford to offer these assets at an insanely low price, compared to what they would cost at an online vendor such as Turbosquid, etc.

If you don't have a project that can make use of these, but know someone who might be working on a flight sim, or anything aircraft related let them know about this by using the sharing tools at the top of the page. You can also share this link:

http://www.indiegogo.com/projects/low-poly-aircraft-pack/x/2305754

story:
**********

Thank you for all you contributions. Funding is now closed. To purchase an AuraVisor please visit Damson Audio

********** 

 

A virtual reality head mounted computer (HMC) that works without a computer or smartphone. Free from the clutter of wires and the hassle of interchanging a smart phone. AuraVisor has an on-board Android based computer that allows you to experience the immersion of virtual reality, and all it offers, without breaking the budget. 

General Public Reaction

The following video captures the public's reaction while experiencing AuraVisor for the first time.

Virtual reality just got accessible to everyone.

Developing AuraVisor means virtual reality is now available for everyone, aimed at casual & pro gamers, intrepid explorers and experience junkies. The AuraVisor can be used straight from the box and doesn't require any specialist knowledge. 

The video below shows a demo of the headset rotating 360º with the hardware sensors and software all working.

Actual gameplay depicting head tracking movement in real time

AuraVisor has been carefully priced to make it accessible to everyone. 

AuraVisor is not just for entertainment, its applications will extend into education and beyond, the recently launched Google Expeditions is something we are very keen to explore and become involved in. VR can already be used to teach complicated medical studies, journey through the inside of the human body or to take a class of 6 years olds to the other side of the world... all without leaving the house.  

AuraVisor Overview

How it works

The AuraVisor has powerful on-board WiFi and a simple smart scrolling graphical user interface. Simply turn on, download and immerse yourself in whatever activity you like. 

Users have the ability to download more content, including games, videos and apps from the VR store. The VR store is based on, and linked to, the Google Play Store. You can add more content via micro SD storage. Watch movies in a realistic immersive environment and enjoy 360º content that you've filmed yourself.

We are working with a number of key partners to deliver more apps and content, including movies, live streaming events, games and educational experiences. There is already a huge selection of apps and videos ready to use. The AuraVisor will ship with a number of apps and games pre-installed to provide a true "out of the box" set up.

More apps are being added all the time. 

Viewing without wearing glasses

Adjustable optical lenses and depth of field sliders allow you to set up the viewing of your AuraVisor exactly to your own requirements. Leaving you free to view the AuraVisor without wearing glasses in most cases. The AuraVisor has been tested on a wide range of eye prescriptions from short to long sighted and with a strong astigmatism. Our feedback indicates that after set up the viewing is completely normal and extremely comfortable.

Detachable Faceplates

The AuraVisor will ship with one adult faceplate. More faceplates can be added if you are looking to share your AuraVisor.

We see significant educational applications and have therefore designed a faceplate specifically to be comfortable for children. This will provide great viewing and comfort for children aged from 4 upwards. Additional faceplates should cost no more than £19.99 / $29.99.

 Help spread the word

If you like what we're doing and want to help us succeed then please take the time to share our campaign and help us make 'Virtual History' as we bring Virtual Reality to the masses. Just click the button below

About Us

All parties have the credentials required to deliver the hardware and software eliminating risks associated with quality control and delivery. Prior to this campaign, James has already successfully funded and delivered Headbones via Kickstarter (please note that this project is not being delivered by Damson Audio). This should provide confidence that you are backing a project that will be well communicated and delivered. Please note that this project is not being delivered by Damson Audio. 

We are a small team battling against the likes of Facebook and HTC so that's why we need your help. We believe that doing another Kickstarter is the best and most efficient way for us to deliver this great product to the people believing in us and who want it most. People like you.

Can children use the AuraVisor?

As we mentioned above, there is a junior size faceplate. Check out the videos below of James' four year old daughter using it. These have been recorded in a totally natural environment and her reactions are completely genuine. Please note she was not wearing the child faceplate at the time of the recording. It should also be noted that, just as with any modern computer device, usage is strictly controlled by a parent or guardian. Parental controls will be available to stop minors downloading inappropriate content.

You can't fool children, and we felt that these videos demonstrate the power of the headset and that the AuraVisor is real, working and almost ready for mass production. We know some of you may be concerned about her being exposed to zombies, but she insisted and didn't have nightmares!

Why the AuraVisor will make a difference?

It frees your experience at an affordable price compared to other virtual reality headsets.

The AuraVisor doesn't tether you to a single platform like a PC, games console or smartphone. It frees you up to experience content however you choose. Connect to these platforms to expand your experiences or use the intuitive user interface to download games from the app store or add movies or video clips.

AuraVisor will make virtual reality a possibility that can be enjoyed by us all. Virtual reality has so much to offer. We're only seeing the tip of the iceberg. There's far more under the surface just waiting to be explored!

The opportunity to take The AuraVisor much further really exists. It's our goal to work with providers to deliver educational apps that allow teacher/lecturers/trainers a totally different learning experience. Imagine a world so immersive out children will actually want to learn.

What's left to do?

The software and hardware is ready. We will update software on an ongoing basis until we go into mass production. The only alterations we may consider would be changing the screen to an OLED screen to increase the battery and extend playback time. Ultimately, these are dependent on how successful we are... so help us shout Auravisor from the rooftops.

Most of the tooling is complete, the faceplates and strap are the final two components. Neither of which is expected to cause any delay to shipping.

Shipping, Warranty & Refunds

The AuraVisor will ship from hubs within the US, EU and China. Please be aware that our projected shipping date includes an allowance for us to ship by sea to the US and EU before distributing to your final address.

For most of the pledge levels shipping costs are as follows: 

To addresses in the US & UK £6
To addresses in the EU £20
Rest of World £25

International Backers

We're proud to have had so many backers from all over the world for our last campaign. We will ship AuraVisor worldwide, with the exception of politically or economically embargoed countries. Please note that you will be responsible for any duties, fees and taxes applicable to your region.

We will be offering a 12 months warranty on the product in the event of a manufacturing fault.

Unfortunately, due to the way that the project is being funded in advance by backers we are unable to offer refunds once you have confirmed your payment.

Brief Chinese Overview

AuraVisor 同样在中国有售，我们将从中国工厂直接快速发货。您也可以选择AuraVisor 中文版，更多的虚拟现实内容即将为您呈现。

We are a small team battling against the likes of Facebook and HTC so that's why we need your help. We believe that doing another Kickstarter is the best and most efficient way for us to deliver this great product to the people believing in us and who want it most. People like you.

These have been recorded in a totally natural environment and her reactions are completely genuine. Please note she was not wearing the child faceplate at the time of the recording. It should also be noted that, just as with any modern computer device, usage is strictly controlled by a parent or guardian. Parental controls will be available to stop minors downloading inappropriate content.


 
 PLAY  

Subtitles & Captions


English — English
English — English العربية — Arabic Català — Catalan Čeština — Czech Dansk — Danish Deutsch — German ελληνικά — Greek Español (España) — Spanish (Spain) Español (México) — Spanish (Mexico) Suomi — Finnish Français — French Gaeilge — Irish עברית — Hebrew हिन्दी — Hindi Hrvatski — Croatian Magyar — Hungarian Bahasa Indonesia — Indonesian Italiano — Italian 日本語 — Japanese 한국의 — Korean Bahasa Melayu — Malay Norsk bokmål — Bokmål Nederlands — Dutch Diné bizaad — Navajo Polski — Polish Português (Brasil) — Portuguese (Brazil) Português (Portugal) — Portuguese (Portugal) Română — Romanian Русский — Russian Slovenčina — Slovak Svenska — Swedish ภาษาไทย — Thai Türkçe — Turkish українська — Ukrainian tiếng Việt — Vietnamese יידיש — Yiddish 简体中文 — Chinese (Simplified) 繁體中文 — Chinese (Traditional)

Add track 


Make your video accessible in other languages and to deaf and hard-of-hearing backers.



You can't fool children, and we felt that these videos demonstrate the power of the headset and that the AuraVisor is real, working and almost ready for mass production. We know some of you may be concerned about her being exposed to zombies, but she insisted and didn't have nightmares!
Why the AuraVisor will make a difference?
It frees your experience at an affordable price compared to other virtual reality headsets.
The AuraVisor doesn't tether you to a single platform like a PC, games console or smartphone. It frees you up to experience content however you choose. Connect to these platforms to expand your experiences or use the intuitive user interface to download games from the app store or add movies or video clips.
AuraVisor will make virtual reality a possibility that can be enjoyed by us all. Virtual reality has so much to offer. We're only seeing the tip of the iceberg. There's far more under the surface just waiting to be explored!
The opportunity to take The AuraVisor much further really exists. It's our goal to work with providers to deliver educational apps that allow teacher/lecturers/trainers a totally different learning experience. Imagine a world so immersive out children will actually want to learn.


What's left to do?
The software and hardware is ready. We will update software on an ongoing basis until we go into mass production. The only alterations we may consider would be changing the screen to an OLED screen to increase the battery and extend playback time. Ultimately, these are dependent on how successful we are... so help us shout Auravisor from the rooftops.
Most of the tooling is complete, the faceplates and strap are the final two components. Neither of which is expected to cause any delay to shipping.
Shipping, Warranty & Refunds

 
The AuraVisor will ship from hubs within the US, EU and China. Please be aware that our projected shipping date includes an allowance for us to ship by sea to the US and EU before distributing to your final address.
For most of the pledge levels shipping costs are as follows: 
To addresses in the US & UK £6To addresses in the EU £20Rest of World £25
International Backers
We're proud to have had so many backers from all over the world for our last campaign. We will ship AuraVisor worldwide, with the exception of politically or economically embargoed countries. Please note that you will be responsible for any duties, fees and taxes applicable to your region.
We will be offering a 12 months warranty on the product in the event of a manufacturing fault.
Unfortunately, due to the way that the project is being funded in advance by backers we are unable to offer refunds once you have confirmed your payment.


Brief Chinese Overview
AuraVisor 同样在中国有售，我们将从中国工厂直接快速发货。您也可以选择AuraVisor 中文版，更多的虚拟现实内容即将为您呈现。

story:
We have created a new project for Heroes of Quasar as there had been some changes. Especially its going to be fixed to reach 10 000 eu. That is the minimum what we will need to start this up.  help us turn this idea into a reality! So please if you like this project you can help us turn this idea into a reality. 

Updated version: Heroes of Quasar updated

Please contribute to Heroes of Quasar updated version.


HoQ is an upcoming Multiplayer Online Battle Arena (MOBA) title. Action packed tactical spaceship battle. Wage a war by yourself or with your friends against the enemies. Earn resources, upgrade your ship and FIGHT against the other team! Epic pseudo-3d game with max 3 players on each team, both single and multiplayer, for mobile and tablet devices.



We love games like Warcraft, Starcraft, Dota and HoN. And we also love space!!! That’s why we have decided to combine all these great things and create an amazing looking game! Firstly, we want it for mobile and tablet devices (iOS, android), as there are not that many games like this for those platforms. Secondly move to PC, MAC, & Linux. If you share our enthusiasm about sci-fi keep reading to find out more about our project! 



Two teams, 3 players max on each team, will fight for a win. The victory can be achieved by killing the enemy heroes or by destroying their mothership.

Players have 2 lives, which means they can re-spawn once after being killed. After that it is a permanent death!


Each player picks one ship at the start of a game next to the mothership. The mothership is defended by 3 towers and it automatically provides repairs to nearby ships and sells upgrades for your ship. Upgrades consists of basic upgradable stats like life, shield, armor, speed, short range and long range weapons and then special features. Each hero has his own special set of weapons and shields available for purchase. Upgrades are only applied to their own ship.



Players have to earn resources by killing the enemy drones and heroes. Also when one team controls most of the map, that means everyone from that team is behind the middle line at the enemy territory, it gains bonus of 10% to the gained resources. Drones are deployed from mothership in waves.



The games should last about 15 minutes.

Singleplayer: Game mode for offline play. A player can practice and have fun against bots.

Multiplayer: Connect via bluetooth/wifi or internet to play. When connected locally (bluetooth/wifi) players will be able to create or join games with their friends. With internet you can join online games. Win games to earn points and coins!

Points will determine your skill and when looking for a game you will fight against more equal enemies.

Coins can be spent on different new avatars or brand new heroes. 

*skin- means the look (graphic presentation) of your ship in game

1. Stage - singleplayer for mobile and tablet devices (graphics, sounds, AI-bots coding, testing and bugs fixing)


2. Stage - multiplayer for mobile and tablet devices (wifi or bluetooth connection, internet servers for online-games, some more tests and bugs correction) 

3. Stage – lastly we want to develop this game also for PC, MAC, & Linux.

- then create more levels for singleplayer, different modes for multiplayer, many more new heroes and bad-ass skins for ships! 


Well everything in life today is really expensive. It's almost impossible to get funding through traditional methods for a game like this. The best thing about Indiegogo is that we can go directly to the people who love these types of games as much as we do. People who support us know what they will be getting. YOU can even help us create and improve the game! We make the development decisions, we market the game, and we don't have to answer to anyone but you – our fans.



We aim to create the best and only the best so we will need help. There comes the outsourcing, creation of AI, cool graphics, connection both wifi/bluetooth and internet, stable game and so much more! Also there are some more fees like company registration, trademarks, licenses for some programs that we will need and a lot more... It is more than we can afford on our own. So if you like the idea of spaceships war game, THIS is the game for you. Help us bring this game to life! Spare few bucks to make this game happen! There are rewards waiting for you of course!


We need to raise 25 000 € to fully fund this project. We know we are asking for a lot of money but that's because we are creating something new! Something that has not been done this way for mobile or tablet devices before. That means a new MOBA system that will work smoothly, have beautiful graphics, animation and so much more.

We have set this project for flexible budget, so if we don't make it to the target goal, we will still try to create this game! If we on the other hand raise more, we have additional stretch goals we would like to implement to this game. New spaceships, abilities, skins, maps, different levels, modes (death-match, defense,...) and many other features.


Tell about us to your family, friends, or basically anyone you know.
Like us, Follow us, Subscribe and get all new information before everyone else!
Facebook               Twitter                 Website


We are currently working on different designs. Hope you guys like

story:
Block2D is a 2D tribute to Minecraft, a popular multiplayer 3D game. 

 

Why do we need funding?

We need money to pay for our domain, Block2D.net, and Amazon S3 to host player skins. We also need to pay for our Android developer license to make Block2D available on Android. We would love to be able to bring Block2D to iOS aswell. It's all up to you, our contributors. Just a simple contribution, like $2 is enough to keep us going, and adding new features.

story:
Short Summary

Do you have World Cup fever?  Are you going crazy following your favorite teams all over the social networks?  We are building the ultimate fan apps for you to see everything about your favorite World Cup team on your phone.  

Help us, pledge a few dollars... so that we can build the apps for your favorite teams.

These apps will be powered by SOCXS.  It’s a cool new way to rally fans around similar passions.  Instead of chasing random World Cup Tweets, Instagram photos, Facebook posts, YouTube videos, we bring it all together in an app for you.  You’ll be able to engage in all the fun…with all the fans. 

Our team has a successful track record building apps for Fortune 500 companies, startups, and celebrities.  From this experience, we’ve built the SOCXS platform that unifies the consumption of media and simplifies the engagement with fans.  

The SOCXS platform allows us to build apps easily, by inverting Twitter, Facebook, YouTube, Instagram, etc. (all social networks), back into a single all media destination.  

Viva la World Cup!



What We Need & What You Get

We have an amazing team, and we’ll need your support to pull together a one-of-a-kind experience.  

Tell us who your favorite World Cup team is.  Make your pledge, and we will build the apps for the TOP 5 TEAMS with the most pledges.  Once we build the apps, we’ll email you links to the apps so you can enjoy the World Cup experience, and share it with your friends.


Breaking It Down

  • Your support in determining the top 5 World Cup teams will help us design and build the apps…just in time for the World Cup.  And, we'll keep the apps fresh for 12 months following the World Cup.
  • You will be able to see what fans are sharing: all the videos, photos, messages, and more. 
  • The SOCXS platform unifies and simplifies your life… and we are applying this technology to bring together the World Cup all media access.
  • Ultimately, it’s a cool new way for fans like you to enjoy what you love, all in one place…in the palm of your hand. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Thank you for supporting the development of these apps for your favorite teams. We appreciate your pledge indicated below, or just showing us love for your favorite team.  We’d also appreciate it if you could share this project with your friends: http://igg.me/at/fanofworldcup

story:
Short Summary

Did you play and enjoy my games, but have a guilty secret?

Perhaps you did not buy them at all, or in a way that meant that I did not get anything (for example on the second hand market)?

We don't like to carry guilty secrets. If you are in this situation, and feel the guilt, you can easily and simply put this behind you by making a contribution. If you do not feel any guilt, then this campaign is not for you.

This idea was inspired by David Thomson ( https://twitter.com/dwlt ) who found his treasured copy of Kick Off 2 (pictured) and suggested he owed me a few beers.

What We Need & What You Get

What we need in this world is a good flow of positive energy. Unfortunately, until we figure out a better way of turning positive energy into food and shelter and maintaining Internet access, money must be part of the equation for any creator of entertainment. What you will get out of donating is the release of the guilt you feel. What I get out of it is positive energy, to inspire me to create new things. So, for very little cost, it's a big win-win.

The Impact

Supporting indie game development is a worthwhile and important activity. All developers everywhere who entertain their audiences deserve something back for their efforts. It is not just about money; it is about a message. The contributions show that you care.

Other Ways You Can Help

You can spread the message.

story:
You've landed on the lunar research station.
Too bad you *crash* landed.

What is Crashed Lander?

This is a gravity-based arcade game inspired by classics like Lunar Lander and Space Taxi. You'll pilot your craft from pad to pad trying to beat your best time – then flirt with that fine line between speed and control. 

If you’re brave enough to try Hard Mode you’ll be flopping around like a QWOPy, low gravity turtle. With a little practice you’ll be zippin' around doin' barrel rolls. You can also pilot your lander in virtual reality with your Oculus Rift.

Download and play the demo now:
Windows   |   Mac OS X   |   Linux

Contribute to get the XL version of the demo with 4 more levels!
You can also support me with your Thumbs Up on Steam Greenlight.

You’ll see sites from the cutting edge of fractal mathematics, bizarre organic shapes, arcane archaeological digs, and all manner of WTFderful alien vistas. Each level is a  hand-crafted landscape that encourages the player to explore - and goof around!

“Crashed lander is really great! Play it with the autopilot off though”
Bennett Foddy, foddy.net

“...it's set in a wonderfully bizarre alien world that's absolutely worth exploring”
Konstantinos Dimopoulos, indiegames.com 

“Crashing is just as rewarding as landing, which transforms Crashed Lander from an interesting experiment to a delightful low-gravity playground.”
Richard Moss, web.appstorm.net 

Where will the money go?

I'm shooting for 4 months of living expenses plus a bit more to cover taxes and fees. This will give me time to polish the game, add new play modes, and create lots of new levels for you to explore. I'm also in need of a new computer. My main system got fried late last year when my power supply went kaput - along with the CPU and motherboard.

I want to use this campaign to give me a running start on a full-time game dev career. Last year I had to quit my day job to help take care of my Dad. I'd like to turn this problem into an opportunity by working at home where I can bring in some money and take care of my family at the same time. 

Here's a break-down of how I'll be spending the money:

  • Rent: $1800 for 4 months
  • Utilities, food, and other living expenses: $2200
  • New computer: $800
  • Steam Greenlight submission fee: $100
  • Unity Pro subscription: $300
  • IndieGoGo and Credit Card fees: 7% of funds $450
  • Taxes: About 15% of funds $950

If I don't make it to the full goal, I'll be using the funds in the same way over a shorter period of time. I'll have to get a part time job and split my energies. The full version of Crashed Lander will still be completed, it'll just take longer if I can't continue putting all of my time into the project.

What will be included in the game?

This free demo is just a taste of what's to come. I have plans for many more levels and new play modes - plus plenty of shine and polish. Here's a rundown of the main features I have planned for the full version of Crashed Lander:

  • Support for Windows, Mac OSX, and Linux
  • Full Oculus Rift support
  • At least 24 levels to conquer and explore
  • Time Trials - as featured in the demo
  • Trail Tracker - fly through a custom course on each level 
  • Fuel Hoarder - finish a level with as little fuel as possible
  • Online high score lists
  • Achievements
  • Hidden collectibles - explore the nooks and crannies to find 'em all
  • A full hour of my own original music
  • Gamepad support (xbox 360 controller)
  • Customizable vehicle - new paint jobs and doodads for your lander

I'll also be taking feedback from my supporters via polls and live Q&A sessions. You can help shape the final version of the game with your ideas, comments and suggestions.

Explore alien landscapes.

What about the Perks?

This campaign isn't just about raising funds - it's about having fun and getting you into my game! Here are some details about the different Perks: 

Everyone who contributes will get their name in the credits and a free warm fuzzy feeling. (^_^)

I like what I see: If you contribute five dollars or more you'll get the Extra Large version of the demo. The XL Demo will include 10 full levels with Time Trial and Fuel Hoarder modes plus online high score lists. It will be released during the last week of this campaign.

Play in the Voronoi ball pit

I'm In! Everyone who chips in $10 or more will get a digital copy of the final game released on June 15th, 2014 - for all three platforms, Windows, Mac and Linux. If I can get the game onto Steam you'll get a Steam key, too. Get in early and you can grab one of the 20 discounted perks for $7.

Note that the Linux version will be somewhat experimental. I have very little experience with Linux but thanks to Unity's cross-platform magic I can build for multiple operating systems. You can always try the demo to see how it works on your system.

Heck ya, can't wait! Contribute $15 and you'll get the full game plus monthly developer builds to keep you entertained until the final release. You'll also get an mp3 album of the soundtrack - Music to Crash To. Glitch-hoppy, loop-based music that I make with Kaossilator and Looptastic Producer. You can hear some of the tracks on my SoundCloud page.

Nerd Cred: $25 or more will get you a spot on the game's main menu. This will be a slideshow featuring profile pics and names of all Nerd Cred contributors. You provide me with a (family friendly) picture and the name, nickname or Twitter handle that you want to display.


Lots of nooks and crannies to explore in the Rococo Arch

Art Director for a Day: Make your mark at the $150 level. We'll get together via a Google Hangout and create a special level for inclusion in the final game. You'll make all the design decisions and I'll do all the work. We can make a landscaped terrain, a spacey sci-fi environment, or an abstract obstacle course.  I'll do my best to create whatever you can dream up. If you happen to be digital artist we could also put some of your own creations in the game. 

This is gonna be epic! Get your head in the game for $250. I'll create a 3D model of your face and head and you'll be immortalized in a virtual landscape - Mt Rushmore style! Where else could you get a chance to fly up your own nose? :) You'll need to provide a series of pictures of your head that I'll use to construct and texture the model - easily done with a smartphone or digital camera. I'll also give you a copy of the final model that you could send to a 3D printing service to get your very own mini you. 


Collect  alien artifacts

Brought to you by: You can sponsor Crashed Lander for $3200. This will get you a spot on a loading screen that displays every time people play the game. A drop in the bucket compared to the cost of some advertising options and you'll get your product or service in front of thousands of gamers and VR enthusiasts. 

Who am I?

I'm a 46 year old digital tinkerer living in the Willamette Valley of Oregon, USA. I've been making things with computers for over 33 years using every creative tool I can get my hands on. For the last three years I've been using Unity to combine my various digital design skills into fun, experimental projects. I feel I'm ready now to launch a full-time game dev career and Crashed Lander will be my first full-on game. 


An early prototype test of some destructible plants.

You can see some of my other game experiments over on my BrainBlinks website. Widdly Tinks is a one-finger arcade game, Gravitas is a fun physics toy, and Breeders is a simulation of artificial life.  

Thanks for taking the time to read my GoGo proposal. I appreciate whatever support you can give - even if it's just a Tweet or Facebook post about the campaign. Every little bit will help me reach my goals. I'm active over on Google+ and Twitter and I'll be happy to answer any questions you have here in the comments section.

Thanks for your interest and support!

Notes about the campaign:

I'm collecting fund via PayPal, but you don't have to have a PayPal account to contribute. There's an option on the ordering page to use your credit card without an account.

Check the Updates tab to read bout what I'm working on this week.
