Play it with the autopilot off though”Bennett Foddy, foddy.net“...it's set in a wonderfully bizarre alien world that's absolutely worth exploring”Konstantinos Dimopoulos, indiegames.com “Crashing is just as rewarding as landing, which transforms Crashed Lander from an interesting experiment to a delightful low-gravity playground.”Richard Moss, web.appstorm.net Where will the money go?I'm shooting for 4 months of living expenses plus a bit more to cover taxes and fees. This will give me time to polish the game, add new play modes, and create lots of new levels for you to explore. I'm also in need of a new computer. My main system got fried late last year when my power supply went kaput - along with the CPU and motherboard.I want to use this campaign to give me a running start on a full-time game dev career. Last year I had to quit my day job to help take care of my Dad. I'd like to turn this problem into an opportunity by working at home where I can bring in some money and take care of my family at the same time. Here's a break-down of how I'll be spending the money:

Rent: $1800 for 4 months

Utilities, food, and other living expenses: $2200
New computer: $800
Steam Greenlight submission fee: $100
Unity Pro subscription: $300
IndieGoGo and Credit Card fees: 7% of funds $450
Taxes: About 15% of funds $950
If I don't make it to the full goal, I'll be using the funds in the same way over a shorter period of time. I'll have to get a part time job and split my energies. The full version of Crashed Lander will still be completed, it'll just take longer if I can't continue putting all of my time into the project.What will be included in the game?This free demo is just a taste of what's to come. I have plans for many more levels and new play modes - plus plenty of shine and polish. Here's a rundown of the main features I have planned for the full version of Crashed Lander:
Support for Windows, Mac OSX, and Linux

Full Oculus Rift support

At least 24 levels to conquer and explore
Time Trials - as featured in the demo
Trail Tracker - fly through a custom course on each level 
Fuel Hoarder - finish a level with as little fuel as possible
Online high score lists
Achievements
Hidden collectibles - explore the nooks and crannies to find 'em all
A full hour of my own original music
Gamepad support (xbox 360 controller)
Customizable vehicle - new paint jobs and doodads for your lander
I'll also be taking feedback from my supporters via polls and live Q&A sessions. You can help shape the final version of the game with your ideas, comments and suggestions.Explore alien landscapes.What about the Perks?This campaign isn't just about raising funds - it's about having fun and getting you into my game! Here are some details about the different Perks: Everyone who contributes will get their name in the credits and a free warm fuzzy feeling. (^_^)I like what I see: If you contribute five dollars or more you'll get the Extra Large version of the demo. The XL Demo will include 10 full levels with Time Trial and Fuel Hoarder modes plus online high score lists. It will be released during the last week of this campaign.Play in the Voronoi ball pitI'm In! Everyone who chips in $10 or more will get a digital copy of the final game released on June 15th, 2014 - for all three platforms, Windows, Mac and Linux. If I can get the game onto Steam you'll get a Steam key, too. Get in early and you can grab one of the 20 discounted perks for $7.Note that the Linux version will be somewhat experimental. I have very little experience with Linux but thanks to Unity's cross-platform magic I can build for multiple operating systems. You can always try the demo to see how it works on your system.Heck ya, can't wait! Contribute $15 and you'll get the full game plus monthly developer builds to keep you entertained until the final release. You'll also get an mp3 album of the soundtrack - Music to Crash To. Glitch-hoppy, loop-based music that I make with Kaossilator and Looptastic Producer. You can hear some of the tracks on my SoundCloud page.Nerd Cred: $25 or more will get you a spot on the game's main menu. This will be a slideshow featuring profile pics and names of all Nerd Cred contributors. You provide me with a (family friendly) picture and the name, nickname or Twitter handle that you want to display.Lots of nooks and crannies to explore in the Rococo ArchArt Director for a Day: Make your mark at the $150 level. We'll get together via a Google Hangout and create a special level for inclusion in the final game. You'll make all the design decisions and I'll do all the work. We can make a landscaped terrain, a spacey sci-fi environment, or an abstract obstacle course.  I'll do my best to create whatever you can dream up. If you happen to be digital artist we could also put some of your own creations in the game. This is gonna be epic! Get your head in the game for $250. I'll create a 3D model of your face and head and you'll be immortalized in a virtual landscape - Mt Rushmore style! Where else could you get a chance to fly up your own nose? :) You'll need to provide a series of pictures of your head that I'll use to construct and texture the model - easily done with a smartphone or digital camera. I'll also give you a copy of the final model that you could send to a 3D printing service to get your very own mini you. Collect  alien artifactsBrought to you by: You can sponsor Crashed Lander for $3200. This will get you a spot on a loading screen that displays every time people play the game. A drop in the bucket compared to the cost of some advertising options and you'll get your product or service in front of thousands of gamers and VR enthusiasts. Who am I?I'm a 46 year old digital tinkerer living in the Willamette Valley of Oregon, USA. I've been making things with computers for over 33 years using every creative tool I can get my hands on. For the last three years I've been using Unity to combine my various digital design skills into fun, experimental projects. I feel I'm ready now to launch a full-time game dev career and Crashed Lander will be my first full-on game. An early prototype test of some destructible plants.You can see some of my other game experiments over on my BrainBlinks website. Widdly Tinks is a one-finger arcade game, Gravitas is a fun physics toy, and Breeders is a simulation of artificial life.  Thanks for taking the time to read my GoGo proposal. I appreciate whatever support you can give - even if it's just a Tweet or Facebook post about the campaign. Every little bit will help me reach my goals. I'm active over on Google+ and Twitter and I'll be happy to answer any questions you have here in the comments section.Thanks for your interest and support!Notes about the campaign:I'm collecting fund via PayPal, but you don't have to have a PayPal account to contribute. There's an option on the ordering page to use your credit card without an account.Check the Updates tab to read bout what I'm working on this week.

story:
Soul Tyrant Main Theme

Original Trailer 




Play Soul Tyrant Now On Kongregate!


The Game

  Soul Tyrant is a free to play action adventure game that runs right in your browser which is available to play right now.  In the game Soul Tyrant, you are the villain.  Cutting down all in your path, your goal is to destroy the world and gather souls for your own special abilities and summons.  Raise the corpses of your fallen enemies to fight for you and call upon special summons using the gathered souls.  

  Soul Tyrant is a serious game for serious gamers.  Every moment of the game is very intense as you are constantly overwhelmed with hordes of enemies.  You must think fast and remember to raise the dead as fast as you can.  Soul Tyrant was intentionally designed this way.


Help Us Reach A Much More Massive & Free Experience

  Soul Tyrant was released nearly a year ago now last fall.  The game has spread to hundreds of websites all across the internet with an estimated 1 million hits.  As spectacular as this sounds and happy as we are with the popularity of the game, we have not received a dime.  We set out to create a completely free game, but we can no longer afford to support it for free. 

  We need your help!  We have great dreams for this game and have already put a great deal of work into it.  One of the most requested features is an open world version of the game.  From the start, this is what we wanted as well, but didn't have the time and resources to make this happen.  We have now taken the time to show that this is possible in the video presentation, but we need your help to make it a complete reality!

   

What Will You Get In Return?

  All donors will get their names placed in the credits of the game with the highest bidders being placed on the top.  Any donations over 25 dollars will get exclusive beta access.  Donations over 50 dollars will get exclusive alpha & beta access, as well as being our official testers for the game.  Donations over 100 dollars will receive all the previous benefits plus a personal shout-out in our conclusion video for this campaign and the full soundtrack for the game. 


The Soundtrack 

The soundtrack for Soul Tyrant is a completely original score.  Its written and composed by myself (Robert Weaver).  I used to run a recording studio and worked with many musicians and bands.  I have always had a huge passion for writing orchestral music.


Soul Tyrant Main Theme 


What Happens If We Don't Meet Our Goal?

  Of course, there is the possibility that we may not meet our goal.  If this happens, the game will no longer be free.  The price of the full version of the game will depend on how much was raised.  

  For the people who donated, have no fear.  There will be no loss for donors if we do not meet our goal.  Development will continue, you will get all the promised perks and ALL donors will receive a free copy of the full version upon release!

story:
Short Summary

Welcome! We are "Underground Apartment", an independent group of game makers located in Toronto, Ontario, CA. As a part of the "serious gaming" movement, our mission is to design a role-playing game that impacts the way the world thinks about diversity. Specifically, we want to give gamers worldwide the experiencing of valuing diversity in others, to form interwoven communities where each member plays a vital role, and most importantly, to have fun doing it! We plan to do this with the development and release of "I, Zombie", a game that celebrates the unique aspects of zombiehood.

"I, Zombie" places the player in the role of an awakened zombie in a world where humans and zombies are in savage conflict, with a twist: in order to survive, you must learn to communicate with, interact with, and form a community with other zombies in the world, with the ultimate goal of reuniting with mankind. In the process, you learn about your past and about the lives and aspirations of other zombies. You discover the gifts and talents that make each of these zombies unique, and in doing so, your objective is to team up with other zombies and to form a movement for change in the world. In order to gain momentum, your community will need to grow and flourish over time. Your mission, should you choose to accept it, is to revolutionize the very definition of zombiehood in this interactive adventure!

"I, Zombie" also breaks new grounds in the gaming world as the first game to offer a wide variety of accessibility features. Among these are voice commands and navigation, flexible text size and font, magnification of the display, multiple input controller support (including some third-party accessibility interfaces), real-time audio game-state information (such as the location of your character and immediate surroundings), flexible tutorials (only learn what you want to learn), smart navigation, macro support and key mapping, and more! "I Zombie" - with your help - will be released on Christmas 2013 on multiple mobile platforms, consoles and PC.

As an independent game development group, we need your help to take this game to the next level - its first full release! To get this game released and available to the world, we are faced with funding challenges for engine licensing, legal costs, console ports, hiring quality art and music developers, servers to support online multiplayer play, team support, and costs for development of the accessibility features. These require tremendous resources, and your support can help us cover these costs and release "I, Zombie" to the world by the end of the year.

What We Need & What You Get

Your donations will go toward:

$2,500 Engine Licensing: Establishing the I, Zombie "Inclusion Engine" as a standard for other game developers to use to easily construct accessible games. This includes costs for patenting and distribution of the engine.

$2,000 Legal Costs: These are the costs for establishing "I, Zombie" as an official game by our group.

$3,000 Console Ports: These are the costs for developing and releasing the game on multiple home consoles.

$2,500 Art Assets: "I, Zombie" will feature a rich, interactive environment, and this requires a lot of art! In order to release by Christmas of 2013, we need more artists to join the art team, which already features our very own Judith Snow, Michael Skubic, and Alex Hollands!

$2,500 Music Assets: We need help in order to be able to hire musicians, including the famous Peter Gilli to compose the music for this epic adventure. Funding will ensure that we produce quality music for each aspect of the game.

$1,000 Online Multiplayer Feature: The future of "I, Zombie" is to be a worldwide multiplayer game. What else would make a fully diverse and peaceful world possible? To reach this most powerful potential, we need zombie players worldwide to help us make that connection.

$4,000 Accessibility Features: We are working to make "I, Zombie" accessible to everyone! To develop, test, design and incorporate each of the required features takes time and resources.

$2,000 Team Support: Releasing the game by Christmas of this year will be a challenge, but one we are prepared to meet as an INTERNATIONAL TEAM through dedicated and tireless effort. Your support will ensure that every team member is able to make this commitment by taking care of his/her basic needs during the development phase.

We have set up the following rewards for contributors to thank you for your support:

Shambler ($5): You get our deepest thanks!!!!

Donor ($10): Digital Artbook including art from our renowned artists, Judith Snow and Michael Skubic. Contains original art and character concepts for the game!

Super Donor ($20): The above + the official "I, Zombie" digital game soundtrack upon release of the game.

Contributor ($25): The above + an early copy of the game on PC and your name in the credits as a contributor.

Grave Contributor ($50): The above + an early copy of the iPad or tablet version of the game.

Supporter ($100): The above + a digital copy of the game's journal detailing the development process, created and signed by the engine's lead developer, Ramin Tadayon.

Deadly Supporter ($500): A one-hour online inspirational speaking engagement Q&A session with Ramin and/or Judith from "Underground Apartment"!

Mortifying Supporter ($2000+): Your very own custom-designed in-game character! Limited supply!

The Impact

"I Zombie" is designed to be fun and it will enact social change. Beneath the interactive gameplay and storyline, it carries with it a message: that when individuals value one another, everyone wins! The widespread release of our game will spread this message to a worldwide audience.

As the first fully accessible game, "I Zombie" is also a message to the gaming industry that games are for everyone and that there are simple steps in development to make them that way. The Inclusion Engine on which the game is developed will help other indie game developers design accessible and fun games without extraordinary effort. I Zombie will be the first proof-of-concept in a new wave of accessible gameplay.

Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word! "I, Zombie" is about social change, and by sharing the message with your friends, you can help us make a difference in the world. We encourage anyone who is interested to share this campaign via Twitter, Facebook or any other social platform.

story:
Wrectified 

The game features a walking ragdoll actor, in game dynamic assemblies, and 3d logic nodes.

  • The game is 99% open source (with the exception of ad delivery system)
  • The games ad revenue will go directly to developing the blender game engine, so anyone can make a "next-gen" game at home.

The team has decided to donate all indiegogo money to BGE development

  • Please help make the BGE a viable engine for indie studios.

The Impact

  • I want to teach coding and physics using explosions rockets and 3d logic nodes.
  • The project has 120,000 views - No game yet :D 
  • We are raising funds for these features-
  1. Inferred Lighting
  2. Hardware Armature Skinning.

Other Ways You Can Help


  • Code, design , render or illustrate - (see link below)
  • http://blenderartists.org/forum/showthread.php?284456-Blender-Open-Game-Development-Project-Wrectified

story:
Hi there! My name is Erin, and I'm the Creative Director for the game Nevermind - a PC biofeedback-enhanced exploration horror game in which you venture into the minds of trauma patients to discover the truth behind their horrific experiences. Nevermind started as my Interactive Media Graduate Thesis project at the University of Southern California and became a labor of love for a passionate team of engineers, programmers, actors, writers, filmmakers, composers, and designers.

 

 

 


What is Nevermind?

In Nevermind, you play as an employee of the Neurostalgia Institute tasked with uncovering the mysteries hidden within the repressed memories of trauma victims.  The game places you in situations that range from the unsettling to downright disturbing - like any good horror experience. The catch, however, is that you can play it while wearing a GARMIN heart-rate sensor. As a result, the more scared you get, the harder the game becomes - and, conversely, as you calm down, the game will gradually return to its easier, gentler default state.

 
Ultimately, you will have to learn how to recognize and manage your stress levels in order to properly play Nevermind. That is… if you want to see what's behind that next door...

 
As a game designer and artist who has always had a flair for the macabre, Nevermind is - in many ways - a dream project for me. Not only does it give the team and I an opportunity to play with biofeedback, which is gearing up to be the next frontier in gaming, it also allows us to craft an experience that is both fun and personally rewarding.  By creating a narrative experience compelling enough that players would want to force themselves into dark and stressful scenarios to see "what's next," and requiring them to temper their subconscious anxiety response in order to do so successfully, Nevermind, in many ways, encourages "true bravery."

 All in all, we think that's pretty neat!

Read more about Nevermind at nevermindgame.com

 

 

 

What We Need & What You Get

Nevermind is what we call a "proof-of-concept." We have completed one full level that demonstrates the big-picture of what Nevermind is as well as what it can be. In this level you can experience the fully fleshed out story, world, and the biofeedback-based dynamics of the game (unfortunately, we are not able to offer the game with the Garmin sensor at this time, but you can easily pick up one of your own from Amazon along with the USB dongle and try it!  We hope to be able to offer the game with a sensor in the near future.  The game has a built in metric algorithm that tracks your playing style to detect elements of stress none-the-less, so you'll still have a very similar experience). The experience is about an hour long and will take you on a ride you'll never forget! 

This fundraising campaign is to help us get the game (in its current state) out there! Every contribution will help us submit Nevermind to shows and festivals and will allow us to stock up on sensor hardware to send to press and other interested and influential parties. The more we can get Nevermind out there, the better a chance it has at one day becoming a full game that can fulfill its full potential (with over 10 unique levels and many hours of gameplay). 

 
Basically, right now we just want to hear what YOU think! So, for supporting the cause, we will minimally send you a copy of the current version of the game. We're not distributing sensors at this time (the game is fully playable without it) - but, if you're so inclined, you can easily buy them off of Amazon. Don't worry, we'll send you all the information you need to make sure you get the right one. PLEASE NOTE: The game is currently PC only. While we hope to have a Mac version available one day, the current version (both the game and biofeedback connection) is incompatable with Apple machines. 


 
All that said, if we don't reach our goal, it won't be the end of the world. Nevermind will still live on in its current state! However, every contribution will help us establish a stronger future not only for Nevermind, but also for biofeedback-based gaming and for video games willing to work toward making the world a better place one fun experience at a time.  
 

 (One last note about the perk: we will send the game to you via email within 2 weeks -often much sooner- after your contribution.)

 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

"Hey, Erin, I think Nevermind sounds great but I can't contribute any funds at this time. What should I do?"

Well, I'm glad you asked!

Simply by talking about Nevermind and/or this Indiegogo campaign on Facebook, Twitter, Reddit, an airplane, the phone with your mom, etc. would also be very helpful. We're extremely appreciative of those who simply just want to spread the word!

That said, if you do opt to share the campaign, we encourage you to do so via the fancy, high-tech Indiegogo links provided on this page.   

 

 

 

 

Still Not Sure What the Heck Nevermind Is? 

That's okay! It's all part of the adventure. Here are some links that might help explain the project a little further:

Our Website: Nevermindgame.com

Videos About Nevermind: https://vimeo.com/album/1975596   

 

Press and Honors

• GameTrailers.com – Psychological Horror Game Challenges Players to Calm Down
• Rock, Paper, Shotgun – Oh Well, Whatever: Nevermind
• PC Gamer - Nevermind Tests Your Stress Control With Biofeedback-Fueled Terror
• Unity 2012 Awards - Finalist in the Categories of Best Student Project and Best Technical Achievement (Winners to be Announced on 8/23/2012)
• Elder-Geek.com - Nevermind Preview
• G4TV - The Future Starts Today
• LAWeekly Writeup - UCLA Game Art Festival
• CelebritySC - Hands-On With Nevermind
• The Creative Mind Blog - Designing Video Games for Mental Health
• LA Times - USC Competition Pushes the Limits of Modern Video Games
• Independent Games Channel - USC's Erin Reynolds on Nevermind, Managing Stress, and Eternal Darkness

 
Erin Reynolds in the Press

• TRAINER on Apps for Healthy Kids
• The Daily BR!NK - Erin Reynolds, Video Game Designer
 
 
 
 
 
 

Our Team

The Nevermind team is headed up by myself, Jesse Busch, and Konstantin Brazhnik, who are both producers on the project.  Prior to pursuing a graduate degree at USC, I worked in the game industry as an Artist and Game Designer. I recently had the privilege of being flown to the White House -- where another game I helped create, "Trainer," won two awards in a nation-wide competition initiated by First Lady Michelle Obama and sponsored by institutions such as the USDA, General Electric, and the IGDA.  I recently received my MFA at the University of Southern California in the Interactive Media Division of the School of Cinematic Arts, and will soon be embarking on my next adventure in the game industry.


The rest of our team is an eclectic, talented mix of artists, engineers, a PhD electrical engineering candidate, a documentary filmmaker, a satellite engineer, actors, a film writer, and several film composers. The wide variety of expertise on our team enriches Nevermind's unique perspective and fosters a fresh and innovative take on the horror genre.

Read more about the team at nevermindgame.com/team
story_txt:
Hi there! My name is Erin, and I'm the Creative Director for the game Nevermind - a PC biofeedback-enhanced exploration horror game in which you venture into the minds of trauma patients to discover the truth behind their horrific experiences. Nevermind started as my Interactive Media Graduate Thesis project at the University of Southern California and became a labor of love for a passionate team of engineers, programmers, actors, writers, filmmakers, composers, and designers.
 
 
 


What is Nevermind?

In Nevermind, you play as an employee of the Neurostalgia Institute tasked with uncovering the mysteries hidden within the repressed memories of trauma victims.  The game places you in situations that range from the unsettling to downright disturbing - like any good horror experience. The catch, however, is that you can play it while wearing a GARMIN heart-rate sensor. As a result, the more scared you get, the harder the game becomes - and, conversely, as you calm down, the game will gradually return to its easier, gentler default state. Ultimately, you will have to learn how to recognize and manage your stress levels in order to properly play Nevermind. That is… if you want to see what's behind that next door... As a game designer and artist who has always had a flair for the macabre, Nevermind is - in many ways - a dream project for me. Not only does it give the team and I an opportunity to play with biofeedback, which is gearing up to be the next frontier in gaming, it also allows us to craft an experience that is both fun and personally rewarding.  By creating a narrative experience compelling enough that players would want to force themselves into dark and stressful scenarios to see "what's next," and requiring them to temper their subconscious anxiety response in order to do so successfully, Nevermind, in many ways, encourages "true bravery." All in all, we think that's pretty neat!Read more about Nevermind at nevermindgame.com
 
 

 
What We Need & What You Get
Nevermind is what we call a "proof-of-concept." We have completed one full level that demonstrates the big-picture of what Nevermind is as well as what it can be. In this level you can experience the fully fleshed out story, world, and the biofeedback-based dynamics of the game (unfortunately, we are not able to offer the game with the Garmin sensor at this time, but you can easily pick up one of your own from Amazon along with the USB dongle and try it!  We hope to be able to offer the game with a sensor in the near future.  The game has a built in metric algorithm that tracks your playing style to detect elements of stress none-the-less, so you'll still have a very similar experience). The experience is about an hour long and will take you on a ride you'll never forget! This fundraising campaign is to help us get the game (in its current state) out there! Every contribution will help us submit Nevermind to shows and festivals and will allow us to stock up on sensor hardware to send to press and other interested and influential parties. The more we can get Nevermind out there, the better a chance it has at one day becoming a full game that can fulfill its full potential (with over 10 unique levels and many hours of gameplay).  Basically, right now we just want to hear what YOU think! So, for supporting the cause, we will minimally send you a copy of the current version of the game. We're not distributing sensors at this time (the game is fully playable without it) - but, if you're so inclined, you can easily buy them off of Amazon. Don't worry, we'll send you all the information you need to make sure you get the right one. PLEASE NOTE: The game is currently PC only. While we hope to have a Mac version available one day, the current version (both the game and biofeedback connection) is incompatable with Apple machines. 
 All that said, if we don't reach our goal, it won't be the end of the world. Nevermind will still live on in its current state! However, every contribution will help us establish a stronger future not only for Nevermind, but also for biofeedback-based gaming and for video games willing to work toward making the world a better place one fun experience at a time.   
 (One last note about the perk: we will send the game to you via email within 2 weeks -often much sooner- after your contribution.)
 

 
Other Ways You Can Help
"Hey, Erin, I think Nevermind sounds great but I can't contribute any funds at this time. What should I do?" 
Well, I'm glad you asked! 
Simply by talking about Nevermind and/or this Indiegogo campaign on Facebook, Twitter, Reddit, an airplane, the phone with your mom, etc. would also be very helpful. We're extremely appreciative of those who simply just want to spread the word! 
That said, if you do opt to share the campaign, we encourage you to do so via the fancy, high-tech Indiegogo links provided on this page.   
 
 
 

 

Still Not Sure What the Heck Nevermind Is? 

That's okay! It's all part of the adventure. Here are some links that might help explain the project a little further: 
Our Website: Nevermindgame.com
Videos About Nevermind: https://vimeo.com/album/1975596   
 
Press and Honors

• GameTrailers.com – Psychological Horror Game Challenges Players to Calm Down

• Rock, Paper, Shotgun – Oh Well, Whatever: Nevermind

• PC Gamer - Nevermind Tests Your Stress Control With Biofeedback-Fueled Terror


• Unity 2012 Awards - Finalist in the Categories of Best Student Project and Best Technical Achievement (Winners to be Announced on 8/23/2012)
• Elder-Geek.com - Nevermind Preview

• G4TV - The Future Starts Today

• LAWeekly Writeup - UCLA Game Art Festival

• CelebritySC - Hands-On With Nevermind

• The Creative Mind Blog - Designing Video Games for Mental Health

• LA Times - USC Competition Pushes the Limits of Modern Video Games

• Independent Games Channel - USC's Erin Reynolds on Nevermind, Managing Stress, and Eternal Darkness


 Erin Reynolds in the Press

• TRAINER on Apps for Healthy Kids

• The Daily BR!NK - Erin Reynolds, Video Game Designer

 
 
 
 
 

 
Our Team
The Nevermind team is headed up by myself, Jesse Busch, and Konstantin Brazhnik, who are both producers on the project.  Prior to pursuing a graduate degree at USC, I worked in the game industry as an Artist and Game Designer. I recently had the privilege of being flown to the White House -- where another game I helped create, "Trainer," won two awards in a nation-wide competition initiated by First Lady Michelle Obama and sponsored by institutions such as the USDA, General Electric, and the IGDA.  I recently received my MFA at the University of Southern California in the Interactive Media Division of the School of Cinematic Arts, and will soon be embarking on my next adventure in the game industry.
The rest of our team is an eclectic, talented mix of artists, engineers, a PhD electrical engineering candidate, a documentary filmmaker, a satellite engineer, actors, a film writer, and several film composers. The wide variety of expertise on our team enriches Nevermind's unique perspective and fosters a fresh and innovative take on the horror genre.
Read more about the team at nevermindgame.com/team

story:
My Story

Hey, everybody! I'm Talin and I've been gaming for a long time now. Games are my biggest passion, but I don't like only playing them, I love to talk about them, to analyze them and I even make my own games, both at my current job and in my spare time - when I can get any.

I also had a small chemistry with writing since I was a kid, so now in my wiser days I thought why not combine the 2 of them in game reviews. I put up a blog where I write quick reviews that can be read in maximum 5 minutes. I often lack the time and patience to go through the big reviews on famous sites so I mostly resume to the conclusions. I thought that surely there are others like me out there, so this is why I chose this 5 minutes format.

I analyze a game from the graphics, sounds, story, gameplay and longevity perspectives, reaching a conclusion. I avoid to give ratings to a game, as I find those misleading. Since a review will always depend on the personal experience with the game, I only give my opinion as whether you'll hate it, ignore it, like it, love it or even the elusive live it.

This the blog with the reviews, currently only for PS3:

http://5minutesps3reviews.blogspot.com/


The Goal

I want to hear the community's opinion on this little project of mine. I've been writing some reviews so far. I need you guys to show me if this is something worth continuing, if you like my writing style and so on. I write the reviews when I get some spare time and energy, but with your support I can get much more motivated and try to write a new review each 2-3 weeks.

I've also been playing with the idea of expanding the whole concept to new consoles: 3DS, PS Vita, maybe even indie PC games. Based on your feedback and support, this will become a reality.

Another quirky idea I have is to put all of this into an online magazine. Each issue would contain at least one PS3, 3DS, Vita and PC review. It would also highlight the most interesting games coming out for each of the platforms.

So, here are my goals:

  • 1000$ - Continue with the 5 minutes PS3 reviews blog, one at each 2-3 weeks at least
  • 2000$ - Start the 5 minutes 3DS reviews blog, one each 4-6 weeks at least
  • 3000$ - Start the 5 minutes Vita reviews blog, one each 4-6 weeks at least
  • 4000$ - Start the 5 minutes PC reviews blog, one each 4-6 weeks at least
  • 5000$ - Start the 5 minutes reviews magazine, one issue every 2 months

Looking forward to your feedback!

story:
Crowdfunding finished!

Do you still want to contribute?

If you want to contribute, you can make a donation in our website, and you will recive the content of your perk (see the perks in the website) as soon as posible!

Contribute in our official website

Contact: team@comaamindadventure.com

Official Website: www.comaamindadventure.com

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

What is Coma: a mind adventure?

In Coma, the main character (you, the player) is in a deep coma after a terrible accident, and the scenarios, humans and entities you encounter are a representation of the feelings of the character; everything in Coma happens in his head. He did something terrible in the past (many years ago) and to get out of the coma he will have to forgive himself by finally accepting who he is and what he did.

The player has the ability to change the climate and the weather, and to solve the puzzles you will have to use that! You are the one who decides if it’s nightime, daytime, ifit  rains, if the skies are clear, if there is a terrible fog, and in any one of these states the environment changes radically. There are zones in the environment (the environment is the puzzle) that are sensible to the player and certain objects, and the player must use the characteristics of each macro climatic state to combine them and solve the puzzles.

 

Who we are?

We are the main team behind Warcelona,  one of the most renowned campaigns for Left 4 Dead 2, with more than 160.000 downloads and a score of 96/100 after more than 150 reviews. But this time we’re not making a mod, now we are ready to make a game!

Coma is a combination of many ideas we have for new videogame mechanics that now we are ready to make a reality. The game will be an FPP (first person puzzler, not first person shooter) with puzzles and a deep and personal story behind it. You won't find Space Marines or meaningless violence in Coma, as opposed to most First Person Shooters. You will find a mature adult story about life; sadness, violence, remorse, guilt, hope, and what is more important;  self-accomplishment. 

If you want to think in terms of reference, Coma is a mix of games like Dear Esther, Portal 2, Shadow of the Colossus or Journey.

 

F.A.Q

When will Coma be ready for release?

Although we don’t dare set a deadline just yet, we can assure you that it won’t be launched in less than a year, but we won’t take more than two years for it either. It all depends on the amount of income we get from the donations. The more people that contribute, the easier we’ll have it to develop and finish key aspects of the game.

What will the money be used for?

We will use the money gotten from the donations to pay for three main things: the specialists (animators, programmers, musicians, web designers and others) we will hire, the licenses we will have to pay, and the tools and applications that will help us hugely to speed up the development of Coma.

Why Flexible Funding?

We devised Coma to be a project flexible to the amount of contributions obtained, from the very beginning. If we get more than a dollar we’ll release the complete game with a coherent story, but not the depth and length we had initially hoped it to have. To achieve the level of quality and polishment (in that regard) we have set ourselves, we calculate we require a minimum of 7400$. If we get less than that the game will probably lack somehow, but if we surpass that amount then it will be even more detailed and polished than expected.

Will the game be available through Steam?

Yes. We have read the Steamwork “rules” and this project fulfills all requirements to be a part of Steam.

Which platforms will Coma be available on?

PC and Mac

Will there be achievements?

Only if we get to 10,000$. There are other, more important things we want to invest the money in before we start working on the achievements

Will the game include scorelists, time-related challenges, and such?

No. We haven’t imagined Coma: A mind adventure as a competitive game

On a scale from 1 to 10, how much do we contributors influence the videogame?

Depending on the level of access to the viral game, between 6 and 10.

How much will the final release of Coma cost?

We don’t know yet, the only thing we know for sure is that paying for the lowest perk (10$) is going to be cheaper than waiting for the final release.

 

Gameplay

If you want to see some gameplay, check our gameplay video and our tutorial, that’s the best way to know how Coma works, but here are some specific hints:

We are planning to do different environments like a forest, a volcanic zone, badlands, an infinite beach, and many other abstract ,natural and huuuuuuge environments (about 12 different kind of environments). In each of these environments and in all the game the player will be able to play with the climate:

  • Fog: the enemies won’t see you unless you’re very close to them and the mist also disables certain elements as force fields (and way more!)
  • Night: the night activates portals (non bidirectional) and light objects that will only exist during the night
  • Rain: the rain makes some elements grow and it also floods some areas. The rain is perfect to create new paths or go to high areas.

And waaay more! We are planning to make other climatic states such as tornadoes, burning Sun, eclipse, sand storm, and others, but we will need funding to do that! Aside from that, there will be 4 levels that will have a very different and unique gameplay (how can you beat a colossus using the climate? :D, for example)

How will the narrative work?

The game will have a slow non frantic rhythm, but it won’t be just an aesthetic experience, because the most important part of the game is solving the puzzles and traveling through the mind of the main character.
Various narrators will join us for the adventure, but the environmental narrative will be the most important one. These narrators will be relatives, doctors, friends, and others that are in the room where the main character lays in the deep coma, and we will listen to what they say. That will be very important because the mind of the main character will pick up these words and will transform them into environments and puzzles full of metaphors. But the most interesting part is that, as a backer of this proyect, you will be able to influence what these narrators say (among many other things) thanks to the viral alternative reality game (ARG) that will happen during development!

Viral Game (ARG) during development

We need the help of your pledge for making this project a reality, and we've got awesome news for the Backers: aside from getting the game for free when it's done, getting concept art and other surprises you will participate in a viral game during the development process of the game that will determine the destiny of the main character in Coma -and this won't be standalone-  so everyone will get the consequences of the events in the viral game.

The more you pledge, the more power you will have to affect the game! But this is not the only thing you can do in the viral game. Anyone that's in the viral game will know more about the character, the context, his work, his past and more so when you play the game you will recognize every detail, every metaphor, every hint.

This viral game will be done though the internet; viral facebook accounts, viral characters, viral websites, viral newspapers, and others. Here is a hint about one thing that will happend in the viral game: it is said that when you're in a coma, you can listen to the real word and this affects you. Imagine that somebody goes to visit the character, and tells him word for word exactly what you have written with the other backers, and in the game, when the player listens to this voice, this will create a scenario surrounding him in real time (like in Inception); in ther words, the entire scenario/level will be metaphor based on what YOU have written.

Viral Game Levels

The levels are acumulative, so if you have level 4, you can also access the content of level 1, 2 and 3.

  • Level 0: acces to the viral webs, viral accounts and more secrets.
  • Level 1: Access to the community, forums, and the viral news we will send you every week. Access to the votes about the ending of the game and the final destiny of the character.
  • Level 2: access to the votes and private forums where you will decide about certain secondary elements with a high emotive burden of the main plot.
  • Level 3: access to the votes and private forums where you will decide about a lot of elements of the main plot.
  • level4: access to the forums where you will decide the design and appearance of an entire level (1 hour of gameplay).
  • level5: Roleplay a character of the game, based on your own experience and feedback. Put your face and memories in the game.
  • level6: only you will be able to judge the main character.

story:
Presenting Zone 0

 

Zone 0 was the first planet you discovered when you were looking for an earthlike planet. This will be the main area you start in and probably will spent most of your time. It has a very similar atmosphere to earth, that's why there is no special equipment needed to survival on this planet. Everything you expect to be on an earthlike planet can be found here, from a beautiful landscape to lakes, waterfalls and animals.

You can build a house, valleys or cities as you wish. In the preview you see a house which is equal to what you can build in the very beginning of GROW, nothing fancy but it works..

There will be more zone updates in the future, presenting each zone in its look and physics. Stay tuned and spread the word!

 

 

 

GROW is a first person 3D open world survival game in which you can explore a multi planetary universe to further educate your character mentally and physically.

GROWs dynamic world will change to real life seasons accordingly. This and its high quality design lets you experience beautiful planets. 

 

 

 

After earth has been destroyed by humanity, a few people got selected to discover a new earthlike planet. Unfortunately you got seperated from your crew and have to try to survive by your own. While exploring the planet you discover multiple portals...

 

 

 

Multi Planetary Universe

GROW takes place in different 'zones', zone 0 is an earthlike planet on which you can loot, level, and build. 

Beside Zone 0 there are 6 more zones which you can enter by using portals around the world. Every zone has its own physical laws, meaning that you have to prepare your character first before entering a particular zone. Zone 1-6 are all different. For example a zone can have non-breathable air, no gravity, a dynamically changing environment or damaging weather and more.

In each zone you will face different creatures which, when killed, will  reward you with loot. Every zone has its own lootable Items which don't exist in other zones. With these Items you can craft tools and weapons for a specific zone, these will be stronger and more effective than in other zones. You can combine loot from all zones and craft Items which would then work in every zone. This progress takes more time and experience to accomplish.

 

Unique Building System

Building a unique house is one of the main focuses in GROW. With this advanced building system you can build your own house. Not only that, you can also place furniture wherever you want!

Beside building your own house you can interact with almost everything. Turning on and off lamps, locking doors and storage units, using the TV to watch Twitch live streams or Youtube videos, and listening to real life radio makes GROW more alive and dynamic.

Over 400 furnitures items and more than 60 different textures are giving you the freedom to absolutely build everything. With not only straight but curved walls you can create unique architectures and thus make you house unique.

 

Advancing AI

In GROW your enemies will learn, so attacking them the same way over and over again will bring you in trouble. They will memorize your actions and adjust accordingly in future fights.

Killing a creature from a long distance will result in a more defensive behaviour of the enemy. It may also occur that creatures will call for backup when they see it's you they are fighting against. Vary between different play styles will reduce this kind of behaviour. 

 

Dynamic Seasons

You will also experience seasons which will correspond to the current real-life seasons accordingly. That gives you a more realistic feeling when playing GROW. Seasons will actively change your environment and hence your way of playing the game.

 

 

 

GROW is an insanely detailed well optimized survival Game. Its beautiful landscapes are simulating a very realistic world. Besides the environment it offers highly detailed weapons and tools which can be changed by its textures at anytime.

With the character customization tool you can dress your character with stylish outfits and accessoiresas well as protection like nano suits.

With over 70 different character customizations you can already create a unique looking character, just like the weapons and tools you can change the look of the outfits as you wish.

 

 

I am in the early stages of developing GROW. Creating Counter-Strike 1.6  maps years ago brought me to develop my own game. I always loved to create things which are unique, therefore I started developing GROW to realize my idea of a multiplayer survival game. GROW will be released for Windows & Apple products. Although Windows will be the first platform on which the game will be tested on. So Windows has a higher priority at the moment.

 

How does the money get spent?

 

Goal extensions

 

 

 

You can follow the progress of GROW anytime at one of the following social media platforms:
story_txt:
Presenting Zone 0

 
Zone 0 was the first planet you discovered when you were looking for an earthlike planet. This will be the main area you start in and probably will spent most of your time. It has a very similar atmosphere to earth, that's why there is no special equipment needed to survival on this planet. Everything you expect to be on an earthlike planet can be found here, from a beautiful landscape to lakes, waterfalls and animals.You can build a house, valleys or cities as you wish. In the preview you see a house which is equal to what you can build in the very beginning of GROW, nothing fancy but it works..There will be more zone updates in the future, presenting each zone in its look and physics. Stay tuned and spread the word!   GROW is a first person 3D open world survival game in which you can explore a multi planetary universe to further educate your character mentally and physically.GROWs dynamic world will change to real life seasons accordingly. This and its high quality design lets you experience beautiful planets.    After earth has been destroyed by humanity, a few people got selected to discover a new earthlike planet. Unfortunately you got seperated from your crew and have to try to survive by your own. While exploring the planet you discover multiple portals...   Multi Planetary UniverseGROW takes place in different 'zones', zone 0 is an earthlike planet on which you can loot, level, and build. Beside Zone 0 there are 6 more zones which you can enter by using portals around the world. Every zone has its own physical laws, meaning that you have to prepare your character first before entering a particular zone. Zone 1-6 are all different. For example a zone can have non-breathable air, no gravity, a dynamically changing environment or damaging weather and more.In each zone you will face different creatures which, when killed, will  reward you with loot. Every zone has its own lootable Items which don't exist in other zones. With these Items you can craft tools and weapons for a specific zone, these will be stronger and more effective than in other zones. You can combine loot from all zones and craft Items which would then work in every zone. This progress takes more time and experience to accomplish. Unique Building SystemBuilding a unique house is one of the main focuses in GROW. With this advanced building system you can build your own house. Not only that, you can also place furniture wherever you want!Beside building your own house you can interact with almost everything. Turning on and off lamps, locking doors and storage units, using the TV to watch Twitch live streams or Youtube videos, and listening to real life radio makes GROW more alive and dynamic.Over 400 furnitures items and more than 60 different textures are giving you the freedom to absolutely build everything. It may also occur that creatures will call for backup when they see it's you they are fighting against. Vary between different play styles will reduce this kind of behaviour.  Dynamic SeasonsYou will also experience seasons which will correspond to the current real-life seasons accordingly. That gives you a more realistic feeling when playing GROW. Seasons will actively change your environment and hence your way of playing the game.   GROW is an insanely detailed well optimized survival Game. Its beautiful landscapes are simulating a very realistic world. Besides the environment it offers highly detailed weapons and tools which can be changed by its textures at anytime.With the character customization tool you can dress your character with stylish outfits and accessoiresas well as protection like nano suits.With over 70 different character customizations you can already create a unique looking character, just like the weapons and tools you can change the look of the outfits as you wish.  I am in the early stages of developing GROW. Creating Counter-Strike 1.6  maps years ago brought me to develop my own game. I always loved to create things which are unique, therefore I started developing GROW to realize my idea of a multiplayer survival game. GROW will be released for Windows & Apple products. Although Windows will be the first platform on which the game will be tested on. So Windows has a higher priority at the moment. How does the money get spent? Goal extensions   You can follow the progress of GROW anytime at one of the following social media platforms:

story:
Who We Are

Project Beanstalk is a socially responsible video game company whose mission is to create a state of mindfulness throughout the world by fixing the game industry’s lack of diversity and all of the negative issues that come with it. This includes the lack of minorities in the workplace, behavior that creates toxic gaming communities (such as hazing) and poor representation of marginalized groups in video games.

 

In order to improve the state of the video game industry and create a space for individuals to understand each other for more than just stereotypes, we create video games with better representation of marginalized groups including but not limited to people of color, women, the LGBTQ community, disabled people, and low income individuals.

As a socially responsible company we welcome opportunities to address other social themes through our games such as bullying, mental health, corruption & power, and environmental issues.

Many individuals from marginalized groups aspire to work in the video game industry, however, they are held back by the lack of awareness and lack of access that surrounds it. This hurts the confidence of these individuals and they lose faith in the idea that they can pursue successful careers as game developers. We aim to work against this preconceived notion by using our work as a diverse team of developers to inspire these individuals and show them that they can succeed in the game industry because we are doing it.

We Need Your Support For A Successful Launch

We are a passionate team with a strong dynamic but we are in need of funds to help us grow. Your donations will be going into resources that will help us develop and release our games including:

  • An account upgrade for Unity3D which costs $125 per month and will be used to give more of our team members the ability to work on our games. 
  • Payroll for the Beanstalk team to prioritize our current project.
  • Hiring fees for consultants to improve the quality of our games including programmers, game designers, and marketers.      

60% of the funds will be used to support our team as they continue to work on and finish our games.  20% of the funds will be invested into hire consultants in order to improve the quality of our products.  The remaining 20% will be used to acquire resources that we need including but not limited to a Unity license upgrade and an office space.

Our Games

Here are our current projects that your donations will be supporting! You can find descriptions and news on their progress on our projects page! 

Behind The Mask

Developed in the video game career accelerator Gameheads, Behind the Mask is a game built to help represent people from the LGBTQ community.  After realizing that we wanted to work on the concept of what it means to be human, we came to the realization that to be human is to struggle through fears and anxiety. Many conversations revolving around the LGBTQ community came up shortly after and that's when we realized that was the group that we were most passionate about representing, You play as our character Iry who like us, sees everything in color, however, her mother, who only sees in black and white, found out about this fact and forced Iry to wear a cursed mask that makes the wearer see in black and white as well.  In Distress, Iry runs away in search of a place where she belongs. 

This game's gameplay is mostly black and white, but whenever the mask falls off, everything becomes colorful and much happier to teach the player that it is ok to be yourself. 

This game will be released on Christmas week with a finalized version following soon after in January.

Ice Cream Tornado

Ice Cream Tornado is a mobile app that we will be using to help make a positive impact on hurricane and flood victims. In this game a tornado made of ice cream is sweeping through town and sucking in everything around it. You must flick objects and people away from the tornado to save them and reduce damage, but you can let the tornado eat ice cream for extra points. The idea is that the ice cream calms the tornado down because who doesn't like ice cream and becomes happier after eating it! We will be adding an option into this game for players to donate and a percentage of the profits will go to helping those who have been negatively impacted by hurricanes and floods. We are currently in search of insights, connections, and partnerships that will help us make a substantial impact on this cause, so please let us know if you have any ideas or connections. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please don't fret if you are unable to donate at this time. Feel free to visit and subscribe to our website, and follow our social media pages for updates and the latest news on us and our games.

www.projectbeanstalk.xyz

Follow us on our social media pages for updates.

Twitter: https://twitter.com/ProjBeanstalk

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/beanstalkproject/

Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/projectbeanstalk/?hl=en

Thank You!

story:
Resumen

 

Hola, soy Carlos Teschendorff y me considero copropietario de este bar de eSports junto a todos vosotros, porque lo sentis tan propio como yo.  Habéis hecho de este lugar vuestra casa. Como sabemos, la familia ha crecido y toca ampliar la casa. 

Con la ampliación, incrementaremos el número de PCs hasta 12 para hacer los deseados torneos 5vs5 de League of Legends, CSGO, Smite y 6vs6 de Overwatch. Además, podremos acoger eventos más grandes de vuestras temáticas preferidas como Harry Potter, Piratas, Star Wars, Disney, ... Y todo eso sin problemas de espacio, pues el aforo llegará hasta las 100 personas en el interior del local repartidas en 220 metros cuadrados y otras tantas en la terraza.

 

 

Lo que necesitamos y lo que obtienes

 

 

Para llevar a cabo la reforma necesitamos una inversión total de 24.000 euros. Con la campaña de crowdfunding tenemos que recaudar 8.000 euros, yo pondré los 16.000 euros restantes a través de un crédito bancario. Evidentemente cuanto más dinero se recaude a través del crowdfunding. mejores condiciones tendrá el crédito bancario para mí. Si no llegamos a la cifra deseada, intentaremos seguir adelante con una ampliación más "light" o devolveríamos todo a los donantes (menos el 5% que cobra la plataforma Indiegogo) 

En la parte derecha tenéis las recompensas que podéis obtener, por supuesto, únicas e irrepetibles.

Si llegamos a las siguientes cantidades entre todos,  habrá recompensas conjuntas para que disfrutemos todos en Comunidad

2000 euros Cosplayers increíbles para la Reinauguración

3500 euros Torneo 6vs6 de Overwatch con 300 euros de premio

5000 euros Torneo 5vs5 de League of Legends y CS:GO con 300 euros de premio cada uno

6500 euros Torneo 5vs5 de Smite, 1 vs1  de Hearthstone y 1vs1 Super Smash Bros con 300 euros de premio en cada uno 

8000 euros Carlos se pondrá un cosplay en la Reinauguración. ¡Vosotros decidís cuál!

 

 

 

Cómo será el eSports Bar 2.0

 

Zona de PCs y consolas

La zona de PCs contará con 12 Alienwares, periféricos Logitech, 12 sillas NeedforSeat y 2 conexiones de fibra óptica a Internet por si falla una. En la zona de consolas tendremos a nuestra disposición dos Wii U, dos Nintendo Switch, una Playstation 3, una Playstation 4 , una máquina de baile pump y 4 mandos por consola. Por supuesto, hacer uso de todo el material seguirá siendo gratuito con algún cambio. Al hacer una consumición, obtendrás una sesión de una hora para jugar en un PC. Pasado ese tiempo la sesión se desconectará y otra persona ocupará el PC.

 

Zona de retransmisión

Habrá 2 zonas con sofás para poder acomodarnos y disfrutar de los streamings más visualizados y deseados de cada momento. (LVP, LCS, ESL Major League, ...)  Para decorar la nueva zona de sofás contaremos con el apoyo de Monster España y, por tanto, recibirá el nombre de  Zona Monster. (Pronto más detalles al respecto, os gustarán ;)

En la zona central habrá sitio para 9 mesas para que os sentéis, bebáis una copa, charléis con vuestros amig@s y conozcáis nuevos amig@os. Por supuesto, siempre podréis poner un ojo en una de las TVs distribuidas por todo el local para que no os perdáis a vuestro equipo o jugador favorito. 

Construiremos una barra nueva en forma de U para que nunca más haya colas para pedir una copa o una tapa.

 

Riesgos y desafíos

 

Claro que existen riesgos. La creación de negocios innovadores siempre los conllevan. La reforma puede alargarse, puede incrementarse el coste de las obras o puede demorarse el trámite de la licencia nueva. Pero estoy preparado para este tipo de incidentes. Tras 2 años encargado del negocio cuento con que aparecerán problemas y mini-crisis. Si algo he aprendido en todo este tiempo, ha sido a encajar y gestionar las crisis. Tras una crisis siempre aparece una oportunidad, solo hay que perseverar. Y ésa es mi especialidad. Dije que iba a abrir el primer bar de eSports de España y lo abrí. Ahora el "yo" se ha transformado en "nosotros". Hemos dicho tantas veces que íbamos a ampliarlo ... y eso es precisamente lo que vamos a hacer ahora, todos juntos.  ¿Por qué? Porque es nuestra manera de entender la vida. Porque esta Comunidad la hemos creado entre todos. Porque no podemos dejar que muera. Porque debe seguir creciendo. Porque muchos de nuestros mejores amig@s actuales pertenecen a esta Comunidad. Y queremos seguir compartiendo momentos únicos en Comunidad.

Por todo eso; como un mero administrador, os pido vuestra confianza. Dádmela una vez más y me aseguraré de que esta Comunidad tenga el bar de eSports más increíble de España. Lo prometo.

 

 

Otras formas en las que puedes ayudar

 

Compartir, compartir y compartir por facebook, twitter, youtube, en clase o en el trabajo. Con todo aquel que sea fan de los eSports y quiera apoyar la industria.

 

Un saludo, nos vemos pronto! GL HF

 

English

 

Hi, I’m Carlos Teschendorff. As you know, the actual capacity of the eSports bar is not enough for big parties, events and tournaments. Now the time has come to expand it with the adjacent store! (115 square meters) That store already belongs to me and we have set it up in order to start the building work as soon as possible. With both stores we will reach the 215 square meters.

 

Through the expansion, we will increase the number of PCs until 12 in order to make the wanted League of Legends, Smite, CS:GO 5vs5 and Overwatch 6vs6 tournaments. Besides, we will be able to host bigger events of your favorite topics: Harry Potter, Star Wars, Pirates, Disney, ….

 

In order to renovate the existing facility we precise 24.000 euros. With the crowdfunding campaign we have to raise 8.000 euros, I will raise the remaining 16.000 euros through a bank loan. If we are able to raise a fair amount of money through crowdfunding, the loan will have better interest rates. If we don’t raise enough money, we will continue with a lighter expansion or we’ll pay back everything (minus the 5% that Indiegogo takes).

 

We have some unique perks that are only available once and many more common ones.

Furthermore, everyone will get additional extras whenever we reach certain goals.

 

2.000 euros Incredible cosplayers for the re-opening party

3.500 euros 6vs6 Overwatch tournament with 300 euros prize pool

5.000 euros 5vs5 League of Legends and CS:GO tournament with 300 euros prize pool each one

6.500 euros 5vs5 Smite, 1vs1 Hearthstone and 1vs1 Super Smash Bros tournament with 300 euros each one

8.000 euros Carlos will cosplay at the re-opening party. You decide what he’ll become

 

How the bar will look like

 

PCs and consoles area

 

The PC area will have 12 Alienware computers, Logitech peripherals, 12 NeedforSeat gaming chairs as well as two independent internet connections in case one fails. In the console area we will have two Wii U, two Nintendo Switch, one Playstation 3, one Playstation 4, one pump it up dance machine and four controllers per console. Of course, using all this stuff will still be for free with some changes. When getting a drink, you will get a one-hour session on a PC. After this time, the session will disconnect and somebody else will take up the PC.

 

Streaming Area

 

There will be 2 areas with sofas where you can accommodate and enjoy the hottest streamings (LVP, LCS, ESL Major League, …) In order to decorate the new area with sofas, we will get Monster partnership, and this area will receive the name of “Monster Zone”

 

In the central area there will be a space for 9 tables, so people can sit, drink, chat and meet new people. Of course, you will always be able to watch one of the TVs spread around the room so that you don’t miss your favorite teams or players.

 

We will build a new, U-shaped counter so that you don’t have to stand in line to get a drink or a snack ever again

 

Risks and challenges

 

Of course there are risks. The creation of innovative businesses always take risk. The building work can stretch on or the building work cost can increase. But I'm prepared for this kind of incidents. After two years running this eSports bar I count with it. If I have learnt something after these two years is dealing with problems and crisis. After one crisis there's an opportunity. You just have to carry on and I'm a specialist on that. I said I was going to open the first eSports in Spain and I did it. Now it's not me anymore,but us. We have dreamed so many times of expanding the bar ... and that's what we are going to do right now! Why? Because this is our way of life. Because we have created this Community altogether. Because we can't let it die. Because it has to keep growing. Because many of our actual friends belong to this Community. And because we want to keep sharing unique moments with them. 

 

Because if this; I ask you for your confidence. Give it to me and I assure that you have the most incredible eSports bar in Spain.

Un saludo, nos vemos pronto! GL HF
 
English
 
Hi, I’m Carlos Teschendorff. As you know, the actual capacity of the eSports bar is not enough for big parties, events and tournaments. Now the time has come to expand it with the adjacent store! (115 square meters) That store already belongs to me and we have set it up in order to start the building work as soon as possible. With both stores we will reach the 215 square meters.
 
Through the expansion, we will increase the number of PCs until 12 in order to make the wanted League of Legends, Smite, CS:GO 5vs5 and Overwatch 6vs6 tournaments. Besides, we will be able to host bigger events of your favorite topics: Harry Potter, Star Wars, Pirates, Disney, ….
 
In order to renovate the existing facility we precise 24.000 euros. With the crowdfunding campaign we have to raise 8.000 euros, I will raise the remaining 16.000 euros through a bank loan. If we are able to raise a fair amount of money through crowdfunding, the loan will have better interest rates. If we don’t raise enough money, we will continue with a lighter expansion or we’ll pay back everything (minus the 5% that Indiegogo takes).
 
We have some unique perks that are only available once and many more common ones.
Furthermore, everyone will get additional extras whenever we reach certain goals.
 
2.000 euros Incredible cosplayers for the re-opening party
3.500 euros 6vs6 Overwatch tournament with 300 euros prize pool
5.000 euros 5vs5 League of Legends and CS:GO tournament with 300 euros prize pool each one
6.500 euros 5vs5 Smite, 1vs1 Hearthstone and 1vs1 Super Smash Bros tournament with 300 euros each one
8.000 euros Carlos will cosplay at the re-opening party. You decide what he’ll become
 
How the bar will look like
 
PCs and consoles area
 
The PC area will have 12 Alienware computers, Logitech peripherals, 12 NeedforSeat gaming chairs as well as two independent internet connections in case one fails. In the console area we will have two Wii U, two Nintendo Switch, one Playstation 3, one Playstation 4, one pump it up dance machine and four controllers per console. Of course, using all this stuff will still be for free with some changes. When getting a drink, you will get a one-hour session on a PC. After this time, the session will disconnect and somebody else will take up the PC.
 
Streaming Area
 
There will be 2 areas with sofas where you can accommodate and enjoy the hottest streamings (LVP, LCS, ESL Major League, …) In order to decorate the new area with sofas, we will get Monster partnership, and this area will receive the name of “Monster Zone”
 
In the central area there will be a space for 9 tables, so people can sit, drink, chat and meet new people. Of course, you will always be able to watch one of the TVs spread around the room so that you don’t miss your favorite teams or players.
 
We will build a new, U-shaped counter so that you don’t have to stand in line to get a drink or a snack ever again
 
Risks and challenges
 
Of course there are risks. The creation of innovative businesses always take risk. The building work can stretch on or the building work cost can increase. But I'm prepared for this kind of incidents. After two years running this eSports bar I count with it. If I have learnt something after these two years is dealing with problems and crisis. After one crisis there's an opportunity. You just have to carry on and I'm a specialist on that. I said I was going to open the first eSports in Spain and I did it. Now it's not me anymore,but us. We have dreamed so many times of expanding the bar ... and that's what we are going to do right now! Why? Because this is our way of life. Because we have created this Community altogether. Because we can't let it die. Because it has to keep growing. Because many of our actual friends belong to this Community. And because we want to keep sharing unique moments with them. 
 
Because if this; I ask you for your confidence. Give it to me and I assure that you have the most incredible eSports bar in Spain.

story:
Short Summary

We are a video game company from Poland and the creators of Steampunker, a puzzle-based adventure game which is already available for iPad. 

The game was selected and nominated for several awards. We've received critical acclaim for Steampunker, but we want to make it even better and make it playable on other video game platforms. And to do that, we need your help.



Steampunker is the story of Vincent, an inventor and engineer, who must save the world from the invasion of evil robots. Traveling through grim harbors, fantastical submarines, mysterious islands, a rocket trip to the Moon, and finally a death-defying battle against the robots on their space ship, Vincent risks everything to save the world and make the universe a little bit safer for Science.

Antyweb.pl: 'Graphics are Steampunker's strongest point. The backdrops of locations traversed by our hero, as well as the graphics accompanying the subsequent puzzles and brain-teasers, all create a unique alluring atmosphere. The game is simply stunning.'

Shaun Musgrave, Touch Arcade: ‘Steampunker is a fairly interesting hybrid of point and click adventure and hidden object searching from a developer hailing from Poland. It kind of reminded me of those games that were big in the early PC CD-ROM days. The art style in this one is pretty cool, and for some reason, having a digitized actor in a costume on top of a computer generated background stirred up some nostalgia in me.’

Chiho Komoriya, vsmedia: ‘…the artwork is wonderful! If you love Steampunk, you are attracted by the nostalgic, decadent atmosphere that this has. This is an interactive art work as well as a game.’

Yulia Vakhrusheva, Casual Connect: 'Steampunker is more than a point-and-click adventure. It's suspenseful atmosphere keeps you hooked until the end - it felt like reading an exciting sci-fi book and being part of its story! '

What We Need & What You Get

In order to make Steampunker available for release on iPhone and Android tablets, we need to raise $2000. We listen carefully to the feedback offered by gamers playing  the iPad version and with your help we'd like to add several gamer-friendly features in the process. We are already working on it  but we need more funding. Once the goal is reached, the improved version for iPad, iPhone and Android tablets will  be ready no later than in January 2015. We are proud of the unique graphics and atmosphere of the game and these certainly won't change.

The game will be available for the following devices:

1) iPad: iPad 2 or newer, iPad mini or newer, iOS 7 or higher 

2) iPhone: iPhone 4s, iPhone 5,5c,5s iPhone 6, 6+,   iOS 7 or higher 

3) Android: over 500 devices - Android 4.1 (Jelly Bean) or higher, minimum resolution 1024x800, minimum diagonal 8 inches

Then we would like to translate the game to several languages including French, German, Italian, Japanese, Korean, and Spanish. The stretch goal is $ 3000 for  the first set of three languages: German, Japanese and Polish. The language versions are planned for March/April 2015. Once we  reach the goal,  we'll start raisinng funds for  another set of languages. 

As recording musicians we'd like to release the soundtrack on a special limited edition CD.  $7000 is the stretch goal for this. If the goal is reached we'll send out the CDs in January 2015.

If we are able to make the stretch goal of $10,000, the design team will also develop an option of playing Steampunker as a female character. It's going to require a lot of work but we hope to finish it by April 2015.

Even if we fall short of our goal, all the funds raised will still go directly into developing Android and iPhone versions of Steampunker. It will simply take us much longer to produce them. Similarly, even if we don't meet our stretch goals, anything raised beyond the initial $2000 will go into funding language versions, but production will be slowed down until we are able to find additional sources of funding. By meeting our target amount and our stretch goals, we can go ahead and get everything done right away. That means more fun video games for you as soon as possible!

What You Get

$ 1  A "Thank You" message from our team

$ 2
Steampunker video game for Android  tablet, iPad or iPhone


$ 5
Steampunk video game + Wallpaper and social media skins + Game soundtrack 


$ 25 
Video game + Wallpaper and social media skins + Game soundtrack+ Your name in the end credits on the games "Backers" + Art book Ebook + Printable art print.

$ 25 

Video game + Wallpaper and social media skins + Game soundtrack+ Your name in the end credits on the games "Backers" + Art book Ebook + Printable art print.

Silver Rocker - "Tesla"  mp3, Tesla App (iOS only), printable Silver Rocket  "Tesla" poster

$ 60 

Video game + Wallpaper and social media skins + Game soundtrack+ Your name in the end credits on the games "Backers" + Art book Ebook + Printable art print.

Silver Rocker - "Tesla" CD (2008, BMG/Sony), Silver Rocket "Tesla"  T-shirt, Silver Rocket "Tesla"  postcard, 2 badges.
THE PHYSICAL SILVER ROCKET "TESLA" ITEMS LISTED ABOVE ARE AVAILABLE ONLY IN THIS PERK. 20 SETS ONLY - THE LAST CDS AVAILABLE.
Silver Rocker - "Tesla"  mp3, Tesla App (iOS only), printable Silver Rocket  "Tesla" poster.


$ 65
T-shirt, set of 4 postcards,  set of 4 badges+ Video game + Wallpaper and social media skins + Game soundtrack+ Your name in the end credits on the games "Backers" + Art book Ebook + Printable art print. 


$ 400 
All of the above and you in the video game.
If you have a good steampunk photo, we will only adjust colors so it looks like all  other pictures in the game (black and white or sepia). If  you don't have one, send us any photo of your face and we'll compose it  into a picture. You can buy this perk as a gift for someone else but we won't place anybody's photo in the game before we get his or her  permission.


$ 1000 
All of the above and an exclusive special credit on the game. 

Your name will be placed in the credits on the first page, right below the game makers names.  You will be able to choose  the description -  for example"our most generous backer", "Steampunker's main sponsor" etc.


    If we fail to raise the whole amount required, each dollar contributed will go towards the Android and iPhone versions. Unfortunately the deadline will have to be extended, as we will need to work on other projects in the meantime. 

    What makes Steampunker special?

    Every week hundreds, if not thousands, of new games are launched. However, steampunk-style games are few and far between, a couple a year at most. What makes Steampunker unique? First of all, detailed hand-drawn graphics, critically acclaimed by the players and reviewers alike. We think Steampunker stands out among many currently popular games just as beautiful steampunk jewellery and clothing stand out among mass-made products. We believe many gaming enthusiasts are already tired of games which look the same and the clones made in one day after a particular title becomes successful and are ready to embrace something different. 

    What's more, Steampunker also features an original dedicated soundtrack composed and recorded especially for the game. 

    There is a joke that compares crowdfunding to a pre-order with a 10% chance that the ordered product will be created in the first place.  
    As opposed to many other projects seeking funding at the initial development stage, Steampunker actually already exists. The game is available for iPads, as that is the original platform for which it was developed.  Unfortunately we will not be able  to add new features and develop other versions without crowdfunding.

    Risks & Challenges

    While every game development project faces challenges and setbacks, we have the advantage of already having a completed game, albeit only for the iPad. Our design team has the experience necessary to carry through on expending the original Steampunker for multiple platforms and developing new features funded through this campaign.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    Besides monetary contributions you can help us so much by sharing, tweeting, and talking about Steampunker! There are links at the top of the page, below the video, that allow you to easily share this campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and Google Plus.

    That will help us a lot. Thank you so much!
